Headlines: IFR-ASIA CREDIT CLOSE: Fosun below reoffer, Hon Hai hit by Apple

LONDON, Jan 24 (IFR) - Bonds of Hon Hai were beaten up today

revenue growth ahead. The negative news from one of Hon Hai's
most important clients put pressure on the bonds of the
Taiwanese company and its 2017s traded as wide as 162bp over
US Treasuries, 22bp wider than where they were being quoted
yesterday. They recovered a bit toward the end of the session
closing at 156bp, though.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple upgrade program seen driving demand for new iPhones

a new iPhone every year more affordable - a move that analysts

million units the previous versions logged in their first
weekend last year, a feat that analysts attributed to the
inclusion of sales from China.

economy, while undermining arch rival Google Inc,
which dominates the $120 billion online advertising market.

Apple Inc
 will likely seek to invoke the United States'
protections of free speech as one of its key legal arguments in
trying to block an order to help unlock the encrypted iPhone of
one of the San Bernardino shooters, lawyers with expertise in
the subject said this week.

the country for the principle of protecting the privacy of

suspected criminals' phones.

Description: An "application glitch" led some Vanguard Group clients to see an inflated account balance displayed on their Apple mobile devices, a spokeswoman said - a hiccup that left at least one user cheering the apparent extra funds.

Headlines: Half-strength apple juice can help some kids get through stomach flu
Description: NEW YORK (Reuters Health) - When little kids have the stomach flu and need to drink fluids, half-strength apple juice – and whatever fluid the child prefers - can be as effective as expensive electrolyte solutions, researchers say.

Headlines: SAP teams up with Apple to bring SAP's HANA to iOS
Description: Apple Inc is taking another step into the corporate computing world by partnering with SAP to develop apps that run the German company's widely used business software on smartphones and tablets, the two companies said on Thursday.

Headlines: India rejects Apple's plan to import used iPhones
Description: India has rejected a plan by Apple Inc  to import used  iPhones, two telecoms ministry officials said, a blow to the U.S. tech giant that has been seeking to revive waning sales of its flagship smartphones.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple's Tim Cook to visit China for government meetings - source
Description: Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook plans to visit Beijing later this month to meet high-level government officials, at a time when it is facing some setbacks in its  most important overseas market, a source familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Expert helped Los Angeles police hack Apple iPhone: court records

Headlines: Republicans grapple with whether to back Trump for White House
Description: Republican lawmakers, operatives and donors grappled with whether to support Donald Trump, who effectively clinched his party's presidential nomination this week after his two remaining rivals, Ted Cruz and John Kasich, dropped out of the White House race.

Headlines: Spotify says growth has quickened since Apple Music's launch

The $695 billion company is nearing a deal to assemble its iconic phone in Karnataka, a southwestern state in one of the world's fastest growing handset markets. That would help lower retail prices and boost potential sales at a time when the Cupertino-based firm is losing its footing elsewhere in Asia.

The tech colossus sold nearly 51 million smartphones despite maturing markets and a resurgent Samsung following its exploding-battery crisis. App-store sales also grew nicely, and more dividends and buybacks are on the way. That should pacify investors until Apple rolls out the 10th anniversary edition of its pioneering device.

Headlines: Next iPhone is key to Apple's future in China
Description: Apple's next iPhone will be key to its future in China. Sales in what was once the company's biggest growth market have now fallen for five straight quarters. Stiff competition with local handset makers and a weaker yuan have both hurt. While app-store sales are promising, a real turnaround hinges on the success of its much-anticipated, 10th-anniversary smartphone.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple sees sharp increase in U.S. national security requests

than four times as many national-security related requests from
the U.S. government in the first half of this year versus a year
ago, according to a company report on Thursday.

Headlines: FCC says Apple should activate iPhones' FM radio chip, but newer phones don't have
Description: The top U.S. communications regulator urged Apple Inc on Thursday to activate FM radio chips in iPhones that would allow Americans access to life-saving information when a natural disaster takes out wireless networks, but the company said its newer models do not have the chips.

Headlines: India gives blessing to Oppo stores as focus turns to Apple
Description: India has given Chinese smartphone maker Oppo the go-ahead to open its own single-brand retail stores, boding well for rivals like Apple Inc which are seeking similar approvals.

Headlines: EU takes Ireland to court for not claiming Apple tax windfall
Description: The European Commission said on Wednesday it was taking Ireland to the European Court of Justice for its failure to recover up to 13 billion euros ($15.3 billion) of tax due from Apple Inc , a move labeled as "regrettable" by Dublin.

Headlines: Apple names former Honeywell executive as new general counsel
Description: Apple Inc  said on Friday its general counsel, Bruce Sewell, will retire and be succeeded by former Honeywell International Inc  executive Katherine Adams, who will take over Apple's multinational legal battle against Qualcomm Inc .

Headlines: Apple praises French iPhone work before talking tax with Macron
Description: Apple  boss Tim Cook went out of his way on Monday to single out a small French firm involved with innovative features in the latest iPhones ahead of meeting with President Emmanuel Macron, who has called for a tougher line on technology company taxes.

Description: Apple Inc  is finalizing a deal to make 10 new episodes of Steven Spielberg's 1980s science fiction anthology series "Amazing Stories," landing a premiere Hollywood talent for its plunge into original TV programming, a source with knowledge of the discussions said.

Headlines: U.S. top court asks Justice Department for views in Apple antitrust case

Headlines: Microsoft, Apple among companies urging U.S. Supreme Court to weigh gay workers' rights
Description: Dozens of companies including Alphabet Inc’s Google, Apple Inc, Microsoft Corp, and Viacom Inc have asked the U.S. Supreme Court to address whether a law banning sex discrimination in the workplace provides protections to gay employees.

Headlines: Irish court gives $1 billion Apple data center green light
Description: Apple may proceed to build a 850 million euro ($1 billion) data center in Ireland, the High Court ruled on Thursday, bringing relief for the government after a two-year planning delay which it feared could hurt its reputation with investors.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Irish court gives $1 bln Apple data centre green light

Headlines: Activists urge Apple to drop apps that play up Philippine drugs war
Description: A group of civil society organizations has demanded that Apple Inc  remove from its app store games it said violated the tech firm's guidelines and promoted violence and killings  commonplace in the Philippines' war on drugs.

Headlines: Huawei aims to challenge Apple and Samsung on technology as well as price
Description: China's Huawei [HWT.UL] has unveiled a new line of smartphones that match or even improve on key features offered by Apple or Samsung while undercutting their rivals on price.

Description: Qualcomm Inc wants to hit Apple Inc where it hurts most: iPhone sales in China - one of its biggest global markets where most of its flagship smartphones are made.

Description: (Reuters Health) - Washing apples in water with a dash of baking soda is the most effective way to remove pesticide residue, new research shows.

Headlines: Apple X factor: China buyers rapt by new iPhone, but will they buy?

Description: By delivering solid financial results that beat Wall Street's expectations for both revenues and profits on Thursday, Apple Inc's CEO Tim Cook put to rest concerns that the company's flagship device, the iPhone X, wouldn't be ready in time for the holiday shopping season.

the holiday shopping-quarter was largely above market

Headlines: Apple's iPhone X has higher margin than iPhone 8: analysis
Description: Apple Inc's  new flagship iPhone X makes the company more money per phone than its iPhone 8 model, according to an analysis, which found the iPhone X's flashier parts cost Apple 25 percent more than the iPhone 8, but that it retailed 43 percent higher.

Headlines: Irish PM says future of $1 billion Apple data center uncertain
Description: A planned $1 billion Apple data center is in doubt after Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar said the U.S. company's Chief Executive Tim Cook would no longer commit to it, adding that Dublin would do whatever necessary to get it built.

Headlines: EU's Vestager seeking details on Apple's recent tax set-up
Description: European Union regulators have asked iPhone maker Apple for details of its recent tax structure following last year's order to pay back taxes of up to 13 billion euros ($15 billion) to Ireland, Europe's anti-trust chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple says no operations were moved from Ireland
Description: Apple Inc said none of its operations were moved from Ireland and that changes made to its corporate structure in 2015 were specially designed to preserve tax payments to the United States, and not to reduce taxes anywhere else.

Headlines: Apple orders Witherspoon, Aniston drama in TV push
Description: Apple Inc  has ordered two seasons of a dramatic series that stars Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston and looks at the lives of people working on a morning television show, a company spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple has deciding vote in Broadcom-Qualcomm deal
Description: Apple may anoint the winner of Broadcom's $105 billion bid for Qualcomm. A dispute over iPhone royalties left the U.S. chipmaker vulnerable to an opportunistic offer from its acquisitive rival. Settling could preserve Qualcomm’s independence – but it all depends on whether Apple thinks a bigger Broadcom would be slavishly devoted to the handset maker, or just surlier.

Headlines: Apple leads way in tracing cobalt from Congo, Microsoft lags: Amnesty
Description: Apple is leading the way in tracing cobalt used in its electronics to ensure the metal has not been mined by children in Democratic Republic of Congo while Microsoft is lagging, Amnesty International said.

Description:

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple to help India develop anti-spam app after face-off with regulator
Description: Apple Inc has agreed to give limited help to the Indian government to develop an anti-spam mobile application for its iOS platform, after refusing to do so based on privacy concerns, according to sources and documents seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Apple pushes launch of HomePod smart speaker to early 2018
Description: Apple Inc has pushed the launch of its HomePod smart speaker to early next year from December, the company said on Friday, missing the holiday shopping season as the market for such devices becomes increasingly competitive.

Description:

Headlines: Google buys plot near Apple's planned Danish data center

Headlines: Microsoft's Skype pulled from Apple, Android China app stores
Description: Skype, Microsoft Corp's  internet phone call and messaging service, has disappeared from app stores in China including that of Apple Inc , indicating the latest setback for a foreign tech service in the country.

Headlines: Ireland promises progress in Apple tax recovery in coming weeks
Description: Ireland expects to make progress in recovering up to 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in disputed taxes from Apple Inc  in the coming weeks, its prime minister said on Tuesday, following EU criticism that Dublin was moving too slowly.

Headlines: Apple says illegal student labor discovered at iPhone X plant
Description: Smartphone maker Apple Inc  and its biggest manufacturing partner on Wednesday said that a small number of students were discovered working overtime in its Chinese factory, violating local labor laws.

Headlines: Slump in Facebook, Apple raises prospects of tech rally brake
Description: Shares of Facebook , Apple  and other technology heavyweights dropped on Wednesday, creating uncertainty over whether the top-performing sector's record-breaking rally this year is ending or merely taking a break.

Headlines: Apple to audit development processes after Mac bug discovered
Description: Apple Inc  said on Wednesday it would review its software development process a day after a researcher discovered a bug in a new version of its Mac operating system that could give hackers total control of vulnerable machines.

Headlines: Apple accuses Qualcomm of patent infringement in countersuit
Description: Apple Inc on Wednesday filed a countersuit against Qualcomm Inc, alleging that Qualcomm's Snapdragon mobile phone chips that power a wide variety of Android-based devices infringe on Apple's patents, the latest development in a long-running dispute.

Description: Qualcomm Inc  said on Thursday it filed three new patent infringement complaints against Apple Inc , saying there were 16 more of its patents that Apple was using in its iPhones.

Headlines: Dialog shares tank on report Apple to design own power chips
Description: Apple is designing its own power-management chips for use in iPhones as early as 2018, the Nikkei business daily reported on Thursday, triggering a more than 20 percent slide in shares of supplier Dialog Semiconductor.

stamp on online dissent.

Headlines: Apple's Cook optimistic that apps pulled in China will be back
Description: Apple Inc is optimistic that some of its popular apps removed from its China App Store this year to comply with government requests will be reinstated, the U.S. tech giant's Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple, India wrangle over import tax on mobile parts: sources
Description: Apple Inc  has asked India to defer a planned increase in import taxes on mobile phone parts so it can expand its iPhone manufacturing in the country, but the government is unlikely to accede, people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Finisar deal helps Apple block rivals' path to AR features
Description: Apple Inc's  $390 million deal with chip supplier Finisar Corp  announced on Wednesday helps lock in the supply of a component that Apple believes will play a big role in its future products by bolstering augmented reality features.

Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it had awarded $390 million to optical components maker Finisar Corp to boost production of laser chips that power iPhone X's features such as Face ID, Animoji and portrait mode photos.

Headlines: EU court rejects U.S. intervention in Apple's Irish $15 billion tax case
Description: Europe's second-highest court has rejected a request from the U.S. government to intervene in Apple's challenge against an EU order to pay back taxes of up to 13 billion euros ($15.3 billion) because it failed to prove a direct interest in the outcome of the case.

Headlines: Apple names long-time exec as new India sales head: source
Description: Apple Inc  has appointed Michel Coulomb as its top sales executive in India, replacing Sanjay Kaul, a source familiar with the move said on Tuesday, as the U.S. tech giant pursues a bigger share of the world's third-largest smartphone market.

Headlines: Apple wins big with U.S. tax bill but faces snag on foreign patents
Description: The U.S. Republican tax overhaul passed by Congress this week will allow Apple Inc  to bring back its $252.3 billion foreign cash pile without a major tax hit - a long-standing company goal.

Headlines: Japan Display says report it sought Apple, Huawei funds is 'speculative'
Description: Cash-strapped smartphone screen maker Japan Display Inc  dismissed a report on Thursday that it was seeking investment from Apple Inc  and Huawei Technologies Co Ltd [HWT.UL] as "speculative" and declined to comment further.

Headlines: Apple, suppliers drop on report of weak iPhone X demand
Description: Shares in Apple Inc  and several of its Asian suppliers fell on Tuesday after a report by Taiwan's Economic Daily and comments from some analysts suggested iPhone X demand could come in below expectations in the first quarter.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple and Saudi test out their comfort zones
Description: Apple and Saudi Arabia’s partnership may test out their comfort zones. The country's large population and income make it logical that the smartphone giant is in talks to open a shop, as Reuters reported on Thursday. Enticing a cutting-edge global tech firm would also gloss Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s modernizing campaign. There are risks for both; Saudi’s gamble may be bigger.

Headlines: With lineup widening, Apple depends less on iPhone X
Description: In years past, demand for Apple Inc's  latest flagship phone was critical to the company's results over the holiday shopping quarter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple and Amazon in talks to set up in Saudi Arabia - sources
Description: Apple and Amazon are in licensing discussions with Riyadh on investing in Saudi Arabia, two sources told Reuters, part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's push to give the conservative kingdom a high-tech look.

Headlines: Apple apologizes after outcry over slowed iPhones
Description: Facing lawsuits and consumer outrage after it said it slowed older iPhones with flagging batteries, Apple Inc  is slashing prices for battery replacements and will change its software to show users whether their phone battery is good.

Headlines: Apple to issue fix for iPhones, Macs at risk from 'Spectre' chip flaw
Description: Apple Inc will release a patch for the Safari web browser on its iPhones, iPads and Macs within days, it said on Thursday, after major chipmakers disclosed flaws that leave nearly every modern computing device vulnerable to hackers.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to issue fix for iPhones, Macs at risk from 'Spectre' chip flaw
Description:
* Move comes after chipmakers disclose flaws leaving devices
vulnerable to hackers

Headlines: Apple says it looks out for kids, as investors cite phone 'addiction'
Description: Apple Inc said it "has always looked out for kids", defending its technology policy for children, after two major investors urged it to address what they said was a growing problem of young people getting addicted to Apple's iPhones.

Headlines: French prosecutor launches probe into Apple planned obsolescence: judicial source
Description: A French prosecutor has launched a preliminary investigation of U.S. tech giant Apple  over alleged deception and planned obsolescence of its products following a complaint by a consumer organization, a judicial source said on Monday.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Tech backlash catches up to Apple
Description: The tech backlash has caught up to Apple. Jana Partners and CalSTRS want the $900 bln company to give parents better controls over their kids’ iPhones. It’s an unusual issue for an activist, and apps from Facebook and Snap would make better targets.

addicted to Apple's iPhones, Jana partner Charles Penner said.

Headlines: Senator wants Apple to answer questions on slowing iPhones
Description: The chairman of a U.S. Senate committee overseeing business issues asked Apple Inc to answer questions about its disclosure that it slowed older iPhones with flagging batteries, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple plans new U.S. campus, to pay $38 billion in foreign cash taxes
Description: Apple Inc  will open a new campus as part of a five-year, $30 billion U.S. investment plan and will make about $38 billion in one-time tax payments on its overseas cash, one of the largest corporate spending plans announced since the passage of a tax cut signed by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Description:
Apple Inc will open a new campus
as part of a five-year, $30 billion U.S. investment plan and
will make about $38 billion in one-time tax payments on its
overseas cash, one of the largest corporate spending plans
announced since the passage of a tax cut signed by U.S.
President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Tim Cook goes as American as Apple’s pie
Description: Tim Cook is going as American as Apple’s pie. The iPhone maker will pay $38 billion in tax on its huge pile of overseas cash. It’s also aping Amazon with plans to open a second U.S. campus, invest $30 billion over five years and create 20,000 jobs.

Headlines: Apple to release software update to resolve iPhone slowdown: CEO
Description: Apple Inc will release a software update that will allow users to turn off a feature that slows down iPhones when batteries are low on charge, Chief Executive Tim Cook told ABC News.

Headlines: Italy's anti-trust opens probe into Apple, Samsung phone complaints
Description: Italy's antitrust body said on Thursday it had opened a probe into allegations that Apple Inc. and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd used software updates to slow their mobile phones and push  clients into buying new handsets.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple's U.S. tax payment does not change EU's Irish tax ruling
Description:
Apple's announcement
that it will pay $38 billion in U.S. tax on its overseas cash
will not reduce the $16 billion tax bill the company owes
Ireland following a European Union ruling, the EU's executive
said on Thursday.

Headlines: South Korean group files complaint against Apple CEO over iPhone slowdown
Description: A South Korean consumer group has filed a criminal complaint against Apple Inc CEO Tim Cook over slower iPhone devices, after probes in Europe into allegations the firm had deliberately shortened the life of its handsets.

Headlines: Apple launches HomePod voice speaker, takes on Google, Amazon
Description: After missing the critical holiday shopping season, Apple Inc has jumped into the voice speaker wars with the HomePod smart speaker, a device that will use its Siri voice assistant and compete against offerings from Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google.

Headlines: iPhone software update spotlights Apple secrecy on battery health
Description: Apple Inc's move on Wednesday to give iPhone owners information about the health of their batteries reverses the company's longstanding refusal to make such information available directly on iPhones and iPads, even though battery health has long been easy to check on Apple's Mac computers.

Headlines: EU fines chipmaker Qualcomm $1.2 billion over exclusivity deal with Apple
Description: U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc was hit with a 997 million euro ($1.23 billion) fine by European Union antitrust regulators on Wednesday for paying Apple Inc to use only its chips, blocking out rivals such as Intel Corp .

Headlines: Dow, S&P 500 suffer worst one-day fall in five months as Apple drags
Description: Wall Street pulled back from record highs on Monday, with the Dow and the S&P 500 indexes marking their biggest one-day percentage declines in about five months, weighed down by a slide in Apple shares.

Headlines: Coffee meets 7UP in Keurig, Dr Pepper Snapple deal
Description: Keurig Green Mountain has struck a deal worth more than $21 billion to combine with soda maker Dr Pepper Snapple Group Inc  to form a North American drinks company with brands like Green Mountain Coffee, 7UP, Snapple and Sunkist.

Headlines: Apple shares skid on report of iPhone X production cut
Description: Apple Inc  will halve its iPhone X production target for the first three months of the year to around 20 million units, Nikkei reported on Monday, sending its shares down 1.6 percent.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Apple shares skid on report of iPhone X production cut
Description:
Apple Inc will halve its iPhone
X production target for the first three months of the year to
around 20 million units, Nikkei reported on Monday, sending its
shares down 1.6 percent.

Headlines: BRIEF-Keurig Green Mountain To Buy Dr. Pepper Snapple
Description:
* PRESS RELEASE - DR PEPPER SNAPPLE AND KEURIG GREEN

WORLD-CLASS PORTFOLIO OF ICONIC BRANDS AND AN UNRIVALED
NATIONWIDE DISTRIBUTION CAPABILITY

Headlines: Apple sensor supplier AMS shares jump on raised growth outlook
Description: AMS AG  shares rose by 26 percent on Monday after the Austria-based electronic chip maker raised its revenue outlook on rising demand for its sensors from smartphone makers such as Apple , beating analyst forecasts.

Headlines: U.S. agencies probe Apple over slowing iPhones: Bloomberg
Description: The U.S. Department of Justice and the Securities and Exchange Commission are investigating whether Apple Inc violated securities laws concerning its disclosures that it slowed older iPhones with flagging batteries, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple supplier Wistron nears land deal in India: sources
Description: Apple's Taiwanese contract manufacturer Wistron Corp is close to finalizing a land deal in India's tech hub of Bengaluru and the firm is likely to invest about $157 million to develop the site, two government officials told Reuters.

contract manufacturer Wistron Corp is close to
finalising a land deal in India's tech hub of Bengaluru and the
firm is likely to invest about $157 million to develop the site,
two government officials told Reuters.

Headlines: Apple's quarterly report leaves iPhone uncertainty
Description: Apple Inc's stock wobbled in extended trade on Thursday, down 1 percent and then trading up 3 percent, as investors wrestled with uncertainty about demand for the iPhone X following the company's quarterly report.

Headlines: GRAPHIC-Apple's quarterly report leaves iPhone uncertainty
Description:
Apple Inc's stock
wobbled in extended trade on Thursday, down 1 percent and then
trading up 3 percent, as investors wrestled with uncertainty
about demand for the iPhone X following the company's quarterly
report.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple’s less-is-more vibe bodes well for profit
Description: Apple has long followed Mies van der Rohe’s design precept that “less is more.” Now it’s doing the same financially. The company sold fewer iPhones for more money in the last quarter, it reported on Thursday. That raises fears that the company is losing its innovation edge. But that’s OK – persuading customers to pay more arguably requires as much genius as getting people to adopt the technology in the first place.

Headlines: Apple's second-quarter revenue forecast misses estimates
Description:
Apple Inc's revenue forecast for
the second quarter on Thursday was below market expectations,
adding to concerns of a plateau in demand for its newer iPhones,
including the anniversary edition iPhone X.

Headlines: BRIEF-Apple Reports Quarterly Earnings Per Share Of $3.89
Description:
* Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $3.86, REVENUE VIEW $87.28
BILLION --
THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S

Headlines: Ex-Apple, Microsoft engineers tackle security cameras for cars
Description:
A team of former Apple Inc and
Microsoft Corp engineers have launched a company to
sell security cameras for cars.

Headlines: Apple's user base grows, but analysts probe for more detail
Description: In its quarterly earnings report on Thursday, Apple Inc gave the first update in two years on what it calls its active installed base, the number of major products such as iPhones, iPads and Macs in use in the world. Apple said the base expanded 30 percent from two years ago to 1.3 billion.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Strong iPhone prices, cash plans buoy Apple shares after muted outlook (Feb. 1)
Description:
Stronger iPhone prices and hints by Apple
Inc on Thursday that it could return more than half of
its $285 billion in cash to shareholders eased concerns among
investors, even as the world's biggest technology company gave a
disappointing revenue outlook for the current quarter.

Headlines: Apple supplier Cirrus plunges after disappointing results
Description: Cirrus Logic Inc , whose audio chips are used in Apple's iPhones, reported quarterly revenue and profit below estimates due to weakness in smartphone sales, sending its shares down 11 percent in extended trading.

Headlines: Qualcomm shares fall as reports say Apple may scrap its chips
Description: Qualcomm Inc's  shares fell 3 percent on Monday after two brokerages said Apple Inc  might drop the chipmaker in favor of Intel Corp  as the supplier for modem chips in its next generation of iPhones.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Qualcomm shares fall as reports say Apple may scrap its chips
Description:
Qualcomm Inc's shares fell 3
percent on Monday after two brokerages said Apple Inc
might drop the chipmaker in favor of Intel Corp as the
supplier for modem chips in its next generation of iPhones.

Headlines: Apple sees 'strong demand' for replacement iPhone batteries: letter
Description: Apple Inc  has seen "strong demand" for replacement iPhone batteries and may offer rebates for consumers who paid full price for new batteries, the company said in a Feb. 2 letter to U.S. lawmakers made public on Tuesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple sees 'strong demand' for replacement iPhone batteries -letter
Description:

has seen "strong demand" for replacement iPhone
batteries and may offer rebates for consumers who paid full

U.S. lawmakers made public on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple supplier Skyworks jumps after better-than-feared forecast
Description: Shares of Skyworks Solutions Inc  rose as much as 13 percent on Tuesday after the company, whose radio frequency chips are used in iPhones, gave a current-quarter forecast that was not as dour as other Apple Inc  suppliers.

Headlines: Apple supplier AMS's profit leaps as mystery backer funds capex
Description: Chipmaker AMS  forecast a strong 2018 after reporting a more than tenfold increase in fourth-quarter profit, driven by increasing demand for sensors it makes for the latest Apple  iPhones and other smartphone producers.

Headlines: Apple CEO downplays special dividend at shareholder meeting
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook downplayed a suggestion that the company might issue a special dividend to shareholders with some of the $285 billion in cash that the company is now able to bring back from overseas.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple CEO downplays special dividend at shareholder meeting
Description:
Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim

special dividend to shareholders with some of the $285 billion
in cash that the company is now able to bring back from
overseas.

Headlines: What inflation? Apple and Facebook drive Wall Street rally
Description: Wall Street surged on Wednesday as investors shrugged off  stronger-than-expected inflation data and snapped up shares of Facebook, Amazon.com and Apple.

Headlines: Berkshire buys Teva, feels IBM blues as Apple becomes top investment
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Wednesday disclosed a new stake in generic drugmaker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd  and said it bought more shares of Apple Inc , which surpassed Wells Fargo & Co  as its largest common stock investment.

Headlines: VW looks at Apple for electric-car design guidance
Description: Volkswagen  is looking at Apple  products for guidance on how to style its new generation of electric cars, its top designer said, as the automaker aims to turn profits on battery-powered vehicles when they launch in 2020.

Headlines: Apple in talks with miners to secure cobalt supplies: sources
Description: Apple Inc  is talking to major cobalt producers to secure supplies of the material vital for the lithium-ion rechargeable batteries that power its mobile phones, three cobalt industry sources said.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple in talks with miners to secure cobalt supplies - sources
Description:
* Most of the world's cobalt comes from the DRC
(Recasts, adds comment, Reuters sourcing)

Headlines: Philippines' Duterte suggests news site Rappler linked to U.S. spies
Description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Thursday stood by his decision to ban domestic news outlet Rappler from his events, accusing it of trying to undermine his government, probably with the backing of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).

Headlines: Steve Jobs' pre-Apple job application could fetch $50,000 at auction
Description: A job application filled out by Steve Jobs more than four decades ago that reflects the Apple  founder's aspirations to work in technology and design will go up for auction next month.

Headlines: Apple plans biggest iPhone yet for 2018: Bloomberg
Description: Apple Inc is preparing to release three new smartphones later this year, including the largest iPhone ever, a device that may have a bigger display than arch-rival Samsung's flagship phone, Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the products.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Apple plans biggest iPhone yet for 2018 -Bloomberg
Description:
Apple Inc is preparing to

than arch-rival Samsung's flagship phone, Bloomberg reported on
Monday, citing people familiar with the products.

Description:
Shares of Apple
rose 2 percent on Monday and were on the verge of a record high
after billionaire Warren Buffett talked up his company's stake
in the iPhone maker.

Headlines: Apple moves to store iCloud keys in China, raising human rights fears
Description: When Apple Inc begins hosting Chinese users' iCloud accounts in a new Chinese data center at the end of this month to comply with new laws there, Chinese authorities will have far easier access to text messages, email and other data stored in the cloud.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple finds more serious supplier problems as its audits expand
Description:
Apple Inc said on Wednesday it
had found a higher number of serious violations of its labor and
environmental policies for suppliers, such as falsifying work
hours data, as it expanded the scope of its annual audit of
conditions of workers making its iPhones and other products.

Headlines: REFILE-Apple finds supplier problems as its audits expand
Description:
Apple Inc said on Wednesday
that it had found violations of its labor and environmental
policies for suppliers, such as falsifying work hours data, as
it expanded the scope of its annual audit of conditions of
workers making its iPhones and other products.

Headlines: Hold the iPhone! Amazon primed to be larger than Apple
Description: Apple Inc, the world's most valuable publicly listed company, is in danger of being beaten by Amazon.com Inc to the $1 trillion mark.

Description:
Apple Inc, the
world's most valuable publicly listed company, is in danger of
being beaten by Amazon.com Inc to the $1 trillion mark.

Headlines: Apple Music hits 38 million paid subscribers
Description: Apple Inc's streaming music service now has 38 million paid subscribers, up from 36 million in February, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple Music hits 38 million paid subscribers
Description:
Apple Inc's streaming music
service now has 38 million paid subscribers, up from 36 million
in February, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple acquires goodwill of flag-waving publishers
Description: Apple is acquiring the goodwill of flag-waving magazine publishers for less than pocket change. The $925 billion iPhone maker is buying Texture, a digital subscription service for titles like Rolling Stone. The pixelated newsstand was intended as an antidote to Apple’s onerous terms. With the print industry suffering, though, buying it makes the tech giant look like a white knight.

Headlines: Major Dr Pepper Snapple shareholder may sell stake ahead of Keurig merger
Description: One of soda-maker Dr Pepper Snapple's  largest shareholders has said it may sell its shares in the business ahead of a proposed merger with Keurig Green Mountain, questioning the logic of the deal.

Headlines: Apple supplier Wistron secures land to build new site in southern India
Description: A unit of Apple Inc's  Taiwanese contract manufacturer Wistron Corp  has won approval from Karnataka to build a new assembly facility in the south Indian state, signaling a potential expansion of iPhone assembly work in India.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple supplier Wistron secures land to build new site in southern India
Description:
A unit of Apple Inc's
Taiwanese contract manufacturer Wistron Corp has won
approval from Karnataka to build a new assembly facility in the
south Indian state, signalling a potential expansion of iPhone
assembly work in India.

Headlines: Apple supplier Wistron secures land to build new site in southern India -sources
Description:
A unit of Apple Inc's
Taiwanese contract manufacturer Wistron Corp has won
approval from Karnataka to build a new assembly facility in the
south Indian state, two officials said, signalling what could be
a vital expansion of iPhone assembly work in India.

Headlines: Google, Apple face EU law on business practices
Description: Online platforms such as Google , Apple  and Amazon  face new European Union rules on their commercial practices with smaller businesses that use their services, as Brussels seeks to curtail their huge market power.

Headlines: France to sue Google, Apple over developer contracts: minister
Description: France said on Wednesday it will take Google  and Apple  to court and seek fines of 2 million euros ($2.5 million) over what it termed "abusive" contractual terms imposed by the tech giants on startups and developers.

Headlines: Steve Jobs pre-Apple job application fetches $174,000 at auction
Description: A one-page job application filled out by Steve Jobs more than four decades ago that reflected the Apple founder's technology aspirations sold for $174,000 at a U.S. auction, more than three times its presale estimate.

Headlines: Apple developing own screens using next-generation MicroLED tech: Bloomberg
Description: Apple Inc is developing its own MicroLED device displays and has made small numbers of the screens for testing, Bloomberg reported, in a move that could hurt Asian display suppliers to the U.S. tech giant over the long-term.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple developing own screens using next-generation MicroLED tech -Bloomberg
Description:
* Analysts cite hurdles for applying MicroLED to small
screens

Headlines: Apple supplier IQE's sales surge, but takes U.S. tax hit
Description: Semiconductor component manufacturer IQE Plc , whose technology is used in Apple Inc's  iPhone, posted a rise in 2017 adjusted pre-tax profit on Tuesday on strong wafer sales, though a change in U.S. tax policy hit unadjusted earnings.

Headlines: Apple grabs two-year lead in 3D sensing race
Description: Most Android phones will have to wait until 2019 to duplicate the 3D sensing feature behind Apple’s Face ID security, three major parts producers have told Reuters, handicapping Samsung and others on a technology that is set to be worth billions in revenue over the next few years.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Apple bid for education market: new software, same iPad price
Description:
Apple Inc
on Tuesday rolled out a new iPad and classroom software
aimed at grabbing more of the U.S. education market, but did not
cut the price of its entry-level tablet despite schools flocking
to laptops costing a third less.

Headlines: Rift deepens between Apple, India's telecom regulator over anti-spam app
Description: U.S. technology giant Apple Inc and India's telecoms regulator are at loggerheads over the development of a government anti-spam mobile application, with user privacy at the heart of a deepening rift between the two sides.

Headlines: Apple set to update iPad lineup at Chicago education event
Description:
Apple Inc on Tuesday
was widely expected to announce a lower-priced iPad aimed at
helping it grab more of the U.S. educational market.

Headlines: Apple supplier AAC targets 25 percent annual sales growth
Description: AAC Technologies , a key acoustic and haptic component supplier to Apple Inc , said it was looking to grow its sales by at least 25 percent in 2018, and that it does not expect any major impact from the China-U.S. trade situation.

Headlines: Apple bid for education market: new software, same iPad price
Description: Apple Inc on Tuesday rolled out a new iPad and classroom software aimed at grabbing more of the U.S. education market, but did not cut the price of its entry-level tablet despite schools flocking to laptops costing a third less.

Headlines: Apple plans to replace Intel chips in Macs with its own: Bloomberg
Description: Apple Inc  is planning to use its own chips in Mac computers beginning as early as 2020, replacing processors from Intel Corp , Bloomberg reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Description:
Apple Inc is planning to use
its own chips in Mac computers beginning as early as 2020,

Headlines: Apple says repeal of EPA carbon plan would threaten investments
Description: Apple Inc  said on Friday it opposes any repeal by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency of the Clean Power Plan, which is a priority of the agency's Administrator Scott Pruitt and would reverse an Obama-era program to curb greenhouse gases.

Headlines: Apple adds Isaac Asimov sci-fi series to TV development list
Description: Isaac Asimov's influential "Foundation" science fiction novels about the collapse and resurgence of a galactic empire are heading to Apple Inc as a television drama series, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple Music appoints new head, hits 48 million subscribers

Headlines: Lawmakers question FBI over San Bernardino suit against Apple
Description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday sent a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray questioning the law enforcement agency's decision to take Apple Inc to court to force the company to help unlock a mass shooter's iPhone.

Headlines: TSMC shares slide as revenue estimate cut; other Apple, chip stocks also fall
Description: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd tumbled and other Apple supplier and chip stocks fell after it cut its full-year revenue target on softer demand for smartphones.

Description:
U.S. stocks fell on Thursday, as
technology stocks from Apple to chipmakers declined following a
weak forecast on smartphone demand, while a sharp drop in Philip
Morris's shares after results weighed on the consumer
staples sector.

Headlines: TSMC's smartphone warning points squarely at Apple: analysts
Description: Shares in Apple Inc  and its suppliers fell on Thursday after a raft of analysts read a prediction of softer smartphone sales from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd  as driven chiefly by concern about demand for iPhones.

Description: EU antitrust regulators opened an investigation on Monday into Apple's bid for British music discovery app Shazam, concerned the deal might give the iPhone maker an unfair advantage in poaching users from its rivals.

Headlines: Ireland expects Apple EU tax appeal to be heard before end of year
Description: An appeal by Apple and Ireland against a European Union ruling for the U.S. firm to pay 13 billion euros ($16 billion) in disputed taxes is likely to be heard before the end of the year, Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Tuesday.

Description: Shares of Austrian chipmaker AMS tumbled as much as 14 percent after the supplier to tech giant Apple warned of a major customer's continued delays in finalizing product plans, dealing a blow to its second-quarter outlook.

Headlines: Trump, top aides talk trade with Apple CEO Cook at White House
Description: President Donald Trump and two top aides talked about trade issues with Apple Inc  chief Tim Cook on Wednesday as the White House prepares to try to avert a trade war with China, a manufacturing hub for the iPhone maker.

Headlines: Qualcomm's patent deals aim to ease Apple, regulator tensions, executive says
Description: Qualcomm Inc has broadened its use of a lower-cost licensing model for the next generation of mobile data networks, a move that could help in contentious talks with two customers including iPhone maker Apple Inc, the wireless tech company's patent licensing chief said on Monday.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple may double capital returned to investors
Description: Memories of Apple nearly going bankrupt in the mid-1990s scared Steve Jobs and his colleagues. Now worth some $840 billion, it has kept an absurdly conservative balance sheet for two decades. Apple returned about $50 billion to shareholders last fiscal year through share buybacks and dividends. Yet the company, whose free cash flow more than replenishes that every year, still had over $160 billion of net cash last quarter. Doubling the payout for three years wo

Headlines: Apple surprises with solid iPhone sales, announces $100 billion buyback
Description: Apple Inc on Tuesday reported resilient iPhone sales in the face of waning global demand and promised $100 billion in additional stock buybacks, reassuring investors that its decade-old smartphone invention had life in it yet.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple is bumping up against iPhone limits
Description: Apple is bumping up against its iPhone limits. The smartphone market is mature, and soft demand for the $1,000-plus X model suggests the company led by Tim Cook has maxed out on pricing. The company’s just-ended quarter - revenue rose 16 percent to $61.1 billion - shows Apple can still sell a lot of phones and more accessories and services. And a robust balance sheet means it plans to repurchase another $100 billion in shares and increase the dividend. But the

Headlines: Apple shares rise after sales quell iPhone worries
Description: Shares of Apple Inc  rose 3 percent on Wednesday after the company's quarterly report and current-quarter iPhone sales forecast calmed investor nerves about a potential slowdown in sales of its flagship product.

Description:
Apple's forecast-beating results helped
U.S. stock futures edge higher on Wednesday, even as investors
were wary ahead of the Federal Reserve's monetary policy
decision.

Headlines: China steps up quarantine checks on U.S. apple, log imports
Description: China's main ports will step up quarantine checks on imports of apples and logs from the United States, and shipments found carrying disease or rot could be returned or destroyed, the Chinese customs agency said on Monday.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies and Apple approaches $1 trillion value
Description: Wall Street jumped on Thursday, and Apple inched closer to a $1 trillion stock market value, as tepid inflation data eased worries of faster U.S. interest rate hikes this year.

Headlines: Apple scraps $1 billion Irish data center over planning delays
Description: Apple ditched plans to build an 850 million euro ($1 billion) data center in Ireland because of delays in the approval process that have stalled the project for more than three years, the iPhone maker said on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple scraps $1 billion Irish data centre over planning delays
Description:
Apple ditched plans to
build an 850 million euro ($1 billion) data centre in Ireland
because of delays in the approval process that have stalled the
project for more than three years, the iPhone maker said on
Thursday.

Headlines: Apple is almost a $1 trillion company, but watch out for Amazon
Description: Apple is on the verge of becoming the first $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company, but even if it gets there, it could soon be overtaken as Amazon.com surges from behind.

Headlines: Apple supplier Foxconn's first quarter profit dives below estimates, shares fall
Description: A dive in quarterly profit at Taiwan's Foxconn  to below analyst estimates saw shares of the Apple Inc  supplier fall 3 percent on Tuesday, even after a pledge to boost shareholder returns with a $1.2 billion capital reduction.

Headlines: Berkshire doubles Teva stake, adds to Apple, ends a newspaper bet
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Tuesday said it has more than doubled its investment in generic drugmaker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd , and confirmed it has become Apple Inc's  second-largest shareholder.

Headlines: Japan Display aims to double automotive sales to cut Apple dependence: executive
Description: Japan Display Inc  aims to nearly double its automotive display sales in five years to lessen its dependence on Apple Inc  and other smartphone makers, a senior executive said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple pays Ireland first tranche of disputed taxes
Description: Apple has paid 1.5 billion euros ($1.76 billion) into an escrow account set up by the Irish government to hold 13 billion euros in disputed taxes, Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Friday.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Apple pays Ireland first tranche of disputed taxes
Description:
Apple has paid 1.5 billion euros
($1.76 billion) into an escrow account set up by the Irish
government to hold 13 billion euros in disputed taxes, Finance
Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Friday.

Headlines: U.S. jury awards Apple $539 million in Samsung patent retrial
Description: After nearly five days of deliberations, a U.S. jury on Thursday said Samsung Electronics Co Ltd should pay $539 million to Apple Inc for copying patented smartphone features, according to court documents, bringing a years-long feud between the technology companies into its final stages.

Headlines: Apple said to have chosen OLED for new iPhones; Japan Display shares plunge
Description: Apple Inc has decided to use OLED screens in all three new iPhone models planned for next year, according to South Korea's Electronic Times - a report that sent shares in Japan Display tumbling 10 percent.

Headlines: Telegram messaging says Apple has prevented its updates since April
Description: Apple has prevented the Telegram messaging service from updating globally ever since Russia banned the service and ordered Apple to remove it from its online store, Telegram's chief executive and founder claimed on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Telegram messaging says Apple has prevented its updates since April
Description:
Apple has prevented
the Telegram messaging service from updating globally ever since
Russia banned the service and ordered Apple to remove it from
its online store, Telegram's chief executive and founder claimed
on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple cuts smartphone power chip orders from Dialog Semiconductor
Description: Dialog Semiconductor said Apple now planned to source the main power management chips (PMICs) for one of its three new iPhone models from two suppliers instead of just from the German chipmaker.

Headlines: Apple to debut phone-to-phone augmented reality: sources
Description: Apple Inc  next week will debut tools to let two iPhone users share augmented reality while limiting the personal data sent to its servers, two people familiar with the matter said this week.

Headlines: Apple to debut phone-to-phone augmented reality -sources
Description:
Apple Inc next
week will debut tools to let two iPhone users share augmented
reality while limiting the personal data sent to its servers,
two people familiar with the matter said this week.

Headlines: Dialog Semi down 17 percent on Apple warning; sector peers flag
Description: Shares in Dialog Semiconductor fell by 17 percent on Friday to a four-year low after the Anglo-German chipmaker said its main customer Apple would cut orders for its power-management chips by around 30 percent this year.

Headlines: Apple focuses on speed, parental controls in software upgrades
Description: Apple Inc  on Monday unveiled software upgrades that would let older iPhones run faster, help parents limit their children's screen time and make its Siri voice assistant work more like a rival feature from Amazon.com .

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Apple focuses on speed, parental controls in software upgrades
Description:
Apple Inc on
Monday unveiled software upgrades that would let older iPhones
run faster, help parents limit their children's screen time and
make its Siri voice assistant work more like a rival feature
from Amazon.com.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple’s value can chug well past $1 trillion
Description: It has been a long time coming, but Apple could soon be worth $1 trillion – and counting. At $943 billion on Monday, the tech giant is close to being the first company to pass that threshold in market capitalization, as Breakingviews predicted seven years ago. Growth has slowed since then, but customers remain loyal and today’s valuation is far from stretched. Apple’s timely focus on data privacy may help it get there.

Headlines: Apple to make 20 percent fewer new model iPhones this year: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc  expects to ship 80 million new model iPhones this year, down 20 percent from what it had planned at the same time last year, Japanese financial daily Nikkei reported on Friday, citing industry sources.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple to make 20 pct fewer new model iPhones this year -Nikkei
Description:

Headlines: Mapbox taps ex-Apple designer to head augmented reality efforts
Description: Mapping startup Mapbox Inc said Monday that it had hired Avi Cieplinski, an veteran of Twitter and Apple who co-invented several popular iPhone features, to head up its efforts help application makers design location-based augmented reality software.

Headlines: Apple to undercut popular law-enforcement tool for cracking iPhones
Description: Apple Inc  said on Wednesday it will change its iPhone settings to undercut the most popular means for law enforcement to break into the devices.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to undercut popular law-enforcement tool for cracking iPhones
Description:

Headlines: Apple, Qualcomm battle over possible ban on some U.S. iPhone imports
Description: The staff of the U.S. International Trade Commission on Friday recommended that a trade judge find that Apple Inc  infringed at least one of Qualcomm Inc's  patents, a move that could lead to blocking the import of some iPhones.

Headlines: Apple nabs Oprah as top talent flocks to digital entertainment
Description: Apple Inc on Friday announced a multi-year deal with Oprah Winfrey to create original programing, a coup in the battle for A-list talent and projects in the booming digital entertainment market.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple poaches senior self-driving engineer from Waymo
Description:
Apple Inc has hired a senior
self-driving car engineer from Alphabet Inc's Waymo
unit, Apple said on Friday, a sign that the iPhone maker
maintains autonomous vehicle ambitions.

Description:

Headlines: U.S. top court mulls Apple's App Store commissions in antitrust case
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to take up Apple Inc's bid to escape a lawsuit accusing it of breaking federal antitrust laws by monopolizing the market for iPhone software applications and causing consumers to pay more than they should.

Headlines: In Apple case, SCOTUS will decide how old-school antitrust doctrine applies to e-commerce
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed Monday to review a decision by the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals that allowed consumers to sue Apple for allegedly using its monopoly power as the sole distributor of iPhone apps to drive up app prices. The case, as you can see from Apple’s petition for Supreme Court review (2017 WL 3393652), asks the justices to decide how the court’s precedent in 1977’s Illinois Brick v. Illinois (97 S.Ct. 2061) – which blocks federal-law antitrust damages claims b

Headlines: Apple CEO to advocate end to 'inhumane' immigrant children separation:  Irish Times
Description: Apple  Chief Executive Tim Cook has described the separation of children from immigrant parents at the U.S.-Mexico border as "inhumane" and promised to be a "constructive voice" in seeking to end the issue, the Irish Times newspaper reported.

Headlines: Apple CEO to advocate end to "inhumane" immigrant children separation - Irish Times
Description:

Tim Cook has described the separation of children from immigrant

Headlines: Australian court fines Apple $6.7 million over iPhone 'bricking' case
Description: An Australian court fined U.S. electronics giant Apple Inc A$9 million ($6.7 million) on Tuesday after a regulator accused it of using a software update to disable iPhones which had cracked screens fixed by third parties.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple supplier’s M&A bite looks too much to chew
Description: A deal between Dialog Semiconductor and U.S. touchscreen group Synaptics makes sense. The question is whether the British iPhone-chip maker can pull it off.

Headlines: Apple, Samsung settle U.S. patent dispute
Description: Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Wednesday settled a seven-year patent dispute over Apple's allegations that Samsung violated its patents by "slavishly" copying the design of the iPhone.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple, Samsung settle U.S. patent dispute
Description:
Apple Inc and Samsung
Electronics Co Ltd on Wednesday settled a seven-year
patent dispute over Apple's allegations that Samsung violated
its patents by "slavishly" copying the design of the iPhone.

Headlines: Dips in Facebook and Apple leave Wall Street lower
Description: Wall Street dipped on Tuesday, weighed down by Apple, Facebook and other technology stocks, in a trading session ending early ahead of the U.S. July 4 holiday.

Headlines: Firing fake pineapples, Pernod uses 'influencers' to drive sales
Description: This spring, Pernod Ricard's  Malibu Rum paid American singer Nick Jonas to host a competition in Vietnam that began with 33 Instagram stars battling to catch fake pineapples while flying off a giant waterslide into the sea.

Headlines: House Republicans query Apple, Alphabet on privacy, data practices
Description: Four senior U.S. House Republicans sent letters on Monday to the chief executives of Apple Inc  and Google parent Alphabet Inc  asking questions about location data and mobile phone privacy practices and the handling of customer data.

Headlines: Criminal case sheds light on Apple self-driving car technology
Description: The criminal complaint filed Monday against an ex-Apple Inc  employee for allegedly stealing self-driving car trade secrets from the Cupertino company provides a handful of new details about its work on the technology, experts said.

Headlines: Mapping startup hires Apple computer vision expert
Description: Mapillary, a Malmö, Sweden-based map technology startup, has hired a computer vision expert away from Apple Inc, the company said Wednesday.

Headlines: Ex-Apple worker charged with stealing self-driving car trade secrets
Description: U.S. authorities charged a former Apple Inc  employee with stealing trade secrets on Monday, accusing him of downloading a blueprint related to a self-driving car to a personal laptop before trying to flee the country for China, according to a criminal complaint filed in federal court.

Headlines: Japan watchdog: Apple may have breached antitrust rules with iPhone
Description: Japanese regulators said on Wednesday Apple Inc  may have breached antitrust rules by forcing mobile service providers to sell its iPhones cheaply and charge higher monthly fees, denying consumers a fair choice.

Headlines: Apple launches $300 million green energy fund in China
Description: Apple Inc  will launch a $300 million clean energy fund in China, the firm said in a statement on Friday, working with its suppliers to invest in renewable energy projects that could power close to 1 million homes in the country.

Headlines: Apple launches $300 mln green energy fund in China
Description:
Apple Inc will launch

statement on Friday, working with its suppliers to invest in
renewable energy projects that could power close to 1 million
homes in the country.

Headlines: Apple Watch, FitBit could feel cost of U.S. tariffs
Description: The latest round of U.S. tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods could hit the Apple Watch, health trackers, streaming music speakers and other accessories assembled in China, government rulings on tariffs show.

Headlines: Apple supplier LG Display slashes investment plans as losses mount
Description: South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd , a key Apple supplier, slashed its investment plans by $2.7 billion to 2020 citing concern for the global smartphone market, as it posted a second consecutive quarterly loss on sagging panel prices.

Headlines: Apple's pricey iPhone X, subscriptions deliver earnings beat
Description: Apple Inc sales led by the pricey iPhone X pushed quarterly results far beyond Wall Street targets on Tuesday, with subscriptions from App Store, Apple Music and iCloud services bolstering business.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple's pricey iPhone X, subscriptions deliver earnings beat
Description:
Apple Inc sales led by the
pricey iPhone X pushed quarterly results far beyond Wall Street

Music and iCloud services bolstering business.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Privacy builds a wider moat for Apple’s margins
Description: Privacy is building a wider moat for Apple’s margins. The iPhone maker’s premium prices and fast-growing services continued to power earnings in the latest quarter. Selling hardware rather than advertising once seemed like a weakness. But in the wake of Facebook’s woes, CEO Tim Cook is using data security to buff the brand – and profitability.

Headlines: REFILE-Apple earnings beat expectations as it sells pricier iPhones
Description:
Apple Inc on Tuesday posted
quarterly results that topped Wall Street targets and forecast
revenue in the current quarter above expectations, driven by
sales of higher-priced iPhones and revenue from services like
the App Store, Apple Music and iCloud.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple's ride to $1 trillion: The magic number that gets it there
Description:
Apple Inc updated
its latest share count on Wednesday, putting the magic stock
price at $207.04 that would make the iPhone maker the first
publicly listed U.S. company valued at $1 trillion.

Headlines: Stocks sink amid trade war fears but Apple results cap losses
Description: Stocks fell worldwide on Wednesday on persistent fears of an escalation of the trade war between the United States and China although robust results from Apple Inc helped cap losses and the Federal Reserve left U.S. interest rates untouched.

Headlines: Scolding from Chinese state media dampens Apple's earnings cheer
Description: Apple Inc  may have just notched up its fourth straight quarter of double-digit revenue growth in China, but among some Chinese consumers the glow was overshadowed by Chinese state media’s tirade of criticism against the smartphone giant.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Scolding from Chinese state media dampens Apple's earnings cheer

* At least 5 state media reports lambast Apple in the past
week

Headlines: Apple nears $1 trillion as bright forecast highlights future demand
Description: Shares of Apple Inc  touched the $200 mark for the first time and neared a $1 trillion valuation on Wednesday, after the company forecast blowout current-quarter sales and analysts said a September launch of new iPhones set the stage for sustained growth.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple both is and isn’t already a $1 trln company
Description: Apple is so nearly there. Becoming the first publicly traded company with a market value of $1 trillion is a tantalizing prospect. But it’s really just a number.

Headlines: Huawei overtakes Apple as world No. 2 smartphone seller, gains ground in China
Description: China's Huawei Technologies overtook Apple Inc  to become the world's second-biggest smartphone seller in the June quarter, data from market research firms showed, as it gained ground in Europe and expanded its lead back home.

Headlines: Apple shares set to move higher as glossy forecast highlights future demand
Description:
Shares of Apple Inc are inching
closer to a $1 trillion valuation, after the company forecast
blowout current-quarter sales and analysts on Wednesday said a
September launch of new iPhones set the stage for sustained
growth.

Headlines: Apple breaches $1 trillion stock market valuation
Description: Apple Inc  on Thursday became the first $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company, crowning a decade-long rise fueled by its ubiquitous iPhone that transformed it from a niche player in personal computers into a global powerhouse spanning entertainment and communications.

Headlines: Apple CEO calls $1 trillion value a 'milestone' but not a focus
Description: Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Thursday that the iPhone maker's $1 trillion market capitalization was "not the most important measure" of the company's success but was instead a result of its focus on its products, customers and company values.

Headlines: Trade fight drags, but Apple's $1 trillion milestone boosts U.S. indexes
Description: An intensifying trade dispute between the United States and China weighed on global stocks and bond yields on Thursday, but a rise in Apple shares took its valuation above a record $1 trillion and helped major U.S. indexes close in positive territory.

Headlines: S&P 500, Nasdaq rise as Apple hits $1 trillion mark
Description: Technology stocks pushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq higher on Thursday, driven by Apple shares as the iPhone maker became the first publicly traded U.S. company worth a trillion dollars.

Headlines: Patience pays off for decades-long Apple shareholders
Description: Donna Fenn bought shares of Apple Inc  in the 1980s on the recommendation of a stockbroker a good friend of hers was dating. She'd heard of the company because its co-founder Steve Jobs had appeared on the cover of the magazine she worked for.

Headlines: Apple in touch with Chinese telcos on ways to cut spam
Description: Apple Inc  is speaking with Chinese telecom firms to find ways to reduce spam received through its messaging service, a spokeswoman said, days after state media alleged it was allowing illegal content on its platform.

Description:
* Criticism comes as China-U.S. trade tensions rise

Headlines: Wall Street eyes more gains from Apple, its $1 trillion stock
Description: Shares in Apple Inc  edged higher on Friday but stayed close to the $1 trillion valuation milestone the iPhone maker reached a day earlier, even as Wall Street predicted more gains.

Description:
Apple Inc, Alphabet Inc's
YouTube, Facebook Inc and Spotify all
took down podcasts and channels from U.S. conspiracy theorist
Alex Jones, saying on Monday that the Infowars author had broken
community standards.

Headlines: TSMC computer virus hit may delay Apple shipments, but impact limited: analysts
Description: A computer virus outbreak at Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC) could delay chip shipments for Apple Inc's new iPhones but the impact will be limited as TSMC has prepared itself for such disruptions, analysts said.

Headlines: Apple's mettle in India tested in squabble over anti-spam app
Description: In India, the world's second-biggest smartphone market, Apple Inc's  normally deft management of government relations is being put to a fresh high-stakes test.

Headlines: FOCUS- Apple's mettle in India tested in squabble over anti-spam app
Description:
* India regulator warns of "derecognition" in anti-spam app
spat

Headlines: Doug Field, former Tesla engineering chief, returns to Apple
Description: Doug Field, who stepped down as the senior vice president of engineering at Tesla Inc  last month, is returning to Apple Inc , Apple told Reuters on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple accused of pressuring game rivals in Japan: Nikkei
Description: Japanese regulators are investigating Apple Inc over allegations it unfairly pressured Yahoo Japan Corp to slow the expansion of its online games platform, which competes with Apple's App Store, Japanese media reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple reassures customers after Australian media reports hack by teen
Description: Apple Inc  said on Friday no customer data was compromised after Australian media reported a teenager had pleaded guilty to hacking into its main computer network, downloading internal files and accessing customer accounts.

Description:

Description:
Apple Inc says it has
pulled illegal lottery apps from its App Store in China amid
tightening regulation and a barrage of criticism from state
media.

Headlines: Apple to gain unconditional EU approval for Shazam buy: sources
Description: Apple  is set to win unconditional EU antitrust approval for its planned acquisition of British music discovery app Shazam, two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to gain unconditional EU approval for Shazam buy -sources
Description:
Apple is set to win
unconditional EU antitrust approval for its planned acquisition
of British music discovery app Shazam, two people familiar with
the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple supplier AAC Tech posts first profit drop in four years on weak phone market
Description: AAC Technologies Holdings Inc , an acoustic components supplier to Apple Inc , said on Wednesday second-quarter net profit fell for the first time in nearly four years, hit by plateauing iPhone sales and a sluggish global smartphone market.

Headlines: Apple buys startup focused on lenses for AR glasses
Description: (The story has been refiled to correct spelling of Microsoft HoloLens in final paragraph.)

Headlines: REFILE-Apple buys startup focused on lenses for AR glasses
Description:
Apple Inc has acquired a startup focused
on making lenses for augmented reality glasses, the company
confirmed on Wednesday, a signal Apple has ambitions to make a
wearable device that would superimpose digital information on
the real world.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Apple expected to unveil new iPhone models on Sept. 12
Description:
Apple Inc said on Thursday it
will host an event on Sept. 12 at the Steve Jobs Theater in the
company's Cupertino, California, campus, where it is widely
expected to unveil new iPhone models.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple self-driving car rear ended during road testing
Description:
An Apple Inc self-driving car
was rear-ended while merging onto an expressway near the
company's Silicon Valley headquarters this month, the company
said in an accident report posted on Friday that confirmed the
iPhone maker is still in the race to build autonomous vehicles.

Headlines: Apple expected to unveil new iPhone models on September 12
Description: Apple Inc  said on Thursday it will host an event on Sept. 12 at the Steve Jobs Theater in the company's Cupertino, California, campus, where it is widely expected to unveil new iPhone models.

Headlines: Amazon touches $1 trillion, on pace to overtake Apple
Description: Amazon.com Inc  on Tuesday briefly joined Apple Inc  to become the second $1 trillion publicly listed U.S. company after its stock price more than doubled in a year as it grew rapidly in retail and cloud computing.

Headlines: U.S. apple farmers afraid they will be hurt by U.S.-China trade battle
Description: Apple farmers across the U.S. Northwest fear they will be the next victims of a U.S.-China trade war that left cherry growers in the same region with weak prices and having to scramble for alternative buyers because of prohibitive Chinese tariffs.

Headlines: Apple to provide online tool for police to request data: letter
Description: Apple Inc  plans to create an online tool for police to formally request data about its users and to assemble a team to train police about what data can and cannot be obtained from the iPhone maker, according to a company letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: REFILE-Apple to provide online tool for police to request data -letter
Description:
Apple Inc plans to create an
online tool for police to formally request data about its users
and to assemble a team to train police about what data can and
cannot be obtained from the iPhone maker, according to a company
letter seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Apple Inc bans Alex Jones app for 'objectionable content'
Description: Apple Inc said on Friday that it had banned from its App Store the Infowars app belonging to popular U.S. conspiracy theorist Alex Jones after finding that it had violated the company's rules against "objectionable content".

Description:

Headlines: Apple says U.S. tariffs on China would hit 'wide range' of products
Description: A "wide range" of Apple Inc  products including the Apple Watch would be affected by proposed U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods, the company told U.S. trade officials, but gave no sign of an impact on its iPhone cash cow.

products including the Apple Watch would be affected by proposed

Headlines: Wall Street drops on tariff worries, with Apple in crosshairs
Description: Wall Street's major indexes fell on Friday as U.S. President Donald Trump raised the possibility of additional tariffs on Chinese imports and Apple Inc indicated that some of its products could be subjected to such levies.

Headlines: S&P, Nasdaq edge higher after recent losses but Apple drags
Description: U.S. stocks mostly edged higher on Monday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq rebounding to snap a four-day losing streak, although a drop in Apple kept gains in check.

Headlines: Apple supplier shares slide after Trump tells tech giant to make products in U.S.
Description: Shares of Apple Inc  suppliers fell across Asia on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump tweeted that the tech giant should make products in the United States if it wanted to avoid tariffs on Chinese imports.

United States if it wanted to avoid tariffs on Chinese imports.

Headlines: Wall Street gains as Apple, tech rebound; oil lifts energy shares
Description: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday as Apple led a jump in technology shares and a gain of more than 2 percent in oil prices drove up energy shares.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple’s new innovation: tap fear as well as greed
Description: Apple's new innovation is to tap fear as well as greed. The $1 trillion firm’s new watches can detect falls and heart conditions, making them a useful gift for grandma, as well as hypochondriacs everywhere. Meanwhile, aesthetic appeal and better cameras should be enough to convince many users to pay up for an improved phone.

Headlines: Apple's newest iPhone could have big screen, big price
Description:
Apple Inc is expected to blast
further past the $1,000 price barrier when it launches new
iPhones on Wednesday, but Wall Street is most intrigued by how
deep into its larger-than-ever lineup prices hikes may go.

Headlines: Wall Street rises with Apple, easing trade concerns
Description: Apple led a rebound in technology shares and boosted all three major U.S. stock indexes on Thursday, while trade worries eased after China welcomed new talks with the United States.

Headlines: Apple CEO says optimistic on U.S.-China trade talks
Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook, whose products have been spared from new U.S. tariffs imposed on Chinese goods, said on Tuesday he was optimistic that the United States and China will eventually work through their trade differences.

Headlines: Qualcomm accuses Apple of stealing its secrets to help Intel
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday accused Apple Inc of stealing its chip-making secrets and giving them to rival Intel Corp, paving the way for Apple to switch to Intel's improved semiconductors, which may have cost Qualcomm billions of dollars in lost sales.

Headlines: Apple wins reversal in University of Wisconsin patent lawsuit
Description: Apple Inc persuaded a federal appeals court on Friday to throw out a $234 million damages award in favor of the University of Wisconsin-Madison's patent licensing arm for infringing a patent on computer processing technology.

Description: Britain's national cyber security agency said on Friday it had no reason to doubt the assessments made by Apple Inc and Amazon.com Inc challenging a Bloomberg report that their systems contained malicious computer chips inserted by Chinese intelligence services.

Headlines: Apple tells Congress it found no signs of hacking attack
Description: Apple Inc's  top security officer told Congress on Sunday that it had found no sign of suspicious transmissions or other evidence that it had been penetrated in a sophisticated attack on its supply chain.

Description: Jamal Khashoggi believed he was safe in Turkey.

Headlines: Hip and knee surgeons to use Apple Watch to monitor patients

Headlines: Breakingviews - Finance makes Apple and Google forced friends
Description: Apple founder Steve Jobs once wanted “to go to thermonuclear war” against Google for – he said – copying the software that powers the iPhone. Now his company and Alphabet, which owns the giant search engine, are bound by tight financial ties. Payments from Google may account for over 10 percent of Apple’s profit, a figure that is likely to rise.

Headlines: Indian state won't ease crackdown on crime despite Apple manager's death
