Headlines: Trump says China woes help U.S. in trade talks, downplays Apple warning
Description: President Donald Trump on Friday downplayed a revenue warning from Apple Inc that cited slowing sales in China and said China's weakening economic growth puts the United States in a strong position as negotiators from the world's two largest economies prepare for trade talks next week.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook propel Wall Street to three-week peak
Description: The S&P 500 jumped to a three-week high on Tuesday, led by Apple, Amazon, Facebook and industrial shares on bets that the United States and China would strike a deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: Apple, Qualcomm spar over CEOs' comments on settlement talks
Description: Qualcomm Inc  has responded to comments made by Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook in an interview, in which he said there had been no recent settlement talks between the iPhone maker and chip supplier in their global legal battle, calling Cook's remarks "misleading."

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Apple cuts current-quarter production plan for new iPhones by 10 pct - Nikkei
Description:
* Apple told suppliers late last month to assemble fewer
iPhones

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Apple cuts current-quarter production plan for new iPhones by 10 pct - Nikkei
Description:
* Apple told suppliers late last month to assemble fewer
iPhones

Headlines: Apple cuts current-quarter production plan for new iPhones by 10 percent: Nikkei
Description: Apple Inc , which slashed its quarterly sales forecast last week, has reduced planned production for its three new iPhone models by about 10 percent for the January-March quarter, the Nikkei Asian Review reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple demanded $1 billion for chance to win iPhone: Qualcomm CEO
Description: Qualcomm sought to become the sole supplier of modem chips for Apple's iPhone to recoup a $1-billion "incentive payment" that Apple insisted on, not to block rivals from the market, Qualcomm's chief executive testified on Friday.

Headlines: Apple considered Samsung, MediaTek to supply 5G modems for 2019 iPhones
Description: Apple Inc  held talks with Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  and MediaTek Inc  along with existing vendor Intel Corp  to supply 5G modem chips for 2019 iPhones, according to an Apple executive's testimony at a trial between Qualcomm Inc  and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple considered Samsung, MediaTek to supply 5G modems for 2019 iPhones
Description:
Apple Inc held talks with
Samsung Electronics Co Ltd and MediaTek Inc
along with existing vendor Intel Corp to
supply 5G modem chips for 2019 iPhones, according to an Apple
executive's testimony at a trial between Qualcomm Inc
and the U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Friday.

Headlines: Apple to launch three iPhones with new camera features this year: WSJ
Description: Apple Inc plans to launch three iPhone models this year with some new camera features, including three rear cameras for the most expensive model and two for the other models, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to launch three iPhones with new camera features this year - WSJ
Description:
Apple Inc plans to launch three
iPhone models this year with some new camera features, including
three rear cameras for the most expensive model and two for the
other models, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Headlines: China retailers slash iPhone prices after Apple sales warning
Description: Several Chinese electronics retailers including Alibaba-backed Suning  and JD.com  have slashed iPhone prices this week, after Apple  recently blamed poor sales of the smartphone in the country for a rare revenue warning.

Headlines: Apple supplier Dialog Semi weathers iPhone slump to hit revenue target
Description: Chip designer Dialog Semiconductor said on Monday that it managed to hit its fourth-quarter revenue guidance despite a slump in iPhone sales at its main customer Apple.

Headlines: Verizon deepens ties with Apple, offers free Apple Music to some U.S. customers
Description: Verizon Communications Inc  said on Tuesday it will include free Apple Music subscriptions in some of its top-tier U.S. data plans, deepening its ties with the iPhone maker.

Headlines: German court throws out Qualcomm's latest patent case against Apple
Description: A patent lawsuit filed by Qualcomm Inc against Apple Inc was thrown out by a German court on Tuesday, in a reversal for the U.S. chipmaker after it won a recent court ban on the sale of some iPhones in the country.

Headlines: TD Ameritrade taps Apple Pay for instant fund transfers to accounts
Description: Brokerage firm TD Ameritrade Holding Corp is tapping Apple Inc to help solve a problem that has lingered for decades: how to get money into a brokerage account and make it available to trade with on the same day.

Headlines: Apple, Amazon called out for 'incorrect' Taiwan, Hong Kong references
Description: One of China's top government-linked think tanks has called out Apple Inc, Amazon.com Inc and other foreign companies for not referring to Hong Kong and Taiwan as part of China in a report that provoked a stern reaction from Taipei.

Headlines: REFILE-Austrian data privacy activist files complaint against Apple, Amazon, others
Description:
Apple and Amazon
are among eight tech firms named in a complaint filed
in Austria by non-profit organisation noyb, which cited their
failure to comply with the European Union's General Data
Protection Regulation (GDPR).

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple services business grows; CEO Cook says China tensions ease
Description:
Apple Inc reported sharp growth
in its services business on Tuesday and Chief Executive Tim Cook
said trade tensions between the United States and China were
easing, helping boost the company's shares after hours even
though iPhone sales dipped in the holiday shopping quarter for
the first time.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple cash and services salve iPhone worries
Description: Apple’s cash and services help salve iPhone worries. The $740 billion tech giant’s holiday quarter was dismal, as foretold. A 5 percent sales drop shows Tim Cook’s company can no longer expect to sell significantly more phones or jack up prices. Rising margins on extras sold to iPhone users and the promise of $130 billion of capital returns buys Apple time to refresh.

Headlines: Apple sees sales largely below Wall St as iPhone demand weak
Description:
Apple Inc on Tuesday said sales
for its fiscal second quarter would most likely be lower than
Wall Street expected, a signal that it continues to face weak
demand for its iPhone, especially in China, the world's biggest
smartphone market.

Headlines: Apple to patch privacy bug in video-calling feature
Description: Apple Inc said on Monday it will issue a software patch later this week for a bug that lets iPhone users hear audio from users who have not yet accepted a video call.

Headlines: Apple Watch, using Aetna client data, wants to help you be healthy
Description: CVS Health Corp's health insurer Aetna on Tuesday said it is working with Apple Inc on a new health app for Apple Watches that uses an individual's medical history to set personalized health goals.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to patch privacy bug in video-calling feature
Description:
Apple Inc said on Monday it will
issue a software patch later this week for a bug that lets
iPhone users hear audio from users who have not yet accepted a
video call.

Headlines: NY AG, governor probing Apple's response to FaceTime bug
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo and new Attorney General Letitia James on Wednesday said the state was probing Apple Inc's failure to warn consumers about a FaceTime bug that lets iPhones users see and hear others before they accept a video call.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Wall St climbs on Apple, Boeing results; Fed decision eyed
Description:
* Indexes up: Dow 1.33 pct, S&P 0.89 pct, Nasdaq 1.30 pct
(Updates to early afternoon)

Headlines: US STOCKS-Apple, Boeing lift Wall Street ahead of Fed decision
Description:
* Boeing gains after upbeat earnings, 2019 deliveries
forecast

Headlines: Apple services business grows; CEO Cook says China tensions ease
Description: Apple Inc reported sharp growth in its services business on Tuesday and Chief Executive Tim Cook said trade tensions between the United States and China were easing, helping boost the company's shares after hours even though iPhone sales dipped in the holiday shopping quarter for the first time.

Headlines: Apple fixes FaceTime privacy bug, will issue update next week
Description: Apple Inc said on Friday it has fixed a privacy flaw in its group video chat software and that it plans to improve how it handles reports of software bugs after a teenager and his mother tried for days to warn the iPhone maker of the bug.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple fixes FaceTime privacy bug, will issue update next week
Description:
Apple Inc said on Friday it has
fixed a privacy flaw in its group video chat software and that
it plans to improve how it handles reports of software bugs
after a teenager and his mother tried for days to warn the
iPhone maker of the bug.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple briefly regains title as most valuable U.S. company
Description:
Apple very briefly
retook its title as the most valuable publicly listed U.S.
company on Monday, beating out Microsoft and Amazon.com
, while Alphabet was close behind the trio as
it prepared to report its quarterly results.

Headlines: Apple retail chief Angela Ahrendts to depart in April
Description: Apple Inc said on Tuesday that retail chief Angela Ahrendts will leave the company in April after five years on the job, the third departure of a retail head brought in from outside the company.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple retail chief Angela Ahrendts to depart in April
Description:
Apple Inc said on Tuesday that
retail chief Angela Ahrendts will leave the company in April
after five years on the job, the third departure of a retail
head brought in from outside the company.

Headlines: House Democrats want Apple to answer questions on FaceTime flaw
Description: Two key U.S. House of Representatives Democrats on Tuesday asked Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook, to answer questions about a privacy flaw in Apple's group video chat software after a teenager and his mother tried for days to warn the iPhone maker of the bug.

Headlines: Apple agrees to pay back-taxes to French authorities
Description: Apple's  French division said it had reached a deal with France to pay an undeclared amount of back-dated tax, which French media estimated at around 500 million euros ($571 million).

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple agrees to pay back-taxes to French authorities
Description:
Apple's French division
said it had reached a deal with France to pay an undeclared
amount of back-dated tax, which French media estimated at around
500 million euros ($571 million).

Headlines: Lumentum expects Android devices with Apple-like 3D sensing tech in 2019
Description: Lumentum Holdings Inc said on Tuesday it expects Android smartphone makers to launch devices with facial recognition technology this year even as the Apple Inc supplier forecast slightly lower-than-expected revenue for its current quarter.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple departure points to wider mystery
Description: The surprise departure of Apple’s retail chief, Angela Ahrendts, leaves two questions. Why did she leave? And had she done a good job? Investors can’t know the answer to either. The $821 billion smartphone maker has a penchant for hiding information that investors would find useful. The lack of clarity helps explain the valuation discount hanging over its stock.

Headlines: Apple to contribute to U.S. teen's education for spotting FaceTime bug
Description: Apple Inc on Thursday rolled out software updates to iPhones to fix a privacy issue in its FaceTime video calling service, and said it would contribute toward the education of the Arizona teenager who discovered the problem.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple to contribute to U.S. teen's education for spotting FaceTime bug
Description:
Apple Inc on Thursday rolled out
software updates to iPhones to fix a privacy issue in its
FaceTime video calling service, and said it would contribute
toward the education of the Arizona teenager who discovered the
problem.

Headlines: Apple puts modem engineering unit into chip design group
Description:
Apple Inc has moved its modem
chip engineering effort into its in-house hardware technology
group from its supply chain unit, two people familiar with the
move told Reuters, a sign the tech company is looking to develop
a key component of its iPhones after years of buying it from
outside suppliers.

Headlines: Apple iPhone sales in China fell by a fifth in fourth quarter: IDC
Description: Apple Inc iPhone sales in China fell 20 percent year-on-year in the fourth quarter of 2018, while sales for smartphones made by home-grown rival Huawei soared by 23 percent, data from industry research firm IDC showed on Monday.

Headlines: Apple iPhone sales in China fell by a fifth in Q4 -IDC
Description:
Apple Inc iPhone sales in China
fell 20 percent year-on-year in the fourth quarter of 2018,
while sales for smartphones made by home-grown rival Huawei
soared by 23 percent, data from industry research firm IDC
showed on Monday.

Headlines: Apple supplier Japan Display to get $700 million bailout from China, Taiwan group: Kyodo
Description: Ailing Apple supplier Japan Display Inc will receive up to 80 billion yen ($723 million) in a bailout from a group of Chinese and Taiwanese investors, Kyodo news agency reported.

Headlines: Apple supplier Japan Display to get $700 mln bailout from China, Taiwan group - Kyodo
Description:
Ailing Apple supplier Japan
Display Inc will receive up to 80 billion yen ($723
million) in a bailout from a group of Chinese and Taiwanese
investors, Kyodo news agency reported.

Headlines: REFILE-Software pirates use Apple tech to put hacked apps on iPhones
Description:
Software pirates have
hijacked technology designed by Apple Inc to distribute
hacked versions of Spotify, Angry Birds, Pokemon Go, Minecraft
and other popular apps on iPhones, Reuters has found.

Headlines: Apple ramps up self-driving program as Waymo says its tech improves
Description: Apple Inc has sharply increased its efforts to test self-driving cars on public roads but lags far behind market leader Waymo on a key safety metric, according to data released on Wednesday by the California Department of Motor Vehicles.

Headlines: U.S. charges former top Apple lawyer with insider trading
Description: The former top corporate lawyer at Apple Inc was criminally charged by the U.S. Department of Justice on Wednesday with insider trading ahead of six of the iPhone maker's quarterly earnings announcements.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple ramps up self-driving program as Waymo says its tech improves
Description:
Apple Inc has
sharply increased its efforts to test self-driving cars on
public roads but lags far behind market leader Waymo on a key
safety metric, according to data released on Wednesday by the
California Department of Motor Vehicles.

iPhone maker's quarterly earnings announcements.

Headlines: Google, Apple face calls to pull Saudi app allowing men to monitor wives
Description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - A Saudi Arabian government app that allows men in the country to monitor and control their female relatives' travel at the click of a button should be removed from Google and Apple's online stores, a U.S. politician and activists said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Apple, Walmart, IBM CEOs join White House advisory panel
Description: The chief executives of Apple Inc, Walmart Inc, IBM Corp and other major companies are joining a Trump administration advisory board that hopes to prepare U.S. workers to deal with job training issues and the worforce shift brought by artificial intelligence and automation, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple, Walmart, IBM CEOs join White House advisory panel
Description:
The chief executives of Apple Inc
, Walmart Inc, IBM Corp and other major
companies are joining a Trump administration advisory board that
hopes to prepare U.S. workers to deal with job training issues
and the worforce shift brought by artificial intelligence and
automation, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday.

Headlines: 'Pineapple Express' from Hawaii set to soak California
Description: California is bracing for its wettest storm of the winter as the "Pineapple Express" is set to dump up to 8 inches (20 cm) of rain and 8 feet (2.44 m) of snow on areas of the state, raising risks of flooding and mudslides, meteorologists said.

Headlines: Big hedge funds dumped China stocks, Apple as market tumbled
Description: Prominent hedge fund managers sold out of Chinese technology stocks and dumped Silicon Valley majors such as Apple Inc and Facebook Inc while global stock markets cratered during the fourth quarter, according to securities filings released on Thursday.

Headlines: Berkshire trims Apple stake, adds Suncor and Red Hat, exits Oracle
Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said it has trimmed its stake in iPhone maker Apple Inc, though none of the selling was Buffett's, and added positions in Canada's Suncor Energy Inc and software company Red Hat Inc.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to ship iPhones with only Qualcomm chips to German stores
Description:
Apple Inc said Thursday that it
will resume selling older iPhone models in its stores in
Germany, where they were banned last year due to a patent
infringement ruling.

Headlines: Software pirates use Apple tech to put hacked apps on iPhones
Description: Software pirates have hijacked technology designed by Apple Inc to distribute hacked versions of Spotify, Angry Birds, Pokemon Go, Minecraft and other popular apps on iPhones, Reuters has found.

Headlines: Apple supplier Japan Display forecasts 5th straight year of losses
Description: Japan Display Inc said it expects to post its fifth straight year of net losses, with a late shift to organic light-emitting diode (OLED) screens and slowing iPhone sales costing it orders from Apple Inc, its biggest client.

Headlines: Apple, Goldman Sachs to jointly launch credit card paired with iPhone: WSJ
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has teamed up with Apple Inc to issue credit cards that will be paired with iPhones and will help users manage their money, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-goldman-sachs-team-up-on-credit-card-paired-with-iphone-11550750400 on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Apple supplier AAC Tech suffers stock plunge after profit warning
Description: Apple Inc supplier AAC Technologies Holdings Inc saw its shares dropped 13 percent on Tuesday after the acoustic component maker said it expected first-quarter net profit to fall as much as 75 percent due to reduced orders.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple supplier AAC Tech suffers stock plunge after profit warning
Description:
* Rival Apple supplier Luxshare flags 2018 profit jump
(Adds Apple China context, analyst comment)

Headlines: Apple self-driving car layoffs give hints to division's direction
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it planned to lay off 190 employees in its self-driving car program, Project Titan, changes that provide a rare window into the automotive technologies the company has been pursuing.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Apple self-driving car layoffs give hints to division's direction
Description:
Apple Inc said on Wednesday it
planned to lay off 190 employees in its self-driving car
program, Project Titan, changes that provide a rare window into
the automotive technologies the company has been pursuing.

Headlines: Qualcomm launches patent challenge to Apple ahead of antitrust case
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Monday kicks off a patent challenge to Apple Inc, capping off a two-year legal strategy to put pressure on the iPhone maker before a major antitrust lawsuit between the two goes to trial in April.

Headlines: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas
Description: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headlines: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple
Description: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.

Headlines: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected
Description: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected
Description:
Apple Inc on Monday invited
media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its
campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch
a television and video service.

Headlines: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple
Description: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience
Description: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.

Headlines: Apple infringed three Qualcomm patents, jury finds
Description: Mobile phone chip supplier Qualcomm Inc on Friday won a legal victory against iPhone maker Apple Inc, with a jury in federal court in San Diego finding that Apple owes Qualcomm about $31 million for infringing three of its patents.

Headlines: Apple says Spotify wants benefits of a free app without being free
Description: Apple Inc on Thursday responded to Spotify Technology SA's complaint with EU antitrust regulators, saying the audio streaming service "wants all the benefits of a free app without being free".

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple says Spotify wants benefits of a free app without being free
Description:
Apple Inc on Thursday
responded to Spotify Technology SA's complaint with EU
antitrust regulators, saying the audio streaming service "wants
all the benefits of a free app without being free".

Headlines: U.S. judge rules Qualcomm owes Apple nearly $1 billion rebate payment
Description: A U.S. federal judge has issued a preliminary ruling that Qualcomm Inc owes Apple Inc nearly $1 billion in patent royalty rebate payments, though the decision is unlikely to result in Qualcomm writing a check to Apple because of other developments in the dispute.

Headlines: Apple unveils new iPad, updates Mini ahead of video streaming launch
Description: Apple Inc, in a surprise move on Monday, launched a new 10.5-inch iPad Air and updated its iPad Mini ahead of a March 25 event where it is expected to launch a television and video service.

Headlines: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Apple unveils new iPad, updates Mini ahead of video streaming launch
Description:
Apple Inc, in a surprise move
on Monday, launched a new 10.5-inch iPad Air and updated its
iPad Mini ahead of a March 25 event where it is expected to
launch a television and video service.

Headlines: Netflix says it will not join Apple TV service
Description: Netflix Inc, the world's dominant streaming service, will not make its TV shows and movies available through Apple Inc's upcoming video offering, Netflix Chief Executive Reed Hastings said on Monday.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Wall Street rises as Apple, tech shares climb
Description:
* Indexes up: Dow 0.84 pct, S&P 500 1.09 pct, Nasdaq 1.42
pct
(Updates to market close)

Headlines: Factbox - Apple's media ambition: Original shows, news subscription
Description: Apple Inc is expected to unveil a new video streaming service and a news subscription platform at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.

Headlines: FACTBOX-Apple's media ambition: Original shows, news subscription
Description:
Apple Inc is expected to
unveil a new video streaming service and a news subscription
platform at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.

Headlines: Australia's Myer department stores to stop selling Apple products
Description: Australia's largest department store operator Myer will stop selling "unprofitable" Apple Inc products as part of its drive to focus on higher-margin items, Myer Holdings said on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Apple News+, at $10 a month, could deliver more content than multiple subscriptions
Description:
Apple Inc's Apple News+
service will offer content from 300 popular magazines and
newspapers for just $10 a month. Unless you are wedded to print,
it may be time to consider dumping your subscriptions.

Headlines: UPDATE 8-Apple spotlights services with TV, gaming and credit card offerings
Description:
Apple Inc
attempted to reintroduce itself on Monday as an entertainment
and financial services company that also makes iPhones as it
launched a streaming television service, a credit card and an
online gaming arcade.

Headlines: Apple to launch a new credit card with Goldman. Are the perks worth it?
Description: Apple Inc said on Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc this summer that can be used to earn cash back on the purchase of Apple products, but analysts suggest its rewards do not stand out among rivals.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple to launch a new credit card with Goldman. Are the perks worth it?
Description:
Apple Inc said on
Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc
this summer that can be used to earn cash back on the
purchase of Apple products, but analysts suggest its rewards do
not stand out among rivals.

Headlines: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Apple partners with Goldman to add a credit card to Wallet
Description:
Apple Inc said on
Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc
this summer that will be synched with iPhone users' Apple
Wallet and can be used to buy Apple products at a discount.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple stretches to take on Netflix, Amex, Disney
Description: Apple has one big challenge – create new revenue streams – and many less than convincing solutions. Chief Executive Tim Cook unveiled a dizzying array of new subscription services on Monday that cover news, television and gaming. The $880 billion tech firm introduced a credit card too. The offerings ranged from confusing to mildly innovative.

Headlines: Apple TV+ joins crowded market for streaming options
Description: Apple Inc unveiled its Apple TV+ original content streaming service and Apple TV Channels subscription service on Monday without a price tag, making it difficult to evaluate how the new ventures will stack up to Netflix Inc and other competitors.

Headlines: Factbox: Apple launches TV app, streaming and gaming service
Description: Apple Inc on Monday launched streaming and video game services, looking to tap into 1.4 billion users of its gadgets to counter slowing demand for its iPhones.

Headlines: Factbox: Spielberg, Oprah to make shows for Apple's new streaming service
Description: Apple Inc unveiled an all new Apple TV app and a streaming service called Apple TV+ at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.

Headlines: Apple News+ is $10 per month. Is it time to dump your New Yorker subscription?
Description:
Apple Inc's new Apple News+
service consolidates popular newspaper and magazine
subscriptions, which could appeal more to casual readers
suffering from subscription fatigue than long-time fans of
specific publications.

Headlines: Apple invites Hollywood to Silicon Valley in TV push
Description:
Apple Inc
is expected to finally lift the curtain on Monday on a
secretive, years-long effort to build a television and movie
offering designed to compete with big media companies and boost
digital services revenue as iPhone sales taper.

Headlines: Apple, Qualcomm gird for next phase of patent battle after mixed U.S. rulings
Description: Split decisions on Tuesday by a U.S. government panel in  acrimonious patent disputes between iPhone-maker Apple and chip supplier Qualcomm left their battle lines largely unchanged ahead of a U.S Federal Trade Commission ruling and a major trial next month.

Headlines: Goldman's Apple pairing furthers bank's mass-market ambitions
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's credit card deal with Apple Inc is the latest move by the Wall Street investment bank to court mass-market consumers, potentially connecting Goldman with hundreds of millions of iPhone users.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple Card puts customer first, Goldman second
Description: Apple’s new credit card is a remarkable thing. Not because of the cash back offered to users – they can get similar deals elsewhere. And not because it’s made of titanium and has no numbers printed on it. The unusual thing is that in order to muscle in on a competitive industry, issuer Goldman Sachs has tossed aside many of the features that make the card business lucrative for banks in the first place.

Headlines: Apple News+, at $10 a month, could deliver more content than multiple subscriptions
Description: Apple Inc's Apple News+ service will offer content from 300 popular magazines and newspapers for just $10 a month. Unless you are wedded to print, it may be time to consider dumping your subscriptions.

Headlines: Apple spotlights services with TV, gaming and credit card offerings
Description: Apple Inc attempted to reintroduce itself on Monday as an entertainment and financial services company that also makes iPhones as it launched a streaming television service, a credit card and an online gaming arcade.

Headlines: Buffett says Apple content plan hard to predict, touts airline safety
Description: Warren Buffett on Thursday said he could not predict the success of Apple Inc's new suite of services but was confident the public would benefit as content providers vie for their wallets.

Headlines: Apple, luxury brands drop China prices as VAT cuts come into effect
Description:
Apple Inc and other
consumer brands lowered prices for their products in China on
Monday as a cut in the country's value-added tax (VAT) rate came
into effect.

Headlines: Troubled Apple supplier Japan Display to seek funding, shares surge
Description: (This April 1 story corrects the full name of OLED in paragraph 2)

Headlines: CORRECTED-Troubled Apple supplier Japan Display to seek funding, shares surge
Description:
Apple supplier Japan
Display Inc said on Monday it aims to raise as much as
$990 million in new financing as early as this week, sending
shares of the struggling manufacturer sharply higher.

Headlines: Aramco's $10 billion-plus bond plan shows profits put top earner Apple in shade
Description: Saudi Aramco, the world's biggest oil producer, made core earnings of $224 billion last year, almost three times as much as Apple, figures from the state-owned company showed on Monday ahead of its debut international bond issue.

Headlines: Apple, luxury brands drop prices in China on VAT cut
Description: Apple and luxury labels such as Gucci have lowered their prices in China after a cut in its value-added tax (VAT) rate came into effect from April 1.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Apple, luxury brands drop prices in China on VAT cut
Description:
Apple and luxury
labels such as Gucci have lowered their prices in China after a
cut in its value-added tax (VAT) rate came into effect from
April 1.

Headlines: Exclusive: Japan Display to supply OLED screens for Apple Watch - sources
Description: Japan Display Inc will begin to supply organic light-emitting diode (OLED) screens for the Apple Watch later this year, two sources said, a breakthrough for the cash-strapped company whose late shift to OLED has cost it orders from Apple.

Headlines: Apple cuts iPhone XR prices in India: sources
Description: Apple Inc has cut prices of one of its latest iPhones in India by around one-fourth, sources said, as the U.S. tech giant looks to boost sales in the world's second-biggest smartphone market following a similar move in China.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple cuts iPhone XR prices in India -sources
Description:
Apple Inc has cut
prices of one of its latest iPhones in India by around
one-fourth, sources said, as the U.S. tech giant looks to boost
sales in the world's second-biggest smartphone market following
a similar move in China.

Apple Inc has cut
prices of one of its latest iPhones in India by around
one-fourth, sources said, as the U.S. tech giant looks to boost
sales in the world's second-biggest smartphone market following
a similar move in China.

Headlines: Apple Music's U.S. subscriber count overtakes Spotify: source
Description: Apple Inc's streaming music service overtook rival Spotify Technology SA in terms of paid subscribers in the United States, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple Music's U.S. subscriber count overtakes Spotify -source
Description:
Apple Inc's streaming music
service overtook rival Spotify Technology SA in terms
of paid subscribers in the United States, a person familiar with
the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Apple in Dutch antitrust spotlight for allegedly promoting own apps
Description: Apple, already the subject of EU antitrust scrutiny, on Thursday became the target of a Dutch investigation for allegedly favoring its own apps on its popular App Store.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Apple in Dutch antitrust spotlight for allegedly promoting own apps
Description:
Apple, already the
subject of EU antitrust scrutiny, on Thursday became the target
of a Dutch investigation for allegedly favouring its own apps on
its popular App Store.

Headlines: Fried chicken vs $13: Apple, Qualcomm explain claims to jury as trial opens
Description: Apple Inc and Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday opened  a complex trial with the iPhone maker using a fried chicken analogy to illustrate its claim the chip company is abusing  its market power while Qualcomm alleged a years-long plan by Apple to deprive it of billions in revenue, $13 at a time.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple and Qualcomm face up to mutual need
Description: Apple and Qualcomm have faced up to their mutual need. The $940 billion smartphone maker and $85 billion mobile-chip firm on Tuesday ended a two-year fight over royalties with a licensing agreement and a cash payment to Qualcomm. Apple can’t risk being stuck with second-rate semiconductors in its devices, and Qualcomm has huge revenue at stake. At first blush, both sides benefit from the truce.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Fried chicken vs $13: Apple, Qualcomm explain claims to jury as trial opens
Description:
Apple Inc
and Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday opened  a complex trial
with the iPhone maker using a fried chicken analogy to
illustrate its claim the chip company is abusing  its market
power while Qualcomm alleged a years-long plan by Apple to
deprive it of billions in revenue, $13 at a time.

Headlines: Huawei says not discussed 5G chipsets with Apple, wins more telco gear contracts
Description: China's Huawei Technologies said on Tuesday it has not held talks with Apple Inc about supplying 5G chipsets, a day after its founder said it was open to selling such chips to the U.S. firm which has yet to unveil dates for a next-gen iPhone.

Headlines: Explainer: How 5G drove moves by Apple, Qualcomm and Intel
Description: Apple Inc and Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday settled an acrimonious two-year legal dispute. Shortly afterward, Intel Corp said it will exit the smartphone modem chip business.

Description:
Apple Inc and
Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday settled an acrimonious two-year
legal dispute. Shortly afterward, Intel Corp said it
will exit the smartphone modem chip business.

Headlines: Exclusive: Apple in talks with potential suppliers of sensors for self-driving cars - sources
Description: Apple Inc has held talks with at least four companies as possible suppliers for next-generation lidar sensors in self-driving cars, evaluating the companies' technology while also still working on its own lidar unit, three people familiar with the discussions said.

Headlines: Qualcomm gains $30 billion in market value after Apple settlement
Description: Qualcomm Inc added $30 billion to its market value after it resolved a legal battle with Apple Inc, a move that secures its leadership in 5G phone chips and could pave the way for a similar settlement with China's Huawei Technologies.

Headlines: Qualcomm stock jumps 23 percent on surprise settlement with Apple
Description: Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday won a major victory in its wide-ranging legal dispute with Apple Inc as the companies reached a surprise settlement that called for the iPhone to once again use Qualcomm modem chips.

Headlines: RPT-EXPLAINER-How 5G drove moves by Apple, Qualcomm and Intel
Description:
Apple Inc and
Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday settled an acrimonious two-year
legal dispute. Shortly afterward, Intel Corp said it
will exit the smartphone modem chip business.

Headlines: Apple optimistic as accessories, iPhone price cuts help China sales
Description: Apple Inc said sales in China were stabilizing and touted how increasing demand for services and accessories such as Apple Music and the Apple Watch helped offset a record drop in iPhone revenue.

Headlines: In streaming wars, Apple says it can coexist with Netflix
Description: Far from being a Netflix Inc killer, Apple Inc envisions its forthcoming Apple TV+ streaming service as one that could sit alongside other services that viewers buy, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Apple optimistic as accessories, iPhone price cuts help China sales
Description:
Apple Inc said sales in China
were stabilizing and touted how increasing demand for services
and accessories such as Apple Music and the Apple Watch helped
offset a record drop in iPhone revenue.

Headlines: Breakingviews - Apple’s old age beats Google’s adolescence
Description: Apple has old age and experience going for it. The $965 billion firm reported on Tuesday a 5 percent decline in quarterly revenue, but it did better than analysts anticipated. Meanwhile, Alphabet shares tanked even as it posted 17 percent growth in the top line. The Silicon Valley giants are both searching for the next big thing. Lower expectations and generous handouts give Apple more cushion.

Headlines: Apple optimistic on sales as iPhone price cuts help in China
Description:
Apple Inc on Tuesday forecast
stronger-than-expected third-quarter revenue and Chief Executive
Tim Cook said iPhone sales had started to stabilize in China, a
sign that Apple's price cuts there are helping limit sales
declines.

Headlines: Chipmaker AMS signals steady Apple orders, Android share grows

Description:
* Shares back where they were before November warning
(Adds CEO, more detail, analyst, valuation)

Headlines: Qualcomm hangs on to most Apple gains after earnings report
Description: Qualcomm Inc shares fell about 3.5% on Wednesday as investors got their first look at the bottom line impact of a patent fight settlement with Apple Inc, including a multibillion dollar one-time payment and more modest future patent fees.

Headlines: Apple's upbeat forecast pushes market value back toward $1 trillion
Description: Apple Inc shares rose nearly 5 percent on Wednesday, pushing the iPhone maker's market valuation back toward $1 trillion as its quarterly report and upbeat forecast soothed investors worried about falling iPhone sales.

Headlines: Golf: Koepka uses visit to the Big D to prepare for Big Apple
Description: Brooks Koepka does not sound too concerned about whether he wins the PGA Tour's Byron Nelson tournament this week as long as leaves the Big D for the Big Apple with his game in good shape.

Headlines: Apple teams up with SAP to help clients develop iPhone business apps
Description: Business software maker SAP and Apple are teaming up to help clients develop their own mobile business applications using Apple's machine-learning technology.

Description: A divided U.S. Supreme Court on Monday gave the go-ahead to an antitrust lawsuit accusing Apple Inc of forcing consumers to overpay for iPhone software applications, a decision that could lead to billions of dollars in damages and put at risk the company's lucrative way of selling apps.

Headlines: Chinese group to delay bailout funding for Apple supplier Japan Display
Description: A Chinese-Taiwanese group is delaying an up to 80 billion yen ($729.33 million) investment planned as part of a rescue deal for Apple Inc supplier Japan Display as it wants to reassess the target's prospects, the Japanese firm said.

Headlines: More antitrust class actions on the way after Supreme Court’s Apple ruling?
Description: In the U.S. Supreme Court’s decision Monday in Apple v. Pepper (2019 WL 2078087) – an antitrust class action in which consumers claim Apple is abusing its monopoly power in the market for iPhone apps – Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote that the court was merely applying its longstanding antitrust precedent from Illinois Brick v. State of Illinois (97 S.Ct. 2061).

Headlines: Apple's Webkit to launch new privacy feature for ad tracking
Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday its browser engine Webkit will launch a new technology to track advertising clicks and whether they lead to a product purchase while preserving the privacy of users.

Description: U.S. President Donald Trump met with Apple CEO Tim Cook on Thursday to discuss trade and other hot-button issues facing the tech company as Trump deliberates whether to make good on his threat to hike tariffs on imports from China.

Apple Inc iPhone sales dropped

successfully diversifying away from a single product and
forecast results above Wall Street targets.

Apple Inc's quarterly profit

Executive Tim Cook telling Reuters that "marked improvement in
greater China" drove the results.

predicted a boost from its services business and the launch of
new iPhones in the second half of 2019.

Lead Facebook Inc 
underwriter Morgan Stanley took a bet earlier this week
when it increased the size of the social networking firm's $16
billion initial public offering and it boosted the price.

Headlines: Historic Facebook debut falls flat
Description: The historic initial public offering of Facebook Inc did not go as planned on Friday, as the social networking company's sky-high valuation combined with trading glitches left the stock languishing near its offering price at the market close.

Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission will review the Nasdaq trading glitches surrounding the initial public offering of Facebook Inc on Friday, an agency spokesman said.

Description: Facebook Inc's modest debut on Friday may have averted a potential headache for the company and regulators, and kept at bay a debate over the role of "odd lots" in the marketplace.

Description: Nasdaq OMX said it intends to reach a resolution for Facebook Inc orders entered from 11 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. ET through an "offline matching process."

Headlines: Early Facebook mutual fund buyers still in money
Description: Fidelity Investments and other big mutual fund families that were early backers of Facebook Inc are likely still winners despite the social network's troubled stock market debut.

Description: Some customers of Fidelity Investments, Morgan Stanley and Charles Schwab are still waiting to see if their trades for Facebook shares were completed on Friday.

Headlines: Nasdaq admits put wrong fix for Facebook IPO glitch
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc admitted in a call with its member brokerage firms on Tuesday that it put the wrong fix for a technical glitch related to Facebook's IPO in place on Friday, which led to trading disruptions for much of the day.

Headlines: Insight: Morgan Stanley cut Facebook estimates just before IPO
Description: In the run-up to Facebook's $16 billion IPO, Morgan Stanley, the lead underwriter on the deal, unexpectedly delivered some negative news to major clients: The bank's consumer Internet analyst, Scott Devitt, was reducing his revenue forecasts for the company.

Headlines: SEC, FINRA to review Facebook issues, Nasdaq sued
Description: Two top U.S. financial regulators said the issues around the initial public offering of Facebook should be reviewed, putting fresh pressure on the company, its embattled lead underwriter and the Nasdaq.

Headlines: Wall Street struggles to find Facebook's worth
Description: In its three days of trading, Facebook's stock has dropped 18 percent from its $38 issue price. For the thousands of investors that bought at the IPO, that's bad enough, but one analysis of its earnings prospects suggests it could get a lot worse - more like $10 a share.

Headlines: Investor sues Nasdaq, alleges Facebook IPO bungled
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc has been sued by an investor who claimed the exchange operator was negligent in handling orders for Facebook Inc shares following its initial public offering, causing losses for investors.

Headlines: SEC head says Facebook IPO issues should be reviewed
Description: The top securities regulator said on Tuesday that the problems surrounding Facebook's initial public offering should be reviewed, but those issues should not shake investor confidence in the markets.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Silicon Valley takes Facebook fizzle in stride
Description:
Facebook's lackluster
initial public offering performance is a black eye for many on
Wall Street and could have ramifications for similar upcoming
deals such as an offering by Twitter, but venture capitalists in
Silicon Valley are keen to shrug off Facebook's stumble - at
least for now.

Headlines: Silicon Valley takes Facebook fizzle in stride
Description: Facebook's lackluster initial public offering performance is a black eye for many on Wall Street and could have ramifications for similar upcoming deals such as an offering by Twitter, but venture capitalists in Silicon Valley are keen to shrug off Facebook's stumble - at least for now.

Headlines: Knight Capital hit by Facebook loss, wants Nasdaq to pay
Description: Electronic trader Knight Capital Group said it suffered a pre-tax loss of $30 million to $35 million on the botched Nasdaq trading debut of social media giant Facebook and is demanding the exchange compensate that amount.

Headlines: Facebook exec ducks questions about IPO debacle
Description: Facebook Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg spoke to Harvard University students in her first public appearance since the company's disappointing initial public offering, but refrained from addressing the controversy around its messy, glitch-plagued debut.

Headlines: Facebook, banks sued over pre-IPO analyst calls
Description: Facebook Inc and lead underwriter Morgan Stanley were sued by shareholders who claimed they hid the social networking company's weakened growth forecasts ahead of its $16 billion initial public offering.

Headlines: Knight Capital sees losses on Facebook listing glitches
Description: Electronic trader Knight Capital Group Inc said its second-quarter results will be hurt by losses related to numerous issues during Facebook Inc's Nasdaq listing.

Headlines: Regulators, investors turn up heat over Facebook IPO
Description: Two top U.S. financial regulators said on Tuesday the issues around the initial public offering of Facebook should be reviewed, putting fresh pressure on the company, its lead underwriter, Morgan Stanley, and the Nasdaq stock exchange.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley to adjust prices on Facebook trades
Description: Morgan Stanley told brokers on Wednesday it is reviewing every Facebook Inc trade and will make price adjustments for retail customers who paid too much during the social network company's debut last week, according to an internal memo.

Headlines: Facebook told analysts to cut forecasts before IPO
Description: As Facebook Inc officials traveled the country to talk up the company's $16 billion initial public offering, the social networking giant advised analysts for underwriters to reduce revenue and earnings forecasts, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Needham starts Facebook with buy, $40 price target
Description: Brokerage Needham & Co started coverage on Facebook Inc with a "buy" rating, a rare positive take on the shares of the social network after they lost nearly a fifth of their value since the company's stock started trading last Friday.

Headlines: Facebook advised analysts to cut forecasts before float
Description: As Facebook officials traveled the country to talk up the company's $16 billion initial public offering this month, the social networking giant advised analysts for underwriters to reduce revenue and earnings forecasts, said people with direct knowledge.

Headlines: Analysis: Did banks cross the line in Facebook research calls?
Description: As regulators scrutinize Facebook's problem-plagued stock market debut, they may have to confront areas of securities law that do not always clearly spell out what industry analysts are allowed to tell clients about companies on the verge of going public.

Headlines: The numbers on the Facebook earnings revisions
Description: Four of Facebook's major underwriters -- Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan and Bank of America -- reduced their financial estimates for the soon-to-be-public company following the release of a revised prospectus on May 9 that noted the negative impact of mobile users on Facebook's business.

Headlines: Facebook market makers' losses total at least $100 million

Headlines: Shareholders sue Facebook, NYSE comes calling
Description: The fallout from Facebook Inc's messy initial public offering widened on Wednesday as shareholders sued the social network and its bankers while a trading firm revealed a massive loss on the shares and threatened to seek "remedies."

Headlines: Morgan Stanley, others make $100 million profit on Facebook trades: WSJ
Description: Morgan Stanley and other underwriters have made a profit of about $100 million stabilizing Facebook stock since trading began on Friday, the Wall Street Journal said, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook shares to disappoint for several quarters: analyst

Headlines: Facebook's market maker losses may top $115 million: sources
Description: Four of Wall Street's major market makers involved in Facebook's botched initial public offering last Friday expect their losses from technical glitches on Nasdaq's exchange to be around $115 million.

Description: Claims by four of Wall Street's main market makers against Nasdaq over Facebook's botched IPO are likely to exceed $100 million, as they and other traders continue to deal with thousands of problems with customer orders.

Headlines: UBS lost $30 million on Facebook IPO fiasco: source

Headlines: Facebook options debut a wild card for volatility

Description: Silicon Valley isn't quite ready to dump Morgan Stanley over the Facebook IPO fiasco.

Headlines: Facebook faces extended U.S. review of Instagram deal

Headlines: Factbox: Facebook IPO and legal arguments ahead
Description: Facebook's initial public offering has sparked lawsuits and investigations after a botched trading debut on the Nasdaq stock market delayed the completion of many orders and questions arose about selective disclosures of the company's financial prospects.

Headlines: Wall Street rises on Greek bets, Facebook falls 10 percent
Description: Stocks rose on Tuesday as signs Greece would stay in the euro zone were enough to spark buying in what has been a weak month for equities, while Facebook plumbed new lows on high volume.

Headlines: Facebook options volume explodes as stock hits new low
Description: A sharp decline in Facebook Inc shares has many investors scrambling for options to hedge the risk of further near-term weakness in the company's struggling stock.

Headlines: Facebook option volume explodes as stock hits new low
Description: A sharp decline in Facebook Inc shares has investors scrambling for options to hedge against further weakness in the company's struggling stock.

Headlines: Opera seen a Facebook fit but no "For Sale" sign
Description: Facebook is under pressure to make money from the increasing number of users who access the social networking site from mobiles, making Norway's Opera a good fit for it, bankers familiar with the technology industry said.

Headlines: Russia's VKontakte delays IPO after Facebook debacle
Description: Russian social network VKontakte says it won't risk going ahead with its planned initial public offering fearing a repeat of the botched Facebook float which left U.S. regulators red-faced and investors around the world fuming.

Headlines: HOW TO PLAY IT - Media plays beyond Facebook
Description:
Forget Facebook. Billboards may
be the way to go.

Headlines: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman defends Facebook IPO conduct
Description: Morgan Stanley chairman and chief executive officer James Gorman defended the securities firm's role in Facebook Inc's tumultuous initial public offering, telling CNBC on Thursday the firm followed standard procedures.

Headlines: Facebook makes a comeback, options volume soars
Description: Facebook Inc bounced back from record lows in frenetic trading on Thursday to finish in positive territory for the first time in four days, lifted in late trade by a U.S. market rebound and a brokerage upgrade.

Headlines: Nasdaq plays tough with clients angry over Facebook
Description: It's crisis communications 101 for Corporate America: when a company bungles an event as big as the Facebook IPO, alienates customers, and spawns lawsuits and regulatory inquiries, the CEO apologizes and agrees to provide compensation to make things right. Everyone can then move on.

Headlines: Portfolio managers would buy Facebook stock, at lower price
Description: Facebook Inc's 26 percent slide from its initial offering price may have investors who got in on the ground floor feeling resentful, but some fund managers are eager to see shares dip even further.

Headlines: Facebook's website goes down temporarily
Description: Facebook's website suffered sporadic outages on Thursday, anywhere from half an hour to two hours according to various blogs, tweets and affected users, but the company said the problem has been fixed.

Headlines: Facebook comments, ads don't sway most users: poll
Description: Four out of five Facebook Inc users have never bought a product or service as a result of advertising or comments on the social network site, a Reuters/Ipsos poll shows, the latest sign that much more needs to be done to turn its 900 million customer base into advertising dollars.

Headlines: Facebook sharpens mobile advertising
Description: Facebook Inc  is making it easier for advertisers to reach the growing ranks of users on smartphones and mobile devices, taking a significant step toward addressing one of investors' most pressing concerns and broadening its appeal to marketers.

Headlines: Facebook allows bespoke mobile ads, shores up Achilles Heel
Description: Facebook Inc  is making it easier for advertisers to reach the growing ranks of users on smartphones and mobile devices, taking a significant step toward addressing one of investors' most pressing concerns and broadening its appeal to marketers.

Headlines: Factbox: Facebook's post-IPO collapse by the numbers
Description: Shares of Facebook , the No. 1 social network, fell to an all-time low of $25.75 on Tuesday, well below the company's highly anticipated market debut at $38 on May 18.

Headlines: Startups must lower hopes after Facebook: Paul Graham
Description: Prominent Silicon Valley investor Paul Graham is warning the startups he fosters to ratchet down their fundraising expectations and conserve cash - and he blames Facebook.

Headlines: Facebook refines mobile ad offerings
Description:
Facebook Inc is
letting marketers place ads specifically in mobile versions of
its social network service, addressing a key concern about
broadening its appeal as smartphones and mobile devices become
more popular.

Headlines: Nasdaq's $40 million offer for Facebook losses draws criticism
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc said it will offer $40 million in cash and rebates to clients harmed by its mishandling of Facebook Inc's market debut.

Headlines: Nasdaq's Facebook move 'too limited'-Ex-SEC chief Pitt
Description: Nasdaq OMX's compensation for mishandling Facebook Inc's public offering is "too limited", though the exchange deserves praise for tackling the issue, former Securities and Exchange Commission chief Harvey Pitt said.

Headlines: NASDAQ CEO says exchange owes "apology" after Facebook IPO: WSJ
Description: NASDAQ OMX Group Inc's CEO Robert Greifeld said NASDAQ "owes the industry an apology" for technical problems associated with the exchange's Facebook initial public offering on May 18, according to an interview with the Wall Street Journal.

Headlines: Nasdaq rivals blast its Facebook compensation plan
Description: Rival exchanges on Thursday lashed out at Nasdaq OMX's  $40 million plan to compensate clients for its mishandling of Facebook's  initial public offering last month, calling the plan "illegal," "anti-competitive" and saying it was unlikely to be approved by U.S. regulators.

Headlines: Facebook, Microsoft said shopping Manhattan space
Description: Facebook Inc  and Microsoft Corp  are shopping for more office space in Manhattan, sources say, underscoring New York's stature as a must-have location for top tech companies who need to be "book-ended" on both the west and east coasts.

Headlines: Knight says industry losses on Facebook IPO may be $200 million
Description: Losses by banks and brokerages due to Facebook Inc's botched market debut on Nasdaq OMX Group's exchange nearly a month ago may be as high as $200 million, Thomas Joyce, chief executive officer of Knight Capital Group Inc, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Direct Edge to contest Nasdaq plan to aid Facebook clients
Description: Bill O'Brien, chief executive of exchange operator Direct Edge, on Thursday called Nasdaq OMX's plans to compensate clients for its mishandling of Facebook's initial public offering an illegal move and a challenge to the industry.

Headlines: Facebook backer turns his attention to Brazil
Description: One of Facebook's earliest investors has turned his attention to a distant market with a small but lively start-up scene: Brazil.

Headlines: Facebook to join Russell 3000 index
Description: Facebook Inc is on the preliminary list to join the Russell 3000 index, according to Russell Investments on Monday.

Headlines: Zynga shares dive as Facebook game craze wanes
Description: Zynga Inc shares fell more than 10 percent on Tuesday, extending three months of steady losses, as the social gaming company's user numbers wane and investors worry that the craze for games on Facebook may have passed its peak.

Headlines: Facebook sketches out IPO-mess defense; CTO departs
Description: Facebook Inc , facing a raft of lawsuits from investors seeking to recoup losses from its botched IPO, laid out on Friday how cascading Nasdaq trading glitches might have stoked the confusion that marred its May 18 debut.

Headlines: Facebook CTO to depart in first senior-level exit
Description: Facebook Inc's  chief technology officer, Bret Taylor, is departing "sometime this summer" to start his own company, in the first exit of a high-profile executive since the social networking company's IPO on May 18.

Headlines: Retailers feast on free Facebook tools, shun ads
Description: Krishan Agarwal, president of online luxury watch vendor Melrose.com, told a roomful of attentive Internet retailers last week how Facebook had helped his company generate about 25 percent more sales in two years.

Headlines: Facebook to file motion, discuss Nasdaq role in IPO: report
Description: Facebook is set to file a motion to consolidate all the shareholder lawsuits against the social network site, and is expected to place some blame on the Nasdaq for its botched IPO when it files the motion, the New York Times reported Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook to buy facial-recognition startup: sources
Description: Facebook Inc is paying $55 million to $60 million to buy Face.com, according to people familiar with the matter, acquiring the company that provides the facial-recognition technology used by the world's largest social network to help users identify and tag photos.

Headlines: Analysis: Facebook stock's bad start reins in short sellers
Description: Facebook's weak stock market debut has a potential silver lining for the social media giant - some short sellers may have been scared off.

Headlines: Facebook's unique visitors slipped in May: comScore
Description: Facebook's U.S. user numbers dwindled in May from April and March, according to data compiled by research firm comScore, in the latest sign that growth may be leveling off at the No. 1 social network.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Yahoo, Facebook seek more time for settlement talks
Description:
Yahoo Inc and Facebook Inc
 believe settlement talks in a high profile patent lawsuit
would be helped if a U.S. judge pushed back certain deadlines in
the case, according to a court filing on Tuesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook will change ad service to settle lawsuit
Description:
Facebook Inc has agreed to allow
users more control over how their personal information is used
in its "Sponsored Stories" ad feature, part of a deal to resolve
litigation against the social networking company.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook taps COO Sandberg to be first woman on board
Description:
Facebook Inc named
Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg a director on Monday,
elevating the first woman to a board that includes seven men.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook taps COO Sandberg to be first woman on board
Description:
Facebook Inc named
Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg a director on Monday,
adding the first woman to a board that includes seven men.

Headlines: Not all of Wall Street "friending" Facebook
Description: Facebook Inc may be having trouble connecting with Wall Street.

Headlines: Analysis: Top-rated analysts negative on Facebook earnings
Description: Wall Street's disappointment with Facebook looks poised to continue as research shows the social media giant's first earnings report could fall below forecasts by as much as 15 percent.

Headlines: Facebook, LinkedIn boost privacy drive-watchdog
Description: Technology groups Facebook and LinkedIn have agreed to beef up their international privacy and compliance teams in response to demands from the Irish regulator, the deputy Data Protection Commissioner told Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook Q2 earnings results scheduled for July 26
Description: Facebook Inc  will report its second-quarter financial results after the market closes on July 26, the company announced on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Ad exec sues Interpublic over Facebook investment
Description: * Volpe says Interpublic's $2.5 mln stake grew to $383.1 mln

Headlines: GM talking with Facebook about advertising again: sources
Description: General Motors Co and Facebook Inc are discussing the return of the U.S. automaker as a paid advertiser almost two months after GM said it would stop running ads on the social networking website, sources close to the situation said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook, Yahoo tie up, settle lawsuits
Description: Facebook Inc and Yahoo Inc agreed to forge a broad Internet advertising and licensing partnership on Friday, laying to rest their dueling patent lawsuits.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook, Yahoo tie up, settle lawsuits

* Wide-ranging alliance encompasses ad sales, event
coverage, patent licensing

Headlines: REFILE-Facebook, Yahoo tie up, settle lawsuits-AllThingsD
Description:
Facebook Inc and
Yahoo I nc < YHOO.O> have struck a broad advertising partnership
as part of a final settlement of duelling patent lawsuits,
technology blog AllThingsDigital cited sources close to the pact
as saying on Friday.

Headlines: Judge steps away from Facebook privacy lawsuit

Headlines: Facebook shares slide as user growth in question
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell about 1 percent on Tuesday, extending the previous day's losses after an investment analyst reported a decline in U.S. users for the No. 1 social network.

Headlines: Facebook, Wal-Mart chiefs meet to "deepen" relationship
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is about to add the biggest retail players to his list of friends.

Headlines: Nasdaq to unveil Facebook compensation plan next week: report
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc plans next week to release its compensation plan for firms that lost money in the bungled Facebook initial public offering, the FOX Business channel reported on Friday.

Headlines: Zynga takes axe to outlook, spooks Facebook investors
Description: Game provider Zynga Inc slashed its 2012 outlook and quarterly results badly missed Wall Street targets, sending its stock plunging 35 percent and casting a chill over Facebook Inc on the eve of the social network's inaugural results.

Headlines: Google, eBay, Amazon, Facebook back new lobbying group
Description: Google Inc, Amazon.com Inc, eBay Inc, Facebook Inc and other big Internet companies are starting a trade association to handle political and regulatory issues in Washington, a person close to the group said on Wednesday.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Facebook revenue growth skids, shares plunge
Description:
Facebook Inc 
reported a drastic slowdown in revenue growth and failed to
offer financial forecasts to quell fears about its ability to
boost advertising growth, sending its shares plummeting to a
record low.

Headlines: Instant view: Facebook's inaugural results underwhelm, Amazon's outlook weak
Description: Facebook Inc's first set of quarterly numbers failed to impress investors hoping for signs that the world's No. 1 social network can reverse a gradual deceleration in user and revenue growth.

Headlines: Facebook shares pressured by Zynga ahead of results
Description: Facebook shares tumbled ahead of its first quarterly results announcement as a public company on Thursday, hurt by a weak quarterly report and a grim outlook from online game developer Zynga.

Description: Investors wiped $10 billion off the value of Facebook Inc on Friday, taking the recently listed shares to a new low, after the social network offered no forecast and analysts said mobile investments would put future earnings under pressure.

Headlines: Recession, Libor, Facebook punish Europe's banks

Headlines: Judge skeptical of Facebook settlement over ad product

Headlines: Soros, Coleman among few hedge fund fans of Facebook
Description: As dozens of top hedge funds disclosed their second-quarter stock holdings on Tuesday, few reported owning shares in slouching social network Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Analysis: Facebook insider lockup ending, share impact seen muted

Headlines: Facebook plumbs new lows as sales curbs start to expire
Description: Facebook Inc shares sank 6.3 percent to a record closing low after early investors got the greenlight to sell for the first time since the No. 1 social network went public, starting a string of insider lockup expirations that will pressure the stock for months.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop 4 percent, hit another low
Description: Facebook Inc shares sank as much 4.3 percent on Friday to set a new low, a day after early investors got the green light to sell for the first time.

Headlines: Facebook director Thiel sold 20 million shares after lockup

Headlines: Facebook shares edge up after hitting new low

Headlines: Facebook's director in spotlight after cashing out

Headlines: FTC clears Facebook's acquisition of Instagram
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission cleared Facebook Inc's acquisition of Instagram, voting unanimously to close its antitrust investigation into the deal without taking any action.

Headlines: FTC clears Facebook acquisition of Instagram
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission cleared Facebook Inc's acquisition of Instagram on Wednesday, voting unanimously to close its antitrust investigation into the deal without taking any action.

Headlines: UBS says Nasdaq's Facebook compensation plan inadequate
Description: The $62 million compensation plan proposed by Nasdaq OMX Group for fallout from Facebook's botched IPO is "inadequate to address the magnitude of Nasdaq's unprecedented failures", UBS Securities LLC said in a letter to U.S. regulators.

Description: Facebook Inc co-founder Dustin Moskovitz sold 450,000 Class A shares over the past three days, his second such sale since last Friday, becoming the latest insider to sell shares following the end of the lockup, according to a regulatory filing late on Friday evening.

Description: Germany's biggest consumer lobby group believes Facebook is violating privacy laws with its new app centre and has set a deadline for the social network operator to fix it, or potentially face legal action.

Headlines: Facebook co-founder Moskovitz sells more shares

Headlines: Knight accepts Nasdaq's $62 million Facebook payback plan

Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell 4.5 percent to a new low on Friday after brokerages cut their price targets on the company's shares, saying several lock-up expirations over the next year will weigh on the stock.

Headlines: Facebook says no secondary offering to cover tax bill
Description: Facebook Inc promised not to sell stock to cover a nearly $2 billion tax bill and said it will allow employees to cash in their stock weeks ahead of schedule, moving to soothe nervous investors and its own staff as its share price spirals downward.

Headlines: Facebook rules out share sale to cover tax bill
Description: Facebook Inc promised not to sell stock to cover a nearly $2 billion tax bill and said it will allow employees to cash in their stock weeks ahead of schedule, moving to soothe nervous investors and its own staff as its share price spirals downward.

Headlines: Nasdaq unwavering on paybacks for faulty Facebook launch
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc stands by its $62 million compensation plan for firms harmed in Facebook Inc's glitch-ridden market debut and is prepared to defend against any potential litigation related to it, Lee Shavel, the company's chief financial officer, said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook CEO's "search" comments raise hopes, questions
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has fired a warning shot that threatens to ignite a battle to marry social networking with one of the most valuable areas of the technology industry: search.

Headlines: Facebook CEO's 'search' comments raise hopes, questions
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has fired a warning shot that threatens to ignite a battle to marry social networking with one of the most valuable areas of the technology industry: search.

Headlines: After Zuckerberg talks, Facebook gains $6.8 billion
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg might need to talk more often. A 30-minute appearance at a technology industry conference earlier this week has translated into $6.785 billion in additional market valuation for his company.

Headlines: Google seen taking Facebook's crown in U.S. display ads
Description: Google Inc is set to become the biggest earner in U.S. display ads this year, taking the No. 1 rank away from Facebook Inc and cementing its dominant presence in online advertising.

Headlines: Why are 5 million kids on Facebook if it doesn't want them?
Description: Facebook has an ugly little secret, a number disclosed nowhere in its voluminous filings to become a public company and now only vaguely addressed by corporate officials.

Headlines: Nasdaq defends Facebook compensation plan-letter to SEC
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc stood by its proposed $62 million plan to compensate firms affected by the fallout from Facebook's botched initial public offering, taking aim at UBS AG, Citigroup Inc and other parties that derided the payback plan.

Headlines: U.S. judges to decide venue for Facebook lawsuits
Description: Before Facebook Inc investors can pursue their court fight over the social network's problematic stock market debut, a panel of federal judges must decide whether to put the cases under one roof and, if so, where.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook to charge merchants to run offers
Description: Facebook Inc said it will start charging businesses to run Offers on its social network, turning a previously free service into a potential revenue generator at a time when Wall Street is demanding new sources of growth and profit from the company.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook tightens privacy to satisfy Irish regulator
Description:
Facebook Inc has
tightened up its privacy controls sufficiently to satisfy a
review by the body that regulates the social networking company
outside North America, removing the immediate threat of legal
challenges.

Description:
Facebook, the world's
biggest social network, has fully implemented most of the
recommendations made by Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner,
the watchdog responsible for regulating its European and Irish
operations said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop after Barron's snub
Description: Facebook shares dropped on Monday after financial weekly Barron's questioned the social networking company's value and priced its stock at just $15.

Headlines: French government asks Facebook to explain data glitch
Description: The French government has summoned Facebook Inc managers to appear before the country's data watchdog to explain how some of its users came to believe their privacy had been infringed on the social network, it said in a statement early on Tuesday.

Headlines: Middle East telcos mull alliance in Facebook fight
Description: Middle East telecommunications firms are discussing the idea of creating a pan-Arab online platform that would earn them more revenue from their networks by challenging Facebook and other Internet behemoths of the West.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's new pitch to brand advertisers: forget about clicks
Description:
Facebook Inc, stung
by doubts that advertising on the social network delivers enough
bang for the buck, is preparing to unveil data to counter its
critics and show that "clicks," the current metric of choice,
tell only half the story.

Headlines: Medvedev points Facebook's Zuckerberg towards Russian IT sector
Description: Prime minister Dmitry Medvedev told Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Monday that Russia's IT industry was as promising an area for investment as its natural resources sectors.

Headlines: Facebook lets U.S. users pay to boost visibility of postings
Description: Facebook Inc is letting users in the United States pay a fee to boost the visibility of their postings on the social network, the company's latest effort to look beyond advertisers for revenue.

Headlines: Facebook crosses billion threshold, on quest for growth
Description: Facebook Inc passed the 1 billion user mark in September, a level of global penetration that is a remarkable achievement for an 8-year-old social network and a heightened challenge to its quest for sustained growth.

Description:

8-year-old social network and a heightened challenge to its

Headlines: Facebook's head of communications to leave company
Description: Joe Lockhart, Facebook Inc's head of global communications and a former press secretary for President Bill Clinton, is leaving the social networking company, Facebook said.

Headlines: Facebook pitches new $20 million "Sponsored Stories" settlement
Description: Facebook Inc has proposed a revised $20 million settlement in a class action lawsuit accusing it of violating the rights of users through its "Sponsored Stories" advertising feature after a U.S. judge rejected an earlier accord.

Headlines: Facebook opens first international engineering centre in London
Description: Facebook's first engineering centre outside the United States opened in London on Tuesday, boosting the British government's ambition to make the digital economy a central plank of its growth strategy.
