Description:
* Monthly active users top 1 billion, of which 604 million
were mobile

Headlines: Facebook mobile revenue grows faster than expected
Description: Facebook Inc grew mobile advertising revenue several times in the third quarter, a faster-than expected pace that helped reassure investors that the world's No. 1 social network is beginning to figure out how to earn money off smartphone and tablet users.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook mobile revenue grows faster than expected
Description:
* Monthly active users top 1 billion, of which 604 million
were mobile

Headlines: Clinton: Facebook post about Benghazi attack not hard "evidence"
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said on Wednesday a Facebook post in which an Islamic militant group claimed credit for a recent attack on the U.S. mission in Benghazi, Libya did not constitute hard evidence of who was responsible.

Headlines: Facebook wins back friends on Wall Street, shares soar
Description: Facebook Inc's shares headed towards their biggest one-day jump on Wednesday after the company reported a surprising rise in mobile advertising, easing concerns it was having trouble capitalizing on soaring use of smartphones and tablets.

Headlines: Facebook's mobile surprise allays growth fears
Description: Facebook Inc grew mobile advertising revenue several times in the third quarter, a faster-than-expected pace that helped drive shares in the world's No. 1 social network nearly 13 percent higher.

Headlines: Star Silicon Valley analyst felled by Facebook IPO fallout
Description: The firing of Citigroup stock analyst Mark Mahaney on Friday in the regulatory fallout from Facebook Inc's initial public offering was greeted with shock and dismay in Silicon Valley, where Mahaney was a well-known and well-liked figure.

Headlines: Citi fined $2 million over Facebook IPO, fires two analysts
Description: Citigroup fired its top Internet analyst, Mark Mahaney, and paid a $2 million fine to a Massachusetts regulator to settle charges that the bank improperly disclosed research on Facebook IPO and information on other tech companies.

Headlines: New York man who sued Facebook faces criminal charges
Description: A New York man was arrested Friday on charges he forged documents in a multibillion-dollar scheme to defraud Facebook Inc and its chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, through a lawsuit claiming a huge ownership stake in the Internet company.

Headlines: Facebook shares fall as lock-up period expires
Description: Facebook Inc shares fell nearly 4 percent in busy trade on Wednesday as the company allowed employees to start selling roughly 230 million shares less than six months after its rocky market debut.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg sells $7.4 million in stock
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg and two other executives at the social networking company sold millions of dollars worth of stock this week as restrictions on insider trading expired.

Headlines: Facebook stock jumps 12.6 percent as share lockup expires
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc jumped nearly 13 percent on Wednesday, as investors breathed a sigh of relief that expiring trading restrictions on a huge block of shares failed to trigger an immediate wave of insider selling.

Headlines: Facebook campaign wins German boy soccer gravestone
Description: A church in Germany has bowed to public pressure and allowed the parents of a soccer-mad nine-year old boy who died from a brain tumor to erect a gravestone with a ball beside it after a Facebook campaign spawned more than 100,000 angry messages.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook offering e-retailers sales tracking tool
Description: Facebook Inc wants more credit for making online cash registers ring.

Headlines: Facebook director Andreessen sells $54 million in shares to cover taxes
Description: Facebook Inc board member Marc Andreessen sold roughly $54 million worth of shares in the social networking company on Monday to cover taxes he owes on his holdings.

Headlines: Facebook to share data with Instagram, loosen email rules
Description: Facebook Inc is proposing to combine user data with that of recently acquired photo-sharing service Instagram, and will loosen restrictions on emails between members of the social network.

Headlines: Privacy groups ask Facebook to withdraw proposed policy changes
Description: Two privacy advocacy groups urged Facebook Inc on Monday to withdraw proposed changes to its terms of service that would allow the company to share user data with recently acquired photo-application Instagram, eliminate a user voting system and loosen email restrictions within the social network.

Headlines: Facebook not so fun with a click from boss or mom
Description: Posting pictures of yourself plastered at a party and talking trash online with your Facebook friends may be more stress than it's worth now that your boss and mom want to see it all.

Headlines: Tajikistan blocks Facebook access to silence critics
Description: Tajikistan has blocked access to Facebook in response to a slew of comments spreading "mud and slander" about veteran President Imomali Rakhmon and officials in the Central Asian republic.

Headlines: Zynga shares slide after privileged status with Facebook ends
Description: Shares of gaming company Zynga Inc fell as much as 10 percent, a day after the "Farmville" creator reached an agreement with Facebook Inc that reduces its dependence on the social networking giant.

Headlines: Judge gives initial OK to revised Facebook privacy settlement
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday gave his preliminary approval to a second attempt by Facebook Inc to settle a class action lawsuit which charges the social networking company with violating privacy rights.

Headlines: Facebook voting begins on Instagram data-sharing, email privacy
Description: Facebook Inc opened the polls on Monday for its roughly 1 billion users to vote on a variety of changes to the social network's policies, including a proposal to scrap the user voting system that Facebook introduced in 2009.

Headlines: Student group takes Facebook privacy gripes to court
Description: An Austrian student group plans to go to court in a bid to make Facebook Inc, the world's biggest social network, do more to protect the privacy of its hundreds of millions of members.

Headlines: U.S. judge names lead plaintiffs in Facebook litigation
Description: A group of investors including state pension funds in North Carolina and Arkansas will be the lead plaintiffs in securities lawsuits arising out of Facebook Inc's $16 billion initial public offering, a U.S. judge ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook in talks to buy Microsoft ad technology: reports
Description: Facebook Inc is in negotiations with Microsoft Corp about acquiring advertising technology that could allow the social network displays ads on other websites, broadly expanding its advertising business, according to media reports on Thursday.

Headlines: Italian tax police visit Facebook's Milan offices
Description: Italian police have been carrying out checks at the Milan offices of Facebook to assess whether it regularly declared its income in Italy, an investigative source and the U.S. company said on Friday.

Headlines: Twitter launches photo color filters to battle Instagram, Facebook
Description: Twitter on Monday introduced the ability to add color filters to user-uploaded photos, a step that sharpened its budding rivalry with Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Facebook helps FBI bust cybercriminals blamed for $850 million losses
Description: Investigators led by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and aided by Facebook Inc, have busted an international criminal ring that infected 11 million computers around the world and caused more than $850 million in total losses in one of the largest cybercrime hauls in history.

Headlines: Intel launches microserver chips, gets nod from Facebook
Description: Intel launched a data-center chip using low-power technology found in smartphones, stepping up competition in the nascent microserver market and winning a nod from Facebook.

Headlines: Google, Facebook drive mobile ad market growth: report
Description: Google Inc's mobile ad revenue in the United States will be roughly $4 billion next year, while Facebook Inc's nascent mobile advertising business will more than double, according to a new study by research firm eMarketer.

Headlines: Internet ayatollah: Iran's supreme leader "likes" Facebook
Description: Facebook - banned in Iran due to its use by activists to rally government opponents in 2009 - has an unlikely new member: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

Headlines: Internet ayatollah - Iran's supreme leader "likes" Facebook
Description: * Use of websites appears aimed at countering Western media

Headlines: Facebook set to bring video ads to news feed - report
Description:
Facebook Inc is set to unveil a
new application in the first half of next year that would stream
video advertisements in users' news feed, Ad Age reported,
citing several industry executives who have been briefed on the
company's plans over the past few weeks.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg donates $500 million for health, education
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg is donating half a billion dollars in Facebook stock to a Silicon Valley charity, his second major donation since committing to giving away most of his wealth.

Headlines: Facebook tests charging users to send certain messages
Description: Facebook Inc unveiled a test on Thursday that charges users to send certain types of messages through the social network, the latest example of the company looking for new sources of revenue and profit.

Headlines: Facebook Instagram use dived after photo fiasco: AppData
Description: Facebook Inc's Instagram lost almost a quarter of its daily users a week after it rolled out and then withdrew policy changes that incensed users who feared the photo-sharing service would use their pictures without compensation.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook Instagram use dived after photo fiasco-AppData
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
Instagram lost almost a quarter of its daily users a week after
it rolled out and then withdrew policy changes that incensed
users who feared the photo-sharing service would use their
pictures without compensation.

Headlines: Facebook shares rise in buildup to mystery event, earnings
Description: Facebook Inc's stock opened on Monday above $32 for the first time since July as anticipation about upcoming products and financial results underscored Wall Street's renewed confidence in the online social network.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook rolls out friends-based search product
Description:
Facebook Inc 
took the wraps off a new search tool on Tuesday that lets people
trawl their network of friends to find everything from
restaurants to movie recommendations, an improvement that's
likely to increase competition with review websites like Yelp
 and potentially even Google Inc.

Description:

took the wraps off a new search tool on Tuesday that lets people
trawl their network of friends to find everything from
restaurants to movie recommendations, an improvement that's
likely to increase competition with review websites like Yelp
 and potentially even Google Inc.

Headlines: Facebook's new search feature will reveal only "shared" results
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday the No. 1 social network's new search feature will initially focus on helping users sort through photographs, people, places and other content that has been shared with them.

Headlines: Facebook search to generate revenue, no rival to Google: analysts
Description: Facebook Inc's new search tool has strong potential to generate revenue for the social networking company, though it is unlikely to challenge Google Inc as the world's dominant search engine, Wall Street analysts said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Is Facebook envy making you miserable?
Description: Witnessing friends' vacations, love lives and work successes on Facebook can cause envy and trigger feelings of misery and loneliness, according to German researchers.

Headlines: Facebook founder to host fundraiser for New Jersey Governor Christie
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla, will host a fundraiser for New Jersey Republican Governor Chris Christie at their California home on February 13, the social networking site said on Thursday.

Headlines: Yandex says new mobile app is blocked by Facebook
Description: Russian internet company Yandex said on Friday its new experimental application to search on social networking sites from mobile devices was blocked by Facebook.

Headlines: Fusion-io cuts 2013 forecast as Apple, Facebook delay orders
Description: Fusion-io Inc slashed its fiscal 2013 revenue forecast as key customers Facebook Inc and Apple Inc delayed orders, sending the storage drive maker's shares down 21 percent after the bell.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook's mobile ad revenue doubles in fourth quarter
Description:
* Facebook alerts Street to big spending inflation in 2013
to chase growth

Headlines: Facebook CEO plans to grow headcount in 2013
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the company expects to grow its headcount in 2013 as it invests in new products. Zuckerberg said the world's No.1 social network will be focused on building the business for the long-term and will not be operating to maximize profit in 2013.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook's mobile ad revenue doubles in fourth quarter
Description:
Facebook Inc 
doubled its mobile advertising from the previous quarter as the
world's No. 1 social network expanded its business aggressively
onto handheld devices.

Headlines: Fusion-io sees weak third quarter as Apple, Facebook delay orders
Description: Storage drive maker Fusion-io Inc forecast current-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates as Facebook Inc and Apple Inc delayed bulk orders, sending its shares down 21 percent after the bell.

Headlines: Instant View: Facebook ad revenue climbs as mobile expands
Description: Facebook Inc advertising business grew at its fastest clip since before the company's May initial public offering, helping the company's revenue expand 40 percent to $1.585 billion.

Headlines: Facebook stock avoids steep drop as Street rethinks results
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc recovered from an 8 percent slide on Thursday, finishing the regular session down less than 1 percent, as Wall Street's initial alarm over mobile revenue results and spending plans subsided.

Headlines: Facebook starts selling retail gift cards on website
Description: Facebook Inc introduced gift cards on Thursday that consumers can use at Target Corp and a handful of other businesses in the social network's latest move into the retail market.

Headlines: Coming soon to Facebook- more action, battle games
Description: When nWay began a trial of its dark, sci-fi combat game "ChronoBlade" on Facebook last year, the San Francisco-based startup felt sure it had a hit on its hands.

Headlines: Coming soon to Facebook: more action, battle games
Description: When nWay began a trial of its dark, sci-fi combat game "ChronoBlade" on Facebook last year, the San Francisco-based startup felt sure it had a hit on its hands.

Headlines: Nasdaq in settlement talks with SEC over Facebook IPO: WSJ
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc is in preliminary talks with U.S. securities regulators over a possible settlement for the glitch-ridden stock market debut of social networking site Facebook Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people with knowledge of the discussions.

Headlines: Facebook says target of sophisticated hacking attack
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday that it been the target of a series of attacks by an unidentified hacker group, but it had found no evidence that user data was compromised.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says target of sophisticated hacking attack
Description:
* Social network company says no evidence user data
compromised

Headlines: Facebook hacked, social media company says
Description:
* Social network company says no evidence of user data
compromised

Headlines: Yahoo goes social, teams with Facebook for site revamp
Description: Yahoo Inc is overhauling its website to incorporate features familiar to Facebook users such as a newsfeed and people's "likes," in CEO Marissa Mayer's biggest product revamp since taking the helm of the ailing company last year.

Headlines: Facebook blocks access to NBC.com after reports site is infected
Description: Facebook Inc has blocked users from accessing the NBC.com website following reports that the site is infected with a computer virus.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook blocks access to NBC.com after reports site is infected
Description:
Facebook Inc has blocked
users from accessing the NBC.com website following reports that
the site is infected with a computer virus.

Headlines: Facebook, Google tech gurus to design cancer research game
Description: Scientists from a British cancer charity are teaming up with technology gurus from the likes of Amazon, Facebook and Google to design and develop a mobile game aimed at speeding the search for new cancer drugs.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook buys Microsoft ad technology platform
Description: * Technology should help Facebook show effectiveness of ads

Headlines: Facebook to showcase new look for newsfeed on March 7
Description: Facebook Inc will unveil a new look for its popular "newsfeed" next week, the latest move by the Web company to revamp key elements of its 1 billion member social network.

Headlines: Facebook to showcase "new look" for newsfeed
Description: Facebook Inc will hold a media event on March 7 at its Menlo Park, California headquarters to showcase a "new look for newsfeed," the company said in an emailed invitation on Friday.

Headlines: Twilio copies Facebook tactic: funding other startups
Description: Years before becoming a publicly traded internet juggernaut, Facebook  tried an unorthodox tactic to expand its influence - giving start-ups money to build Facebook apps.

Headlines: Facebook unveils 'mobile first,' picture-friendly newsfeed
Description:
Facebook Inc 
introduced a visually richer, mobile device-oriented "newsfeed"
on Thursday, in the most significant changes to date for the
social network's most recognizable feature.

Headlines: Insight: On Facebook, app makers face a treacherous path
Description: Last spring, the future for Viddy, a video-sharing Facebook app, seemed as sunny as Southern California's skies.

Headlines: Netflix allows U.S. users to connect accounts to Facebook
Description: Video service Netflix Inc unveiled a new feature on Wednesday that allows subscribers to let their Facebook Inc friends know what television shows and movies they are watching and also see friends' viewing activity.

Headlines: Facebook may emulate rival Twitter with introduction of hashtags
Description: Facebook Inc is looking to improve its search and indexing capabilities by adding the hashtag symbol, one of the most recognizable features of its social networking rival Twitter, according to media reports.

Headlines: Ex-Oregon governor candidate charged in Facebook IPO fraud
Description: A former Oregon gubernatorial candidate was arrested on Tuesday for his alleged role in defrauding investors who had hoped to buy shares of Facebook Inc before its initial public offering in May 2012, federal authorities said.

Headlines: Zynga relaunches gaming site, loosens Facebook ties
Description: Online game publisher Zynga Inc relaunched its website on Thursday, allowing users to play its games without first signing on to Facebook, a significant step toward establishing its independence from Facebook Inc.

Headlines: U.S. approves Nasdaq payback plan for Facebook IPO, UBS unhappy
Description: Regulators approved Nasdaq OMX Group's $62 million compensation plan for firms that lost money in Facebook Inc's glitch-ridden market debut, a victory for the exchange operator that also set the stage for potential lawsuits from firms seeking more.

Headlines: Judge recommends Ceglia case vs Facebook be dismissed
Description: A federal judge on Tuesday recommended the dismissal of a lawsuit against Facebook Inc in which Paul Ceglia, an upstate New York wood pellet salesman, claimed a huge ownership stake in the social media company.

Headlines: Nasdaq extends deadline for Facebook IPO compensation applications
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group said on Wednesday it filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to extend the deadline for firms to apply for compensation relating to Facebook Inc's problematic IPO to April 8 from March 29.

Headlines: Facebook aims to take centerstage on Android phones
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday unveiled its most ambitious attempt yet to enter mobile computing without a phone of its own, introducing a new app that replaces the home screen on some Android smartphones.

Headlines: Facebook unveils "chat heads" messaging tool for mobile phones
Description: Facebook Inc introduced a messaging tool called "chat heads" on Thursday, part of a new family of software applications called "Home" intended to place the social network and its services at the forefront of users' mobile phones.

Headlines: First phones with Facebook's "Home" will be exclusive to AT&T
Description: AT&T Inc will exclusively sell the first smartphones pre-loaded with Facebook Inc's new family of "Home" applications starting April 12, the wireless carrier said on Thursday.

Headlines: Citi files claim with Nasdaq for compensation from Facebook IPO: sources
Description: Citigroup has filed a claim with Nasdaq OMX Group to potentially receive compensation for losses associated with Facebook Inc's glitch-ridden market debut last May, according to two people with knowledge of the situation.

Headlines: Nasdaq slashes Greifeld's bonus over botched Facebook IPO
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc  said it slashed the 2012 annual bonus of Chief Executive Robert Greifeld by $542,100 over the botched handling of Facebook Inc's  initial public offering last year.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg calls for U.S. immigration reform
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said the U.S. needs to fix a "strange" immigration policy that prevents promising but undocumented students from contributing to the country's future and doesn't provide enough visas for foreign workers with advanced skills.

Headlines: Facebook to build data center near Des Moines, Iowa
Description: Facebook Inc is building a data center near Des Moines, Iowa, to bolster its computing power as it rolls out new services and as the growing use of smartphones increase the pressure on its infrastructure.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook's mobile business expands in first quarter
Description:
Facebook Inc's mobile advertising
business continued to expand in the first three months of the
year, but the social network's rising spending restrained profit
growth.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook first-quarter revenue up 38 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc's first-quarter
revenue increased 38 percent year-on-year, as the world's
largest social network continued to grow its mobile advertising
business.

Headlines: Facebook and banks ask U.S. judge to throw out IPO lawsuit
Description: Facebook Inc, its Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg and dozens of banks asked a federal judge to throw out a lawsuit accusing the social media company of misleading investors about its financial condition before its $16 billion initial public offering a year ago.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Facebook's mobile business expands in first quarter
Description:
(In 7th paragraph, corrects analyst Ronald Josey's firm to JMP
Securities from Jefferies & Co)

Headlines: Facebook in talks to buy Israel's Waze for up to $1 billion: report
Description: Facebook Inc is in advanced talks to acquire Israeli mobile satellite navigation start-up Waze for $800 million to $1 billion, business daily Calcalist reported on Thursday.

Headlines: AT&T cuts "Facebook phone" price to 99 cents, weeks after launch
Description: AT&T Inc has cut the price of the HTC First phone, which is preloaded with Facebook Inc applications, to 99 cents from $99.99 less than a month after the phone's launch.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter apps come to Glass, Google's wearable computer
Description: Social networking services Facebook Inc and Twitter are coming to Google Glass, the wearable computer made by the Internet search company.

Headlines: Google eyes Waze as Facebook circles hot Web maps property
Description: Google Inc is in talks to buy Waze, an Israeli mapping start-up that has held discussions with several large technology companies, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Headlines: Nasdaq to pay $10 million to settle SEC charges from Facebook snafu
Description: Nasdaq OMX on Wednesday agreed to pay $10 million, the largest penalty ever levied against a stock exchange, to settle civil charges stemming from mistakes made during Facebook's initial public offering last year, U.S. securities regulators said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says needs to improve response to hate speech
Description:
Facebook Inc admitted
its systems to remove hate speech haven't worked as well as the
company had hoped, amid reports that advertisers were pulling
their brands off the social network in the face of a backlash
from women's groups.

Headlines: Facebook shares jump as brokers say usage concerns overblown
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc jumped 5.6 percent on Thursday after two investment brokerages upgraded their recommendations, arguing that concerns over the waning engagement of younger users were overblown.

Headlines: Yelp open to partnering with Facebook's rival offering: CFO
Description: Consumer review aggregator Yelp Inc, which analysts say could face intense competition from Facebook Inc's "graph search", is open to partnering with the social networking website's latest offering, Yelp's Chief Financial Officer Rob Krolik told Reuters.

Headlines: Analysis: As Facebook grows up, grand ambitions get reality check
Description: Facebook, which once seemed poised to take over the Internet, is showing its limitations: a host of newer services are gaining ground among trend-setting youth; a much-hyped smartphone app has received a tepid response; and grand ambitions such as taking on Google in the search business seem ever more fanciful.

Headlines: Facebook denies providing government 'direct access' to servers
Description: Facebook Inc said Thursday it does not provide any government agency with "direct access" to its servers, denying a central element of a Washington Post report.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook pares ad options, simplifies marketing tools
Description:
Facebook Inc is
eliminating various types of advertisements on its website in an
effort to simplify a system that it acknowledged was confusing
marketers.

Headlines: Facebook urges U.S. government to allow disclosure of security requests
Description: Facebook Inc on Tuesday urged the U.S. government to allow Internet companies to reveal the size and scope of the national security information requests they receive, echoing statements made by Google Inc and Microsoft Corp.

Headlines: Facebook tackles stock price complaints in first shareholder meeting
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg faced a barrage of questions on Tuesday about the company's slumping stock price during the No. 1 social networking company's first shareholder meeting since its rocky initial public offering last May.

Headlines: Facebook got 9,000-10,000 government data requests in second half 2012
Description: Facebook Inc received between 9,000 and 10,000 requests for user data from various U.S. government entities in 2012's second half, involving 18,000 to 19,000 of its users' accounts, the world's largest social network said in a Friday blogpost.

Headlines: Facebook has never been stronger since IPO, Sandberg says
Description: A year after Facebook Inc's fumbled IPO, Wall Street remains slow to recognize what Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg argues has been an across-the-board improvement in its business.

Headlines: Facebook rolls out video for Instagram
Description: Facebook Inc introduced video for its popular photo sharing application Instagram in an attempt to go to head-to-head with rival Twitter.

Headlines: Facebook admits year-long data breach exposed 6 million users
Description: Facebook Inc has inadvertently exposed 6 million users' phone numbers and email addresses to unauthorized viewers over the past year, the world's largest social networking company disclosed late Friday.

Headlines: Fund manager gets 11 years for Facebook, Groupon shares scam
Description: Former fund manager John Mattera was sentenced to 11 years in prison on Friday, after pleading guilty of defrauding investors of $13 million with a story that he put their money in Facebook Inc and Groupon Inc shares before the companies went public.

Headlines: Former Oregon politician pleads guilty to Facebook IPO fraud
Description: Former Oregon gubernatorial candidate Craig Berkman pleaded guilty on Tuesday to defrauding investors by persuading them he could use their money to buy shares of Facebook Inc before the company's May 2012 initial public offering.

Headlines: Facebook ad products director to join online-payment firm Square
Description: Facebook Inc's director of advertising products has been hired by Square in a significant coup for the young online-payments company.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook ad products director to join online-payment firm Square
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
director of advertising products has been hired by Square in a
significant coup for the young online-payments company.

Headlines: Judge scrutinizes Facebook deal to end privacy lawsuit over ads
Description: Child rights advocates tried to convince a U.S. judge on Friday that a Facebook  legal settlement did not go far enough to keep content created by minors out of the hands of advertisers.

Headlines: Tired of helping the CIA? Quit Facebook, Venezuela minister urges
Description: A Venezuelan government minister on Wednesday urged citizens to shut Facebook accounts to avoid being unwitting informants for the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency, referring to recent revelations about U.S. surveillance programs.

Headlines: Facebook mobile users jumped around 20 percent in U.S., UK in June
Description: The number of users accessing Facebook via their mobile phones in June jumped around 20 percent in the United States and Britain, the social network said, touting its appeal for brands trying to reach consumers during the summer months.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook shares soar as users, mobile ads climb
Description:
Facebook Inc 
delivered strong evidence it can thrive on smartphones and
tablets on Wednesday, reporting a much better-than-anticipated
surge in mobile advertising revenue in the second quarter that
ignited a nearly 17 percent share rally.

Headlines: Facebook shares soar as users, mobile ads climb
Description: Facebook Inc delivered strong evidence it can thrive on smartphones and tablets on Wednesday, reporting a much better-than-anticipated surge in mobile advertising revenue in the second quarter that ignited a 20 percent share rally.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook shares soar as users, mobile ads climb
Description:
Facebook Inc 
delivered strong evidence it can thrive on smartphones and
tablets on Wednesday, reporting a much better-than-anticipated
surge in mobile advertising revenue in the second quarter that
ignited a 20 percent share rally.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook Q2 revenue grows 53 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc's revenue in the
second quarter increased 53 percent, surpassing Wall Street
targets, as the Internet company continued to grow its mobile
ads business.

Headlines: Nasdaq likes Facebook's surge, but earnings curb Dow, S&P
Description: The Nasdaq climbed on Thursday, led by a rally in Facebook a day after its earnings, but the broader market's advance was modest after another round of mixed earnings reports.

Headlines: Facebook lifts U.S. stocks as dollar, global shares fall
Description: The dollar and global equity markets fell on Thursday after mixed corporate earnings and renewed worries about growth in China weighed on investor sentiment, but a 30 percent jump in Facebook Inc shares lifted U.S. stocks from the doldrums.

Headlines: Facebook shares jump 28 percent, Wall Street sees more ad growth
Description: Facebook Inc shares opened 28 percent higher on Thursday after the company reported a huge jump in mobile advertising revenue, and analysts pointed to further growth from new advertising on Instagram and 15-second videos.

Headlines: Facebook wows Wall Street with mobile ads growth
Description: Facebook Inc's stellar results allayed fears that the company may face difficulty in making money from mobile ads and prompted several Wall Street brokerages to raise their target price on the stock.

Headlines: Facebook stock almost hits IPO price, 14 months after rocky debut
Description: Facebook Inc's stock on Tuesday came within a hair of reclaiming its $38 debut price for the first time since going public in 2012, a milestone in the social networking company's effort to wipe away Wall Street's skepticism of its business.

Headlines: Facebook surfing pays off for some investors
Description: Nabil Elsheshai jokes about wasting time on Facebook, but his surfing has paid off.

Headlines: Facebook plans to buy voice recognition app maker
Description: Facebook Inc plans to buy the maker of a speech recognition and language translation app, providing technology that could bolster the social networking company's mobile efforts.

Headlines: Facebook reveals daily users for U.S. and UK, data aimed at advertisers
Description: One out of three people in the United States - more than 128 million - visit Facebook every day, and about 24 million in the United Kingdom do the same, the company said on Tuesday, releasing regional data for the first time as a way of helping advertisers understand how people use the social network.

Headlines: Facebook to offer OpenTable restaurant bookings via mobile
Description: Facebook Inc  struck a deal with online restaurant booking service OpenTable Inc  that will allow users to reserve tables at restaurants via a Facebook app, as the world's No. 1 social network continues to expand its mobile services.

Headlines: Hacker who exposed Facebook bug to get reward from unexpected source
Description: A man who hacked into Mark Zuckerberg's Facebook page to expose a software bug is getting donations from hackers around the world after the company declined to pay him under a program that normally rewards people who report flaws.

Headlines: Facebook-led project seeks Internet access for all
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg has enlisted Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, Qualcomm Inc and other technology companies to help him in a project aimed at making Internet access affordable for the 5 billion people around the world who are not online.

Headlines: U.S. judge approves Facebook privacy settlement over ads
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday granted final approval to Facebook's $20 million settlement of a lawsuit over targeted advertising despite objections that the deal did not go far enough to protect children's privacy.

Headlines: Facebook says countries sought data on 38,000 users in first half of 2013
Description: Governments sought information on over 38,000 Facebook users in the first half of 2013 and the No.1 social network complied with most requests, the firm said in its first report on the scale of data inquiries it gets from countries around the world.

Headlines: In Facebook's first pay vote, tough love from an old friend
Description: Some of Mark Zuckerberg's mutual fund backers delivered a tough message on compensation for the leaders of Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Facebook considers adding profile photos to facial recognition
Description: Facebook Inc is considering incorporating most of its 1 billion-plus members' profile photos into its growing facial recognition database, expanding the scope of the social network's controversial technology.

Headlines: A Minute With: Vin Diesel on going dark, getting ripped and Facebook
Description: With a voice several octaves underground and a piercing stare, action star Vin Diesel goes to an even darker place as Riddick in the third installment of the sci-fi film series, nine years after "The Chronicles of Riddick."

Headlines: Russia's Mail.Ru sells remaining Facebook stock
Description: Russian internet firm Mail.Ru has sold its remaining shares in social network group Facebook Inc for $525 million, making a hefty profit on its original investment and paving the way for a possible one-off payout to shareholders.

Headlines: Apps make self-destructing posts for Facebook and Twitter
Description: The Snapchat app popularized the concept of sending photos and videos that self-destruct in minutes and new apps do the same for posts on social media sites like Facebook and Twitter.

Headlines: FTC to scrutinize new Facebook facial recognition feature
Description: U.S. officials will examine changes to Facebook Inc's privacy policy to determine whether they violate a 2011 agreement with federal regulators, a Federal Trade Commission spokesman confirmed Wednesday after certain changes drew fire from privacy advocates.

Headlines: U.S. broker's Facebook misstep leads to fine, suspension
Description: A Facebook post defending a drug company stock has spurred more than a year of headaches for a broker who has been fined and suspended in a case that highlights the perils of running afoul of the securities industry's social media rules.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg says U.S. spying hurt users' trust
Description: Facebook Inc CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday said revelations about U.S. government surveillance hurt users' trust in Internet companies and that knowing more about the programs would help relieve some of the public concerns.

Headlines: Facebook 'like' deserves free speech protection: U.S. court
Description: Facebook users who employ the website's "like" feature to show support for a political candidate engage in legally protected speech, a U.S. appeals court said, reviving a lawsuit examining the limits of what people may constitutionally do online.

Headlines: Facebook, other banned sites to be open in China free trade zone: report
Description: Facebook, Twitter and other websites deemed sensitive and blocked by the Chinese government will be accessible in a planned free-trade zone (FTZ) in Shanghai, the South China Morning Post reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook, other banned sites to be open in China free trade zone - report
Description:
Facebook, Twitter and
other websites deemed sensitive and blocked by the Chinese
government will be accessible in a planned free-trade zone (FTZ)
in Shanghai, the South China Morning Post reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook, other banned sites to be open in China free trade zone - report
Description:
Facebook, Twitter and
other websites deemed sensitive and blocked by the Chinese
government will be accessible in a planned free-trade zone (FTZ)
in Shanghai, the South China Morning Post reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook and Twitter too late for China's Internet
Description: Facebook Inc and Twitter face a daunting task in China, if access to their social networks is unblocked, as they would be up against deeply entrenched domestic rivals which cater to local needs and tastes.

Headlines: Cisco, Facebook to work with businesses to expand free Wi-Fi use
Description: Cisco Systems Inc and Facebook Inc said on Wednesday they will work with big businesses such as hotels and retailers to provide free wireless Internet access to consumers who sign in using a Facebook log-in.

Headlines: Facebook helps design housing complex near headquarters
Description: The commute may be getting a lot shorter for some of Facebook Inc's workers.

Headlines: Memories of Facebook cloud Twitter's IPO
Description: When Facebook Inc was preparing to go public last year, the telephones at Granite Investment Advisors rang off the hook as clients called about the social media's company's highly anticipated debut.

Headlines: Onavo buy to boost Facebook's plan to widen Internet access
Description: Facebook Inc bought Israeli mobile app-maker Onavo to use its data-saving capabilities for a project aimed at making the Internet available to billions of people round the world who are not online.

Headlines: Facebook lifts restriction on teen users sharing with public
Description: Facebook Inc removed a restriction for users under 18 that previously limited who could see their online postings from photos to musings on the world-wide social network.

Headlines: Gory videos OK when posted for users to 'condemn': Facebook
Description: Facebook Inc has surreptitiously resumed allowing decapitation videos to be posted on its website, lifting a temporary ban it had placed earlier this year on content featuring graphic violence.

Headlines: One-third of U.S. adults get news through Facebook: study
Description: One in three Americans get news through Facebook, according to a study from the Pew Research Center released on Thursday.

Headlines: Analysis: Apple, Facebook options reflect hopes for stock gains
Description: The options market is reflecting a higher probability of large upside moves in Apple Inc and Facebook Inc stock when both companies report quarterly earnings next week.

Headlines: Nasdaq says FINRA caps Facebook IPO claims at $41.6 million
Description: The total value of the claims that market makers can recover after suffering losses due to Nasdaq OMX Group Inc's botched handling of Facebook Inc's initial public offering is $41.6 million, the exchange operator said Friday.

Headlines: Facebook executives coach Brazil politicians before Internet vote
Description: As Brazil threatens to impose strict new regulations on American Internet companies, Facebook offered some of its top politicians free advice this week on how to win "friends" and maximize "likes" on their webpages.

Headlines: RPT--Wall Street's love affair with Facebook hinges on mobile
Description:
Facebook Inc 
finally earned Wall Street's love in the second quarter. Now it
needs to make the relationship last.

Headlines: BlackBerry met with Facebook about potential bid: WSJ
Description: BlackBerry Ltd executives flew to California to meet with Facebook Inc last week to gauge its interest in a potential bid for the struggling smartphone-maker, according to a Wall Street Journal report citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Vietnam court sentences Facebook campaigner to house arrest
Description: * Jailing of government critics complicates ties with U.S.

Headlines: Facebook shares back on roller-coaster, but analysts see value
Description: More than a dozen brokerages increased their price targets on Facebook Inc shares on Thursday.

Headlines: Analysis - Facebook's ad warning sounds a note of caution for Twitter
Description: Facebook Inc's investors and other proponents of the social network like to say that it captures one of the greatest concentrations of human attention on the planet and thus offers a boundless opportunity for advertisers.

Headlines: GM executive defends company on Facebook, then closes account
Description: A top General Motors executive deactivated his Facebook account on Monday after he responded to a website that wrote dismissively about the company's shrinking U.S. auto market share.

Headlines: Twitter's goal in IPO: to avoid becoming Facebook
Description: As Twitter Inc's chief financial officer planned the company's initial public offering this year, he had one overriding goal: to avoid becoming the next Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Snapchat rejected $3 billion buyout offer from Facebook: report
Description: Mobile messaging startup Snapchat rejected an acquisition offer from Facebook Inc that would have valued the company at $3 billion or more, according to a Wall Street Journal report on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook phases in 'Unfollow' button
Description: Facebook Inc has replaced its "Hide All" button with the more succinct "Unfollow," letting users block all messages and posts from selected friends.

Headlines: Facebook phases in "Unfollow" button
Description:
Facebook Inc has replaced its "Hide
All" button with the more succinct "Unfollow," letting users
block all messages and posts from selected friends.

Headlines: Facebook to join S&P 500
Description: Standard & Poor's on Wednesday said Facebook Inc will join its S&P 500 stock index after the close of trading on December 20, cementing the social media network's rise into one of the biggest, most powerful U.S. companies.

Headlines: Oregon politician gets six years for Facebook IPO fraud
Description: A former candidate for governor of Oregon was sentenced to six years in prison on Monday for fraudulently convincing investors he had access to shares of Facebook Inc before its highly anticipated initial public offering in 2012.

Headlines: Nasdaq fails to win dismissal of Facebook IPO lawsuit
Description: A federal judge has rejected Nasdaq OMX Group Inc's bid to dismiss lawsuits by investors who accused the exchange operator of botching Facebook Inc's $16 billion initial public offering, a decision released on Monday shows.

Headlines: Facebook backer Yuri Milner exits automatic Y Combinator investments
Description: Yuri Milner, the Russian investor known for his bets on Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc, is pulling out of an arrangement that let him invest automatically in a group of companies participating in a program called Y Combinator.

Headlines: Facebook to test video ads, opening new revenue source
Description: Facebook Inc took a first step on Tuesday toward selling video ads that play automatically in newsfeeds, moving cautiously to unlock a source of revenue that could annoy users.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to test video ads, opening new revenue source
Description:
Facebook Inc took a
first step on Tuesday toward selling video ads that play
automatically in newsfeeds, moving cautiously to unlock a source
of revenue that could annoy users.

Headlines: Facebook to begin selling video ads - WSJ
Description:
Facebook Inc will begin selling
video ads later this week and plans to make an announcement on
Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people
familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook, Zuckerberg, banks must face IPO lawsuit: judge
Description: Facebook Inc, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg and dozens of banks must face a lawsuit accusing the social media company of misleading investors about its health before its $16 billion initial public offering, a federal judge said.

Headlines: Zuckerberg to sell Facebook shares worth about $2.3 billion
Description: Facebook Inc founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg will sell 41.4 million shares worth about $2.3 billion to pay a tax bill, as part of an offering by the social network of 70 million Class A common shares.

Headlines: T-Mobile prepaid service to offer free Facebook access
Description: GoSmart, the prepaid service of No. 4 U.S. operator T-Mobile US, said on Monday it would offer its customers free access to Facebook Inc whether or not they subscribe to its Internet service.

Headlines: Nasdaq to compensate firms on December 31 for botched Facebook IPO
Description: Nasdaq OMX Group Inc will compensate firms on December 31 for qualifying claims related to Facebook Inc's botched May 2012 initial public offering, the exchange operator said in a note to traders on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook to buy Android app monitoring tool maker
Description: Facebook Inc is buying India-based Little Eye Labs, a startup that builds performance analysis and monitoring tools for mobile Android apps, to help boost its technology as it focuses on growing revenue from its mobile business.

Headlines: Russia's Yandex to get access to Facebook content
Description: Russian internet group Yandex has signed an agreement with Facebook for access to content from some of the social networking site's users in a move to further improve its search results.

Headlines: Facebook cites progress on low-power server technology
Description: Facebook Inc's executive in charge of revolutionizing data centers on Tuesday lauded low-energy server technology that is expected to compete against heavyweight Intel Corp.

Headlines: Facebook 4th-quarter revenue rises 63 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
revenue increased 63 percent in the fourth quarter, as
advertising on its mobile services continued to accelerate.

Headlines: Wall Street rallies on Facebook and GDP; Amazon sinks late
Description: The S&P 500 scored its biggest gain in more than a month on Thursday as Facebook led a tech rally and data showed the U.S. economy was on solid footing in the fourth quarter.

Headlines: Facebook grants father's wish to see dead son's video
Description: Facebook has granted a Missouri father's tearful request to unlock his dead son's social media page and give him access to a video compilation of photos and posts he had been unable to view.

Headlines: BlackBerry shares surge after Facebook bid for WhatsApp
Description: Facebook Inc's stunning $19 billion bid for fast-growing mobile-messaging startup WhatsApp sent shares of BlackBerry Ltd surging after the closing bell on Wednesday, as investors were cheered by the lofty valuation for the messaging platform.

Headlines: Facebook to buy WhatsApp for $19 billion
Description: Facebook Inc will buy fast-growing mobile-messaging startup WhatsApp for $19 billion in cash and stock, as the world's largest social network looks for ways to boost its popularity, especially among a younger crowd.

Headlines: Wall St. rises on factory data; Tesla and Facebook jump
Description: Stocks climbed on Thursday after a reading on manufacturing activity hit its highest in nearly four years, while news about Facebook and Tesla drove their shares to record highs.

Headlines: BlackBerry shares set to jump on Facebook's WhatsApp bid
Description: Facebook Inc's $19 billion bid for fast-growing mobile-messaging startup WhatsApp sent shares of BlackBerry Ltd higher before the opening bell on Thursday as investors placed bets that the smartphone maker's own messaging platform has been undervalued.

Headlines: Thai protesters take to Facebook to target businesses linked to PM
Description: Protesters campaigning to oust Thai Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra turned to Facebook and other social media to attack businesses linked to her family on Thursday and rallied outside the offices of a property developer whose share price tumbled.

Headlines: Facebook to buy WhatsApp for $19 billion in deal shocker
Description: Facebook Inc will buy fast-growing mobile-messaging startup WhatsApp for $19 billion in cash and stock in a landmark deal that places the world's largest social network closer to the heart of mobile communications and may bring younger users into the fold.

Headlines: Wall Street sees sense in Facebook's $19 billion WhatsApp purchase
Description: Facebook Inc's purchase of fast-growing mobile-messaging startup WhatsApp for $19 billion stunned the markets but analysts said the deal made strategic sense as it will solidify the social network's position as a leader in mobile.

Headlines: In Asia, WhatsApp posts mixed message for Facebook
Description: WhatsApp may be hugely popular but its forays into Asia, the world's biggest mobile market, have had mixed success, raising questions about whether it can sustain the explosive growth Facebook Inc cited to justify its $19 billion price tag.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says makes progress targeting users
Description:
Facebook highlighted on Wednesday
two ad campaigns in an attempt to persuade advertisers that its
massive membership base and ability to home in on specific
audiences makes it a more effective advertising platform than
broadcast TV.

Headlines: Facebook, Instagram crack down on gun sales on social networks
Description: Facebook Inc and its photo sharing subsidiary, Instagram, will delete posts offering to buy or sell guns without background checks, Facebook announced on Wednesday.

Headlines: Yahoo to stop user access of services with Facebook, Google IDs
Description: Yahoo Inc will stop letting consumers access its various online services, including Fantasy Sports and photo-sharing site Flickr, by signing-in with their Facebook Inc or Google Inc credentials.

Headlines: Privacy groups ask regulators to halt Facebook's $19 billion WhatsApp deal
Description: Privacy advocates have asked U.S. regulators to halt Facebook Inc's $19 billion acquisition of messaging service WhatsApp until there is a clearer understanding of how the company intends to use the personal data of WhatsApp's 450 million users.

Headlines: Man who sued Facebook's Zuckerberg must face fraud charges: judge
Description: A New York businessman must face criminal fraud charges for trying to claim a billion-dollar stake in social media company Facebook Inc, a federal judge ruled on Friday.

Headlines: Turkish president rejects Facebook, YouTube ban over wiretaps
Description: Turkey's president on Friday ruled out any ban on Facebook and YouTube after Prime Minister Tayyip Erdogan said the sites could be shut to stop his foes anonymously posting audio recordings purportedly exposing corruption in his inner circle.

Headlines: Turkey's Gul says Facebook, YouTube ban out of question
Description: Turkey's president on Friday ruled out a ban on Facebook and YouTube after Prime Minister Tayyip Erdogan threatened such a move to stop political foes posting audio recordings purportedly exposing government corruption.

Headlines: Facebook's San Francisco-area HQ secured after threat made: police
Description: Police searched and secured the headquarters of social media giant Facebook Inc on Tuesday evening after receiving a threat against the company, which San Francisco-area authorities said turned out to be "totally not credible".

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg phoned Obama to complain about spying
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg blasted the U.S. government's electronic surveillance practices on Thursday, saying he'd personally called President Barack Obama to voice his displeasure.

Headlines: U.S. news readers less engaged when referred by Facebook: study
Description: Readers of some of the top U.S. news sites are more engaged when they go directly to the website rather than through Facebook, according to a study from the Pew Research Center released on Monday.

Headlines: How Facebook avoided Google's fate in talent poaching lawsuit
Description: Facebook Inc has emerged as one of the biggest Silicon Valley companies to have resisted rivals' entreaties to stop poaching each other's employees, according to emails between the No. 1 social network and Google Inc released in court filings.

Headlines: Federal judge dismisses Ceglia case against Facebook
Description: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit filed by New York businessman Paul Ceglia against Facebook Inc and its founder Mark Zuckerberg, adopting findings by a magistrate judge that a purported contract entitling him to an ownership stake in the company was fake, according to court documents.

Headlines: Judge tosses lawsuit against Facebook over use of minors' photos
Description: A California federal judge has dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit against Facebook Inc that had accused the company of misappropriating the names and likenesses of minors who use the social network.

Headlines: Facebook takes page out of Google playbook with Oculus deal
Description: Does Facebook Inc have Google envy?

Headlines: Apple, Facebook, Google Web data centers getting greener: report
Description: Apple Inc, Google Inc and Facebook Inc have made significant progress in adopting renewable energy sources to power their Web services, the environmental group Greenpeace said in a report on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to require separate mobile app for messages
Description: Facebook Inc will no longer let users send and receive private messages within its main smartphone app, and will require that users install a separate messaging app, the Internet company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook says WhatsApp deal cleared by FTC
Description: Facebook Inc said U.S. regulators have cleared its $19 billion acquisition of mobile messaging service WhatsApp, even as the Federal Trade Commission warned the two Internet companies on Thursday that they must not backtrack on commitments to user privacy.

Headlines: Facebook plans to provide mobile payment services: FT
Description: Facebook Inc is preparing to join the mobile-payments race with remittances and electronic-money services on the social network, the Financial Times reported on Sunday, citing several people involved in the process.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook Q1 revenue grows 72 percent on rising mobile ads
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
mobile advertising business accelerated in the first three
months of the year, helping the Internet social networking
company top Wall Street's financial targets.

Headlines: Facebook Q1 revenue grows 72 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
mobile advertising business continued to accelerate in the first
three months of the year, helping the Internet social networking
company top Wall Street's revenue target.

Headlines: Facebook gets U.S. antitrust approval to buy Oculus
Description: Social network giant Facebook Inc has won U.S. antitrust approval to buy Oculus VR Inc, a two-year-old maker of virtual reality goggles, the Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook acquires fitness tracking mobile app Moves
Description: Facebook Inc has acquired the maker of a mobile app that can track the distance consumers walk or run and measure the calories burned, giving the social networking company an entree into the nascent market for fitness and health monitoring technology.

Headlines: Facebook lets users limit data shared with apps
Description: Facebook introduced new features on Wednesday that let users limit how much personal information they share with third-party mobile apps, a move meant to quell privacy concerns as the social network seeks to become a top entry port to the Internet.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook lets users limit data shared with apps
Description:
(Recasts with Facebook privacy charges, details about the ad
network)

Headlines: Facebook launches mobile ad network to vie with Google, Twitter
Description:
Facebook Inc 
rolled out a new service that it envisions will distribute ads
across a network of mobile applications, opening the door to a
new source of revenue for the Internet social network.

Headlines: Wiretap claims fail against Facebook, Zynga in disclosure lawsuit
Description: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday dismissed federal wiretap claims against Facebook Inc and Zynga Inc in a civil lawsuit over disclosure of user information to advertisers.

Headlines: Facebook says it may open sales office in China
Description: Facebook Inc said it may consider opening a sales office in China to provide more support to local advertisers who use the website to reach customers overseas.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says it may open sales office in China
Description:
Facebook Inc said it may consider
opening a sales office in China to provide more support to local
advertisers who use the website to reach customers overseas.

Headlines: Facebook to open sales office in China: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc plans to open a sales office in China to work with local advertisers, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook to open sales office in China -Bloomberg
Description:
Facebook Inc plans to open a sales
office in China to work with local advertisers, Bloomberg
reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Publicis, Facebook set marketing deal in 'hundreds of millions': source
Description: French advertising agency Publicis Groupe SA and Facebook Inc have struck a multi-year digital marketing deal worth hundreds of millions of dollars, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook to roll out 'I'm a Voter' feature worldwide
Description: When Americans voted to renew President Barack Obama's lease on the White House in November 2012, more than 9 million citizens took to Facebook to click the "I'm a Voter" button, showing their online friends that they had cast a ballot.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook to expand video ads to seven countries outside U.S.
Description: Facebook Inc is expanding its new video advertising service, allowing marketers to show the television-like spots to users of the social network in Britain, Brazil and five other countries, the company told Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook narrows audience that sees new users' first posts
Description: Facebook Inc has changed a privacy setting on its social network, limiting the audience that sees new users' first posts in a reversal of a feature that had critics said forced people to over-share personal information.

Headlines: REFILE-Facebook narrows audience that sees new users' first posts
Description:
Facebook Inc has
changed a privacy setting on its social network, limiting the
audience that sees new users' first posts in a reversal of a
feature that had critics said forced people to over-share
personal information.

Headlines: Facebook seeks EU antitrust review of WhatsApp deal: source
Description: Social network Facebook has asked European Union antitrust regulators to examine its $19 billion takeover of mobile messaging service WhatsApp, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Thai ministry sparks alarm with brief block of Facebook
Description: Thai Facebook users were alarmed on Wednesday when the Information Communications Technology (ICT) Ministry blocked access to the site at the request of the military, but the junta blamed the brief shutdown on a technical problem.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Thai ministry sparks alarm with brief block of Facebook
Description: * Army says social media not blocked, blames gateway glitch

Headlines: Thai military seeks Facebook, Google cooperation with censorship
Description: Thailand's military junta will send officials to Singapore and Japan in coming days to seek tighter censorship of social media from Facebook, Google Inc and instant messenger service Line, a government spokesman said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg pledges $120 million to Bay Area schools
Description: Facebook founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan have pledged $120 million to Bay Area schools to help underserved communities in San Francisco, the two wrote in an essay to the San Jose Mercury News.

Headlines: Facebook acquires mobile data plan firm Pryte
Description: Facebook Inc is acquiring Pryte, a Finnish company that aims to make it easier for mobile phone users in under-developed parts of the world to use wireless Internet apps.

Headlines: U.S. spy agency joins Facebook, Twitter
Description: The CIA, which has long trolled social media to try to uncover global trends and track evil-doers, officially joined Twitter and Facebook on Friday.

Headlines: Zuckerberg, other Facebook directors are sued over pay plan
Description: Mark Zuckerberg and other members of Facebook Inc's board have been sued by a shareholder who claimed a policy letting them annually award directors more than $150 million of stock each if they choose is unreasonably generous.

Headlines: Facebook's Instagram to expand ads beyond U.S
Description: Instagram, the mobile photo service owned by Facebook Inc, is expanding its nascent advertising business beyond the United States and will begin showing ads to users in Britain, Canada and Australia, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook expands users' ad targeting profiles with website data
Description: Facebook Inc is expanding the internal user profiles that underpin its targeted advertising system, for the first time including personal information based on activities that did not occur within the boundaries of its social network.

Headlines: Irish judge asks EU court to clarify data rules after Facebook allegations
Description: Ireland's High Court on Wednesday asked the European Court of Justice (ECJ) to clarify European Union data protection rules in light of allegations that Facebook shared data from EU users with the U.S. National Security Agency.

Headlines: Irish judge rejects demand for probe into Facebook cooperation with NSA
Description: An Irish judge on Wednesday rejected an attempt by campaigners to force an investigation into Facebook's alleged sharing of data from EU users with the U.S. National Security Agency.

Headlines: Facebook website returns to service after crash
Description: Facebook Inc.'s FB.O website crashed briefly on Thursday, temporarily preventing computer and mobile phone users from reaching the site around the globe.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook website returns to service after crash
Description:
Facebook Inc.'s website crashed
briefly on Thursday, temporarily preventing computer and mobile
phone users from reaching the site around the globe.

Headlines: Facebook website crashes
Description:
Facebook Inc's website was down
at 0815 GMT, displaying a message saying "Sorry, something went
wrong."

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook scores record 1 billion interactions for World Cup
Description: With 1 billion posts, likes and comments in just the first half of the World Cup, the soccer tournament is already the most talked-about event in Facebook Inc's decade-long history, data obtained by Reuters showed.

Headlines: UK regulator investigates Facebook over emotions study
Description: The British data watchdog is investigating whether Facebook Inc violated data-protection laws when it allowed researchers to conduct a psychological experiment on its users.

Headlines: Facebook seeks India revenue boost with 'missed call' ads
Description: Facebook Inc wants its users in India to hang up on advertisers.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify at N.Y. forgery trial: prosecutors
Description: The government will call Mark Zuckerberg to testify against an upstate New York man accused of trying to cheat the billionaire founder of Facebook Inc  out of half his stake in the social media company, a federal prosecutor said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook goes express to mega-cap status - now valued more than AT&T, Coke
Description: In the days after its infamously mishandled initial public offering in May 2012, it looked as if Facebook would struggle to become a must-own for fund managers.

Headlines: Facebook shares hit record high as market likes earnings
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  hit a record high on Thursday after a surge in mobile advertising revenue helped the world's No. 1 social network trounce analysts' expectations for quarterly profit and revenue.

Headlines: Facebook says SEC's IPO probe ends, extending WhatsApp closing date
Description: Facebook Inc said the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission dropped its probe into the social networking company over events surrounding its controversial initial public offering.

Headlines: OkCupid admits to Facebook-style experimenting on customers
Description: OkCupid, a top U.S. matchmaking website, intentionally mismatched users to test its technology, the IAC/InterActive Corp service said on Monday, weeks after Facebook Inc admitted to misleading users in a psychological study.

Headlines: Pakistan mob kills woman, girls, over 'blasphemous' Facebook post
Description: A Pakistani mob killed a woman member of a religious sect and two of her granddaughters after a sect member was accused of posting blasphemous material on Facebook, police said Monday, the latest instance of growing violence against minorities.

Headlines: Facebook to shut down Gifts service in latest e-commerce shift
Description: Facebook Inc will shut its 2-year-old Gifts shop on Aug. 12, as the world's largest social network tests other ways to let consumers buy products on its website.

Headlines: Facebook mobile app to offer free, limited Internet in Zambia
Description: Facebook Inc is launching a mobile app that gives users in Zambia free access to a handful of online services on mobile phones, broadening an effort to boost Internet usage in underdeveloped countries.

Headlines: Facebook restores service after outage in many countries
Description: Facebook Inc said service to the world's largest online social network was fully restored on Friday, following a widespread outage that affected users in multiple countries.

Headlines: Thousands join Austrian student's class action against Facebook
Description: More than 17,000 people have signed up to join an Austrian law student's class action against Facebook over the social media group's alleged violations of its users' privacy, the student said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Austrian data activist's suit against Facebook gets 25,000 plaintiffs
Description: Data protection activists challenging Facebook in a Vienna court said on Wednesday they had closed the list of plaintiffs after 25,000 people joined a campaign alleging that the social media giant had violated users' privacy.

Headlines: Facebook to acquire Internet security company PrivateCore
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it will to acquire a company that helps protect the computers and data centers that power Internet services.

Headlines: Class action against Facebook attracts 60,000 users
Description: An Austrian law student said his class action challenging Facebook for alleged privacy violations had gathered support from 60,000 users and passed its first legal review.

Headlines: Facebook goes down for some U.S. users
Description: Facebook Inc went down briefly for an unknown number of U.S. users on Wednesday afternoon in what appeared to be the latest outage to affect the world's largest social network.

Headlines: Facebook ready to spend billions to bring whole world online: Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook Inc  is prepared to spend billions of dollars to reach its goal of bringing the Internet to everyone on the planet, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook targets advertisers as 100 million log on in Africa
Description: One in 10 Africans are logging on to Facebook every month, the world's No.1 online social network said on Monday, presenting a new target audience for advertisers.

Headlines: Facebook draws some of YouTube's top content producers : WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc has approached some of YouTube's biggest content producers to get them to distribute their videos on the social network, the Wall Street Journal said on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook draws some of YouTube's top content producers -WSJ
Description:
Facebook Inc has approached some
of YouTube's biggest content producers to get them to distribute
their videos on the social network, the Wall Street Journal said
on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Fraud trial of NY man who claimed Facebook stake delayed to May
Description: The trial of an upstate New York man accused of attempting to defraud Facebook Inc and billionaire founder Mark Zuckerberg of half of the company was delayed by six months on Monday after the defendant hired a new lawyer.

Headlines: San Francisco drag queens meet with Facebook over name policy
Description: San Francisco drag queens and a city lawmaker met with Facebook on Wednesday demanding the site change its policy banning users from using aliases online, but said they were rebuffed.

Headlines: Facebook to introduce new advertising platform : WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc is set to unveil a new advertising platform to improve effectiveness of online ads, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Facebook to introduce new advertising platform -WSJ
Description:
Facebook Inc is set to unveil a
new advertising platform to improve effectiveness of online ads,
the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday citing people with
knowledge of the matter.

Headlines: Hemorrhaging talent, Infosys' new CEO allows staff to use Twitter, Facebook
Description: Infosys Ltd's new CEO has come up with a novel approach to reviving the financial fortunes of India's trailblazing outsourcing firm: use Facebook at work, tweet, but get the job done.

Headlines: Facebook to win EU approval for $19 billion WhatsApp bid: sources
Description: Facebook , the world's leading social network, will win unconditional EU approval for its $19 billion offer for mobile messaging startup WhatsApp in a deal pitting it against telecoms operators, two people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook plans stricter scrutiny for accessing user data
Description: Facebook Inc plans a stricter review of requests to access information on its 1.32 billion active users after a psychological experiment on unwitting users in 2012 created a furor on social media.
