active users after a psychological experiment on unwitting users
in 2012 created a furor on social media.

Headlines: Facebook sets guidelines for access to user information
Description:
Facebook Inc has set up guidelines
for proposed research requests to access user information, both
for internal work and academic work.

Headlines: Facebook wins EU approval for $19 billion WhatsApp bid
Description: Facebook , the world's most popular social network, gained European Union clearance on Friday for its proposed $19 billion takeover of mobile messaging startup WhatsApp in a deal setting it against the telecoms industry.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook plots first steps into healthcare
Description: Facebook Inc  already knows who your friends are and the kind of things that grab your attention. Soon, it could also know the state of your health.

Headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp acquisition now has price tag of $22 billion
Description: Facebook Inc  closed its acquisition of mobile messaging service WhatsApp on Monday, with the final price tag rising an additional $3 billion to roughly $22 billion because of the increased value of Facebook's stock in recent months.

Headlines: Facebook has no near-term plan to monetize WhatsApp: CEO
Description: Facebook Inc , which closed its acquisition of mobile messaging service WhatsApp on Monday, has no near-term plan to make money from the service, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook will pay for female employees to freeze their eggs
Description: Apple Inc  and Facebook Inc  will help pay for female employees to freeze their eggs, signaling a willingness to spend on perks and benefits in a race to acquire top-flight talent.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to donate $25 million to tackle Ebola
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday he and his wife, Priscilla Chan, would donate $25 million to the Centers for Disease Control Foundation to fight Ebola.

Headlines: Facebook sues lawyers for pursuing dubious Ceglia lawsuit
Description: Facebook Inc and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg have sued several lawyers who represented Paul Ceglia, claiming they helped the upstate New York entrepreneur pursue a fraudulent lawsuit to extort a 50 percent stake in the social networking company.

Headlines: Fidelity Contrafund loads up on Facebook and it pays off
Description: The $108 billion Fidelity Contrafund continues to have a big appetite for Facebook Inc's stock, adding to its position in the social media company during the third quarter and praising its mobile ad revenue growth and "visionary management."

Headlines: Facebook warns of increased spending, shares fall
Description: Facebook Inc warned on Tuesday of a dramatic increase in spending in 2015 and projected a slowdown in revenue growth this quarter, slicing a tenth off its market value.

Headlines: Facebook says government requests for user data rises 24 percent
Description: Facebook Inc said requests by governments for user information rose by about a quarter in the first half of 2014 over the second half of last year.

Headlines: British spy chief demands more access to Twitter, Facebook to thwart attacks
Description: Twitter and Facebook are so important to militant groups that the technology giants should give security services greater access to their networks to allow governments to foil attacks, the head of Britain's eavesdropping agency said.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-British spy chief demands more access to Twitter, Facebook to thwart attacks
Description: * Islamic State harnessing Internet to stoke jihadi threat

Headlines: Facebook launches Ebola charity donation button
Description: Facebook Inc said users would now have option to donate directly to various Ebola relief charities through a button at the top of their News Feeds.

Headlines: Facebook says messenger service has half a billion users
Description: Social networking site Facebook Inc said its messaging service is being used by more than half a billion people, few months after it was separated from the main Facebook app. (http://bit.ly/1u1Xw4o)

Headlines: Facebook service aimed at professionals to launch in a few months: source
Description: Facebook Inc's professional version of its social network aimed at businesses will launch in the next few months, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook developing a professional website 'Facebook at Work': FT
Description: Facebook Inc is secretly working on a new website called "Facebook at Work" that would allow users to keep their personal profile separate from their work profile, the Financial Times reported.

Headlines: Hong Kong protest leaders arrested: student Facebook accounts
Description: Hong Kong student protest leaders Joshua Wong and Lester Shum were arrested on Wednesday as police cleared pro-democracy demonstrators from a site in the city's Mong Kok district, the Facebook accounts of two student groups said.

Headlines: Chinese Internet regulator welcomed at Facebook campus
Description: Lu Wei, China's top Internet regulator, may not welcome Facebook to his house, but he's certainly welcome at Facebook.

Headlines: Facebook buys video startup QuickFire
Description: Social network operator Facebook Inc said it bought QuickFire Networks, a startup that helps view high-quality video with low bandwidth.

Headlines: Facebook to issue missing children alerts in U.S.
Description: Social networking website Facebook  plans to use its estimated 140 million daily U.S. users to help track missing children through emergency alerts, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg brings free Internet to Colombia, mute on China
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg launched a free Internet application in Colombia on Wednesday as part of a drive to bring developing markets online, but remained mute on when and if the company would look to move into China.

Headlines: Facebook launches mobile app offering free Internet in Colombia
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday launched a mobile phone application that gives Colombian users free access to a handful of online services, broadening Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg's effort to boost Internet usage in developing markets.

Headlines: Facebook clamps down on fake news stories
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it has taken steps to clamp down on "hoaxes" and fake news stories that can spread like wildfire on its 1.35-billion member online social network.

Headlines: Facebook report says it adds more than $200 billion to global economy
Description: With 1.35 billion users of its Internet social network, Facebook Inc would rank as the world’s second-most populous nation if it were a country.

Headlines: EU unlikely to support ban on free unlimited Facebook, Spotify
Description: European Union member states are unlikely to support an EU-wide ban on telecoms companies offering online services such as Facebook and Spotify for free, according to a proposal by EU presidency Latvia.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's Oculus forms in-house virtual-reality film studio
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
Oculus VR is getting into movies with an in-house studio
dedicated to making virtual-reality films and will show its
first short movie at the Sundance Film Festival on Monday, the
company said.

Headlines: Turkish court orders Facebook to block pages insulting Mohammad: media
Description: A Turkish court has ordered Facebook to block a number of pages deemed insulting to the Prophet Mohammad, threatening to stop access to the whole social networking site if it does not comply, state broadcaster TRT reported.

Headlines: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Facebook takes blame for service outages, which hit wider Web
Description:
Access to Facebook, the
world's largest social network, and its Instagram photo-sharing
site, was blocked around the world for up to an hour on Tuesday,
which the company said later was due to an internal fault and
not an outside attack.

Headlines: Facebook takes blame for service outages, which hit wider Web
Description: Access to Facebook , the world's largest social network, and its Instagram photo-sharing site, were blocked around the world for up to an hour on Tuesday, which the company said later was due to an internal fault and not an outside attack.

Headlines: Hacker group claims it is behind outages at Facebook, other sites
Description: Internet sites including Facebook, the world's largest social network, Instagram and other popular sites suffered temporary outages on Tuesday and a hacker group associated with other recent high-profile attacks claimed it caused the outages.

Headlines: Facebook appears to be down
Description:
Facebook appeared to be down early
Tuesday, with the social media site saying it is working on
fixing the issue.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook tops Wall Street revenue target in 4th quarter
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
revenue grew 49 percent in the fourth quarter, as mobile
advertising growth helped the world's largest Internet social
network beat Wall Street's targets for earnings and sales.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook tops Wall Street revenue target in 4th quarter
Description:
Facebook Inc's 
revenue grew 49 percent in the fourth quarter, as mobile
advertising growth helped the world's largest Internet social
network beat Wall Street's targets for earnings and sales.

Headlines: Facebook Q4 revenue grows 49 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc said
on Wednesday its revenue grew 49 percent in the final three
months of 2014, as strength in mobile advertising helped the
Internet social networking company beat Wall Street's revenue
target.

Headlines: Delta Air Lines says its Facebook page was hacked
Description: Delta Air Lines Inc said its Facebook page was hacked and posted with "objectionable and offensive content" that the company removed within an hour.

Headlines: Facebook launches free mobile Internet service in India
Description: Facebook has tied up with India's Reliance Communications to provide basic internet services on mobile phones for free, making India the first country in Asia to get Facebook's Internet.org service.

Headlines: Facebook counts 2 million active advertisers, mostly small businesses
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday that its active advertisers rose to 2 million, a 33 percent increase from the 1.5 million it had in July 2014.

Headlines: Facebook counts 2 mln active advertisers, mostly small businesses
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Tuesday that
its active advertisers rose to 2 million, a 33 percent increase
from the 1.5 million it had in July 2014.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg seeks peace with telcos on Web-for-all push
Description: Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg was on hostile turf on Monday as spoke to executives at the world's biggest annual gathering of the mobile industry, renewing attempts to win their backing to help reach billions of users with no Internet access.

Headlines: Facebook's Instagram rolls out new 'carousel' ads
Description: Instagram will let brand marketers showcase more images on its photo-sharing smartphone app, the Facebook-owned service’s latest move to expand its money-making advertising features.

Headlines: N.Y. man missing ahead of fraud trial over Facebook claim: lawyer
Description: An upstate New York man, who was set to face trial in May for attempting to defraud Facebook Inc and founder Mark Zuckerberg, is missing, his lawyer said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. judge revokes bail for missing man accused in Facebook fraud
Description: A federal judge on Tuesday revoked the bail of an upstate New York man who disappeared from authorities as he faces criminal charges that he tried to defraud Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg out of half of the social media company.

Headlines: Facebook to face U.S. class action over children's online purchases
Description: A federal judge said Facebook Inc must face a nationwide class-action lawsuit seeking to force the social media company to provide refunds when children spend their parents' money on its website without permission.

Headlines: Facebook clarifies rules on banned content
Description: Facebook Inc clarified its rules banning certain content from its social network, as the Internet company strives to curb controversial posts such as support for violent militant groups and nudity without damaging its status as a global hub for users to share information.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook clarifies rules on banned content
Description:
Facebook Inc clarified its rules
banning certain content from its social network, as the Internet
company strives to curb controversial posts such as support for
violent militant groups and nudity without damaging its status
as a global hub for users to share information.

Headlines: Facebook report shows slight rise in government requests for data
Description:
Facebook Inc recorded a slight
increase in government requests for account data in the second
half of 2014, according to its Global Government Requests
Report, which includes information about content removal.

Headlines: Facebook to allow users to send money to friends through Messenger
Description: Facebook Inc said it is adding a new feature to its messaging app that allows friends to send and receive money through it.

Headlines: Tencent looks to Facebook for inspiration as revenue growth declines
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd, China's biggest social network and online media firm, is taking inspiration from Facebook Inc in growing advertising revenue, executives said on Wednesday, after posting its slowest revenue growth in seven years.

Headlines: Facebook brings apps, businesses to Messenger service
Description: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday opened up its Messenger service for developers to create apps and for shoppers to communicate directly with retailers, as the Internet company seeks to expand its reach.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook brings apps, businesses to Messenger service
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Wednesday opened up its Messenger service for developers to
create apps and for shoppers to communicate directly with
retailers, as the Internet company seeks to expand its reach.

Headlines: Facebook expands messaging service features
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Wednesday opened up its Messenger service for developers to
create apps and for consumers to communicate directly with
retailers, in the social media network's latest effort to expand
its reach.

Headlines: Facebook talks up need for virtual reality, big tech bets
Description: Virtual reality, artificial intelligence and drones will enable Facebook Inc  to create a more lifelike and useful social network, the company said in its clearest explanation so far for technology projects that have puzzled some investors and analysts.

Headlines: Uber hires chief security officer from Facebook
Description: Cab-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc, under fire for how it charges passengers and ensures their safety, said it hired Facebook Inc Chief Security Officer Joe Sullivan.

Headlines: Facebook says has complied with Turkish court order to block some content
Description: Facebook  has complied with a Turkish court order demanding it restrict access to certain content or face its service being blocked, a company spokesman said on Monday.

Headlines: Austrian student's lawsuit vs Facebook bogged down in procedure
Description: Facebook presented a long list of procedural objections to an Austrian court on Thursday trying to halt a class action lawsuit for 25,000 users that accuses the social media giant of  violating their privacy.

Headlines: Andreessen Horowitz hires Facebook former general counsel Ted Ullyot
Description: Venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz has hired Facebook Inc's former general counsel Ted Ullyot for handling its policy and regulatory affairs.

Headlines: Fugitive fails to revive Facebook lawsuit, block criminal case
Description: A federal appeals court on Monday forcefully rejected the fugitive Paul Ceglia's effort to revive what U.S. prosecutors have called his fraudulent lawsuit to extort social media company Facebook Inc and its founder Mark Zuckerberg.

Headlines: Facebook brings down top end of expenses growth forecast
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday that foreign exchange rates would likely cut revenue in the current quarter by more than 10 percent due to the strong U.S. dollar.

Headlines: Facebook starts testing mobile calling app 'Hello'
Description: Facebook Inc said it started testing its mobile calling app 'Hello' on Android, which allows users to connect with Facebook to see the identity and information about callers even if the number is not saved on the phone.

Headlines: Nasdaq to settle Facebook IPO lawsuit for $26.5 million
Description: In a first for a U.S. stock exchange, Nasdaq OMX Group on Thursday agreed to pay $26.5 million to settle a class-action lawsuit involving its bungling of Facebook Inc's $16 billion initial public offering, the plaintiffs' lawyers said.

Headlines: Facebook opens Internet.org to developers amid open web debate in India
Description: Facebook Inc  opened up its Internet.org platform to new websites and applications from developers on Monday, a move the social media giant said would boost efforts to get people online in low-income and rural areas in emerging markets.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook opens Internet.org to developers amid open web debate in India
Description:
Facebook Inc opened up its
Internet.org platform to new websites and applications from
developers on Monday, a move the social media giant said would
boost efforts to get people online in low-income and rural areas
in emerging markets.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg emerges to speak at husband's memorial
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg re-emerged in public on Tuesday after the accidental death of her husband last week, telling a Silicon Valley memorial service about his effortless compassion and selflessness.

Headlines: Facebook's Seattle site leader leaves company
Description: The leader of Facebook Inc's fast-growing Seattle office left the company last month, a spokeswoman for the online social network told Reuters on Wednesday, a crucial personnel change at Facebook's largest engineering office outside of its Silicon Valley headquarters.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg speaks at husband's memorial
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg re-emerged in public on Tuesday after the accidental death of her husband last week, offering a personal tribute to him in a Silicon Valley memorial service and on her Facebook page.

Headlines: Facebook may sue lawyers over fugitive's lawsuit: NY judge
Description: Facebook Inc may pursue a lawsuit against law firms that represented a New York man who recently turned fugitive rather than face federal charges that he tried to defraud founder Mark Zuckerberg out of half of the company, a judge ruled on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook raises minimum pay for contractors to $15 per hour
Description: Facebook  raised wages for its contract workers, such as cafeteria staff and janitors, to a minimum of $15 per hour amid rising tension over the wage gap between the technology sector's elite and the lower-paid workers.

Headlines: Facebook to let nine news companies publish news to mobile feeds
Description: Facebook Inc tied up with nine news publishers to launch "Instant Articles" that will let them publish articles directly to the social network's mobile news feeds.

Headlines: White House praises new Facebook minimum wage policy for contractors
Description: The White House on Wednesday praised Facebook's new minimum wage and family leave policy, which raises minimum hourly salaries for contractors to $15 per hour.

Headlines: Facebook ties up with 9 publishers to directly inject news
Description:
Facebook Inc tied up with nine
news publishers to launch "Instant Articles" that will let them
publish articles directly to the social network's mobile news
feeds.

Headlines: Facebook 'tramples European privacy law': Belgian watchdog
Description: Belgium's privacy watchdog accused Facebook  on Friday of trampling on European privacy laws by tracking people online without their consent and dodging questions from national regulators.

Headlines: Russia warns Google, Twitter and Facebook on law violations
Description: Russia's media watchdog has written to Google, Twitter and Facebook warning them against violating Russian Internet laws and a spokesman said on Thursday they risk being blocked if they do not comply with the rules.

Headlines: Founder of Facebook's Oculus hit with lawsuit
Description: The founder of virtual reality glasses maker Oculus VR Inc, acquired by Facebook Inc for $2 billion, has been accused of taking confidential information he learned while working with another company and passing it off as his own, according to a lawsuit filed this week.

Headlines: Facebook COO says mourning over husband left her '30 years sadder'
Description: Facebook's Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg took to the social media site on Wednesday to say she felt "thirty years sadder" after the 30-day mourning period she observed following her husband's sudden death.

Headlines: Facebook rolls out new Android app for emerging markets
Description: Facebook Inc rolled out a new Android app for its social media service on Thursday that uses less data and runs faster in regions with spotty connections.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook earns 51 percent of ad revenue overseas - executives
Description: Overseas markets bring in more advertising revenue than the United States for Facebook Inc, amounting to 51 percent of global ad sales in the first quarter, with growth in Asia the fastest in the world at 57 percent, company executives told Reuters.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook earns 51 percent of ad revenue overseas
Description: Overseas markets bring in more advertising revenue than the United States for Facebook Inc, amounting to 51 percent of global ad sales in the first quarter, with growth in Asia the fastest in the world at 57 percent, company executives told Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook shareholders shoot down 'one share, one vote' proposal
Description: A proposal to give Facebook Inc's  stockholders one vote per share was rejected at the company's annual meeting, according to preliminary results.

Headlines: Belgian privacy watchdog takes Facebook to court
Description: Belgium's privacy watchdog has begun legal action against Facebook, accusing the social network site of tracking  its users across the web and even monitoring the activities of those without an account.

Headlines: Facebook plans new data center in growing Irish cloud hub
Description: Facebook plans to open a new data center in Ireland, the social network said on Monday, becoming the latest technology giant to set up an energy efficient center in Ireland's recovering economy.

Headlines: Airbnb poaches Brazilian Facebook executive in Olympic push
Description: Online home-rental marketplace Airbnb Inc hired Facebook Inc's most senior executive in Brazil to lead its expansion in the country as an official provider of accommodations for the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

Headlines: Facebook allows users to sign up for Messenger without account
Description: Facebook Inc has enabled users without an account to sign up for its Messenger app with a phone number, the social media company said on Wednesday, in another move to broaden the app's reach and make it a standalone platform.

Headlines: HBO offers premiere episodes of two series on Facebook
Description: Television network HBO said it would offer the premiere episodes of two new comedy series on Facebook, underlining the growing popularity of the social networking site as a video platform.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Dutch court: Facebook must turn over user data in sex video case
Description:
Facebook must turn
over any information it possesses that could help a young woman
find out who published a sex video of her without her consent, a
Dutch court ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: Yahoo's Alex Stamos says to join Facebook as chief security officer
Description: Yahoo Inc's Alex Stamos will join Facebook Inc as chief security officer from Monday, he said in a Facebook post on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dutch court: Facebook must turn over user data in sex video case
Description:
Facebook must turn
over any information it possesses that could help a young woman
find out who published a sex video of her without her consent, a
Dutch court ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook staff diversity little changed over past year
Description: Facebook Inc released new diversity data Friday that showed the number of women and minorities has remained little changed over the past year.

Headlines: Austrian student's privacy battle against Facebook suffers setback
Description: An Austrian student's legal battle against Facebook, accusing it of helping the U.S. security service collect personal data, suffered a setback after a Vienna court rejected his case on procedural grounds, both sides said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook executive Sheryl Sandberg joins board of SurveyMonkey
Description: Facebook Inc's Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg is taking a seat on the board of SurveyMonkey, the online polling company that was run by her late husband, Dave Goldberg.

Headlines: Facebook to build new data center in Fort Worth
Description: Facebook Inc announced plans on Tuesday to build a new data center in Fort Worth, Texas, its fourth in the United States and fifth overall.

Headlines: Hackers of Apple, Facebook seen as independent group seeking money
Description: A hacking group best known for breaking into top-tier technology companies Apple Inc, Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc more than two years ago is now believed to be one of a handful of highly skilled independent gangs pursuing corporate secrets for profit.

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus buys Israel gesture recognition firm Pebbles
Description: Facebook's Oculus unit said on Thursday it has agreed to buy Israeli gesture recognition technology developer Pebbles Interfaces for an undisclosed amount.

Headlines: Facebook must hand over New York users' info to prosecutors, court rules
Description: Facebook Inc cannot challenge search warrants New York prosecutors used to get information from its site on hundreds of users suspected of Social Security fraud, a state appeals court said on Tuesday, in a decision likely making it harder for New Yorkers to keep their digital lives private.

Headlines: Facebook defeats shareholder litigation over IPO
Description: A federal appeals court on Friday said Facebook Inc officials including Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg cannot be sued by shareholders who said the social media company concealed threats to its growth prospects before its May 2012 initial public offering.

Headlines: Facebook to scale up free mobile Internet service to boost usage
Description: Facebook Inc plans to scale up its service to offer free basic Internet on mobile phones, an executive said, after introducing the application in 17 developing countries over the past year.

Headlines: Facebook's ascent has investors betting on more gains
Description: Investors in social media shares have zeroed-in on Facebook Inc , piling into stock options to add bullish bets on the company in the days ahead of its Wednesday earnings.

Headlines: German regulator orders Facebook to allow pseudonyms
Description: Facebook may not prevent its users from using fake names, a German privacy watchdog said on Tuesday, in the latest privacy setback for the U.S. company in Europe.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook profit falls 9 pct as costs soar
Description:
Facebook Inc reported quarterly
revenue that beat forecasts but its profit fell 9 percent as the
social media company sharply increased spending to boost mobile
revenue and future growth.

Headlines: Facebook revenue jumps 39 pct as mobile ad sales rise
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 39
percent jump in quarterly revenue on Wednesday as more
advertisers used its increasingly popular mobile app.

Headlines: Facebook profit falls 9 percent as costs soar
Description: (Story corrects second-last paragraph to say $330 million instead of $33 million)

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Facebook profit falls 9 pct as costs soar
Description:
Facebook Inc reported quarterly
revenue that beat forecasts but its profit fell 9 percent as the
social media company sharply increased spending to boost mobile
revenue and future growth.

Headlines: Facebook shares dip as results fail to impress
Description: Facebook Inc's  shares fell as much as 5 percent on Thursday, after the company's weak advertising sales growth outlook dampened investor expectations boosted by Google Inc's  strong report earlier this month.

Headlines: Facebook says drone ready for real-world testing later this year
Description: Facebook Inc  announced on Thursday it has completed building its first full-scale drone, which has the wingspan of a Boeing 737 and will provide Internet access to the most remote parts of the world.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg and wife expecting a baby girl
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla Chan, are expecting a baby girl, he said on his Facebook page on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook struggles to sell advertising in India
Description:
Facebook is
trying to lure skeptical advertisers in India with features such
as free email support for questions about advertising and advice
on increasing sales in a bid to boost revenue from its second
biggest market.

Headlines: RPT-Facebook struggles to sell advertising in India
Description:
Facebook is
trying to lure skeptical advertisers in India with features such
as free email support for questions about advertising and advice
on increasing sales in a bid to boost revenue from its second
biggest market.

Headlines: Facebook testing personal digital assistant inside Messenger
Description: Facebook Inc is testing a personal digital assistant called "M" within its Messenger service that can answer questions with live human help and perform tasks such as buying gifts online and booking restaurants.

Headlines: German justice minister takes aim at Facebook over racist posts
Description: Germany's justice minister has accused Facebook of doing too little to thwart racist posts and hate comments on the social media platform and has proposed a meeting next month in Berlin with top officials from the company in Europe.

Headlines: Facebook must obey German law even if free speech curtailed: minister
Description: Facebook will have to abide by German laws banning racist sentiment even if it might be allowed in the United States under freedom of speech, Justice Minister Heiko Maas said in an interview with Reuters.

Headlines: For many refugees, journey to Europe begins on Facebook
Description: By Naline Malla, Ayla Jean Yackley, Marton Dunai and Aleksandar Vasovic

Headlines: Merkel says Facebook needs to do more against racist posts
Description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel urged Facebook  to do more against racist comments and hate posts, in comments due to be published in a regional newspaper on Friday.

Headlines: Germany vows to work with Facebook to tackle racist posts
Description: Germany's justice minister vowed on Monday to work with Facebook Inc to thwart racist and hate posts, acting on worries about a rise of xenophobic comments in German on social media linked to Europe's refugee crisis.

Headlines: Facebook users express concerns over possible 'dislike' button
Description: Facebook users took to the social media site on Wednesday to react to the company's decision to test what Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg called a "dislike button" - and not everyone liked the idea.

Headlines: Facebook, expanding in Asia, opens first office in Thailand
Description: Facebook Inc opened its first office in Thailand Thursday as the social network company expanded its footprint in Asia, its fastest-growing region.

Headlines: Facebook's new ad service to charge only after full-scroll
Description: Facebook Inc said it would launch a service that will let advertisers pay for ads only when they are scrolled through from top to bottom on its news feed.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's new ad service to charge only after full-scroll
Description:
Facebook Inc said it would launch
a service that will let advertisers pay for ads only when they
are scrolled through from top to bottom on its news feed.

Headlines: Modi trip gives Facebook, Google chance to press on Indian expansion
Description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's trip this weekend to Silicon Valley gives Facebook and Google the chance to press him on issues that have bedeviled them in that country, a market they see as vital to their aggressive global expansion.

Headlines: Facebook.com up for most users after outage
Description: Facebook.com was up for most users, except in some parts of western Europe, nearly four hours after an outage was first observed.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook.com up for most users after outage
Description:
Facebook.com was up for most users,
except in some parts of western Europe, nearly four hours after
an outage was first observed.

Headlines: Facebook.com not working for some users
Description:
Facebook Inc's social media
website was inaccessible on Thursday afternoon, but it remained
unclear whether the glitch affected all or some users.

Headlines: Facebook.com back in service after second outage
Description: Facebook Inc  restored access to its social media website for most users on Monday afternoon, after its second outage in less than a week.

Headlines: Facebook updates News Feed to accommodate weak connections
Description: Facebook Inc updated its News Feed feature on Tuesday so that content loads quickly even with weak Internet connections.

Headlines: Max Schrems: the law student who took on Facebook
Description: From Vienna cafes to the European Union's highest court, an Austrian law student's two-year battle against Facebook and mass U.S. surveillance culminated in a landmark ruling that has rippled across the business world.

Headlines: From sadness to wow, Facebook launches reaction buttons  beyond like
Description: Like it or not, Facebook Inc's trademark "like" button is set to get more expressive.

Headlines: Facebook pushes shopping features in move to e-commerce
Description: Facebook Inc  wants its users to shop for clothes and other products from their mobile phones without ever leaving its app.

Headlines: Facebook requests a say in Austrian student's privacy case
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday requested the chance to voice its opinion in a legal challenge mounted by an Austrian law student against the Irish privacy regulator for refusing to investigate the U.S. company's transfers of data to the United States.

Headlines: Irish court orders investigation of Facebook data transfers to U.S
Description: Ireland's High Court on Tuesday ordered an investigation into Facebook's transfer of European Union users' data to the United States to make sure personal privacy was properly protected from U.S. government surveillance.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook revenue, profit beat forecasts; shares hit all-time high
Description:
Facebook Inc posted
a surprisingly strong 40.5 percent jump in quarterly revenue as
new advertising services and its mobile app boosted ad sales at
the world's largest social network.

Headlines: Facebook third-quarter revenue rises 40.5 percent
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 40.5
percent jump in quarterly revenue helped by the launch of new
advertisement formats and updates to its mobile app that drove
more ad sales.

Headlines: Facebook to launch news app: FT
Description: Facebook Inc is preparing to launch a new standalone news app called Notify next week, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the plans.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to launch news app - FT
Description:
Facebook Inc is preparing to launch
a new standalone news app called Notify next week, the Financial
Times reported, citing people familiar with the plans.

Description:

Headlines: Obama launches Facebook page, sends message on climate
Description: The White House launched a Facebook  page on Monday for President Barack Obama and used the social media platform to send a message on climate change.

Headlines: Facebook to appeal Belgian ruling ordering it to stop tracking non-users
Description: Facebook said on Monday it would appeal a court ruling ordering it to stop tracking the online activities of non-Facebook users in Belgium who visit Facebook pages, or face a 250,000 euro ($269,000) daily fine.

Headlines: German prosecutor investigates Facebook manager for ignoring racist posts
Description: Prosecutors in Hamburg have launched an investigation into the European head of Facebook over the social platform's alleged failure to remove racist hate speech, a spokeswoman for the prosecutor said on Tuesday.

Headlines: RPT-UPDATE 3-Facebook reports spike in government requests for data
Description:
Facebook Inc
 said in a report on Wednesday that government demands for
its user data surged in the first half of 2015, taking a trend
that began at least two years ago when the company started
revealing such requests to new heights.

 said content restrictions and government requests for

such data two years ago.

Description: Facebook Inc  said in a report on Wednesday that government demands for its user data surged in the first half of 2015, taking a trend that began at least two years ago when the company started revealing such requests to new heights.

Headlines: Facebook launches news app 'Notify' in U.S
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it launched its news app Notify for iPhone users in the United States, featuring content from media partners such as Fox News, Washington Post and CBS.

Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it
launched its news app Notify for iPhone users in the United

Washington Post and CBS.

Headlines: Facebook launches news app 'Notify' in U.S.
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it
launched its news app Notify for iPhone users in the United
States.

Headlines: Facebook to enable safety check more in disasters after criticism
Description: Facebook Inc vowed on Monday to turn on its "Safety Check" feature more often during disasters in response to growing criticism that it only enabled the function after the attacks in Paris.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg to take two months of paternity leave
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday he will take two months of paternity leave after his daughter's birth, a strong statement from one of the busiest and most powerful U.S. executives on the importance of family time.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg will take two months of paternity leave
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said he will take two months of paternity leave after his daughter's birth, though he did not say when she is due.

Headlines: Austria's highest court to decide whether to allow class action vs Facebook
Description: Austrian student Max Schrems's attempt to bring a class-action lawsuit against Facebook  over its privacy policies will head to Austria's Supreme Court to determine whether such collective legal action is allowed, his group said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook plans first Asia-Pacific data center in Taiwan: Government official
Description: Facebook Inc is evaluating the possibility of investing T$10 billion ($300 million) to build its first data center in the Asia-Pacific region in Taiwan, joining Google, an official said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to give 99 percent of shares to charity
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg and his wife said on Tuesday they will give away 99 percent of their Facebook shares, currently worth about $45 billion, to a new charity in a letter addressed to their daughter, Max, who was born last week.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook's Zuckerberg to give 99 pct of shares to charity
Description:
Facebook Inc
 Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg and his wife said

shares, currently worth about $45 billion, to a new charity in a

Headlines: Zuckerberg intends to retain majority voting position in Facebook stock for 'foreseeable future'
Description: * CEO zuckerberg intends to retain his majority voting position in Facebook

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg takes philanthropy into profit, politics
Description: Mark Zuckerberg, who famously urged his company Facebook Inc  to "move fast and break things," is taking a similar approach to the staid world of philanthropy, indicating his new venture will get directly involved with politics and may even turn a profit.

Headlines: Facebook's CEO and wife to give 99 percent of shares to their new foundation
Description: Mark Zuckerberg will put 99 percent of his Facebook Inc  shares, currently worth about $45 billion, into a new philanthropy project focusing on human potential and equality, he and his wife said Tuesday in a letter to their newborn daughter.

Headlines: Facebook to halt tracking non-Facebook users in Belgium
Description: Facebook will stop tracking browsers of Facebook pages in Belgium who are not signed into a Facebook account, seeking to comply with a court ruling last month ordering it to do so or face daily fines, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg speaks out in support of Muslims
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday said he supported Muslims in his community and around the world.

Headlines: Facebook service aimed at professionals to launch in coming months
Description: Facebook at Work, Facebook Inc's  professional version of its social network, is expected to launch in the coming months, after spending a year in tests, a company executive said.

Headlines: Facebook, Google, Twitter agree to delete hate speech in 24 hours: Germany
Description: Germany said on Tuesday that Facebook, Google and Twitter have agreed to delete hate speech from their websites within 24 hours, a new step in the fight against rising online racism following the refugee crisis.

Headlines: California shooter messaged Facebook friends about support for jihad: LA Times
Description: One of the shooters in the San Bernardino massacre, Tashfeen Malik, sent at least two private messages on Facebook to a small group of Pakistani friends in 2012 and 2014, pledging her support for Islamic jihad and saying she hoped to join the fight one day, the Los Angeles Times reported on Monday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook partners with Uber for ride-hailing service via Messenger
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it
is testing a service that will allow users of its Messenger app
to hail Uber rides directly from the app, without leaving a
conversation or downloading the ride-hailing app.

Headlines: RPT-Facebook partners with Uber for ride-hailing service via Messenger app
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it
partnered with Uber to allow Facebook users to request a ride
from their messenger service, without the need to download a
ride-hailing app or leave a conversation.

Headlines: Facebook partners with Uber for ride-hailing service via Messenger app
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it
partnered with Uber to allow Facebook users to request a ride
from their messenger service, without the need to download a
ride-hailing app or leave a conversation.

Headlines: Facebook launches instant articles for Android users
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it launched its instant articles service for Android users which allows media firms to publish articles directly to the social network's news feeds.

Headlines: Brazil court lifts suspension of Facebook's WhatsApp service
Description: A Brazilian judge on Thursday ordered the lifting of a 48-hour suspension of the services in Brazil of Facebook Inc's WhatsApp phone-messaging application, overturning an order from a lower court.

Headlines: Facebook puts a price on suburban living for employees
Description: Facebook Inc is offering employees at its Silicon Valley headquarters at least $10,000 to move closer to the office, a reflection of the challenges many tech companies face in the increasingly expensive and congested San Francisco Bay area.

Headlines: Facebook fights for free Internet in India, global test-case
Description: India has become a battleground over the right to unrestricted Internet access, with local tech start-ups joining the front line against Facebook Inc  founder Mark Zuckerberg and his plan to roll out free Internet to the country's masses.

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus prices Rift virtual reality headset at $599
Description: Oculus, the virtual reality company owned by Facebook Inc, said the Rift, its much-awaited virtual reality headset, was priced at $599.

Headlines: Facebook's Messenger app passes 800 million users
Description: Facebook Inc's Messenger app surpassed 800 million users, the company said on Thursday, making it the fastest-growing app of 2015 according to research firm Nielsen.

Headlines: German high court rules Facebook "Friend Finder" is unlawful
Description: Germany's highest court has declared unlawful a feature that encourages Facebook users to market the social media network to their contacts, confirming the rulings of two lower courts.

Headlines: Egypt arrests Facebook page administrators ahead of revolt anniversary
Description: Egyptian security forces have arrested two people for managing multiple Facebook pages they said were used to support the outlawed Muslim Brotherhood and encourage protest, the Interior Ministry said.

Headlines: Facebook outsources fight against racist posts in Germany
Description: Facebook has hired a Bertelsmann business services unit to monitor and delete racist posts in Germany following widespread public criticism of the company for failing to do enough to halt hate speech, a spokeswoman said in Friday.

Headlines: Facebook adds Android app support for anonymity service Tor
Description: Users of Facebook Inc's Android app can now privately browse the world's largest social network through the anonymity service Tor, the company said on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawsuit against founder of Facebook's Oculus can proceed, judge says
Description: Part of a lawsuit can proceed against the founder of Facebook's virtual reality glasses unit Oculus VR Inc, but a U.S. judge also dismissed several claims filed by another company which alleged the Oculus founder had passed off its confidential information as his own.

Headlines: Facebook launches real-time sports platform
Description: Facebook Inc is tackling the sports arena with a new platform called Facebook Sports Stadium, which the social media site said will provide real-time updates on games, popular posts from fans, statistics and commentary from experts.

Headlines: Facebook's price-earnings ratio near record low ahead of fourth-quarter report
Description: A recent drop in Facebook Inc's stock has left the online social network trading at earnings multiples near record lows as it prepares to hand investors its fourth-quarter report.

Headlines: Facebook shares soar as mobile drives big jump in ad sales
Description: Facebook Inc smashed investors' expectations with a 52-percent jump in quarterly revenue as it sold more ads targeted at a fast-growing number of mobile users, sending its shares sharply higher after hours.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook shares soar as mobile drives big jump in ad sales
Description:
Facebook Inc smashed investors'
expectations with a 52-percent jump in quarterly revenue as it
sold more ads targeted at a fast-growing number of mobile users,
sending its shares sharply higher after hours.

Headlines: Facebook revenue jumps 51.7 pct as mobile drives ad sales
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 51.7
percent jump in revenue for the final quarter of 2015 as new
advertising formats and an improved mobile app drove a sharp
rise in ad sales.

Headlines: Independent Syrian dissident Makdissi says will not attend first round of peace talks: Facebook
Description: Independent Syria dissident Jihad Makdissi said on his Facebook account that he had been invited to take part in peace talks in Geneva but said he will not attend its first round.

Headlines: Facebook 'likes' push Wall Street higher
Description: Wall Street climbed on Thursday as a blockbuster quarterly report from Facebook drove tech shares higher and a bounce in oil prices propped up the beleaguered energy sector.

Headlines: Facebook shares jump 15.5 percent after strong results
Description: Facebook Inc  shares surged 15.5 percent on Thursday, their biggest percentage increase since July 2013, after the social networking service posted quarterly results that blew away expectations on every key measure.

Headlines: White House welcomes Facebook move to block private gun sales
Description: The Obama administration on Monday welcomed Facebook Inc's move last week to prohibit users from using its services to coordinate person-to-person private sales of firearms.

Headlines: India introduces net neutrality rules barring Facebook's free Internet
Description: India introduced rules on Monday to prevent Internet service providers from having different pricing policies for accessing different parts of the Web, in a setback to Facebook Inc's plan to roll out a pared-back free Internet service to the masses.

Headlines: French data privacy regulator cracks down on Facebook
Description: The French data protection authority on Monday gave Facebook three months to stop tracking non-users' web activity without their consent and ordered the social network to stop some transfers of personal data to the United States.

Headlines: Facebook's India stumble could embolden other regulators
Description: India's decision to effectively ban Facebook's pared-back free Internet service is a major blow to the social network's plans, and may prompt other regulators to demand equal online access for their users.

Headlines: Facebook director Andreessen sorry for India Internet remarks
Description: Marc Andreessen, a prominent venture capitalist and Facebook Inc board director, apologized on Wednesday for tweets that condemned the Indian government for banning the social media company's free Internet service.

Headlines: Storyful editor to join Facebook to manage journalism partnerships
Description: The managing editor of News Corp's social media news agency Storyful said on Wednesday she is leaving to manage journalism partnerships at Facebook Inc	, as the social network broadens its push into news.

Headlines: Facebook India MD Kirthiga Reddy stepping down
Description: Facebook Inc's India managing director, Kirthiga Reddy, said on Friday she is stepping down and returning to the United States to "explore new opportunities" at the company's headquarters in Menlo Park, California.

Headlines: Court says Facebook nude painting case can be tried in France
Description: A French court ruled on Friday that a case against social networking company Facebook over a painting of a nude woman can be tried in France, rejecting Facebook's argument that it is governed by Californian law.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter support Apple on encryption dispute with FBI
Description: Facebook Inc  and Twitter Inc , two of Silicon Valley's most powerful companies, on Thursday backed Apple Inc's  refusal to help the FBI break into an iPhone used by a shooter in the San Bernardino attack, saying that complying would set a dangerous precedent for privacy.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says supports Apple's response to court order on unlocking iPhone - reports
Description:
Facebook :

Facebook says supports Apple's response to court order on
unlocking iPhone - reports
Further company coverage:

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg both woos and lashes out at phone industry
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Monday tried to extend an olive branch to mobile phone companies, on which the popular social network company increasingly relies, but which are also among his biggest critics.

Headlines: 'Wow': Facebook launches 'Reactions' worldwide
Description: Facebook users around the globe can now do more than "like" a post. They can love it, laugh at it or feel angered by it.

Headlines: RPT-UPDATE 3-"Wow": Facebook launches "Reactions" worldwide
Description:

Headlines: Germans talk tough, fete Facebook's Zuckerberg
Description: Prominent Germans appeared starstruck by Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg on a visit to Berlin on Thursday even while talking tough about the social network's record on data protection and hate speech.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, others plan briefs supporting Apple in iPhone case: sources
Description: Alphabet Inc's  Google, Facebook Inc , Microsoft Corp  and Twitter Inc  will all file or sign on to amicus briefs in support of Apple Inc's  fight against a magistrate's order, which requires it to help the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation break into a San Bernardino shooter's iPhone.

Headlines: Germany says Facebook's Zuckerberg gets message on hate speech
Description:
Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg
understands the need to stamp out hate speech on the world's
biggest social network, German Chancellor Angela Merkel's chief
of staff said on Thursday after a meeting between the two in
Berlin.

Headlines: German court fines Facebook $109,000 in dispute over IP license clause
Description: A German court has fined Facebook 100,000 euros ($109,000) for refusing to follow an order to adequately inform users about how it was using their intellectual property, a consumer group said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook executive jailed in Brazil as court seeks WhatsApp data
Description: Brazilian police arrested a senior Facebook Inc executive on Tuesday as a dispute escalated over a court's demand that the company provide data from its WhatsApp messaging service to help in a secretive drug-trafficking investigation.

Headlines: Facebook calls detention in Brazil over Whatsapp 'extreme'
Description: Facebook Inc called the detention of its vice president for Latin America on Tuesday an "extreme and disproportionate measure" stemming from a case in Brazil involving its messaging service Whatsapp, which operates separately from the Facebook platform.

Headlines: Facebook calls detention in Brazil over Whatsapp "extreme"
Description:

an "extreme and disproportionate measure" stemming from a case

operates separately from the Facebook platform.

Headlines: Germany takes on Facebook in competition probe
Description: Germany's cartel office is investigating Facebook  for suspected abuse of market power over breaches of data protection laws in the first formal probe of the social network for violating competition rules.

Headlines: Facebook executive released from jail in Brazil
Description: A senior Facebook Inc executive was released after nearly 24 hours in a Brazilian jail due to a disputed court order demanding data from the company's WhatsApp messaging service for a confidential drug-trafficking investigation.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook executive released from jail in Brazil
Description:

Headlines: UK lawmakers say Facebook may have broken tax rules
Description: Facebook  said it would ditch a corporate structure that helps minimize its UK tax bill, prompting lawmakers and campaigners to ask whether the arrangement had ever complied with UK tax rules.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-UK lawmakers say Facebook may have broken tax rules
Description:
* Facebook says is compliant with UK tax law

 (Adds MPs comment, academics, recasts)

Headlines: German court rules Facebook may block pseudonyms
Description: Facebook may prevent its users from using fake names, a German court said on Thursday, overturning a previous order from the Hamburg data protection authority.

Headlines: German regulator well suited to investigate Facebook: EU's Vestager
Description: Germany, which launched an investigation into social network Facebook last week, is well placed to handle the case, Europe's antitrust chief said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook snaps up face-swapping app creator Masquerade
Description: Facebook Inc is acquiring Masquerade Technologies Inc, creator of the popular face-swapping app MSQRD, as part of efforts by the world's largest social network operator to build its video services.

Headlines: German court rules against use of Facebook "like" button
Description: A German court has ruled against an online shopping site's use of Facebook's "like" button on Wednesday, dealing a further legal blow to the world's biggest social network in Germany.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter compete for live TV rights -NY Post
Description: Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc are vying to buy rights to stream conventional TV programming, the New York Post reported on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook, Twitter compete for live TV rights -NY Post

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus starts shipping Rift virtual reality headset
Description: Virtual reality company Oculus started shipping its highly awaited Rift headsets from Monday, about two years after the company was acquired by social media giant Facebook Inc .

Headlines: Exclusive: Egypt blocked Facebook Internet service over surveillance - sources
Description: Egypt blocked Facebook Inc's  Free Basics Internet service at the end of last year after the U.S. company refused to give the Egyptian government the ability to spy on users, two people familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: Facebook expands live video, challenging TV and web rivals
Description: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday expanded its live video product, Facebook Live, giving the feature prominent placement on its app and rolling out features to make it easier for users to search and comment in real time.

Description:

Headlines: Facebook's next frontier: chatbots
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it has opened up its Messenger app to developers to create "chatbots," hoping that by simulating one-on-one conversations between users and companies it will expand its reach in customer service and enterprise transactions.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook's next frontier: chatbots

Description:
Facebook Inc said
on Tuesday it will begin allowing developers to build chatbots
inside its Messsenger app that will enable users to communicate
with businesses one-on-one in its latest efforts to dominate
enterprise transactions and customer service.

Headlines: Facebook developing camera app similar to Snapchat: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc  is developing a stand-alone camera app, similar to disappearing photo app Snapchat, to increase user engagement, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook revenue smashes expectations as mobile ad sales surge
Description: Facebook Inc's  quarterly revenue rose more than 50 percent, handily beating Wall Street expectations as its wildly popular mobile app and a push into live video lured new advertisers and encouraged existing ones to boost spending.

Headlines: Facebook plans new non-voting shares to keep Zuckerberg at helm
Description: Facebook announced on Wednesday it will create a new class of non-voting shares in a move aimed at letting Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg give away his wealth without relinquishing control of the social media juggernaut he founded.

Headlines: Facebook revenue jumps 51.9 pct as mobile ad sales surge
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 51.9
percent rise in quarterly revenue as its increasingly popular
mobile app and push into live video continued to attract new
advertisers and encouraged existing ones to boost spending.

Headlines: Facebook says government requests for data continue to rise
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday that government requests for account data increased by 13 percent in the second half of 2015, with the United States and India topping the list.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Wall St gets a lift from Facebook, corporate M&A
Description:
* Dow down 0.17 pct, S&P up 0.04 pct, Nasdaq up 0.47 pct

 (Adds details, changes comment, updates prices)

Headlines: Facebook hit with lawsuit over plan to issue new stock
Description: A Facebook Inc  shareholder filed a proposed class action lawsuit on Friday in a bid to stop the company's plan to issue new Class C stock, calling the move an unfair deal to entrench Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg as controlling shareholder.

Headlines: Facebook CEO urges Brazilians to decry WhatsApp block
Description: Facebook Inc's  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg called on Brazilians to demand his company's WhatsApp messaging service  never be blocked again after an appeals court on Tuesday overturned the application's second suspension in five months.

Headlines: Facebook pays $10,000 to 10-year-old Instagram hacker
Description: Social media giant Facebook  has paid a $10,000 reward to a 10-year-old Finnish boy for finding a glitch in its picture sharing app Instagram.

Headlines: Facebook loses first round in suit over storing biometric data
Description: Facebook Inc  lost the first round in a court fight against some of its users who sued the social networking company, alleging it "unlawfully" collected and stored users' biometric data derived from their faces in photographs.

Headlines: Senate committee questions Facebook over news selection
Description: A U.S. Senate committee launched an inquiry on Tuesday into how social media website Facebook selects its news stories after a report that company employees blocked news about conservative issues from its "trending" list.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook provides information about "trending topics"
Description:
* Facebook says "does not allow or advise our reviewers to
discriminate against sources of any political origin"

Headlines: Facebook launches probe into report of political bias
Description: Facebook Inc, the social networking powerhouse, is conducting a full investigation into allegations of political bias, Chairman and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said.

Description:

allegations of political bias, Chairman and Chief Executive Mark

Facebook Inc, the social

allegations of political bias, Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer Mark Zuckerberg said in a statement late Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg meets U.S. conservatives over bias controversy
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg heard from more than a dozen U.S. conservative leaders on Wednesday and said he will work to build trust with users who believe the social network displays politically biased news content.

Headlines: Facebook says no evidence of political bias found on 'Trending Topics'
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Monday that
an investigation into its editorial practices had found no
evidence of political bias in the selection or prominence of
stories shown on its Trending Topics feature.

Headlines: Facebook changes policies on 'Trending Topics' after criticism
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday that it had changed some of the procedures for its "Trending Topics" section after a news report alleging it suppressed conservative news prompted a U.S. Congressional demand for more transparency.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook changes policies on 'Trending Topics' after criticism
Description:
* Company says internal probe showed no evidence of
political bias

Headlines: Irish privacy watchdog refers Facebook's U.S. data transfers to EU court
Description: Data transfers to the United States by companies such as Facebook and Google face a renewed legal threat after the Irish privacy watchdog said on Wednesday it would refer Facebook's data transfer mechanisms to the top EU court.

Headlines: Microsoft, Facebook to build transatlantic subsea cable
Description: Microsoft Corp and Facebook Inc have agreed to jointly build a subsea cable across the Atlantic Ocean to meet growing demand for high-speed cloud and online services.

Headlines: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Microsoft, Facebook to build transatlantic subsea cable
Description:
Microsoft Corp and Facebook Inc
 have agreed to jointly build a subsea cable across the
Atlantic Ocean to meet growing demand for high-speed cloud and
online services.

Description:
* Facebook CIO Tim Campos is leaving Co at the end of the

online services.

Headlines: Vietnam restricted access to Facebook during Obama visit: activists
Description: The Vietnamese government restricted access to Facebook Inc inside Vietnam for several days this week as part of a broader crackdown on human rights and political dissidents during a visit by President Barack Obama, two activist organizations said on Thursday.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says expanding Audience Network to show better ads
Description:
* Facebook says expanding audience network so publishers and
developers can show better ads to "everyone" - blog

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg may lose majority voting control if he exits
Description: Facebook Inc's  board has proposed removing Mark Zuckerberg's majority voting control in the event of the social media giant's chief executive and founder deciding to exit management at some point in future.

Headlines: Facebook founder Zuckerberg's social media accounts restored after alleged hack
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's Twitter and Pinterest accounts have been resecured, a spokesman from the social media platform said on Monday, responding to questions about weekend media reports that the founder's sites had been hacked.

Headlines: Facebook adds 360-degree photos to newsfeed
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday launched a feature that allows users to upload photos with 360-degree views.

Headlines: French killer's Facebook broadcast underscores live video challenges
Description: After Larossi Abballa killed a French police commander and the commander's partner on Tuesday, he took to Facebook Live to encourage viewers in a 12-minute video to follow his example: Kill prison staff, police officials, journalists, lawmakers.

Headlines: Facebook investors OK new share class to keep Zuckerberg at helm
Description: Facebook Inc  shareholders approved a proposal to create a new class of non-voting shares, a move aimed at letting Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg give away his wealth without relinquishing control of the social media company he founded.

Headlines: Facebook signs deals with media firms, celebrities for Live: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc  has signed deals worth more than $50 million with media companies and celebrities to create videos for its live-streaming service, the Wall Street Journal reported.

Headlines: Facebook signs deals with media firms, celebrities for Live -WSJ
Description:
Facebook Inc has signed deals
worth more than $50 million with media companies and celebrities
to create videos for its live-streaming service, the Wall Street
Journal reported.

Headlines: Florida man brags about burglary on Facebook, lands him in jail
Description: A Florida burglar who posted a Facebook video bragging about a $500,000 jewelry haul has landed himself and one of his accomplices in jail, police said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook wins privacy case against Belgian data protection authority
Description: The Belgian data protection authority on Wednesday lost a legal battle with Facebook in which it sought to stop the social network from tracking the online activities of non-Facebook users in Belgium who visit the social network's pages.

Headlines: Facebook's political influence under a microscope
Description: As the U.S. presidential campaign heats up, Facebook Inc is going out of its way to show its neutrality - an increasingly urgent matter for the social network as evidence of its power  continues to emerge.

Headlines: Brazil court blocks Facebook funds over WhatsApp dispute: report
Description: A court in Brazil on Thursday blocked 19.5 million reais ($6.07 million) in Facebook Inc funds after the U.S-based social networking company's WhatsApp messaging service failed to turn over messages sought in a drugs case, the G1 news service said.

Headlines: Twitter names former Facebook technology chief to its board
Description: Twitter Inc said it had appointed former Facebook Inc Chief Technology Officer Bret Taylor to its board, effective immediately.

Headlines: U.S. tax agency investigates Facebook's Ireland asset transfer
Description: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) said Facebook Inc  may have understated the value of intellectual property it transferred to Ireland by "billions of dollars", unfairly cutting its tax bill in the process, according to court papers.

Headlines: Facebook Live streaming of shooting spotlights ethical, legal policies
Description: A live, 10-minute video of the aftermath of a police officer shooting a black man in Minnesota was the latest example of the  riveting power of video streaming and the complex ethical and policy issues it raises for Facebook Live and similar features.

Headlines: Relatives of Palestinian attack victims sue Facebook for $1 billion in U.S.
Description: A group of Israelis and Americans filed a lawsuit on Monday seeking $1 billion in damages from Facebook Inc.  for allegedly facilitating deadly Palestinian militant attacks on their loved ones.

Headlines: Shooting of three men in Virginia captured by Facebook Live camera
Description: Three Virginia men were wounded by a hail of gunfire in a shooting recorded on Facebook Live video, police said on Wednesday, another example of the phenomenon of violence being streamed online.

Headlines: Facebook makes little progress in race, gender diversity: report
Description: Facebook Inc's employees are still mainly white or Asian males as the world's largest social network made little progress in hiring a more diverse talent pool over the past year, it said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Messenger hits 1 billion users, after two years as standalone app
Description: Facebook Inc's Messenger has more than 1 billion users, the social media company said on Wednesday, making it one the world's top three apps just two years after it was split off from Facebook's main app, which is by far and away the most popular.

Headlines: Facebook's solar-powered internet drone takes flight
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday it had completed a successful test flight of a solar-powered drone that it hopes will help it extend internet connectivity to every corner of the planet.

Headlines: Illinois Republican lawmaker resigns, cites Facebook, Twitter hacks
Description: A prominent Illinois Republican has resigned from the state legislature, citing multiple incidents of fake Facebook and Twitter accounts set up in his name in recent weeks.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter co-operated with Brazil probe of alleged militants
Description: The judge overseeing the probe that led to the arrest last week of suspected Islamist militants in Brazil said Facebook Inc. and Twitter Inc. co-operated with investigators by providing information about the suspects' use of both social networks.

Headlines: Facebook trounces Wall Street estimates with sharp ad sales growth
Description: Facebook Inc provided more evidence on Wednesday that it can turn eyeballs into profit as the maker of the world's most popular app and social website trounced Wall Street's estimates, sending its shares to an all-time high.

Headlines: Brazil prosecutor freezes $11.7 million of Facebook funds due to WhatsApp case
Description: The public federal prosecutor in the Brazilian state of Amazonas said on Wednesday the court there froze 38 million reais ($11.7 million) of funds held in Facebook Inc's account for failing to comply with a court order to supply data on users of the company's WhatsApp messaging service who are under criminal investigation.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says anticipate lower advertising revenue growth rates in each successive quarter in 2016 - Conf call
Description:
* "anticipate ad load on Facebook will continue to grow
modestly over next 12 months " - Conf call

Headlines: Facebook revenue jumps on blistering ad sales growth
Description:
Facebook Inc's quarterly revenue
jumped 59.2 percent as its hugely popular mobile app attracted
new advertisers and encouraged existing ones to spend more.

Headlines: Facebook shares hit record high as it beats estimates again
Description: Facebook Inc  is growing so fast that analysts can't keep up.

Headlines: Thai activist's mother charged under royal insult laws over Facebook post
Description: The mother of a leading activist against the military junta in Thailand was charged on Monday with insulting the country's monarchy in a one-word Facebook post.

Headlines: Facebook to let emerging market companies sell through their pages
Description: Facebook Inc is to let small businesses in emerging markets sell to customers for free through their Facebook pages, the social media company said on Wednesday, marking a new effort to build up potential advertisers in its fastest-growing regions.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook to let emerging market companies sell through their pages
Description:
Facebook Inc is to
let small businesses in emerging markets sell to customers for
free through their Facebook pages, the social media company said
on Wednesday, marking a new effort to build up potential
advertisers in its fastest-growing regions.

Headlines: Facebook denies reluctance to give data to German investigators
Description: Facebook rejected on Monday claims made by Germany's state authorities that it was reluctant to co-operate with them on criminal investigations, saying many of the requests it received for user data were incorrectly formulated.

Headlines: U.S. Federal Reserve launches Facebook page
Description: The Federal Reserve said it was launching a Facebook page on Thursday, part of an effort to reach out directly to a general public.

Headlines: WhatsApp relaxes privacy stance, to share phone numbers with Facebook
Description: Popular messaging service WhatsApp said it would start sharing users' phone numbers with parent Facebook Inc , marking a notable shift in its stance on privacy.

Headlines: Facebook to start using WhatsApp data for targeted advertising
Description:
WhatsApp, Facebook Inc's popular
messaging service, will start sharing users' phone numbers with
its parent, allowing for more relevant advertisements and friend
recommendations on the social network.

Headlines: Facebook changes 'Trending' feature to rely less on human editors
Description: Facebook Inc  changed its popular "Trending" feature, which shows users the most-talked about topics of the day, to make it more automated and further eliminate the potential for human bias, the company wrote in a blog post on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook changes 'Trending' feature to rely less on human editors

Description:
* Making changes to Trending feature on facebook to make

Headlines: UK regulator to monitor WhatsApp's data sharing with Facebook
Description: Britain's data privacy regulator said on Friday it would monitor how popular messaging service WhatsApp shares data with parent Facebook Inc under a new privacy policy.

Headlines: Germany wants Facebook to take initiative in fight against online hate
Description: Germany's interior minister visited Facebook's offices in Berlin on Monday and said it should be more proactive in removing forbidden content from its social network platform.

Headlines: Facebook reinstates Vietnam photo after outcry over censorship
Description: Facebook Inc on Friday reinstated a Vietnam War-era photo of a naked girl fleeing a napalm attack, after a public outcry over its removal of the image including harsh criticism from Norway's prime minister.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook reinstates Vietnam photo after outcry over censorship
Description:
* Newspaper appeals to Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg
