Headlines: Facebook privacy issues may not be competition matters: EU antitrust chief
Description: Facebook's problems with European privacy regulators do not mean that the social network has breached the bloc's competition rules, EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said on Friday.

Headlines: Austrian court refers Facebook privacy case to European court
Description: An attempt by Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems to have a data protection case against Facebook  heard as a class action suit moved a step ahead on Monday when Austria's Supreme Court referred the question to the European Court of Justice (CJEU).

Headlines: Facebook announces payment capabilities for Messenger service
Description: Facebook's Messenger application, which now boasts a billion users, is introducing new capabilities that will make it possible to pay for goods and services through Messenger or though "bots," or automated programs, that use the messaging app.

Headlines: Facebook says will learn from mistake over Vietnam photo
Description: Facebook Inc will learn from a mistake it made by deleting a historic Vietnam War photo of a naked girl fleeing a napalm attack, the company's chief operating officer said.

Headlines: Facebook tells U.S. judge it takes terroristic threats seriously
Description: Lawyers for Facebook Inc  on Tuesday sought to assure a U.S. judge overseeing lawsuits by victims of militant attacks in the Middle East that it took a "zero tolerance" approach to any communications that may promote terrorist threats or activity.

Headlines: Facebook to appeal German order on WhatsApp data
Description: Facebook  said it would appeal against an order by a German privacy regulator on Tuesday to stop collecting and storing data of German users of its messaging app WhatsApp and to delete all data that has already been forwarded to it.

Headlines: German lawyer makes hate-speech complaint against Facebook
Description: German prosecutors are again considering whether to press charges against Mark Zuckerberg and other Facebook executives for failing to staunch a tide of racist and threatening posts on the social network during an influx of migrants into Europe.

Headlines: Facebook launches Marketplace for local buying and selling
Description: Facebook Inc launched Marketplace to allow people to buy and sell items locally as the social media network tries new ways to keep users engaged.

Headlines: Facebook to build data center in Denmark: report
Description: Facebook is to build its third data center outside the United States in Denmark to store and manage the social media giant's growing data, such as photos and videos, a Danish news website reported.

Headlines: Facebook rolls out pared down Messenger app for emerging markets
Description: Facebook Inc launched a stripped down version of its popular Messenger app for emerging markets on Monday as it seeks to expand its international footprint.

Headlines: Facebook rolls out business software, launches pricing war
Description: Facebook Inc  launched a workplace version of its mobile app and website on Monday, marking the social networking company's first foray into the hotly competitive and crowded enterprise software arena.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg says has no plan to work in government
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg, who has been mentioned as a potential Treasury Secretary should Democrat Hillary Clinton become the next U.S. president, said on Tuesday she has no plans to go into government.

Headlines: Facebook adds food ordering feature
Description: Facebook Inc  said users in the United States would be able to order food through the Facebook pages of restaurants starting on Wednesday as part of its efforts to connect users and businesses.

Headlines: Facebook executives feel the heat of content controversies
Description: After Facebook's removal of an iconic Vietnam war photo stirred an international uproar last month, the social network's executives quickly backtracked and cleared its publication.

Headlines: Facebook pledges fewer content removals, new criteria as yet unclear
Description: Facebook will allow more content on its platform that it would have earlier removed because it violated its standards, with new criteria being worked out, a senior executive said on Monday, following a row over the removal of an iconic Vietnam War photo.

Headlines: Rights groups ask Facebook to clarify policies on content removal
Description: More than 70 rights groups asked Facebook on Monday to clarify its policies for removing content, especially at the behest of governments, alleging the company has repeatedly censored postings that document human rights violations.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook pledges fewer content removals, new criteria as yet unclear
Description:
Facebook will allow more
content on its platform that it would have earlier removed
because it violated its standards, with new criteria being
worked out, a senior executive said on Monday, following a row
over the removal of an iconic Vietnam War photo.

Headlines: Facebook says will remove fewer pictures, stories after Vietnam photo row
Description:
Facebook will allow more
content on its platform that it would have earlier removed
because it violated its standards, a senior company executive
said on Monday, following the controversy over the removal of an
iconic Vietnam War photo.

Headlines: Facebook warns growth will slow, shares dip
Description: Facebook Inc  shares tumbled 7 percent in after-hours trading on Wednesday as the world's largest online social media network warned that revenue growth would slow this quarter, offsetting strong earnings that handily beat Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook warns growth will slow, shares dip
Description:
Facebook Inc shares tumbled 7
percent in after-hours trading on Wednesday as the world's
largest online social media network warned that revenue growth
would slow this quarter, offsetting strong earnings that handily
beat Wall Street estimates.

Headlines: Facebook reports 55.8 percent rise in revenue
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 55.8
percent rise in quarterly revenue on Wednesday as its
mobile-advertising sales soared.

Headlines: Facebook stymies Admiral's plans to use social media data to price insurance premiums
Description: British motor insurer Admiral  has had to abandon plans to use data taken from Facebook  to price insurance premiums for first-time drivers following discussions with the social media firm, an Admiral spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Headlines: S&P 500 losing streak runs to 8 days as Facebook weighs
Description: The S&P 500 fell for an eighth straight session on Thursday, its longest losing streak since the 2008 financial crisis, as Facebook shares weighed and investors grappled with uncertainty over next week's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Drop in Facebook's stock makes for good time to connect: analysts
Description: Facebook Inc's  shares fell as much as 5.5 percent in early trading on Thursday, wiping out about $20 billion of market value.

Headlines: Goldman, JPMorgan, Morgan Stanley defeat appeal over Facebook IPO
Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc , JPMorgan Chase & Co  and Morgan Stanley  need not forfeit their estimated $100 million of profit from trading Facebook Inc  stock soon after underwriting its May 2012 initial public offering, a federal appeals court said on Thursday.

Headlines: German prosecutors investigate Facebook over hate postings
Description: German prosecutors are investigating Mark Zuckerberg and other Facebook executives, a spokesman for the Munich prosecutor's office said on Friday, following a complaint alleging the company broke national laws against hate speech and sedition by failing to remove racist postings.

Headlines: Facebook takes on LinkedIn with new job opening features
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday, it was testing a feature that would let page administrators create job postings and receive applications from candidates, a move that could pressure LinkedIn Corp's  recruiting business.    "Based on behavior we've seen on Facebook, where many small businesses post about their job openings on their Page, we're running a test for Page admins to create job postings and receive applications from candidates," a company spokesman tol

Headlines: UK privacy watchdog says Facebook agrees to suspend using WhatsApp users' data
Description: Britain's privacy watchdog said on Monday that Facebook  has agreed to suspend using data from UK users of its WhatsApp messaging app for advertisements or product-improvement purposes after the watchdog said consumers weren't properly protected.

Headlines: Facebook to stop ethnicity-based targeting for some ads
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it would no longer allow certain advertisers to exclude racial or ethnic groups when placing ads on its service, following criticism that the practice was discriminatory.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to stop ethnicity-based targeting for some ads
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Friday it
would no longer allow certain advertisers to exclude racial or
ethnic groups when placing ads on its service, following
criticism that the practice was discriminatory.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says updating its ethnic affinity marketing
Description:
* Facebook announces additional changes designed to better
enable it to enforce policies that prohibit discriminatory uses
of ethnic affinity marketing

Headlines: Google, Facebook move to restrict ads on fake news sites
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google  and Facebook Inc  on Monday announced measures aimed at halting the spread of "fake news" on the internet by targeting how some purveyors of phony content make money: advertising.

Headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp adds secure video calling amid privacy concerns
Description: One of the world’s most popular means of communication, Facebook's  WhatsApp, is adding fully encrypted video calling to its messaging app on Monday, a move that comes as privacy advocates worry about the potential for stepped-up government surveillance under a Trump administration.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Facebook aims for more transparency with video ad data
Description:
Two months after Facebook Inc 
admitted it had inflated the average time it told advertisers
that users were watching their video ads, the company is
promising better data to give ad buyers a clearer picture of how
they are spending their money.

Headlines: German minister says Facebook should be treated as a media company
Description: Germany's Justice Minister says he believes Facebook Inc.  should be treated like a media company rather than a technology platform, suggesting he favors moves to make social media groups criminally liable for failing to remove hate speech.

Headlines: Facebook sets $6 billion buyback; accounting chief to leave
Description: Social media giant Facebook Inc  on Friday set a $6 billion buyback program for its Class A shares, beginning in the first quarter of 2017.

Headlines: Facebook sets $6 bln buyback program, accounting chief to leave
Description:
Social media giant Facebook Inc 
said on Friday it would buy back up to $6 billion of its Class A
shares, beginning in the first quarter of 2017.

Headlines: Facebook 'likes' Britain's talent, to add jobs despite Brexit
Description: Facebook  said it would expand its presence in Britain by 50 percent in 2017, joining other U.S. technology firms in increasing investment despite the uncertainty sparked by the country's vote to leave the European Union.

Headlines: Facebook builds censorship tool to attain China re-entry: NYT
Description: Facebook Inc has quietly developed a censorship tool that could persuade China to allow the world's biggest social media network to re-enter the world's second largest economy after a seven-year ban, the New York Times reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook users can now play Pac-Man on Messenger app
Description: For users hooked on to Facebook's Messenger app, it's game on.

Headlines: Facebook COO Sandberg donates $100 million to donor advised fund
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg has donated more than $100 million to the Sheryl Sandberg & Dave Goldberg Family Fund.

Headlines: Norway's Schibsted to hire more staff to stave off Facebook in classified ads
Description: Norwegian media group Schibsted plans to add 200 people to its 1,800-strong technology team in the next year to further develop its online classified ads business and fend off competition from Facebook, its chief executive says.

Headlines: Merkel ally threatens Facebook with fines over online hate speech
Description: A senior German conservative has warned Facebook it could face fines if it fails to act faster to tackle online hate speech, and he said the government could propose legislative measures in the new year.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook to roll out new tools to tackle fake news
Description:
Facebook Inc said on
Thursday it will introduce tools to prevent fake news stories
from spreading on its platform, an about-face in response to
rising criticism that it did not do enough to combat the problem
during the U.S. presidential campaign.

Headlines: Facebook underreported iPhone traffic for some publishers
Description: Facebook Inc  said it had underreported the number of views on iPhone of content published by some publishers using its Instant Articles platform between Sept. 20 and Nov. 30.

Headlines: Virtual butler 'Jarvis' takes up residence in Facebook founder's home
Description: Mark Zuckerberg on Monday introduced the world to "Jarvis", an artificial intelligence system the Facebook chief created in his spare time, which can choose and play music, turn on lights, and recognize visitors, deciding whether to open the front door.

Headlines: EU accuses Facebook of misleading it in WhatsApp takeover probe
Description: The European Commission has charged Facebook Inc  with providing misleading information during its takeover of the online messaging service WhatsApp, opening the company to a possible fine of 1 percent of its turnover.

Headlines: Facebook inks agreement with 17 universities to streamline research
Description: Facebook Inc's hardware development division on Wednesday announced a new partnership with Harvard, Princeton and 15 other universities intended to allow swifter collaboration on technology research projects.

Headlines: Facebook says government requests for account data rise 27 percent
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday that government requests for user account data rose 27 percent in the first half of 2016 compared to the second half of last year, with U.S. law enforcement agencies topping the list.

Headlines: Orlando nightclub victims' families sue Twitter, Google, Facebook
Description: The families of three men killed at Orlando's Pulse gay nightclub have sued Twitter Inc, Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc in federal court, accusing the companies of providing "material support" to the self-radicalized gunman.

Headlines: New York Times surpasses 100 million views on Facebook Live
Description: Presidential politics and celebrity interviews helped The New York Times Co surpass 100 million views for its Facebook Live videos, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Four ordered held without bail over Chicago torture shown on Facebook
Description: Four African-Americans accused of attacking an 18-year-old white man with special needs while making anti-white racial taunts in an assault broadcast on Facebook were ordered held without bail by a Chicago judge on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook launches project to improve ties with news media
Description: Facebook Inc launched its "Journalism Project" on Wednesday, as the world's biggest social media network looks to deepen its relationship with news organizations.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook launches project to improve ties with news media
Description:
Facebook Inc launched its
"Journalism Project" on Wednesday, as the world's biggest social
media network looks to deepen its relationship with news
organizations.

Headlines: Facebook moves to head off tougher regulation in Germany
Description: Facebook is stepping up efforts to head off tougher regulation by Germany, a fierce critic of the social media network operator, with top managers visiting Germany and saying they would do more to combat fake news and hate speech.

Headlines: Facebook bets on Paris with start-up incubator
Description: Facebook gave the French tech scene a vote of confidence on Tuesday by picking Paris as the location for its first start-ups incubator, a boost for the city as European capitals compete to attract firms post-Brexit.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook bets on Paris with start-up incubator
Description:
Facebook gave the French
tech scene a vote of confidence on Tuesday by picking Paris as
the location for its first start-ups incubator, a boost for the
city as European capitals compete to attract firms post-Brexit.

Headlines: Facebook dismissive of censorship, abuse concerns, rights groups allege
Description: Nearly 80 rights groups on Wednesday accused Facebook   of "racially biased censorship" and failing to be more transparent about its removal policies and cooperation with law enforcement, adding to criticism the company has faced in recent months over its management of content on its network of 1.8 billion users.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg questioned at trial over virtual-reality technology
Description: Facebook Inc  chief executive Mark Zuckerberg took the witness stand in Dallas federal court on Tuesday and denied an allegation by a rival company that the virtual-reality technology of Facebook's Oculus unit was stolen.

Headlines: Facebook to build third foreign data center in Denmark
Description: Facebook will build a new data center in the Danish city of Odense, the California-based tech company said at a press conference with local authorities, only the third such facility outside of the United States.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to build third foreign data centre in Denmark
Description:
Facebook will build a
new data centre in the Danish city of Odense, the
California-based tech company said at a press conference with
local authorities, only the third such facility outside of the
United States.

Headlines: Facebook to build data centre in Denmark
Description:
Facebook plans to
build its third data centre outside the United States in Odense,
Denmark, the California-based tech company said at a joint press
conference with Odense municipality on Thursday.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook's Zuckerberg sues over rights to Hawaiian hideaway
Description:
LONDON, Jan 19 (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Facebook
co-founder Mark Zuckerberg has launched a raft of lawsuits that
could see the U.S. billionaire secure full ownership of his
island hideaway from local Hawaiian families who retain rights
over the land dating back generations.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg 'reconsidering' land sale actions against Hawaiians
Description:
Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said he
is reconsidering efforts to force the sale of land tracts
belonging to native Hawaiians that fall within a large estate he
bought on the island of Kauai, after facing harsh criticism.

Headlines: Xiaomi executive Barra joins Facebook to lead virtual reality business
Description: Facebook Inc  has hired Hugo Barra, the most prominent global executive at Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Inc [XTC.UL], to lead its virtual reality business including the Oculus unit, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said.

Headlines: Facebook CEO, facing wave of criticism, stops attempt to force Hawaii land sale
Description: Facing mounting criticism from islanders and local lawmakers, Facebook  CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday revealed he was dropping his legal gambit to force the sale of land tracts on his seafront property on the island of Kauai that are claimed by native Hawaiians.

Headlines: Facebook to develop app for television set-top boxes: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc is creating an app for television set-top boxes, including Apple Inc's Apple TV, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook to develop app for television set-top boxes - WSJ
Description:
Facebook Inc is creating an app
for television set-top boxes, including Apple Inc's 
Apple TV, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people
familiar with the matter.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook eases past Wall St estimates, sees spending up in 2017
Description:
Facebook Inc cruised past Wall
Street's earnings and revenue expectations on Wednesday with
strong growth in its mobile ad business, demonstrating that
controversy over so-called "fake news" and inaccurate
advertising measurements had little impact on its financial
performance.

Headlines: U.S. jury issues $500 million verdict in Facebook virtual reality lawsuit
Description: A U.S. jury in Texas on Wednesday ordered Facebook Inc, its virtual reality unit Oculus, and other defendants to pay a combined $500 million to ZeniMax Media Inc, a video game publisher that says Oculus stole its technology.

Headlines: Facebook's quarterly revenue surges 50.8 pct
Description:
Facebook Inc's quarterly revenue
surged 50.8 percent as the world's largest social network
continues to benefit from its aggressive push into mobiles and
video.

Headlines: Facebook eases past Wall Street estimates, sees spending up in 2017
Description: Facebook Inc  cruised past Wall Street's earnings and revenue expectations on Wednesday with strong growth in its mobile ad business, demonstrating that controversy over so-called "fake news" and inaccurate advertising measurements had little impact on its financial performance.

Headlines: Facebook, Google join drive against fake news in France
Description: Giant Internet firms Facebook and Google joined forces with news organizations on Monday to launch new fact-checking tools designed to root out "fake news" stories in France ahead of the country's presidential election.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook, Google join drive against fake news in France
Description:
Giant Internet firms Facebook and
Google joined forces with news organisations on Monday to launch
new fact-checking tools designed to root out "fake news" stories
in France ahead of the country's presidential election.

Headlines: Facebook vulnerable to expected changes in key visa program
Description: (This version of the story removes reference to mininum salary in 14th paragraph.)

Headlines: German court hears Syrian's 'selfie with Merkel' case against Facebook
Description: A German court will on Monday hold its first hearing in the case of a Syrian refugee who is suing Facebook after the social networking site declined to remove all posts linking him to crimes and militant attacks.

Headlines: Facebook launches anti fake-news drive in France as election approaches
Description:
Social media company Facebook
 launched on Monday an initiative to tackle fake news
stories in France, with the media in the spotlight as the
country's presidential election approaches.

Headlines: Facebook doubles its bereavement leave for employees
Description: Facebook Inc is doubling its bereavement leave for employees and also introducing paid family sick time, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said in an internet post.

Headlines: Ireland challenges Facebook in threat to cross-border data pact
Description: Ireland's privacy watchdog has launched a bid to refer Facebook's data transfer mechanism to the European Union's top court in a landmark case that could put the shifting of data across the Atlantic under renewed legal threat.

Headlines: Facebook says Irish challenge to U.S. data transfers 'deeply flawed'
Description: Facebook said on Thursday a legal challenge against the way it transfers EU user data to the United States was "deeply flawed" and should not be referred to the EU's top court because ample privacy protections were already in place.

Headlines: Facebook CEO warns against reversal of global thinking
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg laid out a vision on Thursday of his company serving as a bulwark against rising isolationism, writing in a letter to users that the company's platform could be the "social infrastructure" for the globe.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook in talks to live stream one MLB game per week - sources
Description: Facebook Inc  is in talks with Major League Baseball to live stream one game per week during the upcoming season, which could be a key win as the social media platform works to offer more live sports, according to two people familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Game company seeks to block Facebook from using virtual reality code
Description: Video game publisher ZeniMax Media Inc., which earlier this month won a $500 million verdict against Facebook Inc.’s  Oculus virtual reality unit for unauthorized copying of computer code, has asked a federal judge to block Oculus from using the code in its products.

Headlines: Facebook's virtual reality ambitions could be threatened by court order
Description: Facebook Inc's big ambitions in the nascent virtual reality industry could be threatened by a court order that would prevent it from using critical software code another company claims to own, according to legal and industry experts.

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus cuts price of virtual reality set by $200
Description: Facebook Inc's virtual reality unit Oculus has cut $200 from the total price of its flagship hardware set, in a bid to expand the system's base of video game players, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook turns to artificial intelligence to tackle suicides
Description: Facebook plans to use artificial intelligence and update its tools and services to help prevent suicides among its users.

Headlines: Facebook suspends location-sharing feature after Italian copyright suit
Description: Facebook Inc has suspended its location-sharing feature in Italy after a Milan court ruled last year that the social networking giant had violated competition and copyright laws by effectively copying a similar app from a local start-up.

Headlines: Facebook names LinkedIn executive Susan Taylor as accounting chief
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it appointed LinkedIn executive Susan Taylor as chief accounting officer, effective April 17.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says beginning test of new advanced measurement tools focused on reach, attribution
Description:
* Beginning a test of new advanced measurement tools focused
on reach and attribution

Headlines: German court rejects injunction for Facebook in Syrian selfie case
Description: A German court rejected a temporary injunction against Facebook  on Tuesday in a case brought by a Syrian refugee who sued the social networking site for failing to remove faked posts linking him to crimes and militant attacks.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg and wife expecting a second daughter
Description: Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla Chan, are expecting a second child, a daughter, the billionaire internet mogul said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook bars developers from using data for surveillance
Description: Facebook Inc  barred software developers on Monday from using the massive social network's data to create surveillance tools, closing off a process that had been exploited by U.S. police departments to track protesters

Headlines: Apple, Google, Facebook skip legal challenge to new travel ban
Description: Apple Inc, Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc are among more than 60 technology companies that appear to have backed away from the legal fight against U.S. President Donald Trump's controversial travel ban, deciding not to put their weight behind a lawsuit seeking to block the second version of his executive order.

Headlines: Vietnam urges firms to stop YouTube and Facebook ads in protest over 'fake content'
Description: Vietnam on Thursday called on all companies doing business there to stop advertising on YouTube, Facebook and other social media until they find a way to halt the publication of "toxic" anti-government information.

Headlines: EU authorities demand changes from Facebook, Google, Twitter
Description: Social media companies Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc will have to amend their terms of service for European users within a month or face the risk of fines, a European Commission official said on Friday.

Headlines: Pakistan seeks Facebook meeting, threatens action over blasphemy
Description: Pakistan will punish social media companies that fail to take action against online blasphemy, the interior minister said on Wednesday, adding that he had requested a meeting with Facebook.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says analyzing Facebook reply to WhatsApp probe
Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said on Wednesday she was reviewing Facebook's response to charges the U.S. social network provided misleading information during its bid for messaging service WhatsApp which may result in a hefty fine for the company.

Headlines: Facebook's Messenger app adds live location-sharing
Description: Facebook Inc added a feature to its Messenger app on Monday to allow users to share their locations continuously for up to an hour, ramping up competition with tools offered by Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google Maps.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook adds camera features, moving closer to Snapchat
Description:
Facebook Inc is
giving the camera a central place on its smartphone app for the
first time, encouraging users to take more pictures and edit
them with digital stickers that show the influence of rival
Snapchat.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook updates branded content policy
Description:
* Made some updates to branded content policy based on
direct feedback from publishing partners

Headlines: New York's top court rejects Facebook search warrant challenge
Description: New York state's highest court on Tuesday rejected Facebook Inc's  challenge to 381 search warrants to uncover suspected widespread Social Security disability fraud by its customers.

Headlines: Facebook to use photo-matching to block repeat 'revenge porn'
Description: Facebook Inc  is adding tools on Wednesday to make it easier for users to report so-called "revenge porn" and to automatically prevent the images from being shared again once they have been banned, the company said.

Headlines: Facebook virtual reality unit Oculus faces lawsuit over imaging patent
Description: Facebook Inc's virtual reality unit Oculus VR is facing a lawsuit alleging it incorporated without authorization a smaller competitor's patented technology into its Rift headset.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says launching call-to-action units for instant articles
Description:
* Next week rolling out these call-to-action units to all
publishers on instant articles

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg says number of monthly advertisers tops 5 million
Description: Facebook Inc  plans to announce on Monday that more than 5 million businesses are advertising on the social network each month and that it is updating its suite of ad services to try to draw more small businesses onto its mobile platform.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg says number of monthly advertisers tops 5 mln
Description:
Facebook Inc
plans to announce on Monday that more than 5 million businesses
are advertising on the social network each month and that it is
updating its suite of ad services to try to draw more small
businesses onto its mobile platform.

Headlines: Facebook cracks down on 30,000 fake accounts in France
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it suspended 30,000 accounts in France as the social network giant steps up efforts to stop the spread of fake news, misinformation and spam.

Headlines: Facebook failed to remove reported extremist posts - The Times
Description: Facebook failed to remove dozens of instances of  extremist and child pornography even after the social network's moderators were directly informed of the potentially illegal content, an investigation by The Times showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook failed to remove reported extremist posts -The Times
Description:
Facebook failed to
remove dozens of instances of  extremist and child pornography
even after the social network's moderators were directly
informed of the potentially illegal content, an investigation by
The Times showed on Thursday.

Headlines: Cleveland killing leads Facebook to review handling of videos
Description: Facebook Inc launched a review on Monday of how it handles violent videos and other objectionable material, saying it needed to do better after a video of a killing in Cleveland on Sunday remained on its website and mobile app for two hours.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Cleveland killing leads Facebook to review handling of videos
Description:
Facebook Inc
launched a review on Monday of how it handles violent videos and
other objectionable material, saying it needed to do better
after a video of a killing in Cleveland on Sunday remained on
its website and mobile app for two hours.

Headlines: Facebook says it will review handling of violent videos
Description:
Facebook Inc
launched a review on Monday of how it handles violent videos and
other objectionable material, saying it needed to do better
after a video of a killing in Cleveland remained on its service
for more than two hours on Sunday.

Headlines: Cleveland police seek man they say broadcast killing on Facebook
Description: Cleveland police urged a suspect who they said posted video of himself on Facebook killing an elderly man on Sunday to turn himself in to authorities.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Inspired by Pokemon Go, Facebook pushes augmented reality
Description:
Facebook Inc
is trying to seize on the technology known as augmented reality,
a mix of the real and digital worlds best known from the hit
smartphone game Pokemon Go, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said
on Tuesday.

Headlines: Cleveland police widen manhunt for Facebook murder suspect
Description: The manhunt widened on Monday for a murder suspect who police said posted a video of himself on Facebook shooting an elderly man in Cleveland, where authorities appealed to the public for help in the case after urging the killer to turn himself in.

Headlines: Wells Fargo tests Facebook chatbot
Description: Wells Fargo & Company  is testing a "chatbot", an automated program that can communicate with the bank's customers on Facebook's  messaging platform to give them information on their accounts and help them reset their passwords.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg vows to help prevent repeat of Cleveland murder posting
Description:
Facebook Inc
Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg pledged on Tuesday that his
company would do all it could to prevent postings of incidents
like Sunday's fatal shooting in Cleveland, which was visible on
the social media site for two hours.

Headlines: Suspect in Facebook video murder kills self in Pennsylvania: police
Description: A murder suspect who police said posted a video on Facebook of the killing of a Cleveland man fatally shot himself after a "brief pursuit" by Pennsylvania State Police officers on Tuesday, police said.

Headlines: Inspired by Pokemon Go, Facebook pushes augmented reality
Description: Facebook Inc is trying to seize on the technology known as augmented reality, a mix of the real and digital worlds best known from the hit smartphone game Pokemon Go, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Thai man broadcasts baby daughter's murder live on Facebook
Description: A Thai man filmed himself killing his 11-month-old daughter in two video clips posted on Facebook before committing suicide, police said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Canadian police investigate Facebook beating video in murder case
Description: Canadian police said on Wednesday they were investigating whether a beating captured on video, reported to have been distributed through social networking site Facebook Inc, may be connected to a young woman's murder.

Headlines: Thai police to review ways to take down online content after Facebook killing
Description: Police in Thailand on Wednesday said they would discuss how to expedite taking down "inappropriate online content" after a man broadcast himself killing his 11-month-old daughter in a live video on Facebook.

Headlines: Facebook says it will act against 'information operations' using false accounts
Description: Facebook Inc acknowledged on Thursday that it has become a battleground for governments seeking to manipulate public opinion in other countries and outlined new measures it is taking to combat what it calls “information operations” that go well beyond the phenomenon known as fake news.

Headlines: Vietnam says Facebook commits to preventing offensive content
Description: Vietnam's government said Facebook has committed to work with it to prevent content that violates the country's laws from appearing on its platform.

Headlines: Thai baby's murder on Facebook: The missing hours before video was removed
Description: A relative of the Thai baby whose murder was shown on Facebook Live earlier this week said he was too distraught and intent on getting police to the crime scene to worry about getting the horrific videos taken down.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Thai baby's murder on Facebook: The missing hours before video was removed
Description:
A relative of the
Thai baby whose murder was shown on Facebook Live earlier this
week said he was too distraught and intent on getting police to
the crime scene to worry about getting the horrific videos taken
down.

Headlines: Thai baby's murder on Facebook puts online controls under scrutiny
Description:
A relative of the
Thai baby whose murder was shown on Facebook Live earlier this
week said he was too distraught and intent on getting police to
the crime scene to worry about getting the horrific videos taken
down.

Headlines: Wall St. eyes Apple and Facebook to fuel new leg of tech rally
Description: Apple  and Facebook  may expand their already outsized share of U.S. technology revenue when they report their earnings this week, as investors look for evidence to justify this year's U.S. stock market rally.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook shares dip from high as investors fret over costs, future profit
Description:
Facebook Inc reported surging
quarterly profit and revenue on Wednesday, helped by its
fast-growing mobile ad business, but its shares dipped from a
record high in after-hours trading as investors showed some
nervousness about future earnings.

Headlines: Facebook tries to fix violent video problem with 3,000 new workers
Description: Facebook Inc  will hire 3,000 more people over the next year to speed up the removal of videos showing murder, suicide and other violent acts, in its most dramatic move yet to combat  the biggest threat to its valuable public image.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook tries to fix violent video problem with 3,000 new workers
Description:
Facebook Inc will
hire 3,000 more people over the next year to speed up the
removal of videos showing murder, suicide and other violent
acts, in its most dramatic move yet to combat  the biggest
threat to its valuable public image.

Headlines: Facebook profit surges 76.6 pct as ad sales jump
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 76.6
percent surge in quarterly profit on Wednesday, fueled by robust
growth in its mobile ad business.

Headlines: Facebook to add 3,000 workers to monitor live video, other posts
Description:
Facebook Inc plans
to add 3,000 people over the next year to monitor reports of
inappropriate material on the social media network such as
videos of murders and suicides, Chief Executive Officer Mark
Zuckerberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook nears ad-only business model as game revenue falls
Description: Facebook Inc's growth into a digital advertising power is showing a flip side: The social network is more dependent than ever on the cyclical ad market, even as its rival Google finds new revenue streams in hardware and software.

Headlines: Families of San Bernardino shooting sue Facebook, Google, Twitter
Description: Family members of three victims of the December 2015 shooting rampage in San Bernardino, California, have sued Facebook, Google and Twitter, claiming that the companies permitted Islamic State to flourish on social media.

Headlines: Facebook shares dip from high as investors fret over costs, future profit
Description: Facebook Inc reported surging quarterly profit and revenue on Wednesday, helped by its fast-growing mobile ad business, but its shares dipped from a record high in after-hours trading as investors showed some nervousness about future earnings.

Headlines: Austrian court rules Facebook must delete 'hate postings'
Description: Facebook must remove postings deemed as hate speech, an Austrian court has ruled, in a legal victory for campaigners who want to force social media companies to combat online "trolling".

Headlines: Facebook warns of fake news danger ahead of British election
Description: Facebook has launched a British newspaper advertising campaign to warn users of the dangers of fake news, in the latest drive by the social media giant to tackle malicious information ahead of a national election.

Headlines: Snap's first earnings to shed light on battle with Facebook, Twitter
Description: Snap Inc  has many similarities with archrivals Facebook Inc  and Twitter Inc , but shareholders are eager to avoid one in particular when the social media company reports earnings on Wednesday for the first time since its initial public offering: a plunging stock price.

Headlines: Thailand gives Facebook until Tuesday to remove 'illegal' content
Description: Facebook Thailand could face legal action next week after Thai authorities warned Facebook Inc to take down content deemed threatening to national security or violating strict lese majeste laws, the telecoms regulator said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook adds Snapchat-like camera filters to Instagram
Description: Facebook Inc's  Instagram has souped up its camera with quirky face-tracking filters, adding another feature similar to one offered by social media rival Snap Inc's  Snapchat.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook fined 150,000 euros by French data watchdog
Description:
* Various European countries probing Facebook's practices
(Adds detail, background)

Headlines: Thailand has no immediate plan to suspend Facebook, regulator says
Description: Thailand has no immediate plan to block access to Facebook , the telecoms regulator said on Tuesday, as it expects the social media giant to comply with court orders for the removal of content deemed to threaten national security.

Headlines: Facebook faces EU fine over misleading WhatsApp data: source
Description: U.S. social network Facebook  is set to be penalized by EU antitrust regulators for allegedly providing misleading data related to its WhatsApp acquisition three years ago, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to show Major League Baseball games live on Fridays
Description: Facebook Inc has struck a deal with Major League Baseball to show 20 of the league's games live this season in an agreement that expands the social media network further into the world of live programming.

Headlines: Facebook wins dismissal of U.S. lawsuits linked to terrorism
Description: A federal judge on Thursday dismissed two lawsuits seeking to hold Facebook Inc  liable for supporting terrorist groups by letting them use its social media platform to further their goals, including violence against Jews.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to show Major League Baseball games live on Fridays
Description: Facebook Inc has struck a deal with Major League Baseball to show 20 of the league's games live this season in an agreement that expands the social media network further into the world of live programming.

Headlines: Facebook reaches deal to show 20 Major League Baseball games live
Description: Facebook Inc has struck a deal with Major League Baseball to show 20 of the league's games live this season in an agreement that expands the social media network further into the world of live programming.

Headlines: EU fines Facebook 110 million euros over WhatsApp deal
Description: European Union antitrust regulators fined Facebook 110 million euros ($122 million) on Thursday for giving misleading information during a vetting of its deal to acquire messaging service WhatsApp in 2014.

Headlines: Facebook leaked documents show types of content it allows: Guardian
Description: Leaked Facebook Inc  documents show how the social media company moderates issues such as hate speech, terrorism, pornography and self-harm on its platform, the Guardian reported, citing internal guidelines seen by the newspaper.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook signs BuzzFeed, Vox, others for original video shows - sources
Description: Facebook Inc  has signed deals with millennial-focused news and entertainment creators Vox Media, BuzzFeed, ATTN, Group Nine Media and others to make shows for its upcoming video service, which will feature long and short-form content with ad breaks, according to several sources familiar with the situation.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg urges Harvard grads to contemplate risk
Description: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg returned on Thursday to Harvard University, the school he dropped out of to start the pioneering social network, to urge its graduating class to help create a new social safety net to allow creative risk-taking.

Headlines: Parents have no right to dead child's Facebook account, German court says
Description: A German court rejected a mother's demand on Wednesday that Facebook grant her access to her deceased daughter's account.

Headlines: After London attack, Facebook says aims to be 'hostile environment' for terrorists
Description: Facebook said it wanted to make its social media platform a "hostile environment" for terrorists in a statement issued after attackers killed seven people in London and prompted Prime Minister Theresa May to demand action from internet firms.

Headlines: Facebook to add fundraising option to 'Safety Check'
Description: Facebook said on Wednesday it would soon allow its U.S. users to raise and donate money using its "Safety Check" feature, to make it easier for people affected by natural disasters and violent attacks to receive help.

Headlines: Pressured in Europe, Facebook details removal of terrorism content
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday offered additional insight on its efforts to remove terrorism content, a response to political pressure in Europe to militant groups using the social network for propaganda and recruiting.

Headlines: Facebook gets initial approval to set up local unit in Indonesia: source
Description: Facebook Inc has received an in-principle approval to set up a domestic unit in Indonesia, said a senior government source from the Southeast Asian nation, home to the social networking giant's fourth-largest user base.

Headlines: Facebook gets Indonesia nod for local unit, country's investment chief says
Description: Social networking giant Facebook Inc has received an in-principle approval to set up a domestic unit in Indonesia and the government is now processing the details, the country's investment chief said on Wednesday.

Headlines: CEO Zuckerberg tweaks Facebook mission to focus on groups
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg revised the world's largest online social network's mission statement on Thursday to emphasize support for hobby clubs, civil society organizations and other community groups.

Headlines: Canada's Supreme Court clears way for Facebook privacy lawsuit
Description: Canada's top court cleared the way on Friday for a lawsuit against Facebook Inc over privacy rights to be heard in the province of British Columbia instead of California where the social media site is based.

Headlines: Axel Springer hopeful Facebook will make news pay
Description: The chief executive of German publisher Axel Springer is confident that internet companies like Facebook, Snapchat and Google will help news providers make more money from their content.

Headlines: Facebook launches UK initiative to counter online extremist material
Description: Facebook Inc is launching a UK program to train and fund local organizations to combat extremist material online, as internet companies attempt to clamp down on hate speech and violent content on their services.

Headlines: Facebook in talks to produce original TV-quality shows: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc  is in talks with Hollywood studios about producing scripted, TV-quality shows, with an aim of launching original programing by late summer, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.

Headlines: Facebook hits 2 billion-user mark, doubling in size since 2012
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday that 2 billion people are regularly using its flagship service, marching past another milestone in its growth from a college curiosity in the United States to the world's largest social media network.

Headlines: Facebook says internet drone lands successfully on second test
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it had completed a second test of an unmanned aircraft designed to some day beam internet access to remote parts of the planet, and unlike in the first test, the drone did not crash.

Headlines: Facebook changes algorithm to curb 'tiny group' of spammers
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it was changing the computer algorithm behind its News Feed to limit the reach of people known to frequently blast out links to clickbait stories, sensationalist websites and misinformation.

Headlines: Facebook fights U.S. gag order that it says chills free speech
Description: Facebook Inc  is challenging a gag order from a U.S. court that is preventing the company from talking about three government search warrants that it said pose a threat to freedom of speech, according to court documents.

Headlines: Facebook beats privacy lawsuit in U.S. over user tracking
Description: A U.S. judge has dismissed nationwide litigation accusing Facebook Inc  of tracking users' internet activity even after they logged out of the social media website.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter, Snap to seek soccer World Cup clips from Fox: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc, Twitter Inc and Snap Inc are seeking online rights to video highlights from Twenty-first Century Fox Inc for next year's soccer World Cup, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook, Twitter, Snap to seek soccer World Cup clips from Fox - Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc, Twitter Inc and Snap Inc are seeking online rights to video highlights from Twenty-first Century Fox Inc for next year's soccer World Cup, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter, Snap to seek soccer World Cup clips from Fox - Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc, Twitter Inc and Snap Inc are seeking online rights to video highlights from Twenty-first Century Fox Inc for next year's soccer World Cup, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook to build housing in Silicon Valley for first time
Description: The shortage of housing in California's Silicon Valley has gotten so severe that Facebook Inc on Friday proposed taking homebuilding into its own hands for the first time with a plan to construct 1,500 units near its headquarters.

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus cuts price of virtual reality set, matching rival
Description: Oculus, the virtual reality company owned by Facebook Inc, is temporarily cutting the price of its hardware, as the industry tries to figure out why the technology for immersive games and stories has not taken off among consumers.

Headlines: Facebook in talks with publishers on supporting subscription models
Description: Facebook Inc  is in early talks with several news publishers about how its social media site can better support subscription business models, the company's head of news partnerships, Campbell Brown, said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headlines: Austrian activist, 25,000 supporters seek right to bring class-action suit against Facebook
Description: The Court of Justice of the European Union (ECJ) heard arguments on Wednesday over whether to allow a class action suit against Facebook, brought by Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems - and about 25,000 other users across the globe.

Headlines: Facebook to launch news subscription product - TheStreet
Description:
Facebook Inc plans to launch a
subscription-based news product, and will begin initial tests in
October, TheStreet reported on Tuesday, citing the social media
company's news partnerships head Campbell Brown at a conference.

Headlines: Options traders bullish on Facebook ahead of second-quarter results
Description: As Facebook Inc  geared up to report second-quarter results on Wednesday, traders in the options market are exhibiting a greater degree of bullishness in more than a year, options data showed.

Headlines: House panel wants Google, Facebook, AT&T CEOs to testify on internet rules
Description: The chairman of the U.S. House Energy and Commerce Committee on Tuesday asked chief executives from companies representing the two sides of the net neutrality debate, including Alphabet, Facebook, AT&T and Verizon, to testify at a Sept. 7 hearing.

Headlines: EU increases pressure on Facebook, Google and Twitter over user terms
Description: European Union authorities have increased pressure on Facebook, Twitter and Google to amend their user terms to bring them in line with EU law after proposals submitted by the tech giants were considered insufficient.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook CFO Wehner says News Feed 'biggest driver of growth'
Description:
Facebook Inc
reported quarterly results on Wednesday that surpassed analysts'
forecasts for revenue and earnings.

Headlines: Facebook profit surges 71 pct as mobile ad sales soar
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 71
percent jump in quarterly profit on Wednesday as the social
media giant's push into video ads helped drive growth in its
mobile ad business.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook funds Harvard effort to fight election hacking, propaganda
Description:
Facebook Inc will
provide initial funding of $500,000 for a nonprofit organization
that aims to help protect political parties, voting systems and
information providers from hackers and propaganda attacks, the
world's largest social network said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Russia used Facebook to try to spy on Macron campaign - sources
Description: Russian intelligence agents attempted to spy on President Emmanuel Macron's election campaign earlier this year by creating phony Facebook personas, according to a U.S. Congressman and two other people briefed on the effort.

Headlines: Facebook shares surge as results quash fears of slowing growth
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  touched a record high on Thursday on the back of overwhelmingly positive quarterly results, adding more than $27 billion to its market value.

Headlines: Facebook shares hit record high as mobile ad sales soar
Description: Facebook Inc's mobile advertising business grew by more than 50 percent in the second quarter, the company said in its earnings report on Wednesday, as the social network continued to establish itself as the venue of choice for an ever-growing array of online advertisers.

Headlines: Google, Facebook show power of ad duopoly as rivals stumble
Description: Quarterly results from Alphabet Inc  and Facebook Inc  provided fresh evidence this week that the digital advertising market is effectively a duopoly, a dynamic with deep implications for two of Silicon Valley's titans.

unintentional in advertiser’s campaigns

television market by expanding its video offerings with
programming ranging from professional women's basketball to a
safari show and a parenting program.

Headlines: Facebook OKs local firm's launch of Moments-like app in China: New York Times
Description: Facebook Inc, whose social media platform is blocked in China, authorized a local company to launch a photo-sharing application in the country in May, the New York Times reported, citing a person with knowledge of the company's plans.

moments app - NY Times, citing source

Headlines: Facebook expands Marketplace trading service across Europe
Description: Facebook is stepping up its modest moves into e-commerce by expanding its service for connecting local buyers and sellers into 17 new European markets, the U.S. company said on Monday.

Headlines: TD Ameritrade launches Facebook chatbot
Description: TD Ameritrade has launched a "chatbot", an automated program that can communicate with the brokerage's customers on Facebook Inc's messaging application, to give them information about markets and their accounts.

Headlines: Facebook picks veteran executive to lead hardware efforts: Business Insider
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday named one of its veteran executives Andrew Bosworth to lead all of its consumer hardware efforts, including its Building 8 division, the Business Insider reported.

* Facebook says if a page repeatedly shares stories marked
as false by third-party fact-checkers, they will no longer be
able to buy ads on Facebook

Headlines: Facebook unveils center to teach Brazilian coders, entrepreneurs
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday unveiled its first training center in Latin America for coders and entrepreneurs, encouraging technology careers for young Brazilians saddled with staggering unemployment after a deep economic crisis.

Headlines: Vietnam's Facebook dissidents test the limits of Communist state
Description: "This isn't like China," says Vietnamese activist 'Anh Chi' at a noisy bar off one of the narrow streets of Hanoi's Old Quarter. "They can't shut Facebook down here."

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's Watch goes up against YouTube for ad dollars
Description:
Facebook Inc launched its Watch
video service to U.S.  users on Thursday with plans to allow
people to submit shows, as the No. 1 social media network vies
with Alphabet Inc's YouTube for advertising revenue.

Headlines: Facebook takes the next step to monetize WhatsApp: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc is gearing up to make money from WhatsApp, the messaging service used by more than a billion people every day, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook says likely Russian-based operation funded U.S. ads with political message
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it had found that an operation likely based in Russia spent $100,000 on thousands of U.S. ads promoting divisive social and political messages in a two-year-period through May.

Headlines: Facebook gives election ad data to U.S. special counsel: source
Description: Facebook Inc has turned over information about U.S. election ads it believes were bought by Russians to Robert Mueller, the special counsel in charge of investigating alleged Russian interference in last year's election, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook digital ads figures differ from census data: analyst
Description: Figures Facebook Inc gives advertisers about its potential reach differ from U.S. census data, an investment analyst said on Tuesday, renewing questions about how tech companies verify the value of their digital marketing space.

Description:
Facebook Inc said

Headlines: German competition watchdog to announce Facebook findings by year-end
Description: The initial findings of Germany's investigation of U.S. social network company Facebook over possible market abuse will be announced by the end of the year, the country's cartel office said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook fined 1.2 million euros by Spanish data watchdog
Description: Facebook has been fined 1.2 million euros ($1.4 million) for allegedly collecting personal information from users in Spain that could then be used for advertising, the national data protection watchdog said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook says some Russian ads during U.S. election promoted live events
Description: Some of the ads bought by Russians on Facebook last year promoted events during the U.S. presidential campaign, Facebook Inc said on Tuesday, indicating that alleged meddling ahead of the 2016 election went beyond social media.

Headlines: Facebook pays millions for reality show on NFL's Marshawn Lynch
Description: Facebook Inc  is paying Time Warner Inc's  Bleacher Report millions of dollars for a reality show on NFL player Marshawn Lynch, the sports site told Reuters - a sign that the social media firm is willing to pay top dollar to lure viewers and ads to its Watch video service.

Headlines: REFILE-Facebook pays millions for reality show on NFL's Marshawn Lynch
Description: Facebook Inc is paying Time Warner Inc's Bleacher Report millions of dollars for a reality show on NFL player Marshawn Lynch, the sports site told Reuters - a sign that the social media firm is willing to pay top dollar to lure viewers and ads to its Watch video service.

Headlines: Facebook to clamp down on who can cash in on ads
Description: Facebook  has tightened its rules on who can make money from advertising on its network, responding to criticism that it is too simple for providers of fake news and sensational headlines to cash in.

Headlines: EU lost up to 5.4 billion euros in tax revenues from Google, Facebook: report
Description: European Union states could have lost 5.4 billion euros in tax revenues from Google and Facebook between 2013 and 2015, according to a report of the EU lawmaker responsible for a corporate tax reform that could raise online giants' tax bill.

* Facebook to add another 3,000 staff to spot hate speech

Description:
Facebook said
on Wednesday it would introduce tougher rules on who can make
money from advertising on its network, responding to criticism
that it makes it too easy for providers of fake news and
sensational headlines to cash in.

Headlines: Facebook-backed group to help fund 'Dreamer' application fees
Description: FWD.us, a pro-immigration group co-founded by Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg, is raising funds to help undocumented immigrants brought to the United States as children reapply for a program that shields them from deportation.

Headlines: U.S. election agency seeks comment after Facebook cites Russian ads
Description: The U.S. Federal Election Commission voted on Thursday to seek public comment on possible regulatory changes after Facebook Inc  said that Russians bought ads on the No. 1 social network during the U.S. presidential campaign.

Headlines: Facebook to launch election integrity effort in Canada
Description: Facebook Inc , under pressure over its role in possible Russian meddling in last year's U.S. presidential election, said it plans an election integrity initiative to protect Canada's next vote from cyber threats.

Headlines: Facebook hires AI expert, launches lab in Canada's Montreal
Description: Facebook Inc  has hired artificial intelligence academic Joelle Pineau to head its new research lab in Montreal, the Silicon Valley social media company said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook removes feature that let ads reach 'Jew haters'
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday it was temporarily disabling the ability of advertisers to target based on people's self-reported education and job information after a report that those features allowed targeting based on anti-Semitic topics.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook removes feature that let ads reach 'Jew haters'

Facebook Inc said
on Thursday it was temporarily disabling the ability of
advertisers to target based on people's self-reported education
and job information after a report that those features allowed
targeting based on anti-Semitic topics.

Headlines: Facebook to add more human review to ad system: COO Sandberg
Description: Facebook Inc  will add "more human review and oversight" to its ad-buying system, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Wednesday, responding to rising criticism that automated processes have allowed people to buy discriminatory ads.

Headlines: Facebook to add more human review to ad system -COO Sandberg
Description:
Facebook Inc will
add "more human review and oversight" to its ad-buying system,
Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Wednesday,
responding to rising criticism that automated processes have
allowed people to buy discriminatory ads.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook to overhaul political ads after threat of U.S. regulation
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Thursday launched an overhaul of how it handles paid political
advertisements, giving a concession to U.S. lawmakers who have
threatened to regulate the world's largest social network over
secretive ads that run during election campaigns.

Headlines: Zuckerberg nixes new Facebook share class after shareholder lawsuit
Description: Facebook Inc Chairman Mark Zuckerberg abandoned plans on Friday to create a new class of company stock with no voting power, which was meant to be a way for Zuckerberg to retain control over the company he founded while fulfilling a pledge to give away his wealth.

Headlines: Facebook to overhaul political ads after threat of U.S. regulation
Description: Facebook Inc  on Thursday launched an overhaul of how it handles paid political advertisements, giving a concession to U.S. lawmakers who have threatened to regulate the world's largest social network over secretive ads that run during election campaigns.

Headlines: Facebook lawyer says stock trial canceled, but no settlement
Description: Facebook Inc's trial over a shareholder lawsuit opposing the company's plans to issue class C stock has not be settled, according to a Friday letter from a Facebook attorney to the Delaware Court of Chancery.

Headlines: Trump dismisses Facebook ads controversy as part of 'Russia hoax'
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday questioned Facebook Inc's  decision to overhaul how it handles paid political advertisements amid investigations into alleged Russian interference in U.S. elections.

Headlines: Kremlin: Russia did not use Facebook adverts to sway U.S. election
Description: Russia did not place adverts on Facebook Inc to try to influence the 2016 U.S. Presidential election, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook, Google bound to change handling of politics ads - marketing executives
Description: Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google have little choice but to rein in internet political ads in the face of growing U.S. government pressure, a panel of advertising consultants and executives said on Monday.

Headlines: Myanmar army Facebook posts covering key period of offensive 'hidden'
Description: Facebook posts from Myanmar's army detailing the opening phase of its crackdown last month on Rohingya Muslim insurgents - an operation now being probed by the United Nations - are no longer visible on its official page, Reuters found.

Headlines: Russia tells Facebook to localize user data or be blocked
Description: Russia will block access to Facebook next year unless the social network complies with a law that requires websites which store the personal data of Russian citizens to do so on Russian servers, Russian news agencies reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg defends company after critical Trump tweet
Description: Facebook Inc's  CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday defended his company's role in U.S. elections and rejected assertions in a tweet from U.S. President Donald Trump that the social network was against him.

Headlines: Trump slams Facebook as lawmakers await ads amid Russia probe
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday criticized Facebook Inc  as "anti-Trump" and questioned its role during the 2016 presidential campaign, amid probes into alleged Russian interference in the election and possible collusion by Trump's associates.

Headlines: Facebook says deleted many fake accounts in German campaign
Description: Facebook said on Wednesday its efforts to fight fake news during Germany's national elections included taking down tens of thousands of fake profiles in the final month of the campaign.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers ask Facebook, Twitter for information on anti-fracking ads
Description: A U.S. House committee investigating whether Russia has tried to influence U.S. public opinion on fossil fuels asked Facebook , Twitter  and Alphabet  on Wednesday to turn over information about Russian entities that may have bought anti-fracking advertisements.

Headlines: Facebook, Google, Twitter asked to testify on Russian meddling
Description: Executives from Facebook, Alphabet Inc's Google and Twitter have been asked to testify to the U.S. Congress in coming weeks as lawmakers probe Russia's alleged interference in the 2016 U.S. election, committee sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook says 10 million U.S. users saw Russia-linked ads
Description: Some 10 million people in the United States saw politically divisive ads on Facebook that the company said were purchased in Russia in the months before and after last year's U.S. presidential election, Facebook said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook says about 10 million U.S. users viewed Russian-sponsored ads
Description: Facebook Inc said that about 10 million individuals in the United States had viewed Russian ads that it had shared with the U.S. Congress on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook says about 10 mln U.S. users viewed Russian-sponsored ads
Description:
Facebook Inc said that about 10
million individuals in the United States had viewed Russian ads
that it had shared with the U.S. Congress on Monday.

Headlines: Top House Intelligence Democrat intends to make sample of Russia-bought Facebook ads public
Description: The top Democrat on the House Intelligence Committee said on Monday he intended to make a "representative sampling" of Facebook Inc political ads believed to have been purchased by Russia available to the public later this month and that he hoped to make them all public eventually.

Headlines: Facebook pulls page, limits posting for exiled Chinese tycoon Guo
Description:
Facebook has taken down a
page affiliated with China's highest profile fugitive, exiled
billionaire Guo Wengui, and temporarily restricted his ability
to post on his profile, citing violations of its community
standards.

Headlines: Austria's Social Democrats urge Facebook to unmask people behind smear campaign
Description: Austrian Chancellor Christian Kern's Social Democrats asked Facebook to disclose the identities of those behind sites which they say are spreading libel in an attempt to clean up a smear campaign scandal ahead of an election on Oct. 15.

Headlines: Facebook brings British profits onshore after tax rule change
Description: Facebook  reported profits in Britain in 2016 of 58.4 million pounds ($77 million) after the introduction of anti-profit shifting measures but a modest rise in its tax bill shows the challenge Europe faces in working out how to tax technology giants.

Headlines: Russia Facebook ads targeted more than two states: Senate intelligence chair
Description: Republican Senator Richard Burr, the chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee, said on Wednesday that Facebook ads bought by Russia-linked entities targeted more than just Michigan and Wisconsin, the two states listed in media reports.

Headlines: Wisconsin, Michigan were key targets of Russia-linked ads on Facebook: CNN
Description: Russia-linked Facebook ads during last year's U.S. presidential election mainly focussed on the states of Michigan and Wisconsin, CNN reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Wisconsin, Michigan were key targets of Russia-linked ads on Facebook - CNN

Russia-linked Facebook ads during
last year's U.S. presidential election mainly focused on the
states of Michigan and Wisconsin, CNN reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook pushes ad overhaul before 2018 U.S. election - executive
Description:
Facebook Inc has
begun overhauling how it handles political ads on its platform
and may put some changes in place before U.S. elections next
year, Facebook's chief technology officer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to sell portable headset for virtual reality
Description: Facebook Inc  is launching a new virtual reality headset that does not require a separate computer to operate, allowing more mobile uses than the company's existing Oculus Rift product, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook to sell portable headset for virtual reality
Description:
Facebook Inc is
launching a new virtual reality headset that does not require a
separate computer to operate, allowing more mobile uses than the
company's existing Oculus Rift product, Chief Executive Mark
Zuckerberg said on Wednesday.

Description:
Facebook Inc chief
operating officer Sheryl Sandberg will meet with the U.S. House
of Representatives Intelligence Committee behind closed doors on
Thursday, according to three sources familiar with the
situation.

Description:
Facebook Inc
plans to release a new virtual reality headset that does not
require a separate computer to operate, unlike its Oculus Rift
product, which allows for mobile uses, Chief Executive Mark
Zuckerberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook and Instagram down for some users
Description: Facebook  and Instagram users in some parts of the United States, Europe and Canada were unable to access their accounts on Wednesday as the social networking website faced technical issues.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook will help investigators release Russia ads, Sandberg tells Axios
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief
Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Thursday the company
was committed to helping U.S. congressional investigators
publicly release Russia-backed political ads that ran during the
2016 U.S. election.

Description:
Facebook Inc Chief
Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Thursday that the
company was fully committed to helping U.S. congressional
investigators publicly release Russia-backed political ads that
ran during the 2016 U.S. election.

Description:
Facebook Inc Chief

company was fully committed to helping U.S. congressional
investigators publicly release Russia-backed political ads that
ran during the 2016 U.S. election.

Headlines: Facebook pushes ad overhaul before 2018 U.S. election: executive
Description: Facebook Inc has begun overhauling how it handles political ads on its platform and may put some changes in place before U.S. elections next year, Facebook's chief technology officer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. Congress tangles with Facebook, other social media firms over Russia probe
Description: Despite public promises of cooperation from Facebook and other social media companies, congressional investigators are battling over how much data the companies should hand over to them on Russian efforts to influence the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Facebook buys teen app tbh
Description: Facebook Inc  has acquired tbh, an app popular among teens, as the world's largest social network looks to attract more users.

Headlines: Head of Facebook's secretive hardware unit to step down
Description: Regina Dugan, the head of Facebook Inc's secretive hardware unit, will step down early next year, she said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook general counsel to testify before Congress Nov. 1
Description:
Facebook Inc's general
counsel will testify on Nov. 1 before a U.S. House of
Representatives panel investigating possible Russian meddling in
the 2016 U.S. election, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook dealt setback by EU court adviser in privacy dispute
Description: Facebook was dealt a setback on Tuesday when an adviser to the top European Union court said any data protection authority in the bloc had the power to take action against it for breaching privacy laws.

Headlines: Facebook, in reversal, to publish cache of political ads
Description: Facebook Inc  announced a plan to increase transparency about its role in political advertising on Friday, ahead of congressional hearings next week on social media companies and Russia's meddling in last year's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook, in reversal, to publish cache of political ads
Description:
Facebook Inc
announced a plan to increase transparency about its role in
political advertising on Friday, ahead of congressional hearings
next week on social media companies and Russia's meddling in
last year's U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter, Google executives to testify at U.S. Senate Russia hearing
Description: Executives from Facebook Inc , Twitter Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google will testify on Tuesday before a Senate Judiciary subcommittee hearing on allegations of Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says making advertising more transparent, not just for political ads‍​
Description:
* Facebook says going to make advertising more transparent,
and not just for political ads‍​

Headlines: Facebook says 126 million Americans may have seen Russia-linked political posts
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday that Russia-based operatives published about 80,000 posts on the social network over a two-year period in an effort to sway U.S. politics and that about 126 million Americans may have seen the posts during that time.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook says 126 mln Americans may have seen Russia-linked political posts
Description:
Facebook Inc said on
Monday that Russia-based operatives published about 80,000 posts
