seen the posts during that time.

Headlines: Apple's Cook, Facebook's Zuckerberg meet China's Xi in Beijing
Description: Apple Inc chief executive Tim Cook and Facebook Inc's Mark Zuckerberg met Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday at an annual gathering of advisers to Beijing's Tsinghua University business school.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook says expects FY 2018 total expenses to grow about 45 pct to 60 pct
Description:
* Facebook CEO says plans to double the number of people
working
on safety and security to 20,000 in the next year- conf call

Headlines: Facebook quarterly profit rises on mobile ad growth
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 79 percent
jump in profit on Wednesday as it pushed further into video
advertising in a quarter that was dominated by reports that
Russia allegedly used the social network to meddle in the 2016
U.S. elections.

Headlines: Facebook shares Russian reach on Instagram in day two of U.S. lawmaker grilling
Description:
Facebook Inc disclosed
on Wednesday that about 20 million Americans may have seen
Russian-backed content on Instagram as lawmakers questioned tech
companies for a second day about Russia's use of social media to
influence the 2016 U.S. election.

Headlines: Facebook pressured to notify people who saw Russian posts
Description: Facebook Inc  received several tongue-lashings during U.S. congressional hearings this week, but the world's largest social network also got an assignment: Figure out how to notify tens of millions of Americans who might have been fed Russian propaganda.

Headlines: Spending plans trigger Facebook stock retreat
Description: Facebook Inc  shares slid on Thursday, as investors shrugged off strong quarterly results and worried about the cost of the company's decision to spend more on preventing misuse of the world's biggest social media network.

Headlines: Facebook profit soars, with no sign of impact from Russia scandal
Description: Facebook Inc  faced harsh criticism in Washington on Wednesday over its failure to prevent Russian operatives from using its platform for election meddling, but the earnings report it issued hours later showed just how insulated its business remains from political risk.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers release sample of Russian-bought Facebook ads
Description: U.S. lawmakers released a batch of Russian-bought Facebook Inc ads on Wednesday that showcased politically charged content allegedly spread on social media by Moscow ahead of the 2016 U.S. election.

Headlines: WhatsApp messenger hit by temporary outage; Facebook investigating
Description: Facebook Inc's WhatsApp messenger suffered a temporary outage in India and many other countries, according to reports from multiple users on Facebook and Twitter on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-WhatsApp messenger hit by temporary outage; Facebook investigating
Description:
* WhatsApp users complain of outage in India, other
countries

Headlines: Russia to check if Facebook is complying with law: Ifax
Description: Russia's communications regulator Roskomnadzor said on Wednesday it planned to check whether Facebook was in compliance with Russian law.

Headlines: Austrian can't file Facebook class action suit: EU Court adviser
Description: An Austrian law student cannot bring a class action suit against Facebook's Irish unit over alleged privacy violations in an Austrian court, an EU court adviser said on Tuesday, but can sue the company in his home country on his own behalf.

Headlines: Israel prepares to send tax bills to Facebook, Google: report
Description: Israel is planning to send tax bills within a year to internet companies Google and Facebook, financial newspaper TheMarker reported on Wednesday, joining efforts by several countries, including the European Union, to get the internet giants to pay more tax.

Headlines: Honda to use Facebook to find owners with defective Takata airbags
Description: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Monday it will use Facebook Inc's custom audiences tool to find car owners with defective Takata airbags.

Headlines: Facebook to meet Russian regulators to discuss compliance: TASS
Description: Facebook  plan to meet Russian regulators in late December or early January to discuss compliance, TASS news agency cited the head of Russian communications watchdog Roskomnadzor as saying on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook to meet Russian regulators to discuss compliance -TASS
Description:
Facebook plan to meet
Russian regulators in late December or early January to discuss
compliance, TASS news agency cited the head of Russian
communications watchdog Roskomnadzor as saying on Tuesday.

Headlines: Tencent's stellar share rally sees it surpass Facebook in market value
Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd  has racked up some impressive gains this week - becoming the first Chinese firm to be worth more than $500 billion and surpassing Facebook  to be the world's fifth-most valuable company.

Headlines: Peter Thiel sells most of remaining Facebook stake
Description: Facebook Inc's first major investor Peter Thiel has sold three-quarters of his remaining stake in the social network as part of a previously established trading plan, a regulatory filing showed.

Headlines: Facebook to open Nigerian hub next year in African tech drive
Description: Facebook will open a "community hub space" in Nigeria next year to encourage software developers and technology entrepreneurs and become the latest technology giant to pursue a training program in fast-growing Africa.

Headlines: Slump in Facebook, Apple raises prospects of tech rally brake
Description: Shares of Facebook , Apple  and other technology heavyweights dropped on Wednesday, creating uncertainty over whether the top-performing sector's record-breaking rally this year is ending or merely taking a break.

Headlines: Facebook suspends ability to target ads by excluding racial groups
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Wednesday it was temporarily disabling the ability of advertisers on its social network to exclude racial groups from the intended audience of ads while it studies how the feature could be used to discriminate.

Headlines: Facebook to eliminate transaction fees on donations on its platform
Description: Facebook Inc has eliminated transaction fees on donations made to non-profit organizations on its platform, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday, a change that could help the world's largest social media network expand its presence in online fund raising.

Headlines: Facebook rolls out messenger app for kids under 13
Description: Facebook Inc  on Monday rolled out Messenger Kids, an app that lets the world's biggest social media company expand into a so-far untapped market of kids under 13 while also giving parents complete control over what their children see.

Headlines: Australia to probe Facebook, Google over media disruption
Description: Australia's competition regulator said on Monday it would investigate whether U.S. online giants Facebook  and Alphabet Inc's  Google have disrupted the news media market to the detriment of publishers and consumers.

Headlines: Facebook opens new London hub, to create 800 UK jobs
Description: Facebook opened its new London office on Monday with the promise of a further 800 jobs in the capital next year, underlining its commitment to Britain once it leaves the European Union.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook find something to praise China for amid internet clamp
Description: Top executives at Apple Inc  and Facebook Inc  managed to find something to praise Beijing for at an internet conference in China this week, even as its Communist Party rulers ban Western social media and stamp on online dissent.

Headlines: Wall Street rising: Facebook, Alphabet, Lululemon gain
Description: Wall Street rose on Thursday, buoyed by popular technology companies including Facebook and Alphabet, while shares of yoga pants seller Lululemon Athletica also worked up a sweat.

Headlines: Facebook to book advertising revenue locally amid political pressure
Description: Social media giant Facebook said on Tuesday it would start booking advertising revenue locally instead of re-routing it via its international headquarters in Dublin although the move is unlikely to result in it paying much more tax.

Headlines: France proposes age-of-consent rule for Facebook users
Description: All French children under the age of 16 will have to seek parental approval to open an account on Facebook or any other social network under draft legislation presented on Wednesday.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook And WWE Launch Live In-Ring Series On Facebook Watch
Description:
* FACEBOOK AND WWE® LAUNCH LIVE IN-RING SERIES ON FACEBOOK
WATCH

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook defends itself against critics of social media
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Friday struck back against scientific researchers and tech
industry insiders who have criticized the world's biggest social
media network and its competitors for transforming how people
behave and express emotion.

Headlines: Facebook to notify users when photos of them are uploaded
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it would begin using facial recognition technology to tell people on the social network when others upload photos of them, if they agree to let the company keep a facial template on file.

Headlines: U.S. says Facebook, Microsoft disabled North Korean cyber threats
Description: Facebook Inc and Microsoft Corp disabled a number of North Korean cyber threats last week, a White House official said on Tuesday, as the United States publicly blamed Pyongyang for a May cyber attack that crippled hospitals, banks and other companies.

Facebook Inc and Microsoft
Corp disabled a number of North Korean cyber threats last week,
a White House official said on Tuesday, as the United States
publicly blamed Pyongyang for a May cyber attack that crippled
hospitals, banks and other companies.

Headlines: Facebook abused dominant position, says German watchdog
Description: Germany's competition watchdog has found that Facebook  abused its dominant market position, challenging the U.S. social network's model of monetizing the personal data of its 2 billion users worldwide through targeted advertising.

Headlines: U.S. says Facebook, Microsoft disabled North Korean cyber actions
Description:
Facebook Inc and
Microsoft Corp acted last week to disable a number of
North Korean cyber actions, White House homeland security
adviser Tom Bossert said on Tuesday as the United States
publicly blamed Pyongyang for a May cyber attack that crippled
hospitals, banks and other companies.

Headlines: French privacy watchdog raps WhatsApp over Facebook data sharing
Description: France's data privacy watchdog may fine messaging app WhatsApp if it does not comply with an order to bring its sharing of user data with parent company Facebook into line with French privacy law.

Description: Facebook Inc and Universal Music Group on Thursday announced a global agreement that will enable users to upload videos featuring music from Universal's library across the social media network as well as Instagram and Oculus.

Facebook Inc and Universal Music
Group on Thursday announced a global agreement that will enable
users to upload videos featuring music from Universal's library
across the social media network as well as Instagram and Oculus.

Headlines: Facebook ads that let employers target younger workers focus of U.S. lawsuit

Headlines: Facebook's Oculus to partner with Xiaomi to build VR headsets
Description: Facebook Inc's Oculus said on Monday it is partnering with Chinese phone maker Xiaomi Technology Co to make its new standalone virtual reality headset and also revealed that it will launch a version of the product exclusively for the Chinese market.

Description: Sony/ATV said on Monday it signed a licensing agreement with Facebook Inc that will allow the social media platform's users to upload and share videos from the music publishing company's catalog on Facebook and Instagram.

Facebook Inc
on Thursday began to change the way it filters posts and videos
on its centerpiece News Feed, the start of what Chief Executive
Mark Zuckerberg said would be a series of changes in the design
of the world's largest social network.

Headlines: Facebook, Alphabet shifted in sector classification system
Description: S&P Dow Jones Indices and MSCI said on Thursday they would rename their Telecommunication Services Sector and add Comcast Corp, Netflix, Facebook and Alphabet to the newly broadened category.

Headlines: Zuckerberg changes Facebook's focus to be more 'meaningful'
Description:
Facebook Inc will
change the way it does business to emphasize "meaningful social
interactions" rather than the type of News Feed scrolling that
critics say is addictive, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said
on Thursday.

TO RANKING SO "PEOPLE HAVE MORE OPPORTUNITIES TO INTERACT WITH

Facebook Inc Chief
Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg and Twitter Inc Chief
Executive Jack Dorsey will not seek re-election to Walt Disney
Co's board because of growing conflicts of interest
between the media giant and the technology companies, Disney
said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook changes News Feed, investors click on 'sad'
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell more than 4 percent on Friday and were on track for their worst session in more than three months after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg announced changes that he said would hit user engagement in the near term.

Headlines: Facebook to emphasize friends, not news, in series of changes
Description: Facebook Inc  on Thursday began to change the way it filters posts and videos on its centerpiece News Feed, the start of what Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said would be a series of changes in the design of the world's largest social network.

Headlines: Facebook to prioritize 'trustworthy' news based on surveys
Description: Facebook Inc will prioritize "trustworthy" news in its feed of social media posts, using member surveys to identify high-quality outlets and fight sensationalism and misinformation, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday.

Description:
Facebook Inc will
prioritize "trustworthy" news in its feed of social media posts,
using member surveys to identify high-quality outlets and fight
sensationalism and misinformation, Chief Executive Mark
Zuckerberg said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook to prioritize 'trustworthy' news sources

SAN FRANCISCO, Jan 19
(Reuters) - Facebook Inc will change the ranking of its
News Feed to give priority to trustworthy news sources above
those that its users do not consider trustworthy, Chief
Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook should pay 'trusted' news publishers carriage fee: Murdoch
Description: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch on Monday called on Facebook to pay "trusted" news publishers a carriage fee, similar to the model used by cable companies, amid efforts by the social media company to fight misinformation on its platform.

Headlines: Facebook buys Boston software company that authenticates IDs
Description: Facebook Inc  is buying a software firm that specializes in authenticating government-issued identification cards, the two companies said on Tuesday, a step that may help the social media company learn more about the people who buy ads on its network.

Facebook Inc

authenticating government-issued identification cards, the two
companies said on Tuesday, a step that may help the social media
company learn more about the people who buy ads on its network.

Headlines: Facebook to hand privacy controls to users ahead of EU law
Description: Facebook will make it easier for its more than 2 billion users to manage their own data in response to a tough new European Union law that comes into force in May, the social network's Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said.

Headlines: Facebook: Russian agents created 129 U.S. election events
Description: Facebook Inc said Russian agents created 129 events on the social media network during the 2016 U.S. election campaign, according to testimony to Congress, shedding more light on Russia's purported disinformation drive aimed at voters.

to testimony to Congress, shedding more light on Russia's
purported disinformation drive aimed at voters.

Headlines: Facebook tells Congress: Kaspersky cut from anti-virus choices for users
Description:
Facebook last year
removed Moscow-based Kaspersky Lab from its list of anti-virus
offerings to users who go to the social media site from a
computer that may be infected with malicious code, the company
told Congress on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook says removed Kaspersky Lab from list of anti-virus choices last year
