Facebook last year
removed Moscow-based Kaspersky Lab from its list of anti-virus
offerings made to users who access the social media site from a
computer that may be infected with malicious code, the company
told Congress in responses to questions from lawmakers made
public on Thursday.

Headlines: EU court rejects Facebook class action suit by privacy activist
Description: An Austrian privacy activist cannot bring a class action lawsuit against Facebook for alleged privacy violations but can sue the company himself in his home country, the European Union's highest court ruled on Thursday.

Headlines: Austrian privacy activist says will sue Facebook in Vienna after EU ruling
Description: Max Schrems, an Austrian privacy activist, said his individual case against Facebook would go ahead in a court in Vienna after the EU top court blocked his attempt to bring a class action suit against the company on Thursday.

Headlines: Mueller team interviewed Facebook staff in Russia probe: Wired
Description: Special Counsel Robert Mueller and his office have interviewed at least one member of a Facebook team that was associated with Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign, Wired magazine reported on its website on Friday.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook CEO Zuckerberg Says Facebook's next update is to promote news from local sources
Description:
* FACEBOOK CEO MARK ZUCKERBERG SAYS MAKING A SERIES OF
UPDATES TO
SHOW MORE HIGH QUALITY, TRUSTED NEWS

Headlines: Facebook makes privacy push ahead of strict EU law
Description: Facebook said on Monday it was publishing its privacy principles for the first time and rolling out educational videos to help users control who has access to their information, as it prepares for the start of a tough new EU data protection law.

Headlines: Facebook to ban cryptocurrency-related ads
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it will ban ads promoting financial products and services tied to cryptocurrencies and initial coin offerings.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook Says To Prohibit Ads Promoting Cryptocurrency, ICOs
Description:
* FACEBOOK ANNOUNCES NEW ADS POLICY TO IMPROVE "INTEGRITY
AND
SECURITY" OF FINANCIAL PRODUCT AND SERVICES ADS

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook forecasts rising ad sales despite dip in usage
Description:
Facebook Inc offered reassurances
to investors on Wednesday that its digital ad business would
remain highly profitable, despite a dip in usage on the social
media network and an overhaul of its flagship News Feed.

Headlines: Facebook revenue jumps 47 pct on soaring mobile ad sales
Description:
Facebook Inc reported a 47 percent
jump in quarterly revenue on Wednesday, as the social media
company's mobile ad business got a boost from its focus on
videos and improved targeting.

Headlines: Democrats press Facebook, Twitter again to probe Russia links to Republican memo
Description: Two senior U.S. Democratic lawmakers on Wednesday asked Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc to answer questions about  potential Russian involvement in social media campaigns that urged release of a Republican memorandum alleging surveillance abuses at the FBI, saying the companies had provided insufficient responses so far.

Headlines: Bitcoin slides as Facebook ad ban, India clampdown unnerve investors
Description: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, skidded 11 percent on Thursday to its lowest since November, as a Facebook ban on cryptocurrency adverts and a growing regulatory backlash against the nascent market frightened investors.

Headlines: Facebook soothes market nerves with user experience promise
Description: Shares in Facebook Inc  jumped 3 percent to a record high in early trading on Thursday, after reporting an almost 50 percent jump in quarterly revenue and promises to focus on users' experience on the social network easing concerns over falling usage.

Headlines: Facebook forecasts rising ad sales despite dip in usage
Description: Facebook Inc offered reassurances to investors on Wednesday that its digital ad business would remain highly profitable, despite a dip in usage on the social media network and an overhaul of its flagship News Feed.

Headlines: Seattle says Facebook is violating city campaign finance law
Description: Seattle's election authority said on Monday that Facebook Inc is in violation of a city law that requires disclosure of who buys election ads, the first attempt of its kind to regulate U.S. political ads on the internet.

Headlines: Facebook runs into lawsuit over Cambodian politics
Description: Former Cambodian opposition leader Sam Rainsy has filed a legal case in the United States to get Facebook to release information on Prime Minister Hun Sen's use of the social media platform, his legal team said.

Headlines: Facebook launches $10 million community leader awards
Description: Facebook  launched a community leadership program on Friday that will award $10 million in total to more than 100 people who have successfully built groups on the social network as part of its push to create "meaningful" interactions.

Headlines: Facebook co-founder Saverin's VC firm raises $360 million fund
Description: Facebook Inc co-founder Eduardo Saverin's venture capital firm, B Capital Group, said it has raised $360 million for its fund as it seeks to invest in technology start-ups.

Headlines: German court rules Facebook use of personal data illegal
Description: A German consumer rights group said on Monday that a court had found Facebook's use of personal data to be illegal because the U.S. social media platform did not adequately secure the informed consent of its users.

Headlines: NY top court says 'private' Facebook photos can be disclosed
Description: New York state's highest court ruled on Tuesday that Facebook users may be required to turn over photos and other information that are relevant to litigation, even if they are shielded by "privacy" settings.

Headlines: What inflation? Apple and Facebook drive Wall Street rally
Description: Wall Street surged on Wednesday as investors shrugged off  stronger-than-expected inflation data and snapped up shares of Facebook, Amazon.com and Apple.

Headlines: EU tells Facebook, Google and Twitter to do more for users
Description: Europe's justice commissioner told Facebook , Twitter  and Google  on Thursday to do more to bring their user terms in line with EU law, ramping up pressure on the tech giants after their efforts were deemed too little.

Headlines: Facebook loses Belgian privacy case, faces fine of up to $125 million
Description: A Belgian court threatened Facebook  on Friday with a fine of up to 100 million euros ($125 million) if it continued to break privacy laws by tracking people on third-party websites.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook Says Will Remove About 20 Ad Metrics In July
Description:
* FACEBOOK SAYS INTRODUCING NEW LABELS ON SOME METRICS TO
CLEARLY
SHOW HOW THEY ARE CALCULATED‍​

Headlines: Facebook settles lawsuit over 2012 IPO for $35 million
Description: Facebook Inc and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg have reached a $35 million settlement of class-action litigation accusing them of hiding worries about the social media company's growth prior to its May 2012 initial public offering.

Headlines: German prosecutors say won't investigate Facebook over hate postings
Description: German prosecutors said on Monday they would not open a formal investigation of Mark Zuckerberg and other Facebook managers in connection with a complaint alleging the company broke national laws against hate speech and sedition.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg uses investor meeting to urge gender equality
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg brought her message about workplace gender equality to a typically male domain on Wednesday, urging attendees at an investor conference to improve mentoring of junior female colleagues.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's Sandberg uses investor meeting to urge gender equality
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief
Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg brought her message about
workplace gender equality to a typically male domain on
Wednesday, urging attendees at an investor conference to improve
mentoring of junior female colleagues.

Headlines: Facebook CFO says news feed changes will not have profound impact on ads
Description:
The changes that Facebook
Inc is making to its centerpiece News Feed to emphasize
friends and family will not have a large impact on the social
network's ad business, Chief Financial Officer David Wehner said
on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook says finds no new evidence Russia interfered in Brexit referendum
Description: Facebook Inc has told a British parliamentary committee that further investigations have found no new evidence that Russia used social media to interfere in the June 2016 referendum in which Britain voted to leave the European Union.

Headlines: Facebook's EU regulator says WhatsApp yet to resolve data sharing issue
Description: WhatsApp has still not brought forward proposals to address EU regulators' concerns over the messaging service's sharing of user data with parent company Facebook, Facebook's European regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook expands presence in jobs market
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it was expanding the jobs section on its social network, as it looks to compete in a market dominated by Microsoft Corp's LinkedIn.

Headlines: Facebook ends six-country test that split News Feed in two
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday put an end to a test of splitting its signature News Feed into two, an idea that roiled how people consumed news in the six countries where it occurred and added to concern about Facebook's power.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook ends six-country test that split News Feed in two
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Thursday put an end to a test of splitting its signature News
Feed into two, an idea that roiled how people consumed news in
the six countries where it occurred and added to concern about
Facebook's power.

Headlines: Zuckerberg sold nearly $500 million Facebook stock in February
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg sold  nearly $500 million in the company's shares in February to fund his philanthropic investment vehicle, the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (CZI), regulatory filings showed.

Headlines: Facebook hires former BuzzFeed, Pinterest executives for video content
Description: Facebook Inc hired the former head of BuzzFeed Studios to lead its global video content and a former Pinterest executive as in charge of its video content platform Facebook Watch, they said in separate social media posts on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook hires former BuzzFeed, Pinterest execs for video content
Description:
Facebook Inc hired the former
head of BuzzFeed Studios to lead its global video content and a
former Pinterest executive as in charge of its video content
platform Facebook Watch, they said in separate social media
posts on Monday.

Headlines: BlackBerry sues Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram over patent infringement
Description: BlackBerry Ltd  on Tuesday filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Facebook Inc  and its WhatsApp and Instagram apps, arguing that they copied technology and features from BlackBerry Messenger.

Headlines: France may probe Google and Facebook over online ad dominance
Description: France's competition authority may open investigations into Facebook and Google "in the next few months" after an in-depth examination concluded the pair dominate the French online advertising market.

Headlines: Facebook removes anti-immigrant post by aide to Hungary's PM
Description: Facebook has removed a video posted by the Hungarian prime minister's chief of staff in which he said immigrants were responsible for increased crime in the capital of neighboring Austria and were pushing "white Christians" out.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to show 25 Major League Baseball games this season
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Friday it
signed a deal with Major League Baseball (MLB) to stream 25
games this season on the social network.

Headlines: U.N. investigators cite Facebook role in Myanmar crisis
Description: U.N. human rights experts investigating a possible genocide in Myanmar said on Monday that Facebook had played a role in spreading hate speech there.

Headlines: Facebook bans far-right group Britain First for inciting hatred
Description: Facebook  said on Wednesday it banned Britain First from its platform for breaking rules against inciting hatred, blacklisting a far-right group brought to global attention when U.S. President Donald Trump retweeted its anti-Islamic posts.

Headlines: Facebook Lite to launch in developed countries, including U.S
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday said it will roll out the stripped down version of its social media platform, Facebook Lite, to more countries including developed ones, to attract users struggling with slower mobile data connections.

Headlines: Facebook's security chief to depart, source says
Description: Facebook chief information security officer Alex Stamos is leaving the company in August, a source said on Monday, and a report cited internal disagreements over how the social network should deal with its role in spreading disinformation.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's security chief to depart, source says
Description:
Facebook chief information security
officer Alex Stamos is leaving the company in August, a source
said on Monday, and a report cited internal disagreements over
how the social network should deal with its role in spreading
disinformation.

Headlines: Facebook's security chief to leave company -NYT
Description:
Facebook's chief information security
officer Alex Stamos is leaving the company, New York Times
reported on Monday, citing current and former employees briefed
on the matter.

Headlines: Democratic senator asks Zuckerberg about Facebook data
Description: Democratic Senator Ron Wyden on Monday sent a letter to Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg asking for answers to questions regarding the social media company's policies for sharing user data with third parties.

Headlines: Republican senator joins call for Facebook CEO to testify about data use
Description: Republican Senator John Kennedy has joined his Democratic colleague Amy Klobuchar in calling on Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to testify before Congress following reports that a political consultancy gained inappropriate access to data on millions of Facebook users.

Headlines: Facebook critics want regulation, investigation after data misuse
Description: Facebook Inc faced new calls for regulation from within U.S. Congress and was hit with questions about personal data safeguards on Saturday after reports a political consultant gained inappropriate access to 50 million users' data starting in 2014.

Headlines: Facebook shares slide after reports of data misuse
Description: Facebook Inc's shares fell more than 4 percent in premarket trading after media reports that a political consultancy that worked on President Donald Trump's campaign gained inappropriate access to data on 50 million Facebook users.

Headlines: EU lawmakers to investigate alleged misuse of Facebook users' data
Description: EU lawmakers will investigate whether the data of more than 50 million Facebook users has been misused, the head of European Parliament said on Monday.

Headlines: EU justice chief to discuss data leak with Facebook, U.S. government
Description: EU Justice Commissioner Vera Jourova plans to discuss the alleged misuse of more than 50 million Facebook users' data with the U.S. social network and with the U.S. government on her visit to the United States this week.

Headlines: Senate Democrat wants Facebook CEO Zuckerberg to testify
Description: U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein, the top Democrat on the Judiciary Committee, said on Tuesday that Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg should testify in Congress about his company's treatment of users' data.

Headlines: Germany alarmed by Facebook data abuse reports, lawmakers demand answers
Description: Germany on Tuesday voiced alarm at reports that a political consultancy hired by Donald Trump improperly accessed information on 50 million Facebook users, and lawmakers demanded answers from the company and the government.

Headlines: Facebook to brief U.S. lawmakers' aides on Wednesday: congressional staff
Description: Facebook Inc will brief U.S. Senate and House aides on Wednesday, congressional staff said on Tuesday amid growing pressure on the social media company to answer questions over the use of its users' data.

Headlines: Massachusetts, New York send letter to Facebook demanding documents
Description: State attorneys general for Massachusetts and New York sent a letter to Facebook Inc on Tuesday demanding information about personal data that ended up in the hands of analytics firm Cambridge Analytica, a person familiar with the matter said.

Headlines: UK's Cambridge University questions Facebook about academic's role in data breach
Description: Cambridge University said it wanted Facebook to confirm its academic Alex Kogan used no university data, resources or facilities at a time when the social network says he violated its rules by passing user information on to Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Index provider MSCI says it is reviewing Facebook data privacy issue
Description: MSCI Inc on Tuesday said it is looking into the possibility that Facebook Inc user data was accessed by the consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Privacy issues emerge as major business risk for Facebook
Description: Facebook faces substantial business risks from new European Union privacy rules set to take effect in May, a looming reality that came into stark relief over the weekend with revelations that a controversial political consulting firm had improperly obtained personal data on 50 million Facebook users.

Headlines: UK investigates Facebook over data breach, to raid Cambridge Analytica
Description: Britain is investigating whether Facebook did enough to protect data after a whistleblower said a London-based political consultancy hired by Donald Trump improperly accessed information on 50 million Facebook users to sway public opinion.

Headlines: Facebook's lead EU regulator 'following up' on third party data use
Description: Facebook's lead regulator in the European Union, the Irish Data Protection Commissioner, is "following up" with the U.S. internet giant to ensure its oversight of app developers' use of its data is effective, her office said on Tuesday.

Headlines: 'Socially responsible' investors reassess Facebook ownership
Description: With European and U.S. lawmakers calling for investigations into reports that Facebook user data was accessed by UK based consultancy Cambridge Analytica to help President Donald Trump win the 2016 election, investors are asking even more questions about the social media company's operations.

Headlines: BRIEF-Zuckerberg says Facebook deletions not a 'meaningful number'
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief Executive
Mark Zuckerberg spoke on Wednesday to the New York Times and to
Wired Magazine.

Headlines: Germany summons Facebook over user data safety concerns: report
Description: Germany's justice minister Katarina Barley has asked Facebook to clarify whether the personal data of the social media site's 30 million users in the country were protected from unlawful use by third parties, according to a report in the Funke group of German regional newspapers.

Headlines: Zuckerberg says Facebook 'made mistakes' on Cambridge Analytica
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday that the social media company made mistakes that allowed data about users to end up with the analytics firm Cambridge Analytica and said the company would make changes.

Headlines: BRIEF-Facebook's Sandberg says 'we didn't do enough'
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief Operating
Officer Sheryl Sandberg spoke for the first time about personal
data that ended up in the hands of analytics firm Cambridge
Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook took years to clamp down on developers' data harvesting: ex-operations manager
Description: A former Facebook operations manager told a British parliamentary committee on Wednesday that data harvesting of member profiles by outside software developers was once routine and that the company took years to clamp down on the practice.

Headlines: Academic in Facebook storm worked on Russian 'dark' personality project
Description: The psychologist at the center of a scandal over the misuse of millions of Facebook users' personal data worked with Russian researchers on a study of toxic personality traits.

Headlines: Facebook, Cambridge Analytica sued in U.S. by users over data harvesting
Description: Facebook Inc  and the political consulting firm Cambridge Analytica have been sued in the United States for obtaining information belonging to 50 million of the social media company's users without permission.

Headlines: Wall Street starts to trim Facebook targets as shares fall
Description: DZ Bank was the third Wall Street brokerage this week to make a rare cut in price targets for Facebook Inc  on Wednesday as the social network's shares slid for a third day in response to a row over data use by Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Germany wants clarity from Facebook after reports of data abuse
Description: Germany said on Wednesday it wanted Facebook  to clarify the use of its data after reports that a UK-based political consultancy improperly accessed information on millions of Facebook users to build detailed profiles on American voters.

Headlines: Nordea says its sustainable funds won't buy more Facebook stock
Description: Nordea, the Nordic region's biggest bank, will not let its sustainable funds buy more Facebook shares for the time being, its head of sustainable finance said.

Headlines: Academic at center of Facebook row says the data is greatly exaggerated: BBC
Description: The Cambridge University academic at the center of a row over the use of Facebook data said the accuracy of the information he produced had been greatly exaggerated and would not be able to sway an election.

Headlines: Academic behind Facebook breach says he is a 'scapegoat': BBC
Description: A Cambridge University academic who harvested data on millions of Facebook users said he had been made a scapegoat by the social network and a UK-based political consultancy, and that the accuracy of the dataset had been exaggerated.

Headlines: Facebook apology does little to satisfy lawmakers, Wall Street
Description: Facebook Inc came under further pressure from lawmakers, investors, advertisers and users on Thursday, the day after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg admitted the social media network made mistakes in letting 50 million users' data get into the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Senate subcommittee seeks information on Facebook data
Description: A U.S. Senate subcommittee on Thursday sought information from a Cambridge University researcher about how the personal data of 50 million Facebook users landed in the hands of a political consulting firm that worked for U.S. President Donald Trump's campaign.

Headlines: Israel investigating Facebook over privacy concerns
Description: Israel is investigating Facebook Inc. over possible infringement of its citizens' privacy following reports that British consultancy Cambridge Analytica improperly accessed users' information, the Justice Ministry said on Thursday.

Headlines: Commerzbank suspends ads on Facebook after data leak
Description: Germany's second-largest bank, Commerzbank, has suspended advertising on Facebook until further notice, after a massive leak of user data, its head of brand strategy told the Handelsblatt business daily.

Headlines: House committee to invite Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify
Description: The Republican chairman and top Democrat of the U.S. House Energy and Commerce Committee said on Thursday they will in the coming days formally ask Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to testify, saying the company has left many questions unanswered about its data privacy practices.

Headlines: Zuckerberg apologizes for Facebook mistakes with user data, vows curbs
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg apologized on Wednesday for mistakes his company made in how it handled data belonging to 50 million of its users, and promised tougher steps to restrict developers' access to such information.

Headlines: German justice minister calls in Facebook over data scandal
Description: Germany's justice minister said on Thursday she had asked to speak to Facebook  executives to find out whether the social media site's 30 million users in the country were affected by a scandal involving the handling of personal data.

Headlines: Mozilla suspends ads on Facebook on data privacy concerns
Description: Internet company Mozilla Corp said on Wednesday it was suspending advertising on Facebook Inc's  social media platform on concerns of data privacy.

Headlines: Facebook scandal could push other tech companies to tighten data sharing
Description: Big internet companies and small software developers alike are likely to face scrutiny over how they share customer information in the wake of the scandal involving Facebook Inc  and the British election consulting firm Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Musk deletes Facebook pages of Tesla, SpaceX after challenged on Twitter
Description: Verified Facebook pages of Elon Musk's rocket company SpaceX and electric carmaker Tesla Inc  disappeared on Friday, minutes after the Silicon Valley billionaire promised on Twitter to take down the pages when challenged by users.

Headlines: EU plans tougher consumer laws for Facebook, Gmail
Description: (This March 22 story corrects to show the EU deems Google's user terms changes as sufficient, not insufficient, in paragraph 9)

Headlines: Facebook dropped from Australian Ethical ETF after data breach
Description: Facebook Inc will be removed from the Australia-based BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders Exchange Traded Fund (ETHI) due to recent "controversies", its Responsible Investment Committee (RIC) said on Friday.

Headlines: EU presses Facebook on sharing of user data
Description: The European Commission pressed Facebook  on Monday over whether EU citizens' data were among those improperly harvested by a British political consultancy, after the U.S. regulator said it was investigating the firm's privacy practices.

Headlines: Facebook CEO among those invited to testify at U.S. Senate hearing
Description: The U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee said on Monday it had invited the chief executive officers of Facebook Inc , Alphabet Inc  and Twitter Inc  to testify at an April 10 hearing on data privacy.

Headlines: Facebook must face tighter rules, tougher penalties: German minister
Description: Misuse of data by Facebook means it will in future be bound by stricter regulations and the threat of tougher penalties for further privacy violations, Germany's justice minister said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook must face stricter regulation: German minister
Description: Companies like Facebook must face stricter regulation and tougher penalties meted out by better equipped data-protection authorities, Germany's justice minister said on Monday after a meeting with senior executives from the company.

Headlines: Pep Boys suspends Facebook ads after data security breach
Description: U.S. auto parts retailer Pep Boys said on Monday it is suspending all advertising on Facebook Inc following concerns of data privacy, joining internet company Mozilla Corp in pulling ads from the social networking site.

Headlines: Americans less likely to trust Facebook than rivals on personal data
Description: (This March 25 story has been corrected to remove reference to level of trust being lost over time)

Headlines: Facebook to expand its local news feature beyond U.S.
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it would expand its local news push beyond the United States to provide users with more stories from local sources covering their current cities and other cities of interest.

Headlines: Apple, IBM chiefs call for more data oversight after Facebook breach
Description: Executives from Apple Inc and IBM Corp have called for more oversight on how personal data is used following the Facebook Inc breach that saw roughly 50 million users' data misused by consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify before Congress: source
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg plans to testify before U.S. Congress, a source briefed on the matter said on Tuesday, as he bows to pressure from lawmakers insisting he explain how 50 million users' data ended up in the hands of a political consultancy.

Headlines: Three Facebook users sue over collection of call, text history
Description: Three users of the Facebook Messenger app sued Facebook  on Tuesday, saying the social network violated their privacy by collecting logs of their phone calls and text messages, in the latest legal challenge facing the company.

Headlines: Facebook CEO plans to testify before U.S. Congress: source
Description: Facebook Inc chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will appear before the U.S. Congress to answer questions on data privacy and other issues, but it is not clear to which committee or committees he will testify, a source briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UK's May says she hopes Facebook boss understands data leak concerns
Description: British Prime Minister Theresa May said she hoped Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg understood why people were concerned about alleged leaks of personal data, but it was up to him to decide whether to face a committee in Britain's parliament.

Headlines: U.S. regulator, state attorneys look for answers from Facebook
Description: (This version of the March 26 story corrects paragraph 24 to remove reference to ISBA suspending adverts)

Headlines: UK lawmakers still want to question Facebook's Zuckerberg over data scandal
Description: British lawmakers still want to question Facebook boss Mark Zuckerberg over how millions of users' details got into the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica after the company said it would send another executive to appear before them.

Headlines: Facebook must give judge documents for U.S. tax probe of Irish unit
Description: A U.S. judge has ordered Facebook Inc to let her review documents it has refused to give the Internal Revenue Service as that agency probes whether the social media company used an Irish unit to slash billions of dollars from its tax bill.

Headlines: Facebook privacy debate is tip of the e-commerce iceberg, U.N. says
Description: The scandal over data privacy that is causing a headache for Facebook Inc shows just one aspect of the huge task of preparing the world for e-commerce, the United Nations trade and development agency UNCTAD said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to give users more control over personal information
Description: Facebook Inc  is giving users more control over their privacy by making data management easier and redesigning the settings menu, the company said on Wednesday, in the wake of a scandal over a breach that exposed the personal information of millions and was allegedly used by a political consultancy.

Headlines: New Zealand privacy commissioner joins criticism of Facebook data handling
Description: New Zealand's privacy commissioner joined international criticism against Facebook Inc, saying on Wednesday it has broken the law by declining a citizen access to personal information held on the accounts of other users.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg disavows memo saying all user growth is good
Description:
A Facebook Inc
executive said in an internal memo in 2016 that the social media
company needed to pursue adding users above all else, BuzzFeed
News reported on Thursday, prompting  disavowals from the
executive and Facebook Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.

Headlines: UK information commissioner welcomes Facebook move to cut ties to data brokers
Description: Britain's Information Commissioner welcomed Facebook's decision to end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network.

Headlines: Acxiom shares tank after Facebook cuts ties with data brokers
Description: Shares of Acxiom Corp plunged as much as 34 percent on Thursday, after Facebook Inc said it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook begins 'fact-checking' photos and videos
Description:
Facebook Inc said
on Thursday it had begun "fact-checking" photos and videos to
reduce the hoaxes and false news stories that have plagued the
world's largest social media network.

Headlines: Poll: Are Americans taking steps to protect their data after Facebook scandal?
Description: In the wake of the scandal sparked by Facebook's handling of 50 million users' data, Reuters polled Americans about how they are protecting their privacy online.

Headlines: Facebook cuts ties to data brokers in blow to targeted ads
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network, a step that follows a scandal over how Facebook handles personal information.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook CEO stops short of extending European privacy globally
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday that he agreed "in spirit" with a strict new European Union law on data privacy but stopped short of committing to it as the standard for the social network across the world.

Headlines: Facebook deletes posts linked to Russian 'troll factory': CEO Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook is expanding its response to people using the platform improperly and on Tuesday said it had deleted hundreds of Russian accounts and pages associated with a "troll factory" indicted by U.S. prosecutors for fake activist and political posts in the 2016 U.S. election campaign.

Headlines: Facebook to revise terms of service to include more privacy language
Description:
Facebook Inc said
on Wednesday it planned to revise the written policies that
people agree to when they use the social network, adding
language about the protection of personal data as it prepares to
comply with a strict new European law.

Headlines: Facebook fined $33 million for failing to aid Brazil graft probe
Description: A Brazilian judge has ordered that Facebook Inc  pay 111.7 million reais ($33.4 million) for failing to cooperate with a corruption investigation, federal prosecutors said on Thursday, prompting Facebook to say it was exploring "all legal options."

Headlines: Canada, B.C. in joint investigations of Facebook, AggregateIQ
Description: The Canadian federal agency charged with protecting privacy rights of individuals said on Thursday that it, along with its counterpart in British Columbia, will jointly investigate Facebook Inc  and Canadian data firm AggregateIQ, over an ongoing data sharing scandal.

Headlines: California pension system presses Facebook on data protection
Description: The California State Teachers' Retirement System will ask Facebook Inc about the controls the social media company has in place to protect user data, the system said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook says data leak hits 87 million users, widening privacy scandal
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday the personal information of up to 87 million users, mostly in the United States, may have been improperly shared with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica, up from a previous news media estimate of more than 50 million.

Headlines: German justice minister to press Facebook on its algorithms
Description: German Justice Minister Katarina Barley said she planned a further meeting with Facebook to discuss the impact of its algorithms on the social network's users, adding that recent disclosures of privacy violations were probably not isolated.

Headlines: U.S. congressional panels probe whether Russia got Facebook data: sources
Description: Investigators on two congressional panels are looking into whether Russia acquired the data of millions of Facebook users and if companies with ties to then-2016 Republican election candidate Donald Trump's campaign played any role in providing it, three sources familiar with the inquiries said.

Headlines: Too early to say whether Facebook has done enough on data: UK watchdog
Description: Facebook is co-operating with Britain's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) as it examines how 30 organizations have used personal data, but the ICO said on Thursday it was too early to say whether the social media giant had done enough.

Headlines: Australia begins privacy investigation into Facebook
Description: Australia on Thursday said it had begun an investigation to decide whether social media giant Facebook Inc  breached its privacy laws, after the company confirmed data from 300,000 Australian users may have been used without authorization.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Facebook, Amazon buoy Wall St as trade concerns cool
Description:
* Zuckerberg says no "meaningful impact" on Facebook ad
sales

Headlines: Kremlin calls Facebook's removal of Russian media accounts censorship
Description: The Kremlin on Thursday said Facebook's removal of accounts controlled by various Russian media was a hostile move that smacked of censorship.

Headlines: UPDATE 8-Facebook says data leak hits 87 mln users, widening privacy scandal
Description:
Facebook Inc said
on Wednesday the personal information of up to 87 million users,
mostly in the United States, may have been improperly shared
with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica, up from a
previous news media estimate of more than 50 million.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify before Congress on April 10-11
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg will testify next week before congressional committees over a political consulting firm's misuse of customer data to interfere in the U.S. presidential election, U.S. lawmakers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook suspends Canadian firm AggregateIQ over data scandal
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Friday that it had suspended Canadian political consultancy AggregateIQ from its platform after reports that the data firm may have improperly had access to the personal data of Facebook users.

Headlines: Facebook backs political ad bill, sets limits on 'issue ads'
Description: Facebook Inc backed for the first time on Friday proposed legislation requiring social media sites to disclose the identities of buyers of online political campaign ads and introduced a new verification process for people buying "issue" ads, which have been used to sow discord online.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook backs political ad bill, sets limits on 'issue ads'
Description:
Facebook Inc
backed for the first time on Friday proposed legislation
requiring social media sites to disclose the identities of
buyers of online political campaign ads and introduced a new
verification process for people buying "issue" ads, which have
been used to sow discord online.

Headlines: Facebook backs U.S. regulation of internet political ads
Description:
Facebook Inc
Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Friday endorsed U.S.
legislation to regulate political ads across the internet, a
concession to lawmakers days before he is scheduled to testify
in two U.S. congressional hearings.

Headlines: EU says Facebook confirmed data of 2.7 million Europeans 'improperly shared'
Description: Facebook  has confirmed that the data of 2.7 million EU citizens were among those improperly used by political consultancy Cambridge Analytica, the EU executive said on Friday.

Headlines: Consumer groups to approach FTC over Facebook's facial recognition
Description: A civil rights group and some consumer groups said on Friday they would file a complaint with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) alleging that Facebook Inc's use of facial recognition techniques threaten users' privacy.

Headlines: Italy Antitrust opens probe into Facebook's collection, use of data
Description: Italy's Antitrust Authority has opened a probe into possible incorrect commercial practices by Facebook in its treatment of user data, the agency said in a statement on Friday.

Headlines: Russia asks Facebook to explain curbs on some media accounts: RIA
Description: Russia's communications watchdog said on Friday it had asked Facebook to explain why access had been restricted to the Facebook accounts of some Russian media organizations, RIA news agency said.

Headlines: Indonesia says examining whether Facebook breached laws on data
Description: Indonesia's communication ministry said it has asked Facebook Inc to confirm whether personal data from any of its citizens was shared with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica and is coordinating with police in case any laws were breached.

Headlines: Zuckerberg ditches T-shirt, apologizes for Facebook mistakes
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg swapped his trademark T-shirt and jeans for a dark suit and a purple tie on Monday as he met U.S. lawmakers to apologize for the social network's misuse of its members' data and to head off possible regulation.

Headlines: Widely-watched Dutch comedian says "Bye Bye Facebook"
Description: A popular Dutch comedian has urged hundreds of thousands of fans to join him in saying "Bye Bye Facebook" in protest at the social networking giant’s handling of private data.

Headlines: Alibaba's Jack Ma urges Facebook to fix privacy issues
Description: Jack Ma, founder of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba, on Monday urged Facebook Inc to resolve its data privacy problems, a day before the social media giant's founder, Mark Zuckerberg, was due to appear at U.S. congressional hearings.

Headlines: BRIEF-U.S. lawmakers question Facebook CEO on privacy, antitrust
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief Executive
Mark Zuckerberg testified for nearly two hours on Tuesday in the
first session of privacy-focused hearings on Capitol Hill this
week. Questioning is scheduled to resume on Tuesday after a
break.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg faces Senate hearing but little hope for action
Description: Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's No. 1 mission during his appearance before U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday and Wednesday will be to defend against calls to regulate internet-based companies.

Headlines: Facebook attempts to turn its cheek on the charts
Description: Reuters - ** In wake of plunge that saw Facebook FB.O press against significant support, shares attempting to show their good side again on the charts

Headlines: Facebook launches bounty program for reports of data misuse by app developers
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it is launching a "data abuse" bounty program to reward people who report misuse of data by app developers.

Headlines: Vietnam activists question Facebook on suppressing dissent
Description: Vietnamese human rights activists and independent media groups have written to Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook Inc's chief executive, questioning whether the social media platform was helping suppress dissent in the communist country.

Headlines: Facebook responds to German privacy watchdog on data leak
Description: Facebook has responded to a request for information from a German privacy official on the leak of personal data of millions of users, meeting a deadline that fell just as CEO Mark Zuckerberg prepares to testify before the U.S. Congress.

Headlines: Factbox: 'I know we can do better': Zuckerberg's many Facebook apologies
Description: Facebook Inc  has often angered users by its handling of personal information. Almost as often, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg has apologized.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Facebook's rebound helps Wall Street cut losses
Description:
* Indexes: Dow down 0.57 pct, S&P dips 0.24 pct, Nasdaq flat
(Updates to early afternoon)

Headlines: Second day of U.S. congressional hearings awaits Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
Description:
Facebook Inc
Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg returns to Capitol Hill
on Wednesday for more questioning by lawmakers who have a rare
chance to air grievances about the company directly to the head
of the world's largest social media network.

Headlines: EU Justice Commissioner held 'constructive' talks with Facebook's Sandberg
Description: European Union Justice Commissioner Vera Jourova said she had a "constructive and open discussion" with Facebook Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg about the Cambridge Analytica scandal on Thursday.

Headlines: Russia asks Facebook how it complies with data law - Ifax
Description: Russian communications watchdog Roskomnadzor has asked Facebook to explain how it is complying with a Russian law on data localization, the Interfax news agency reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg unscathed by congressional grilling, stock rises
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg fielded 10 hours of questions over two days from nearly 100 U.S. lawmakers and emerged largely unscathed and considerably richer.

Headlines: Backstory: Putting a spotlight on Facebook
Description: Reuters covers dozens of high-profile Congressional hearings each year, but few draw the intensity and urgency of Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg’s visit to Capitol Hill this week.

Headlines: EU's top court asked to probe Facebook U.S. data transfers
Description: The ability of firms such as Facebook to easily transfer Europeans' data to the United States was plunged into legal limbo on Thursday when the Irish High Court asked the EU's top court for a detailed assessment of whether the methods were legal.

Headlines: Myanmar activists welcome Zuckerberg's 24-hour target to block hate speech on Facebook
Description: Myanmar civil society groups welcomed a commitment by Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to tackle hate speech within 24 hours as the social media giant fights messages inciting violence, but urged it to deploy more resources in the country.

Headlines: Facebook CEO's compensation jumps to $8.9 million as security costs soar
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's compensation rose 53.5 percent to $8.9 million in 2017, a regulatory filing showed on Friday, largely due to higher costs related to the 33-year old billionaire's personal security.

Headlines: Philippines' watchdog probes Facebook over Cambridge Analytica data breach
Description: The Philippines' privacy watchdog said on Friday it has started investigating Facebook Inc  over a data breach involving British firm Cambridge Analytica that affected more than a million Filipino users of social media.

Headlines: Exclusive: BlackRock's biggest stock-picking fund likes Facebook shares
Description: The biggest stock-picking fund at BlackRock Inc raised its bet on Facebook Inc in March, a source familiar with the matter said, making the social media company a top 10 equity holding and apparently betting that Facebook's privacy scandal will not weigh on the stock for long.

Headlines: Majority of divisive Facebook ads bought by 'suspicious groups': study
Description: Most of the political ads about divisive issues that ran on Facebook Inc  before the 2016 U.S. presidential election were sponsored by "suspicious groups" with no publicly available information about them, according to a study released on Monday and based on a database of five million ads on Facebook.

Headlines: Zuckerberg testimony undermines Facebook stance in terrorism case: U.S. court filing
Description: A lawyer for victims of terrorist attacks in Israel on Monday urged a federal appeals court to revive their lawsuit against Facebook Inc, saying Mark Zuckerberg's congressional testimony undermined the social media company's argument that it bore no responsibility for content on its platforms.

Headlines: EU digital chief to meet with Facebook CEO amid privacy scandal
Description: The European Union's digital chief will meet with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg in San Francisco as the world's largest social network faces increasing scrutiny over its use of personal data.

Headlines: Philippines complains Facebook fact-checkers are biased
Description: The Philippines government criticized on Monday Facebook's  choice of two independent online news platforms to help fight the spread of fake news, saying they are biased against President Rodrigo Duterte.

Headlines: Facebook must face class action over facial recognition: U.S. judge
Description: A U.S. federal judge ruled on Monday that Facebook Inc must face a class action lawsuit alleging that the social network unlawfully used a facial recognition process on photos without user permission.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Tech firms, including Microsoft, Facebook, vow not to aid government cyber attacks
Description:
Microsoft, Facebook and
more than 30 other global technology companies on Tuesday
announced a joint pledge not to assist any government in
offensive cyber attacks.

Headlines: Indonesia MPs grill Facebook officials on data breaches
Description: A Facebook official apologised to Indonesian members of parliament on Tuesday during a five-hour grilling at a public hearing on issues ranging from the misuse of personal data to the oversight of content by the social media giant.

Headlines: Investor urges Facebook to set up risk oversight committee
Description: (This April 17 story corrects first paragraph to show Trillium is an asset manager not an activist hedge fund)

Headlines: German lawmakers to grill Facebook manager on data privacy
Description: German lawmakers will question a senior Facebook Inc manager about data privacy in the wake of revelations that the personal information of millions of users wrongly ended up in the hands of political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook to put 1.5 billion users out of reach of new EU privacy law
Description: If a new European law restricting what companies can do with people's online data went into effect tomorrow, almost 1.9 billion Facebook Inc users around the world would be protected by it. The online social network is making changes that ensure the number will be much smaller.

Headlines: British lawmakers to interview Cambridge academic Kogan over Facebook data
Description: A Cambridge University academic who harvested data on millions of Facebook users will appear before a British parliamentary committee investigating the scandal on April 24.

Headlines: Facebook's damage limitation drive hits trouble in Germany
Description: Facebook's attempt to limit fallout from a massive data breach hit trouble in Germany on Friday as a privacy watchdog opened a case against the social network and politicians accused its bosses of evasion.

Headlines: Hamburg data protection officer opens non-compliance procedure against Facebook
Description: Hamburg's data protection ombudsman has opened non-compliance procedures against Facebook, which has been accused of abusing its users' data, a spokesman for the representative said.

Headlines: Indonesia demands more answers from Facebook on data misuse
Description: Indonesia has given Facebook a week to provide more information on how personal data of about one million of its citizens was misused and on the steps the company is taking to prevent such breaches, the country's communications ministry said.

Headlines: PwC had cleared Facebook's privacy practices in leak period
Description: Facebook Inc's privacy practices were cleared by auditing firm PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP in an assessment completed last year of the period in which data analytics consultancy Cambridge Analytica gained access to the personal data of millions of Facebook users.

Headlines: Facebook says it is taking down more material about ISIS, al-Qaeda
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday that it removed or put a warning label on 1.9 million pieces of extremist content related to ISIS or al-Qaeda in the first three months of the year, or about double the amount from the previous quarter.

Headlines: Facebook's hidden data haul troubles German cartel regulator
Description: That the personal data of tens of millions of Facebook  users fell into the wrong hands is troubling politicians, but Germany's top competition regulator is questioning the sheer volume of information that the social network harvests.

Headlines: Facebook removes accounts advertising stolen identities
Description: Facebook Inc has removed a number of accounts and pages that advertised and sold social security numbers, addresses, phone numbers, and alleged credit card numbers of dozens of people, following a report by news website Motherboard.

Headlines: Researcher in Facebook scandal says: my work was worthless to Cambridge Analytica
Description: A researcher at the center of a scandal over the alleged misuse of the data of nearly 100 million Facebook users said on Tuesday the work he did was useless for the sort of targeted adverts that would be needed to sway an election.

Headlines: Facebook's rise in profits, users shows resilience after scandals
Description: Facebook Inc  shares rose on Wednesday after the social network reported a surprisingly strong 63 percent rise in profit and an increase in users, with no sign that business was hurt by a scandal over the mishandling of personal data.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook's rise in profits, users shows resilience after scandals
Description:
Facebook Inc shares rose on
Wednesday after the social network reported a surprisingly
strong 63 percent rise in profit and an increase in users, with
no sign that business was hurt by a scandal over the mishandling
of personal data.

Headlines: Facebook will not testify at U.S. House hearing on social media
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it has declined an invitation to testify at a U.S. House of Representatives hearing Thursday on filtering practices by social media companies, a company spokesman said.

Headlines: Facebook quarterly profit beats estimates
Description:
Facebook Inc's first-quarter
profit topped analyst estimates on Wednesday, as the social
media company's mobile ad business grew from a major push to add
more video content on its site.

Headlines: North Korea's elite quitting Facebook, concealing internet activity: researcher
Description: North Korea's ruling class has in recent months abandoned Western social media sites such as Facebook , Instagram  and Alphabet's Google  and dramatically increased its use of tools that cloak internet activity, according to cyber security research published on Wednesday.

Headlines: Wall Street much quicker to applaud Facebook than criticize it
Description: A month of darkening sentiment around Facebook Inc  among analysts was washed away in an instant when the social media's earnings report blew through even the most optimistic earnings estimates.

Headlines: Facebook slammed by UK lawmakers as CTO promises transparency overhaul
Description: A top Facebook executive apologized for errors made by the firm and vowed to do more to improve transparency during a four-hour grilling on Thursday from British lawmakers who insisted the company's response to a data scandal had been inadequate.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook slammed by UK lawmakers as CTO promises transparency overhaul
Description:
* Says political ads not big part of business
(Recasts, adds further details of hearing)

Headlines: No Doomsday scenario for Facebook as EU privacy rules kick in
Description: As Europe nears tough new privacy rules, Facebook  reckons the worst that could happen is that users will share less data, making it harder to target ads on the social network that raked in revenues of $12 billion in the first quarter.

Headlines: Buck stops with Zuckerberg in Facebook data scandal: CTO
Description: The buck stops with Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg when it comes to the fallout from a recent data scandal that has impacted millions of users, the firm's chief technology officer told UK lawmakers.

Headlines: Buck stops with Zuckerberg in Facebook data scandal - CTO
Description:
The buck stops with Facebook
chief executive Mark Zuckerberg when it comes to the fallout
from a recent data scandal that has impacted millions of users,
the firm's chief technology officer told UK lawmakers.

Headlines: Facebook CTO says decisions on political ads are not to do with money
Description: Political adverts are not an important revenue stream for Facebook so decisions on the issue are not about money, the company's chief technology officer said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook CTO says sorry journalists feel firm is trying to suppress the truth
Description: Facebook did not intend its behavior toward the media to be interpreted as trying to stop the truth about a data scandal from coming out, the company's chief technology officer said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook will bring in new ad transparency measures, CTO says
Description:
Facebook will introduce new
measures to boost transparency around adverts in Britain by June
this year and require political ads to be clearly labelled, the
firm's Chief Technology Officer told a British parliamentary
committee.

Headlines: WhatsApp co-founder to quit in loss of privacy advocate at Facebook
Description: The co-founder of WhatsApp, a messaging service owned by Facebook Inc  with more than 1 billion daily users, said on Monday he was leaving the company, in a loss of one of the strongest advocates for privacy inside Facebook.

Headlines: Facebook must block commentary calling AfD leader a "Nazi swine"-court
Description:
Facebook said on Monday
it had already removed a posting that called German far-right
leader Alice Weidel a "Nazi swine", but would consider its next
steps after a court issued a preliminary injunction against the
social media network.

Headlines: Facebook bids to keep data privacy case from EU's top court
Description: Facebook bid on Monday to block referral of a landmark privacy case to Europe's top court by requesting a last-ditch appeal, seeking to avoid a potential ban on the legal instrument it uses to transfer users' data to the United States.

Headlines: Facebook to play cupid in online dating debut
Description: Facebook Inc is entering the dating game, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday, planning a dating service to matchmake millions of people on the world's largest online social network and nudge them into spending more time there.

Headlines: Market swipes left on Match, Tinder as Facebook swipes right on dating
Description: Like an old flame wrecking a first date, Facebook Inc burst in on the matchmaking scene on Tuesday and sent investors in rival apps on a panicked rush for the door.

Headlines: Facebook adds more tools to Workplace to court business customers
Description: Facebook has announced a way to plug popular business tools into the social network’s office collaboration service, called Workplace, in an effort to catch up with features in competitors such as Slack.

Headlines: UK lawmakers prepared to summon Facebook boss Zuckerberg over data scandal
Description: British parliamentarians said they were prepared to issue a formal summons for Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to appear before them and answer questions over a data scandal which has engulfed the technology giant.

Headlines: Facebook employee fired over bragging about access to user information
Description: Facebook Inc on Thursday said that it fired an employee accused of bragging on matchmaking app Tinder about his access to private user information.

Headlines: Irish court rejects Facebook bid to delay EU data privacy case
Description: Ireland's High Court has refused a request by Facebook to delay referral to Europe's top court of a landmark privacy case that could strike down legal instruments used by U.S. tech companies to transfer EU users' data to the United States.

Headlines: Germany demands more privacy safeguards from Facebook: report
Description: Germany's justice minister has asked Facebook  Chief Executive in a letter to be transparent with users by giving them more control, saying allegations of the improper use of data for millions of people is unacceptable, a German media group reported on Thursday.

Headlines: 'Facebook effect' turns Swedish steel town into tech hot-spot
Description: Facebook  will double the size of its data center in Sweden's northern city of Lulea, raising its total investments in the region to about 8.7 billion crowns ($987 million), the company said on Monday.

Headlines: "Facebook effect" turns Swedish steel town into tech hot-spot
Description:
* Brings Facebook's total investment in area to around $1
billion

Headlines: Facebook shakes up management, launches blockchain division
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday ordered one of the biggest management shakeups in the history of the social network, giving more responsibility to his chief product officer and launching a blockchain division.

Headlines: Cambridge Analytica and British parent shut down after Facebook scandal
Description: Cambridge Analytica, the firm embroiled in a controversy over its handling of Facebook Inc  user data, and its British parent SCL Elections Ltd, are shutting down immediately after suffering a sharp drop in business, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Three-quarters Facebook users as active or more since privacy scandal: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Description: Most of Facebook's U.S. users have remained loyal to the social network despite revelations that a political consultancy collected information about millions of accounts without owners' permission, a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Sunday showed.

Headlines: Vietnam jails Facebook user for posts seen as anti-state propaganda
Description: Vietnam has jailed a Facebook user for 4-1/2 years over posts  that "distorted" the political situation in the Southeast Asian country, a branch of the ruling Communist Party said.

Headlines: Facebook suspends 200 apps over data misuse investigation
Description: Facebook Inc  has so far suspended around 200 apps in the first stage of its review into apps that had access to large quantities of user data, in a response to a scandal around political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook has not fully answered questions on data privacy: UK lawmakers
Description: Facebook has failed to fully answer 39 questions from British lawmakers examining data privacy and fake news, a parliamentary committee said on Tuesday, adding that it would ask the social media giant once again for the missing details.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook has not fully answered questions on data privacy -UK lawmakers
Description:
Facebook has failed to
fully answer 39 questions from British lawmakers examining data
privacy and fake news, a parliamentary committee said on
Tuesday, adding that it would ask the social media giant once
again for the missing details.

Headlines: Facebook says posts with graphic violence rose in early 2018
Description: The number of posts on Facebook showing graphic violence rose in the first three months of the year from a quarter earlier, possibly driven by the war in Syria, the social network said on Tuesday, in its first public release of such data.

Headlines: Facebook has not fully answered questions on data privacy -UK lawmakers
Description:
Facebook has failed to
fully answer 39 questions from British lawmakers examaning data
privacy and fake news, a parliamentary committee said on
Tuesday, adding that it would ask the social media giant once
again for the missing details.

Headlines: Big proxy adviser ISS does not support Facebook's Zuckerberg in proxy vote
Description: Top proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services on Wednesday recommended Facebook Inc investors withhold support from five directors including Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg and vote in favor of shareholder proposals aimed at improving the social media company's response to problems like election interference and harassment.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to meet European Parliament over privacy
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg will meet the leaders of the European Parliament to answer questions about the improper use of millions of users' data by a political consultancy, as pressure on the company's protection of data continues.

Headlines: France’s Macron to hold 'tough talks' with Facebook's Zuckerberg
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron will hold "frank" talks with Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on tax and data privacy in a week's time when he welcomes the bosses of leading tech firms to Paris in a drive to lure more investment.

Headlines: Cambridge Analytica files for bankruptcy in U.S. following Facebook debacle
Description: Cambridge Analytica, the political consultancy at the center of Facebook Inc's privacy scandal, filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy in the United States late on Thursday.

Headlines: Socially responsible funds dump or rethink Facebook over data privacy
Description: Several socially conscious investment firms are selling or rethinking their Facebook Inc  holdings, unsatisfied by the company's moves to strengthen personal data protection and online safety after scandals involving the improper sharing of users' information.

Headlines: Facebook face-off: EU gets little news from Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg sailed through a grilling from EU lawmakers about the social network's data policies as  lengthy questions left the 34-year-old American little time to answer.

Headlines: Facebook not done enough to prevent misuse: Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg apologized to EU lawmakers on Tuesday, saying the company had not done enough to prevent misuse of the social network and that regulation is "important and inevitable".

Headlines: Highlights: Facebook's Zuckerberg faces EU Parliament grilling
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg apologized to the European Parliament on Tuesday for a massive data leak, his latest attempt to draw a line under a scandal that has rocked the world's biggest social media network.

Headlines: Facebook director to start after annual meeting, avoid shareholder vote
Description: Facebook Inc named a new director this month and timed his appointment to avoid a shareholder vote, raising concern among some investors who want to see more accountability from the social media company.

Headlines: EU antitrust official sees more scrutiny for Facebook, others
Description: Facebook and other tech giants may attract more regulatory scrutiny in future because of their market power, a senior EU antitrust official said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook suggests no compensation for European users affected by data breach
Description: Facebook is unlikely to compensate the 2.7 million European users whose data was improperly shared with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica because sensitive bank account data had not been shared, the company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook users unite! 'Data Labour Union' launches in Netherlands
Description: Activists in Amsterdam on Wednesday launched the 'Datavakbond' or "data labor union", which hopes to elect leaders to negotiate directly with Facebook and Google over what they do with users' data.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook launches searchable archive of U.S. political ads
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Thursday launched an archive of U.S. political ads that appear
on the world's largest social network, showing who paid for them
and other details, after an outcry over Russians' alleged
purchase of such ads during the 2016 elections.

Headlines: EU parliament gets Facebook answers after Zuckerberg meeting
Description: The European Parliament distributed on Thursday what it called a first set of written replies from Facebook to oral questions put by lawmakers to CEO Mark Zuckerberg at a meeting in Brussels on Tuesday.

Headlines: Russia to carry out checks on Facebook, Whatsapp: TASS
Description: Russian state telecommunications watchdog Roskomnadzor will check by December whether Facebook and possibly Whatsapp are complying with Russian laws, TASS news agency reported on Thursday, citing the head of the watchdog.

Headlines: Facebook's size no barrier to deals in new areas: executive
Description: Facebook Inc believes it could acquire other large companies without running afoul of antitrust enforcers if the world's largest social media network chose to enter a new market, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook says all directors elected, shareholder proposals rejected
Description: All eight of Facebook Inc's  director nominees were elected at its annual meeting on Thursday, and all six shareholder proposals urging reforms, including to its voting structure and content oversight, were rejected, company executives said.

Headlines: New Zealand privacy watchdog seeks greater power over Facebook
Description: New Zealand's top privacy enforcer is seeking greater powers to regulate Facebook Inc as the social media giant grapples with a tough new privacy regime in Europe and investigations around the globe over its handling of personal data.    New Zealand Privacy Commissioner John Edwards said he was seeking new enforcement provisions as part of an overhaul of privacy laws now being considered by parliament.     Edwards and Facebook have been at loggerheads over whether the tech

Headlines: World's top wealth fund backs activist proposals at Facebook meeting
Description: Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund backed a wide range of activist shareholder proposals at Facebook's annual meeting on Thursday, including a measure to improve the company's oversight of questionable content, the fund's voting record showed on Friday.

Headlines: Washington state sues Facebook, Google over election ad disclosure
Description: The state of Washington said on Monday it had sued Facebook Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google for allegedly violating state campaign finance law by failing to maintain information about who buys election ads.

Headlines: U.S. Senate panel to seek answers from Facebook about data access report
Description: The head of the U.S. Senate Commerce Committee said on Monday he planned to ask Facebook Inc  about a New York Times report that the social media company allowed Apple Inc  and other device makers to have "deep" access to users' personal data without their consent.

Headlines: Outside investors rebuke Facebook vote structure, tallies show
Description: A wide majority of outside investors at Facebook Inc backed a measure that would revamp its voting structure and end the supervoting rights of shares held by Mark Zuckerberg and others, seen as a rebuke to the chief executive of the world's largest social media company.

Headlines: Facebook fan page operator has privacy responsibilities: EU court
Description: The operator of a fan page on Facebook is also responsible for protecting visitors' personal data and cannot hide behind the social network, the European Union's highest court ruled on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers press Facebook over Chinese data sharing
Description: Facebook Inc faced criticism on Wednesday from Republican and Democratic U.S. lawmakers who demanded that the social media company be more forthcoming about data it has shared with four Chinese firms.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-U.S. lawmakers press Facebook over Chinese data sharing
Description:
Facebook Inc
faced criticism on Wednesday from Republican and
Democratic U.S. lawmakers who demanded that the social media
company be more forthcoming about data it has shared with four
Chinese firms.

Headlines: Facebook confirms data sharing with Chinese companies
Description: Facebook Inc  said Tuesday it has data sharing partnerships with at least four Chinese companies including Huawei, the world's third largest smartphone maker, which has come under scrutiny from U.S. intelligence agencies on security concerns.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Facebook confirms data sharing with Chinese companies
Description:
Facebook Inc said
Tuesday it has data sharing partnerships with at least four
Chinese companies including Huawei, the world's third largest
smartphone maker, which has come under scrutiny from U.S.
intelligence agencies on security concerns.

Description:

Tuesday it has data sharing partnerships with at least four
Chinese companies including Huawei, the world's third largest
smartphone maker, which has come under scrutiny from U.S.
intelligence agencies on security concerns.

Headlines: Ex-Cambridge Analytica boss admits getting Facebook data from researcher
Description: The former head of Cambridge Analytica admitted on Wednesday his firm had received data from the researcher at the center of a scandal over Facebook users' personal details, contradicting previous testimony to lawmakers.

Headlines: India seeks Facebook's response over reports of data sharing without consent
Description: India has asked social media company Facebook Inc to respond by June 20 to media reports of sharing users data without their explicit consent, a government statement said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook used less for news as youngsters turn to WhatsApp: Reuters Institute
Description: The use of social media networks such as Facebook  to consume news has started to fall in the United States as many young people turn toward messaging apps such as Facebook-owned WhatsApp to discuss events, the Reuters Institute found.

Headlines: Uber hires Facebook's product director as its driver product head
Description: Uber Technologies Inc [UBER.UL] has hired Facebook Inc product director Daniel Danker as its head of driver product, Chief Executive Officer Dara Khosrowshahi said in a tweet on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook releases new privacy safeguards after ceding to pressure from advertisers
Description: Facebook is installing new controls it says will better inform its members about the way companies are targeting them with advertising, the latest step to quell a public outcry over the company's mishandling of user data.

Headlines: CORRECTED-FOCUS-Facebook releases new privacy safeguards after ceding to pressure from advertisers
Description:
Facebook is installing new
controls it says will better inform its members about the way
companies are targeting them with advertising, the latest step
to quell a public outcry over the company's mishandling of user
data.

Headlines: Facebook's public relations chief to step down
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday that Elliot Schrage, who as head of communications and public policy has led the social network's response to scandals about privacy and election meddling, would step down from the company after a decade.

Headlines: U.S. court halves $500 million verdict in Facebook virtual reality lawsuit
Description: A federal court in Dallas on Wednesday halved the $500 million verdict that a jury ordered Facebook Inc, its virtual reality unit Oculus, and others to pay ZeniMax Media Inc, a video game publisher that alleged Oculus stole its technology.

Headlines: Facebook still evasive over Cambridge Analytica and fake news: UK lawmakers
Description: Facebook continues to be evasive in its answers to a British parliamentary committee examining a scandal over misuse of the social media company's data by Cambridge Analytica, the committee's chair said on Friday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook still evasive over Cambridge Analytica and fake news - UK lawmakers
Description:
Facebook continues to be
evasive in its answers to a British parliamentary committee
examining a scandal over misuse of the social media company's
data by Cambridge Analytica, the committee's chair said on
Friday.
