Description:
Facebook is continuing to
be evasive in its answers to a British parliamentary committee
examining a scandal over misuse of the social media company's
data by Cambridge Analytica, the committee's chair said on
Friday.

Headlines: Probe into Facebook's data breach broadens: Washington Post
Description: A federal investigation into Facebook Inc's data breach with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica has broadened  focus on the actions and statements of the tech giant, the Washington Post reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the inquiries.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop on report of widened probe on data scandal
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc fell 2 percent on Tuesday, after a report that a federal probe on the data breach linked to Cambridge Analytica had been broadened and would include more government agencies.

Headlines: Dips in Facebook and Apple leave Wall Street lower
Description: Wall Street dipped on Tuesday, weighed down by Apple, Facebook and other technology stocks, in a trading session ending early ahead of the U.S. July 4 holiday.

Headlines: Facebook tests augmented reality ads on News Feed in U.S.
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it
is testing augmented reality advertisements on its News Feed
ahead of the holiday shopping season in the United States.

Headlines: Australian lawsuit funder files complaint against Facebook, flags suit over privacy breaches
Description: Litigation funder IMF Bentham Ltd  is preparing to potentially sue social media giant Facebook Inc  in Australia over its sharing of users' data with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook removes 'treason' as tag to identify users' interests
Description: Facebook  has removed "treason" as a keyword to identify its users' interests for advertisers, it said on Wednesday, after Danish state broadcaster DR revealed its existence.

Headlines: Facebook faces small but symbolic UK fine over data protection breaches
Description: Britain's information regulator slapped Facebook with a small but symbolic fine for breaches of data protection law after millions of users' data was improperly accessed by consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook removes "treason" as tag to identify users' interests
Description:
Facebook has removed
"treason" as a keyword to identify its users' interests for
advertisers, it said on Wednesday, after Danish state
broadcaster DR revealed its existence.

Headlines: Facebook tests augmented reality ads on News Feed in U.S
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it is testing augmented reality advertisements on its News Feed ahead of the holiday shopping season in the United States.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook tests augmented reality ads on News Feed in U.S.
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it
is testing augmented reality advertisements on its News Feed
ahead of the holiday shopping season in the United States.

Headlines: Heirs can access Facebook account of deceased relatives: German court
Description: Heirs in Germany have the right to access the Facebook accounts of their deceased relatives, a court said in a landmark privacy ruling on Thursday, saying a social media account can be inherited in the same way as letters.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter, Alphabet to testify at U.S. House hearing
Description: The U.S. House Judiciary Committee will hold a hearing on Tuesday to take testimony from Facebook Inc, Alphabet Inc's YouTube unit and Twitter Inc on whether social media companies are filtering content for political reasons, the committee chairman said.

Headlines: Facebook says Indonesian user data not misused
Description: Social media giant Facebook has assured the Indonesian government that personal data of about one million of its citizens had not been improperly accessed by political consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers urge Google, Facebook to resist Vietnam cybersecurity law
Description: Seventeen U.S. lawmakers have urged the CEOs of Facebook and Google to resist changes stipulated by a new cybersecurity law in Vietnam, which critics say gives the Communist-ruled state more power to crackdown on dissent.

Headlines: Facebook to double office presence in London
Description: Facebook said on Monday it would double its presence in London, acquiring nearly 600,000 square feet (56,000 square meters) of office space across two buildings in King's Cross - enough for more than 6,000 workstations.

Headlines: Facebook signs agreement with Washington state to end discriminatory ad targeting
Description: Facebook Inc  has signed an agreement with the state of Washington to stop third-party advertisers in the United States from excluding protected groups from seeing their ads, the Washington State Attorney General said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook signs agreement with Washington state to end discriminatory ad targeting
Description:
Facebook Inc has signed an
agreement with the state of Washington to stop third-party
advertisers in the United States from excluding protected groups
from seeing their ads, the Washington State Attorney General
said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook to prohibit discriminatory ads on its platform
Description:
Facebook Inc will make changes to
its advertising platform to stop third-party advertisers in the
United States from excluding protected groups from seeing their
ads, the Washington State Attorney General said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China pulls approval for Facebook's planned venture: NYT
Description: China has withdrawn its approval for Facebook Inc's plan to open a new venture in the eastern province of Zhejiang, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

Headlines: UPDATE 7-Facebook's grim forecast: privacy push will erode profits for years
Description:
Facebook Inc's shares lost as
much as a quarter of their value on Wednesday after executives
said that profit margins would plummet for several years due to
the costs of improving privacy safeguards and slowing usage in
the biggest advertising markets.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook removes pages of Brazil activist network before elections
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Wednesday took down a network of pages and accounts used by a
right-wing Brazilian activist group, cracking down on what it
called a misinformation network ahead of elections in October.

Headlines: Facebook misses estimates on monthly active users
Description:
Facebook Inc fell short of
analysts' estimates for monthly active users on Wednesday,
months after the social network became embroiled in a data
scandal that affected millions of its users.

Headlines: Facebook plans innovation hub in China despite tightening censorship
Description: Facebook has set up a subsidiary in China and plans to create an "innovation hub" to support local start-ups and developers, the social media company said on Tuesday, ramping up its presence in the restrictive market where its social media sites remain blocked.

Headlines: Zuckerberg loses more than $15 billion in record Facebook fall
Description: Facebook Inc  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg's fortune took a more than $15 billion hit on Thursday, as the social media company suffered the biggest one-day wipeout in U.S. stock market history a day after executives forecast years of lower profit margins.

Headlines: Facebook sends Nasdaq tumbling, but trade optimism boosts Dow
Description: A plunge in Facebook Inc's  shares pushed the Nasdaq down more than 1 percent on Thursday, the index's biggest one-day drop in a month, but industrial stocks rose after the United States and the European Union said they would negotiate on trade.

Headlines: Global stocks fail to hold four-month peak as Facebook plunges
Description: World stock markets failed to hold onto four-month highs on Thursday as a record sell-off in Facebook shares offset optimism that the European Union and the United States would settle their differences on trade.

Headlines: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P, Nasdaq fall as Facebook plummets; Dow up
Description:
A plunge in Facebook Inc's
shares pushed the Nasdaq down more than 1 percent on
Thursday, the index's biggest one-day drop in a month, but
industrial stocks rose after the United States and the European
Union said they would negotiate on trade.

Headlines: Facebook buys Israeli messaging company Redkix
Description: Israel's Redkix, whose product combines email and team messaging, said on Thursday it has agreed to be acquired by Facebook, where it will join the Workplace team to help companies collaborate.

Headlines: Facebook's grim forecast: privacy push will erode profits for years
Description: Facebook Inc's shares lost as much as a quarter of their value on Wednesday after executives said that profit margins would plummet for several years due to the costs of improving privacy safeguards and slowing usage in the biggest advertising markets.

Headlines: Facebook suspends U.S. conspiracy theorist Alex Jones
Description: U.S. conspiracy theorist Alex Jones has been suspended from Facebook for bullying and hate speech and is close to having pages tied to him and his Infowars website removed from the platform, the social media network said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook is sued after stock plunge 'shocked' market
Description: Facebook Inc  and its chief executive Mark Zuckerberg were sued on Friday in what could be the first of many lawsuits over a disappointing earnings announcement by the social media company that wiped out about $120 billion of shareholder wealth.

Headlines: Instagram not an instant fix for ailing Facebook
Description: Revenue forecasts from Facebook Inc that alarmed investors, fueling the worst day ever for its shares on Thursday, add to the pressure on its Instagram unit to win over more of the ad buyers that have long found success on the company's flagship app.

Headlines: Top Facebook, Twitter executives to testify in Sept. on U.S. election meddling
Description: Top executives at Facebook Inc  and Twitter Inc  have agreed to testify at a Senate Intelligence Committee hearing in September as part of the investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 U.S. elections, a person briefed on the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook says it identifies campaign to meddle in 2018 U.S. elections
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it had identified a new coordinated political influence campaign to mislead its users and sow dissension among voters ahead of November's U.S. congressional elections.

Headlines: U.S. homeland security secretary commends Facebook action
Description: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen commended Facebook on Tuesday for taking action to interrupt a political influence campaign on its site and said it showed the company was taking election security seriously.

Headlines: Facebook deletes hundreds of posts under German hate-speech law
Description: (This July 27 story corrects number of posts deleted to 362 in second paragraph)

Headlines: Facebook in talks with banks to expand customer service
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday it is in talks to deepen links with banks and financial institutions, saying it can help the firms improve their customer service.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook in talks with banks to expand customer service
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Monday it is
in talks to deepen links with banks and financial institutions,
saying it can help the firms improve their customer service.

Headlines: Eleven Sports to stream La Liga, Serie A matches on Facebook
Description: Eleven Sports, a global broadcaster launching two new channels in Britain, will show one Spanish and one Italian top flight soccer match a week live and for free on Facebook, including Cristiano Ronaldo's debut for Juventus.

Headlines: UniCredit has stopped using Facebook for advertising: CEO
Description: Italy's UniCredit has stopped using Facebook for advertising and marketing campaigns and will not do so again until the U.S. giant improves its ethical standards, the bank's CEO said on Tuesday.

Headlines: India asks telcos to find ways to block Facebook, WhatsApp in case of misuse
Description: India has asked its telecom operators to find ways of blocking applications such as Facebook and messaging app WhatsApp in the case of misuse, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook says removing content on 3D printing of guns
Description: Facebook Inc  is removing content related to instructions on 3D printing of firearms, a company spokesperson said on Thursday, as debate around access to gun in the United States intensifies.

Headlines: India regulator, who took on Facebook, Apple, to stay on for two more years
Description: Ram Sewak Sharma, the head of India's telecoms regulator who took on global giants Facebook and Apple, has been given two more years in his assignment, which was due to end on Friday.

Headlines: L'Oreal adds to Facebook sales push with virtual make-up tests
Description: Maybelline parent L'Oreal  is pairing up with Facebook to roll out virtual tests for shoppers to see how they might look with different lipsticks or eye shadows, adding to its push to drive more sales online and through social media networks.

Headlines: Facebook pages with large U.S. following to require more authorization
Description: Facebook Inc  will introduce an authorization process for users who manage Facebook pages with a large U.S. following, it said https://www.facebook.com/business/news/new-authorization-for-pages on Friday, seeking to make it harder to administer a page using a fake or compromised account.

Headlines: Liga announces landmark free-to-air deal with Facebook in India
Description: Spain's top flight soccer division La Liga announced on Tuesday a landmark deal with Facebook which will allow viewers in the Indian sub-continent to watch every game over the next three seasons for free on the social network.

Headlines: Facebook says it was “too slow” to fight hate speech in Myanmar
Description:
Facebook has been “too
slow” to address hate speech in Myanmar and is acting to remedy
the problem, the company said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Special Report: Why Facebook is losing the war on hate speech in Myanmar
Description: In April, Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg told U.S. senators that the social media site was hiring dozens more Burmese speakers to review hate speech posted in Myanmar. The situation was dire.

Headlines: SPECIAL REPORT-Why Facebook is losing the war on hate speech in Myanmar
Description:

founder Mark Zuckerberg told U.S. senators that the social media
site was hiring dozens more Burmese speakers to review hate
speech posted in Myanmar. The situation was dire.

Headlines: Facebook says it was 'too slow' to fight hate speech in Myanmar
Description: Facebook  has been “too slow” to address hate speech in Myanmar and is acting to remedy the problem by hiring more Burmese speakers and investing in technology to identify problematic content, the company said in a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says it was “too slow” to fight hate speech in Myanmar
Description:
Facebook has been “too
slow” to address hate speech in Myanmar and is acting to remedy

technology to identify problematic content, the company said in
a statement on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: U.S. government seeks Facebook help to wiretap Messenger - sources
Description: The U.S. government is trying to force Facebook Inc  to break the encryption in its popular Messenger app so law enforcement may listen to a suspect's voice conversations in a criminal probe, three people briefed on the case said, resurrecting the issue of whether companies can be compelled to alter their products to enable surveillance.

Headlines: Exclusive: Trump says it is 'dangerous' for Twitter, Facebook to ban accounts
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that it is "very dangerous" for social media companies like Twitter Inc  and Facebook Inc  to silence voices on their services.

Headlines: Facebook moves to rate users on trustworthiness: report
Description: Facebook Inc  has started scoring its users based on their trustworthiness in an attempt to fight misinformation, the Washington Post reported on Tuesday, citing a company executive.

Headlines: Facebook moves to rate users on trustworthiness -report
Description:
Facebook Inc has
started scoring its users based on their trustworthiness in an
attempt to fight misinformation, the Washington Post reported on
Tuesday, citing a company executive.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter dismantle disinformation campaigns tied to Iran and Russia
Description: Facebook Inc , Twitter Inc  and Alphabet Inc  collectively removed hundreds of accounts tied to an alleged Iranian propaganda operation on Tuesday, while Facebook took down a second campaign it said was linked to Russia.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook, Twitter dismantle disinformation campaigns tied to Iran and Russia
Description:
Facebook Inc
, Twitter Inc and Alphabet Inc
collectively removed hundreds of accounts tied to an alleged
Iranian propaganda operation on Tuesday, while Facebook took
down a second campaign it said was linked to Russia.

Headlines: Kremlin calls Facebook's allegations of disinformation campaign puzzling
Description: The Kremlin on Wednesday rejected allegations from Facebook that Russia's GRU military intelligence service had been using the social media site to run disinformation campaigns, saying it did not understand the basis for such accusations.

Headlines: U.S. says Facebook fugitive Paul Ceglia arrested in Ecuador
Description: The New York man who spent nearly 3-1/2 years as a fugitive after being charged with trying to defraud Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg out of half of the social media company has been arrested in Ecuador and may be extradited, U.S. prosecutors said on Thursday.

Headlines: Fidelity's Danoff backs Facebook's response to content, privacy issues
Description: Facebook Inc's  second-biggest outside investor has offered backing for the world's largest social media company as it faces public criticism for what people see on its service and how much user information is shared with third parties.

Headlines: U.N. calls for Myanmar generals to be tried for genocide, blames Facebook for incitement
Description: Myanmar's military carried out mass killings and gang rapes of Muslim Rohingya with "genocidal intent", and the commander-in-chief and five generals should be prosecuted for the gravest crimes under international law, United Nations investigators said.

Headlines: Facebook bans Myanmar army chief, others in unprecedented move
Description: Facebook  said on Monday it was removing several Myanmar military officials from the social media website and an Instagram account to prevent the spread of "hate and misinformation" after reviewing the content.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook bans Myanmar army chief, others in unprecedented move
Description:
Facebook said on Monday it
was removing several Myanmar military officials from the social
media website and an Instagram account to prevent the spread of
"hate and misinformation" after reviewing the content.

Headlines: EXPLAINER-Facebook ban on army chief silences Myanmar's military mouthpiece
Description:
Facebook's announcement on
Monday that it was removing accounts connected to Myanmar's
military effectively cuts off the armed forces' main channel of
communication with the public.

Headlines: German antitrust watchdog plans action on Facebook this year
Description: Germany's antitrust watchdog expects to take first steps this year in its probe against Facebook  after finding that the social media giant abused its market dominance to gather data on people without their knowledge or consent.

Headlines: Facebook removes top Myanmar military official, others from website
Description:
Facebook said on Monday it was
removing certain Myanmar military officials from the social
media website and an instagram account to prevent the spread of
"hate and misinformation" after reviewing the content.

Headlines: Trump warns Google, Facebook, Twitter to be careful
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump warned Google, Facebook and Twitter to tread carefully on Tuesday after recently accusing internet and social media firms of political bias and censorship, without providing evidence.

Headlines: Facebook fugitive fights U.S. request to extradite him from Ecuador: lawyer
Description: A New York man charged with trying to defraud Facebook Inc  founder Mark Zuckerberg is fighting extradition from Ecuador where he was arrested after fleeing before his trial in the United States more than three years ago.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter face U.S. Congress over politics and the internet
Description: Top Twitter Inc and Facebook Inc executives will defend their companies before U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday, with Facebook insisting it takes election interference seriously and Twitter denying its operations are influenced by politics.

Headlines: Facebook, Nike drag Wall Street lower; trade concerns linger
Description: U.S. stocks fell on Tuesday as trade concerns lingered and declines in Facebook and Nike shares weighed on Wall Street's major indexes, though data showing U.S. manufacturing activity accelerated in August kept losses in check.

Headlines: CORRECTED-REFILE-US STOCKS-Facebook, Nike drag Wall St lower, data limits losses
Description:
Declines in Facebook and Nike
shares weighed on the S&P 500 and the Dow on Tuesday, although
data showing U.S. manufacturing activity accelerated in August
kept losses in check.

Headlines: Facebook expands Menlo Park headquarters
Description: Facebook Inc opened its newest building at its Menlo Park headquarters as the world's largest social network continues to hire aggressively to support its scorching growth.

Headlines: Nasdaq falls as U.S. lawmakers grill Facebook, Twitter executives
Description: The Nasdaq fell more than 1 percent on Wednesday, dented by technology stocks after Facebook Inc  and Twitter Inc  executives defended their companies before skeptical U.S. lawmakers.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter fall as they face U.S. Congress
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc fell on Wednesday as their top executives testified before the U.S. Congress, defending the companies against what lawmakers see as a failure to combat continuing foreign efforts to influence U.S. politics.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter face U.S. Congress over foreign bids to tilt politics
Description:
Top executives from Facebook
Inc and Twitter Inc will defend their companies
in the U.S. Congress on Wednesday over what lawmakers see as a
failure to combat continuing foreign efforts to influence U.S.
politics.

Headlines: In India, Google races to parry the rise of Facebook
Description: Google retains only a slight lead over Facebook in the competition for digital ad dollars in the crucial India market, sources familiar with the figures say, even though the search giant has been in the country far longer and has avoided the controversies that have dogged its rival.

Headlines: Facebook removes Burmese translation feature after Reuters report
Description: Facebook has removed a feature that allowed users to translate Burmese posts and comments after a Reuters report showed the tool was producing bizarre results.

Headlines: Facebook to invest $1 billion in first Asian data center in Singapore
Description: Facebook  said on Thursday it will invest more than $1 billion to build its first data center in Asia in Singapore, slated to open in 2022.

Headlines: Vietnam urges Facebook to open office ahead of controversial cyber law
Description: Vietnam has asked Facebook  to open a local office as the Communist-ruled country increases pressure on global technology firms to abide by a controversial cyber security law.

Headlines: Facebook yet to comply with EU consumer rules, Airbnb in line: EU sources
Description: Facebook  may face sanctions because it has yet to comply with EU consumer rules while Airbnb has made the necessary changes in response to regulatory demands, EU sources said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook expands fake election news fight, but falsehoods still rampant
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday said it would team with two U.S. non-profits to slow the global spread of misinformation that could influence elections, acknowledging that fake news sites were still read by millions.

Headlines: Facebook and Twitter must comply with EU consumer rules or face sanctions
Description: Facebook  and Twitter  face sanctions unless they comply with European consumer rules by the end of the year, the EU said as its regulators continue to their crackdown on U.S. social media giants over privacy concerns.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook not protecting content moderators from mental trauma -lawsuit
Description:
A former Facebook Inc contract
employee filed a lawsuit in California, alleging that content
moderators who face mental trauma after reviewing distressing
images on the platform are not being properly protected by the
social networking company.

Headlines: Facebook not protecting content moderators from mental trauma -lawsuit
Description:
A former Facebook contract employee has
lodged a suit against the company, alleging that content
moderators who face mental trauma after reviewing distressing
images on the platform are not being properly protected by the
social networking giant.

Headlines: Facebook picks chief of Hotstar streaming service as India head
Description: Facebook has poached the head of Indian video streaming service Hotstar to take on the newly-created role of managing director of its Indian operations, as the social media giant faces pressure to tackle fake news and store more data locally.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook picks chief of Hotstar streaming service as India head
Description:
Facebook has poached the
head of Indian video streaming service Hotstar to take on the
newly-created role of managing director of its Indian
operations, as the social media giant faces pressure to tackle
fake news and store more data locally.

Headlines: Facebook shares slip after Instagram founders quit
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc  fell more than 2 percent in early trading on Tuesday after the two founders of photo-sharing app Instagram left the social networking giant under unexplained circumstances.

Headlines: Instagram co-founders resign in latest Facebook executive exit
Description: Instagram on Monday said co-founders Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger have resigned as chief executive officer and chief technical officer of the photo-sharing app owned by Facebook Inc, giving scant explanation for the move.

Headlines: Facebook not protecting content moderators from mental trauma: lawsuit
Description: A former Facebook Inc contract employee filed a lawsuit in California, alleging that content moderators who face mental trauma after reviewing distressing images on the platform are not being properly protected by the social networking company.

Headlines: Facebook unveils new VR headset 'Oculus Quest' for $399
Description: Facebook Inc  unveiled its new wireless virtual reality headset at a conference on Wednesday and said it plans to start shipping it in spring next year.

Headlines: Facebook, Google to tackle spread of fake news, advisors want more
Description: Facebook , Google  and other tech firms have agreed a code of conduct to do more to tackle the spread of fake news, due to concerns it can influence elections, the European Commission said on Wednesday.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook, Google to tackle spread of fake news, advisors want more
Description:
* Advisory group seeks more concrete action
(Adds advisory group comments)

Headlines: Vietnam jails another Facebook user for comments critical of government
Description: A court in Vietnam has jailed a Facebook user for 2-1/2 years over anti-government comments he posted on the social media website, police said on Thursday, as the Southeast Asian country continues its crackdown on dissent.

Headlines: Facebook says big breach exposed 50 million accounts to full takeover
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Friday that hackers stole digital login codes allowing them to take over nearly 50 million user accounts in its worst security breach ever given the unprecedented level of potential access, adding to what has been a difficult year for the company's reputation.

Headlines: Facebook's slide stalls Intel-led advance on Wall Street
Description: Wall Street ended flat on Friday as gains by Intel, real estate companies and utilities offset a drop in Facebook after the social media network disclosed a security breach.

Headlines: Exclusive: In test case, U.S. fails to force Facebook to wiretap Messenger calls - sources
Description: U.S. investigators failed in a recent courtroom effort to force Facebook to wiretap voice calls over its Messenger app in a closely watched test case, according to two people briefed on the sealed ruling.

Headlines: UK regulator to enquire if Facebook data breach has affected UK citizens
Description: The UK's Information Commissioner's Office said on Friday it will make enquiries with Facebook Inc  and other overseas regulators to find out if British citizens were affected by a security breach announced by the company earlier in the day.

Headlines: German antitrust watchdog eyes steps against Facebook this year
Description: The head of Germany's antitrust watchdog said on Monday he was "very optimistic" that his office would take action against Facebook  this year after finding it had abused its market dominance to gather data on people without their consent.

Headlines: Facebook says hackers did not use stolen logins on third-party sites
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday that investigators have determined that hackers did not access other sites that use the social networking site's single sign-on in a massive cyberattack that the company disclosed last week.

Headlines: Facebook says investigating if security flaw impacted Workplace app users
Description: Facebook Inc  said it was investigating if a security breach that it revealed last week had impacted users of its corporate chat app, Workplace.

Headlines: Dow closes at record but Facebook drags on S&P, Nasdaq
Description: The Dow hit a record closing high on Tuesday, but another drop in Facebook shares weighed on both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, driving both to finish in the red.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook's lead EU regulator opens probe into data breach
Description:
Facebook's lead regulator
in the European Union, the Irish Data Protection Commissioner
(DPC), on Wednesday began an investigation into a massive
cyberattack on the social networking site disclosed by the
company last week.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook Inc's Instagram back up after worldwide outage
Description:
Facebook Inc's photo-sharing social
network Instagram is back up for some users on Wednesday, after
suffering a worldwide outage days after it installed a new head
of the app.

Headlines: Woman sues Facebook, claims site enabled sex trafficking
Description: A Texas woman, claiming that she was raped, beaten and sex trafficked at the age of 15 by a pimp who posed as a Facebook "friend," has filed suit against the social network, alleging its executives knew minors were being lured into the sex trade on their platform.

Headlines: Facebook Inc's Instagram down for some users
Description:
Facebook Inc's Instagram app was
down on Wednesday for some users across several cities,
including London, San Francisco and Singapore.

Headlines: Facebook, responding to lawsuit, says sex trafficking banned on site
Description: Facebook said on Wednesday in response to a lawsuit accusing it of not doing enough to protect users from human traffickers that it works internally and externally to thwart such predators.

Headlines: Facebook debuts smart speaker for Messenger video calls
Description: Facebook Inc  on Monday released a smart speaker designed to ease video calls, but the company's history of privacy mishaps and the device's price and limited functionality could slow it from taking on market leaders Amazon.com Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook debuts smart speaker for Messenger video calls
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Monday released a smart speaker designed to ease video calls,
but the company's history of privacy mishaps and the device's
price and limited functionality could slow it from taking on
market leaders Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's
Google.

Headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp says has fixed video call security bug
Description: Facebook Inc's WhatsApp messenger service said on Wednesday it has fixed the latest bug on its platform that allowed hackers to take over users' applications when they answered an incoming video call.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook's WhatsApp says has fixed video call security bug
Description:
Facebook Inc's
WhatsApp messenger service said on Wednesday it has fixed the
latest bug on its platform that allowed hackers to take over
users' applications when they answered an incoming video call.

Headlines: Exclusive: Vietnam cyber law set for tough enforcement despite Google, Facebook pleas
Description: Vietnam is preparing to strictly enforce a new cybersecurity law requiring global technology companies to set up local offices and store data locally despite pleas from Facebook, Google and other firms, a government document showed.

Headlines: Facebook now says data breach affected 29 million users, details impact
Description: Cyber attackers stole data from 29 million Facebook accounts using an automated program that moved from one friend to the next, Facebook Inc  announced on Friday, as the social media company said its largest-ever data theft hit fewer than the 50 million profiles it initially reported.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook to ban misinformation on voting in upcoming U.S. elections
Description: Facebook Inc will ban false information about voting requirements and fact-check fake reports of violence or long lines at polling stations ahead of next month's U.S. midterm elections, company executives told Reuters, the latest effort to reduce voter manipulation on its service.

Headlines: Facebook to say who pays for UK political adverts
Description: Facebook said on Tuesday that it would require British political adverts posted on its pages to carry disclaimers and identity flags, in an attempt to crack down on the spread of misinformation.

Headlines: Facebook tentatively concludes spammers were behind recent data breach: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc  has tentatively concluded that spammers looking to make money, and not a nation-state, were behind the largest-ever data theft at the social media company, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: At Facebook, public funds join push to remove Zuckerberg as chairman
Description: Four major U.S. public funds that hold shares in Facebook Inc on Wednesday proposed removing Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg as chairman following several high-profile scandals and said they hoped to gain backing from larger asset managers.

Headlines: Brazil election battle rages over Facebook's WhatsApp
Description: Facebook Inc's  WhatsApp messaging service became the frontline in Brazil's bitter presidential campaign on Friday, as front-runner Jair Bolsonaro angrily denied accusations he had encouraged widespread misinformation campaigns on the platform.

Headlines: Facebook hires former UK deputy prime minister as head of global affairs
Description: Facebook Inc  has hired former British Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg to lead its global affairs and communications team, as the social network deals with a number of scandals related to privacy, fake news and election meddling.

Headlines: Facebook shuts accounts of marketing group in Brazil election
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it had removed 68 pages and 43 accounts associated with a Brazilian marketing group, Raposo Fernandes Associados (RFA), for violating the social media network's misrepresentation and spam policies.

Headlines: Oculus co-founder to leave Facebook
Description: VR headset maker Oculus co-founder Brendan Trexler Iribe is leaving Facebook Inc, according to his post on the social media network on Monday.

Headlines: Japan tells Facebook to improve data protection
Description: Japan's government on Monday told U.S. technology firm Facebook Inc  to better protect its users' personal data following lapses this year affecting tens of millions of people globally.

Headlines: Exxon, Ben & Jerry's among buyers of $256 million in political ads on Facebook
Description: Facebook Inc's new searchable database of U.S. political ads reveals that companies such as Exxon Mobil Corp, Ben & Jerry's and Penzeys Spices are cumulatively spending millions of dollars to encourage voting and influence how Americans vote.

Headlines: Despite Brazil election turmoil, Facebook stands by WhatsApp limits
Description: Facebook Inc's  messaging service WhatsApp has no plans to change its group messaging limits in Brazil, an executive said on Tuesday, resisting calls from the leading presidential candidate to allow easier forwarding of viral messages.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Despite Brazil election turmoil, Facebook stands by WhatsApp limits
Description:
Facebook Inc's
messaging service WhatsApp has no plans to change its group
messaging limits in Brazil, an executive said on Tuesday,
resisting calls from the leading presidential candidate to allow
easier forwarding of viral messages.

Headlines: Facebook launches searchable database for U.S. political ad spending
Description:
Facebook Inc on Tuesday unveiled a
searchable database that will provide information on spending by
advertisers for political ads and issues of national importance
in the run-up to the midterm elections.

Headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp says no plan to lift forwarding limit in Brazil
Description: Facebook Inc's popular messaging service WhatsApp has no plan to lift its limit on the number of people who can receive a forwarded message in Brazil, an executive for the company told reporters on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google, Facebook executives meet with UK government over no-deal Brexit: Telegraph
Description: The UK chiefs of Microsoft Corp , Facebook  and Alphabet Inc's  Google met with British government ministers in London on Wednesday to seek assurances over the impact of a no-deal Brexit on jobs and investment, the Telegraph reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook removes 8.7 million sexual photos of kids in last three months
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Wednesday that company moderators during the last quarter removed 8.7 million user images of child nudity with the help of previously undisclosed software that automatically flags such photos.

Headlines: Facebook, Twitter do not find Chinese meddling in 2018 U.S. elections: Bloomberg
Description: Social media companies Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc have not detected Chinese meddling in the 2018 U.S. elections, Bloomberg reported https://bloom.bg/2AqGNku on Wednesday, citing unnamed press representatives for both companies.

Headlines: UK regulator upholds Facebook fine in Cambridge Analytica row
Description: Britain's information regulator on Thursday upheld a small but symbolic 500,000 pound ($645,000) fine for Facebook for breaches of data protection law related to the harvesting of data by consultancy Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Facebook removes fake accounts tied to Iran that lured over 1 million followers
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Friday it had deleted accounts originating in Iran that attracted more than 1 million U.S. and British followers, its latest effort to combat disinformation activity on its platform.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook removes fake accounts tied to Iran that lured over 1 mln followers
Description:
Facebook Inc said on
Friday it had deleted accounts originating in Iran that
attracted more than 1 million U.S. and British followers, its
latest effort to combat disinformation activity on its platform.

Headlines: Facebook expects rising costs to combat scandals to moderate after 2019
Description: Facebook Inc  on Tuesday relieved investors by forecasting that margins would stop shrinking after 2019 as costs from scandals ease up, sending shares up despite a second-straight quarter with record-low user growth.

Headlines: UPDATE 6-Facebook expects rising costs to combat scandals to moderate after 2019
Description:
Facebook Inc on Tuesday relieved
investors by forecasting that margins would stop shrinking after
2019 as costs from scandals ease up, sending shares up despite a
second-straight quarter with record-low user growth.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Facebook's rise in profit outweighs slow user, sales growth
Description:
Facebook Inc on Tuesday beat
profit estimates but missed targets for growing monthly users
and reported its slowest revenue growth in about six years in a
quarter some investors feared would be hit harder by defections
from the social media site.

Headlines: Facebook misses estimates for monthly users, revenue
Description:
Facebook Inc on Tuesday missed
estimates for quarterly user growth and revenue but topped
profit expectations as the social network tries to recover from
privacy and content scandals.

Headlines: NBC, Fox News, Facebook pull Trump campaign ad linking immigration, crime
Description: NBC, Fox News and Facebook  pulled a campaign ad linking a caravan of Central American migrants and a cop killer, which U.S. President Donald Trump endorsed and CNN deemed "racist," the media companies said on Monday. The primetime TV ads on NBC, paid for by Donald J. Trump for President, ran during a "Sunday Night Football" broadcast.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-NBC, Fox News, Facebook pull Trump campaign ad linking immigration, crime
Description:
NBC, Fox News and Facebook
pulled a campaign ad linking a caravan of Central
American migrants and a cop killer, which U.S. President Donald

on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook's Cameroon problem: stop online hate stoking conflict
Description: A video link posted on Facebook on June 20 showed a man cooking human body parts in a pot over a wood fire.

Headlines: Facebook, Google tools reveal new political ad tactics
Description:
Public databases that shine
a light on online political ads - launched by Facebook
and Google before Tuesday's U.S. elections - offer the public
the first broad view of how quickly the companies yank
advertisements that break their rules.
The databases also provided campaigns unprecedented insight
into opponents' online marketing, enabling them to capitalize on
weaknesses, political strategists told Reuters.

Headlines: Facebook referred to EU watchdog over targeting, fake ads
Description: Britain's information watchdog has asked Facebook's lead European regulator to investigate how the company targets, monitors and shows adverts to users, saying it was concerned about some practices at the world's biggest social network.

Headlines: Facebook boots 115 accounts on eve of U.S. election after tip
Description: Facebook Inc blocked about 115 user accounts after U.S. authorities tipped it off to suspicious behavior that may be linked to a foreign entity, the company said in a blog post on Monday, hours before U.S. voters head to the polls.

Headlines: Facebook says human rights report shows it should do more in Myanmar
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday said a human rights report it commissioned on its presence in Myanmar showed it had not done enough to prevent its social network from being used to incite violence.

Headlines: UK data watchdog chief says Facebook must change, calls for more regulation
Description: The head of Britain's data watchdog said on Tuesday Facebook must significantly change how it does business and called for the social media giant to be subject to stricter regulation.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Facebook boots 115 accounts on eve of U.S. election after tip
Description:
Facebook Inc blocked
about 115 user accounts after U.S. authorities tipped it off to
suspicious behavior that may be linked to a foreign entity, the
company said in a blog post on Monday, hours before U.S. voters
head to the polls.

Headlines: Facebook blocks more accounts potentially linked to foreign entity
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it blocked more accounts, in addition to the about 115 accounts it blocked over the weekend, in the run up to the U.S. midterm elections that saw democrats capture U.S. House majority.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook blocks more accounts potentially linked to foreign entity
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it
blocked more accounts, in addition to the about 115 accounts it
blocked over the weekend, in the run up to the U.S. midterm
elections that saw democrats capture U.S. House majority.

Description: Public databases that shine a light on online political ads - launched by Facebook and Google before Tuesday's U.S. elections - offer the public the first broad view of how quickly the companies yank advertisements that break their rules.

The databases also provided campaigns unprecedented insight

Headlines: Facebook to quadruple size of Dublin international headquarters
Description: Facebook has taken on a long-term lease in Dublin which will quadruple the floor space at its international headquarters and allow the company to more than double its current staff of over 4,000.

Headlines: France to 'embed' regulators at Facebook to combat hate speech
Description: Facebook  will allow French regulators to "embed" inside the company to examine how it combats online hate speech, the first time the wary tech giant has opened its doors in such a way, President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker says Facebook cannot be trusted to regulate itself
Description: Democratic U.S. Representative David Cicilline, expected to become the next chairman of House Judiciary Committee's antitrust panel, said on Wednesday that Facebook Inc cannot be trusted to regulate itself and Congress should take action.

Headlines: Facebook defends Russia response, updates plan to curb misbehavior
Description: Facebook Inc  Chairman and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday defended his response to Russian election meddling on the world's largest social media network and issued a new plan aimed at stifling misbehavior while maintaining a vibrant hub for online speech.

Headlines: U.S. senator to query Facebook about report on treatment of critics
Description: A Democratic U.S. senator said on Thursday she will ask Facebook Inc  and the Justice Department about a media report that the company hired an outside firm to attack critics, warning that such action could raise campaign finance issues.

Headlines: Facebook to fund trainee local newspaper reporters in Britain
Description: Facebook is donating 4.5 million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to support communities that have lost local newspapers and reporters, in no little part due to ad revenue and readers switching online to the social media giant.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook to fund trainee local newspaper reporters in Britain
Description:
Facebook is donating 4.5
million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to
support communities that have lost local newspapers and
reporters, in no little part due to ad revenue and readers
switching online to the social media giant.

Description:
Facebook is donating 4.5
million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to
support communities that have lost local newspapers and
reporters, in no little part due to ad revenue and readers
switching online to the social media giant.

Headlines: Facebook sued by Russian firm linked to woman charged by U.S.
Description: A Russian company whose accountant was charged by federal prosecutors for attempting to meddle in U.S. elections sued Facebook Inc on Tuesday, claiming it is a legitimate news outlet and its Facebook account should be restored.

Headlines: Singapore lawmaker blasts Facebook over refusal to take down 'false' post
Description: A Singapore lawmaker hit out at Facebook  on Tuesday, saying it had reneged on a promise to help rein in fake news and calling for tougher regulations, which the social media firm has cautioned against.

Headlines: Former Facebook worker says firm not doing enough to deal with racial discrimination
Description: A former Facebook Inc  employee who worked closely with racial minority groups said in a blog post https://www.facebook.com/notes/mark-s-luckie/facebook-is-failing-its-black-employees-and-its-black-users/1931075116975013 on Tuesday that he left this month over frustration with the social network's "systematic disenfranchisement of underrepresented voices" and other diversity issues.

Headlines: Upended by frat boys: International lawmakers slam Facebook's effect on politics
Description: Facebook  came under fire on Tuesday from lawmakers from several countries who accused the firm of undermining democratic institutions and left out an empty chair for chief executive Mark Zuckerberg after he declined to be questioned.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Upended by frat boys: Lawmakers slam Facebook's effect on politics
Description:
* Democracy "upended by frat-boy billionaires", Canadian MP
says

Headlines: Lawmakers criticise Facebook's Zuckerberg for UK parliament no-show
Description:
Facebook came under fire
on Tuesday from lawmakers from several countries who accused the
firm of undermining democratic institutions and lambasted chief
executive Mark Zuckerberg for not answering questions on the
matter.

Headlines: U.S. rights groups seek secret documents in Facebook encryption case
Description: Two civil rights groups asked a judge on Wednesday to release documents describing a secret U.S. government effort to force Facebook Inc to decrypt voice conversations between users on its Messenger app.

Headlines: Fed up with Facebook, U.S. fund managers look for alternatives
Description: Facebook Inc's  losses are becoming other companies' gains.

Headlines: Facebook to check Indian political ads in build-up to vote
Description: Indian advertisers wanting to run political ads on Facebook will have to confirm their identity and location to help prevent abuse of the system in the build-up to national elections, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook CEO backed sharing customer data despite second thoughts: documents
Description: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg questioned the business case for giving millions of outside software developers wide access to customer data before endorsing the practice in 2012, according to internal emails published on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook to buy back additional $9 billion of shares
Description: Facebook Inc  will buy back an additional $9 billion of its shares, as it looks to pacify investors following a slump in its stock.

Headlines: Australian watchdog wants a regulator for dominant Google, Facebook
Description: Australia's competition watchdog on Monday recommended tougher scrutiny and a new regulatory body to check the dominance of tech giants Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google in the country's online advertising and news markets.

Headlines: Police sound 'all clear' after bomb threat at Facebook's Silicon Valley campus
Description: A bomb threat prompted authorities on Tuesday to evacuate a building at the Silicon Valley headquarters of Facebook Inc , police said, but gave the "all clear" after an hours-long search turned up no sign of a device.

Headlines: Irish regulator investigates Facebook over private photo glitch
Description: An Irish regulator said on Friday it was investigating Facebook Inc  following the company's disclosure that a bug may have exposed private photos of up to 6.8 million users, the latest in a series of Facebook privacy glitches.

Headlines: Facebook takes down more Myanmar accounts over military links
Description:
Facebook Inc has removed hundreds
of additional accounts, pages and groups in Myanmar from its
social networks after discovering what it called "coordinated
inauthentic behaviour" and links to the country's military.

Headlines: Facebook's Sandberg cites need to do more after reports of Russia meddling
Description: Facebook Inc's Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Tuesday the company needs to step up its efforts to curb misinformation after research revealed that Russia-backed organizations targeted African-Americans, who favored Hillary Clinton, to suppress voter turnout during the 2016 election.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop as data privacy fallout spreads
Description: Facebook Inc shares sank on Wednesday as concerns about its ability to safeguard user data sparked a government lawsuit, criticism in the U.S. Congress and a New York Times report on how it had shared data with other companies.

Headlines: Facebook says companies got access to data only after user permission
Description: Facebook Inc  said it did not give companies access to personal data of users without their permission, after the New York Times reported on Tuesday that the social network allowed some tech giants far greater access to data than it had disclosed.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook says companies got access to data only after user permission
Description:
Facebook Inc said it did not give
companies access to personal data of users without their
permission, after the New York Times reported on Tuesday that
the social network allowed some tech giants far greater access
to data than it had disclosed.

Headlines: Facebook says preferential data access was with user permission
Description:
Facebook Inc said it did not give
some companies access to people's data without their permission,
after the New York Times reported on Tuesday that the social
network allowed some large technology companies greater access
to user data.

Headlines: Facebook and Twitter remove pages and accounts in Bangladesh ahead of election
Description:
Facebook and Twitter
said on Thursday they had removed accounts and fake
news pages linked to the Bangladesh government which had posted
anti-opposition content, days ahead of an election in the South
Asian nation.

Headlines: Facebook shares could hit $160 in 2019: Citron
Description: Short-seller Citron Research on Wednesday backed Facebook Inc, saying the stock could hit $160 in 2019 as the company's revenue and user base have seen little impact from the reported data scandals and privacy issues this year.

Headlines: San Bernardino shooting lawsuits vs Facebook, Google, Twitter dismissed
Description: A federal judge has dismissed lawsuits seeking to hold Facebook , Google  and Twitter  liable to victims of the December 2015 mass shooting in San Bernardino, California for letting Islamic State flourish on their social media platforms.

Headlines: Intel working with Facebook on AI chip coming later this year
Description: Intel Corp said on Monday at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas that it is working with Facebook Inc to finish a new artificial intelligence chip in the second half of this year.

Headlines: Facebook CEO plans public debates about tech for 2019 personal challenge
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday he will host a series of public discussions about the future of technology in society as part of his personal challenge this year.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook propel Wall Street to three-week peak
Description: The S&P 500 jumped to a three-week high on Tuesday, led by Apple, Amazon, Facebook and industrial shares on bets that the United States and China would strike a deal to end their trade war.

Headlines: Facebook bans Philippines' Twinmark Media Enterprises
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Friday that
it has banned Twinmark Media Enterprises, a Philippine digital
marketing group.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook brings stricter ads rules to countries with big 2019 votes
Description: Facebook Inc told Reuters on Tuesday that it would extend some of its political advertising rules and tools for curbing election interference to India, Nigeria, Ukraine and the European Union before significant votes in the next few months.

Headlines: Facebook blocks accounts linked to Russian state-owned Sputnik
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday it had removed hundreds of Russia-initiated accounts, which it judged to be involved in coordinated inauthentic behavior on its platforms, including some linked to state-owned news agency Sputnik.

Headlines: U.S. regulators discuss fining Facebook for privacy violations: report
Description: U.S. regulators have met to discuss imposing a fine against Facebook Inc  for violating a legally binding agreement with the government to protect the privacy of personal data, the Washington Post reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the discussions.

Headlines: Facebook takes steps to prevent removed pages from duplicating content
Description: Facebook Inc will make changes to better prevent users who have had their organization's pages removed for violating its rules from using duplicate pages to continue the same activity, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Sandberg says Facebook must earn back trust
Description: Facebook Inc's  operations chief Sheryl Sandberg said on Wednesday that the world's largest social network needed to win back public trust after facing scandals for violating its users' privacy.

Headlines: Facebook's Instagram back up after partial outage
Description: Facebook Inc's photo-sharing social network Instagram said on Monday the service is fully functional now after an issue that caused an outage for some users was resolved.

Headlines: Facebook plans content oversight board, tightens paid ad rules
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday laid out plans for an independent content oversight board with the power to overturn company decisions on user posts, aimed at addressing concerns over misinformation and abusive behavior on the platform.

Headlines: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Facebook plans content oversight board, tightens paid ad rules
Description:
Facebook Inc on Monday
laid out plans for an independent content oversight board with
the power to overturn company decisions on user posts, aimed at
addressing concerns over misinformation and abusive behaviour on
the platform.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Twitter must do more against fake news: EU
Description: Google, Facebook, Twitter and Mozilla must do more to combat fake news as Europeans head towards an election or the companies will face the threat of regulatory action, the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Twitter must do more against fake news - EU
Description:
Google, Facebook
, Twitter and Mozilla must do more to combat fake
news as Europeans head towards an election or the companies will
face the threat of regulatory action, the European Commission
said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook keeps attracting digital ads, shares jump after hours
Description: Facebook Inc reported better-than-expected profit on Wednesday, showing that digital advertisers were still flocking to spend money on the service in order to reach customers even after a series of high profile embarrassments for the world's largest online social media network.

Headlines: UPDATE 4-Facebook keeps attracting digital ads, shares jump after hours
Description:
Facebook Inc reported
better-than-expected profit on Wednesday, showing that digital
advertisers were still flocking to spend money on the service in
order to reach customers even after a series of high profile
embarrassments for the world's largest online social media
network.

Headlines: Apple bans Facebook from tech tools for tracking teen browsing habits
Description: Apple Inc  said on Wednesday it had banned Facebook Inc  from a program designed to let businesses control iPhones used by their employees, saying the social networking company had improperly used it to track the web-browsing habits of teenagers.

Headlines: Facebook quarterly profit, revenue beat estimates
Description:
Facebook Inc topped analysts'
estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Wednesday, helped
by growth in its Instagram business and a steady rise in
advertising spending by companies.

Headlines: Facebook likely to face two more state probes on privacy issues: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc could be subjected to at least two more state probes in the United States on the alleged mishandling of user data, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook removes more accounts tied to Iran
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it removed pages, groups and accounts tied to Iran for using and coordinating fake accounts.

Headlines: Facebook shares rise as products back in focus after strong fourth quarter
Description: After 18 months of distraction defending itself over privacy and its role as a platform for electoral manipulation, Facebook Inc is focusing squarely on products after its strong fourth-quarter results won back investors, who sent its shares up nearly 12 percent on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook takes down hundreds of Indonesian accounts linked to fake news syndicate
Description: Facebook Inc has removed hundreds of Indonesian accounts, pages and groups from its social network after discovering they were linked to an online group accused of spreading hate speech and fake news.

Headlines: Facebook targets 'dangerous' armed groups in latest Myanmar bans
Description: Facebook has banned four insurgent groups fighting against Myanmar's military from its social network, the company said on Tuesday, saying it wanted to prevent offline harm by removing groups it branded "dangerous organisations".

Headlines: Germany to restrict Facebook's data gathering activities
Description: Facebook has been ordered to curb its data collection practices in Germany after a landmark ruling on Thursday that the world's largest social network abused its market dominance to gather information about users without their consent.

Headlines: German minister welcomes cartel office's clampdown on Facebook data collection
Description: German Justice Minister Katarina Barley on Thursday welcomed a crackdown by Germany's antitrust watchdog on Facebook's data collection practices, saying the company was collecting data far beyond its platform.

Headlines: German cartel office concerned by reports Facebook to merge apps
Description: Facebook's reported plans to merge the infrastructure of its Messenger, WhatsApp and Instagram services would, if implemented, face antitrust scrutiny in Germany, the head of the Federal Cartel Office said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. judge keeps documents secret in Facebook encryption case
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday rejected a bid by two civil rights groups that had sought to force the release of documents describing a secret U.S. government effort to compel Facebook Inc to decrypt voice conversations between users on its Messenger app.

Headlines: As Indian election looms, Facebook steps up fact-checks
Description: Facebook Inc is expanding its fact-checking network in India to curb the spread of misinformation as the world's largest democracy prepares for a general election that must be held by May, the U.S.-based social media giant said on Monday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-As Indian election looms, Facebook steps up fact-checks
Description:
Facebook Inc is expanding
its fact-checking network in India to curb the spread of
misinformation as the world's largest democracy prepares for a
general election that must be held by May, the U.S.-based social
media giant said on Monday.

Headlines: Indian lawmakers urged to summon global heads of Facebook, other tech giants
Description: Indian activists have petitioned a parliamentary panel to summon the heads of U.S. tech firms including Facebook and Alphabet Inc's Google and question them on issues ranging from tax compliance to data privacy.

Headlines: U.S. negotiating multibillion-dollar fine with Facebook: report
Description: The U.S. government and Facebook Inc are negotiating a settlement over the company's privacy lapses that could require the online social network to pay a multibillion-dollar fine, the Washington Post reported on Thursday.

Headlines: French TV cuts Facebook live feed from Jewish cemetery after anti-Semitic abuse
Description: A French TV channel said on Wednesday it had been forced to cut short a live Facebook broadcast from a desecrated Jewish cemetery in eastern France because of an onslaught of anti-Semitic commentary.

Headlines: EU's Vestager says not precluding Facebook case in future
Description: Facebook is not currently in EU regulators' crosshairs but it may well be in future because of the crucial role played by data, Europe's antitrust chief said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook meeting shows challenges ahead for proposed 'oversight board'
Description: Facebook's new effort to bring outside experts into its content review process promises to be complicated and possibly contentious, if discussions this week at a meeting in Singapore are any indication.

Headlines: EU countries back copyright reforms aimed at Google, Facebook
Description: European Union countries on Wednesday endorsed an overhaul of the bloc's copyright rules which would force Google and Facebook Inc to pay publishers for news snippets and filter out copyright-protected content on YouTube or Instagram.

Headlines: Democratic senators urge FTC to act on Facebook 'friendly fraud' practices
Description: Two Democratic U.S. senators called for the Federal Trade Commission to act on a complaint filed by consumer groups against Facebook Inc on Thursday that alleged the company scammed children into spending money on its platform.

Headlines: Indian lawmakers summon Facebook officials over citizens' rights protection
Description: An Indian parliamentary panel has summoned representatives of Facebook Inc, its messaging services WhatsApp and photo-sharing app Instagram to appear before it early next month and discuss how to safeguard citizens' rights on social media.

Headlines: UK cannot examine Facebook until it has clarity on Brexit timing: CMA
Description: Britain's competition regulator cannot take a decision on whether to investigate Facebook's role in advertising and data until it has better clarity on the timing of Brexit and how to work with the European Union, its CEO said.

Headlines: Facebook will introduce 'clear history' tool this year: CFO
Description: Facebook Inc will introduce a tool allowing users to clear their browsing history this year, which will affect the company's ability to target advertisements, Chief Financial Officer David Wehner told an investment conference on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook Watch to broadcast El Clasico live and free in India
Description: Fans in India will be able to watch Sunday's El Clasico between Real Madrid and Barcelona live and free on Facebook Watch, the social media giant's streaming platform, La Liga has said.

Headlines: Soccer-Facebook Watch to broadcast El Clasico live and free in India
Description: Fans in India will be able to watch Sunday's El Clasico between Real Madrid and Barcelona live and free on Facebook Watch, the social media giant's streaming platform, La Liga has said.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Twitter fail to live up to fake news pledge
Description: Google, Facebook and Twitter have fallen short of their pledges to combat fake news, three months before key European elections, the European Commission said on Thursday.

Headlines: First Facebook investigation to be completed by summer: regulator
Description: Facebook's lead regulator in the European Union expects to conclude the first of seven investigations into the company's use of personal data this summer and the remainder by the end of the year, Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner said on Thursday.

Headlines: Some Facebook content reviewers in India complain of low pay, high pressure
Description: On a busy day, contract employees in India monitoring nudity and pornography on Facebook and Instagram will each view 2,000 posts in an eight-hour shift, or almost four a minute.

Headlines: Facebook rejects Australian regulator's push for scrutiny of news feeds
Description: Facebook Inc has rejected an Australian regulator's recommendation for greater scrutiny over the social network's advertising market power and the ranking of news articles in customers' feeds.

Headlines: Zuckerberg says Facebook's future is going big on private chats
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday the company would encrypt conversations on more of its messaging services and make them compatible, the latest sign that the world's biggest social network sees its future in intimate online chats.

Headlines: Facebook takes down UK fake accounts; to tackle anti-vaccine info
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it had removed 137 fake pages, groups and Instagram accounts in the United Kingdom and a further 31 in Romania for engaging in hate speech and making divisive comments.

Headlines: UK needs to meet Facebook, Google competition with new rules: report
Description: Britain needs to overhaul its competition rules to tackle the dominance of tech giants like Facebook, Google and Amazon, and increase consumer choice, a government review said on Wednesday.

Headlines: In Indonesia, Facebook and Twitter are 'buzzer' battlegrounds as elections loom
Description: Almost every day, "Janda", a self-described Indonesian housewife with 2,000 Twitter followers, dispenses lifestyle tips, complains about city life, and praises how the government of  President Joko Widodo has improved her life as a young mother.

Headlines: Facebook product chief Cox to exit as focus shifts to messaging
Description: Facebook Inc's chief product officer and one of its earliest employees, Chris Cox, said on Thursday he is leaving the company just days after Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg revealed a plan to transform the world's biggest social network into an encryption-focused messaging company.

Headlines: Facebook restores services after global outage
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it had restored service to its main app and Instagram, after the world's largest social network suffered a major outage that frustrated users across the globe for about 24 hours.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook restores services after global outage
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Thursday it
had restored service to its main app and Instagram, after the
world's largest social network suffered a major outage that
frustrated users across the globe for about 24 hours.

Headlines: U.S. prosecutors probing Facebook's data deals: New York Times
Description: U.S. federal prosecutors are conducting a criminal investigation into data deals Facebook Inc struck with some of the world's largest technology companies, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: 17 minutes of carnage: how New Zealand gunman broadcast his killings on Facebook
Description: A gunman who killed 49 people at two New Zealand mosques live-streamed the attacks on Facebook for 17 minutes using an app designed for extreme sports enthusiasts, with copies still being shared on social media hours later.

Headlines: Facebook shares drop as executives quit, Christchurch live-stream shooting stirs outrage
Description: Shares of Facebook Inc fell as much as 5 percent on Friday to their lowest in nearly three months after the surprise departure of Chief Product Officer Chris Cox, at a time when the company is again being scrutinized over its handling of privacy, extremism and political content.

Headlines: Facebook readies AI tech to combat 'revenge porn'
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it would use artificial intelligence to combat the spread of intimate photos shared without people's permission, sometimes called "revenge porn," on its social networks.

Headlines: Facebook plans more fact-checking ahead of European Parliament election
Description: Facebook plans to ramp up efforts to fight misinformation ahead of the European Parliament election in May and will partner with German news agency DPA to boost its fact-checking, a senior executive said on Monday.

Headlines: Lithuanian pleads guilty in U.S. to massive fraud against Google, Facebook
Description: A Lithuanian man on Wednesday pleaded guilty to U.S. charges that he helped orchestrate a scheme to defraud Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google out of more than $100 million, federal prosecutors announced.

Headlines: Facebook agrees to advertising overhaul to settle U.S. discrimination suits
Description: Facebook Inc has agreed to change its paid advertising platform as part of a wide-ranging settlement to prevent discriminatory and "harmful" practices, the company and U.S. civil rights groups said on Tuesday.

Headlines: German minister on Facebook password glitch: Didn't expect such frightening unprofessionalism
Description: Germany's Justice Minister on Friday said she would hardly have expected such "frightening unprofessionalism" from Facebook after the company acknowledged a glitch that exposed passwords of millions of users to its employees.

Headlines: Facebook fixes glitch that exposed millions of user passwords to employees
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it has resolved a glitch that exposed passwords of millions of users stored in readable format within its internal systems to its employees.

Headlines: EU lawmakers back copyright reforms targeting Google, Facebook
Description: EU lawmakers have endorsed an overhaul of the bloc's two-decade old copyright rules, which will force Google and Facebook Inc to pay publishers for use of news snippets and make them filter out protected content.

Headlines: Facebook removes accounts from Russia, Iran for 'coordinated inauthentic behavior'
Description: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it has removed more accounts from Iran, Russia, Macedonia and Kosovo, citing what it described as "coordinated inauthentic behavior."

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook removes accounts from Russia, Iran for "coordinated inauthentic behavior"
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it
has removed more accounts from Iran, Russia, Macedonia and
Kosovo, citing what it described as "coordinated inauthentic
behavior."

Headlines: French Muslim group sues Facebook, YouTube over footage of Christchurch massacre
Description: One of the main groups representing Muslims in France said on Monday it was suing Facebook and YouTube, accusing them of inciting violence by allowing the streaming of footage of the Christchurch massacre on their platforms.

Headlines: U.S. charges Facebook with racial discrimination in targeted housing ads
Description: The Trump administration accused Facebook Inc on Thursday of selling targeted advertising that discriminated on the basis of race, in violation of the U.S. Fair Housing Act.

Headlines: New Zealand PM welcomes Facebook bans on white nationalism, separatism
Description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Thursday that she welcomed Facebook Inc's decision to ban praise, support and representation of white nationalism and white separatism on its social media platforms.

Headlines: Facebook bans white nationalism, white separatism on its platforms
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday banned praise, support and representation of white nationalism and white separatism, a move that drew qualified approval from New Zealand where a massacre of 50 people in mosques was live streamed earlier this month.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook looks to place restrictions on who can go live after Christchurch attack
Description:
Facebook Inc Chief Operating
Officer Sheryl Sandberg said on Friday the company was looking
to place restrictions on who can go live on its platform based
on certain criteria in the aftermath of the Christchurch
massacre.

Headlines: Facebook removes online network in Philippines over 'inauthentic behavior'
Description: Facebook Inc has removed a social media network in the Philippines for "coordinated inauthentic behavior", and took the unusual step of linking it to a businessman who said he had managed the president's online election campaign in 2016.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook removes online network in Philippines over "inauthentic behaviour"
Description:
* Accounts were involved in "coordinated inauthentic
behavior"

Headlines: Facebook blocks 200 accounts in Philippines
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Thursday
the company removed 200 pages, groups and accounts on Facebook
and Instagram in the Philippines, citing "coordinated
inauthentic behavior".

Headlines: Facebook's news page to help publishers make money: Zuckerberg
Description: Facebook Inc plans to create a separate news page on its platform where publishers will be able to make money, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook deletes accounts linked to India's Congress party, Pakistan military
Description: Facebook has deleted 712 accounts and 390 pages in India and Pakistan for "inauthentic behavior", it said on Monday, many linked to India's opposition Congress party days before a national election, and others related to Pakistan's military.

Headlines: Facebook's news page to help publishers make money -Zuckerberg
Description:
Facebook Inc plans to create a
separate news page on its platform where publishers will be able
to make money, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on
Monday.

Headlines: Facebook removes accounts linked to Pakistani military employees
Description: Facebook has removed 103 pages, groups and accounts that were part of a network it said was linked to employees of the Pakistani military's public relations arm, the social media group announced on Monday.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook removes accounts linked to Pakistani military employees
Description:
Facebook has removed 103
pages, groups and accounts that were part of a network it said
was linked to employees of the Pakistani military's public
relations arm, the social media group announced on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook removes exposed user records stored on Amazon's servers
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday that it removed public databases containing its user data on Amazon.com Inc's cloud servers after cybersecurity firm UpGuard discovered  millions of exposed records.

Headlines: Facebook's ads system leans on stereotypes for housing, job ads: study
Description: Facebook Inc directs advertising to audiences in ways that could promote racial and gender discrimination, a new study showed, adding to allegations that prompted the U.S. government to sue the world's largest social media company last week.
