Description:
Facebook Inc on Wednesday changed
the privacy settings on its WhatsApp messaging platform,
allowing users to decide who can add them to chat groups, as it
tries to revamp its image after growing privacy concerns among
users.

Headlines: Facebook vows to block foreign ad-buying during Australia's election
Description:
Social media giant Facebook Inc
said on Friday it would block electoral advertisements
purchased outside Australia from being displayed there ahead of
a national election due in May.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg confident of stopping interference in 2020 campaign
Description:
Facebook Inc's Chief Executive
Officer Mark Zuckerberg is confident the world's biggest social
network will do better in 2020 at stopping "bad actors" from
manipulating the U.S. presidential election.

Headlines: Facebook promises crackdown on fake news in Australia
Description: Social media giant Facebook Inc said on Friday it would strengthen measures to fight fake news in Australia and briefly block foreigners from buying political advertisements in the lead-up to a national election due in a few weeks.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Facebook promises crackdown on fake news in Australia
Description:
* Facebook bans foreign political ads during election
campaign

Headlines: Facebook says has made headway against abuses ahead of India election
Description: Facebook has said it has made strides in its efforts to prevent online abuses in the Indian national election that starts this week but acknowledged that gaps remain in its "election integrity" efforts.

Headlines: Facebook to clearly explain how it uses consumer data: EU
Description: Facebook has bowed to pressure from the European Commission and consumer authorities by revising its terms, making it clear what it does with users' data and taking responsibility when data has been mishandled by third parties.

Headlines: Facebook, Google accused of anti-conservative bias at U.S. Senate hearing
Description: Republican senators on Wednesday said Alphabet Inc's Google, Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc  discriminate against conservative viewpoints and suppress free speech, suggesting anti-trust action could be a solution.

Headlines: Facebook spends $22.6 million to keep Mark Zuckerberg safe
Description: Facebook Inc more than doubled the money it spent on Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2018 to $22.6 million, a regulatory filing showed on Friday.

Headlines: EU copyright revamp targeting Google, Facebook set for approval on Monday
Description: EU countries are set to agree an overhaul of the bloc's two-decade old copyright rules next week, requiring Google to pay publishers for news snippets and Facebook to filter out protected content, despite increasing opposition from some governments.

Headlines: Russia finds Facebook failed to provide information on data-agencies
Description: A court in Russia fined Facebook on Friday for failing to tell authorities where it stores Russian user data, Russian news agencies reported, a ruling that highlights wrangling between tech giants and Moscow as it ramps up Internet controls.

Headlines: EU approves tougher EU copyright rules in blow to Google, Facebook
Description: Google will have to pay publishers for news snippets and Facebook filter out protected content under new copyright rules aimed at ensuring fair compensation for the European Union's $1 trillion creative industries.

Headlines: Russia: Twitter, Facebook have nine months to comply with data law - Ifax
Description: Twitter and Facebook have nine months to comply with data law by moving Russian user data onto servers in Russia, Interfax cited communications watchdog head Alexander Zharov as saying on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook working on voice assistant to rival Amazon's Alexa
Description: Facebook Inc is working to develop a voice assistant to rival the likes of Amazon.com Inc's Alexa, Apple Inc's Siri and Alphabet Inc's Google Assistant.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook working on voice assistant to rival Amazon's Alexa
Description:
Facebook Inc is working to
develop a voice assistant to rival the likes of Amazon.com Inc's
Alexa, Apple Inc's Siri and Alphabet Inc's
Google Assistant.

Headlines: EU unfair practices digital rules put spotlight on Google, Amazon, Facebook
Description: Google and Amazon will have to tell companies how they rank products on their platforms while Facebook and other tech firms will have to be more transparent about their terms and conditions under new EU rules approved on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook says it uploaded email contacts of up to 1.5 million users
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it may have "unintentionally uploaded" email contacts of 1.5 million new users since May 2016, in what seems to be the latest privacy-related issue faced by the social media company.

Headlines: Facebook hires State Department lawyer as general counsel
Description: Facebook Inc on Monday named the legal adviser to the U.S. State Department as its general counsel, as the social media giant faces growing regulatory hurdles and privacy concerns.

Headlines: Facebook's flood of languages leave it struggling to monitor content
Description: Facebook Inc's struggles with hate speech and other types of problematic content are being hampered by the company's inability to keep up with a flood of new languages as mobile phones bring social media to every corner of the globe.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Twitter have to do more to fight fake news: EU
Description: Google, Facebook and Twitter have to do more to tackle fake news ahead of key European Parliament elections next month, the European Commission said on Tuesday, as its latest report showed a lack of progress in some areas.

Description:

content are being hampered by the company's inability to keep up

Description:
Facebook Inc's
struggles with hate speech and other types of problematic
content are being hampered by the company's inability to keep up
with a flood of new languages as mobile phones bring social
media to every corner of the globe.

Headlines: UPDATE 3-Facebook beats profit estimates, sets aside $3 bln for privacy penalty
Description:
Facebook Inc on Wednesday blew
past Wall Street profit estimates in the first quarter and set
aside $3 billion to cover a settlement with U.S. regulators,
calming investors who had worried about the outcome of a
months-long federal probe.

Headlines: REFILE-Facebook revenue jumps as U.S. privacy penalty looms
Description:
Facebook Inc beat analysts'
estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, aided by growth in
its Instagram business and a surge in advertising spending by
companies while also warning it could face up to $5 billion in
losses related to an official U.S. privacy investigation.

Headlines: Facebook users care less about privacy than regulators
Description: Facebook Inc is preparing for a record-setting fine from U.S. regulators over privacy issues, but Wall Street shrugged at the looming penalty after the company added users and trounced profit expectations for the first quarter.

Headlines: Facebook files lawsuit against New Zealand company, three people
Description: U.S. social media giant Facebook Inc on Thursday said it has filed a lawsuit in U.S. Federal court, against a company and three people in New Zealand, alleging the sale of fake engagement services on its Instagram photo-sharing platform.

Headlines: New York investigating Facebook over storage of 'unauthorized' email contacts
Description: New York Attorney General Letitia James said on Thursday she is investigating Facebook Inc's unauthorized storage of up to 1.5 million Facebook users' email contact databases, the latest privacy issue to affect the U.S. social media giant.

Headlines: Canada watchdog to seek court order to force Facebook to follow privacy laws
Description: Facebook Inc broke Canadian privacy laws when it collected the information of some 600,000 citizens, a top watchdog said on Thursday, pledging to seek a court order to force the social media giant to change its practices.

Headlines: Irish regulator opens inquiry into Facebook over password storage
Description: Facebook's lead regulator in the European Union, Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner, on Thursday said it had launched an inquiry into whether the company violated EU data rules by saving user passwords in plain text format on internal servers.

Headlines: Facebook beats profit estimates, sets aside $3 billion for privacy penalty
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday blew past Wall Street profit estimates in the first quarter and set aside $3 billion to cover a settlement with U.S. regulators, calming investors who had worried about the outcome of a months-long federal probe.

Headlines: Facebook overhauls design as it pivots to private messaging
Description: Facebook Inc debuted an overhaul of its core social network on Tuesday, taking its first concrete steps to refashion itself into a private messaging and e-commerce company as it tries to move past scandals while tapping new revenue sources.

Headlines: Facebook redesigns app, rolls out dating service to 14 more countries
Description: Facebook Inc on Tuesday unveiled a redesigned app and rolled out its dating feature to 14 more countries as it tries to boost user-engagement on its social network.

Headlines: UPDATE 5-Facebook overhauls design as it pivots to private messaging
Description:
Facebook Inc
debuted an overhaul of its core social network on Tuesday,
taking its first concrete steps to refashion itself into a
private messaging and e-commerce company as it tries to move
past scandals while tapping new revenue sources.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg says working on to make Messenger faster, smaller
Description:
Facebook Inc's Chief Executive
Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Tuesday the social media company
is working on "LightSpeed" in order to make its Messenger app
smaller in size and faster.

Headlines: Facebook's settlement with U.S. regulators likely to include WhatsApp: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc's potential settlement with U.S. regulators over breaches of consumer data privacy is nearing completion, and the agreement will likely include its WhatsApp messaging service, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook settlement with U.S. may include privacy oversight: Politico
Description: Facebook Inc and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) are negotiating a possible settlement that would require the company to create an independent privacy oversight committee and take other steps to safeguard users, Politico reported on Wednesday, citing a source.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers criticize potential Facebook settlement with FTC
Description: Two U.S. senators on Monday criticized reported plans for a Federal Trade Commission settlement with Facebook Inc for misuse of consumers' personal data, saying that top officials, potentially including founder Mark Zuckerberg, must be held personally responsible.

Headlines: Facebook 'labels' posts by hand, posing privacy questions
Description: Over the past year, a team of as many as 260 contract workers in Hyderabad, India has ploughed through millions of Facebook Inc photos, status updates and other content posted since 2014.

Headlines: Factbox: The work at one Facebook 'labeling' project
Description: Facebook Inc has thousands of content labelers around the world who categorize content with the aim of creating large datasets that can be more readily analyzed by humans and software.

Headlines: Facebook executive meets with U.S. lawmakers to discuss privacy
Description: With a multibillion-dollar settlement looming for Facebook over user privacy violations, Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg met with U.S. lawmakers on Capitol Hill on Tuesday to discuss legislation to protect users of the social network, officials said.

Headlines: Explainer: What would it take for U.S. regulators to break up Facebook?
Description: Facebook Inc co-founder and Mark Zuckerberg's former college roommate Chris Hughes urged U.S. regulators to break up the social media company in a New York Times opinion piece on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook rejects co-founder call for breakup, senator urges U.S. antitrust probe
Description: Facebook Inc quickly rejected a call from co-founder Chris Hughes on Thursday to split the world's largest social media company in three, while lawmakers urged the U.S. Justice Department to launch an antitrust investigation.

Headlines: Turkish watchdog says it fines Facebook $271,000 for data breach
Description: Turkey's Personal Data Protection Authority (KVKK) said on Friday it had fined Facebook a total of 1.65 million lira ($270,976.01) in April due to a data breach.

Headlines: Facebook facing 20-year consent agreement after privacy lapses: source
Description: The social media giant Facebook Inc is headed toward an agreement with the U.S. government over its privacy policies and practices that would put it under 20 years of oversight, according to a source knowledgeable about the discussions.

Headlines: Facebook raises minimum wage for U.S. contract workers to $20/hour
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it was raising its minimum wage for all U.S. contract workers, reacting to rising costs of living as it faces intense scrutiny over the treatment of ordinary employees and their pay.

Headlines: Facebook restricts Live feature, White House snubs call for New Zealand shooting response
Description: Facebook announced steps on Wednesday to temporarily block users who break its rules from broadcasting live video, in the wake of an international outcry after a gunman killed 51 people in New Zealand last month and streamed the attack live on his page.

Headlines: Facebook says removes 265 'fake accounts' linked to Israel
Description: Facebook said on Thursday it had removed 265 Facebook and Instagram accounts, pages, groups and events linked to Israel due to what it called "inauthentic behavior" targeting users in Southeast Asia, Latin America and Africa.

Headlines: CORRECTED-Facebook says removes 265 "fake accounts" linked to Israel
Description:
Facebook said on
Thursday it had removed 265 Facebook and Instagram accounts,
pages, groups and events linked to Israel due to what it called
"inauthentic behaviour" targeting users in Southeast Asia, Latin
America and Africa.

Headlines: Facebook forms Swiss fintech firm with payments focus
Description: Facebook has set up a new financial technology company in Switzerland focusing on blockchain and payments as well as data analytics and investing, Geneva's commercial register shows.

Headlines: Facebook breakup would be solution of last resort: EU's Vestager
Description: A break-up of U.S. social media company Facebook would be a solution of last resort that would probably generate long judicial procedures, EU Competition Commissioner Margrethe Vestager said on Friday.

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Twitter rapped for not doing enough in EU fake news fight
Description: Facebook, Google and Twitter were reprimanded by the European Commission on Friday for not doing enough to tackle fake news plaguing the election campaign to the European Parliament, seven months after promising to do more.

Headlines: Facebook increased Vietnam content restrictions by 500% during 2018 - report
Description: Facebook increased the amount of content it restricted access to in Vietnam by over 500% in the last half of 2018, the U.S. social media giant said in a report released on Friday, as the Southeast Asian country ramps up its crackdown on online dissent.

Headlines: Canadian lawmakers fume after Facebook's Zuckerberg snubs invitation
Description: Canadian lawmakers fumed on Tuesday when Facebook Inc founder and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg snubbed an invitation to Ottawa to testify on privacy and democracy before an international panel, slapping the billionaire with a standing summons.

Headlines: Inflatable angry emoji looms over Facebook annual meeting as users vent frustrations
Description: Protesters carrying an inflatable angry emoji greeted Facebook Inc shareholders as they gathered for the company's annual meeting on Thursday, the latest sign of its struggle to shake off privacy scandals and rein in fake news and hate speech.

Headlines: Refusal to remove video shows Facebook enabled Russian election meddling: Pelosi
Description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Wednesday that Facebook Inc's refusal to remove a heavily edited video that attempted to make her look incoherent had convinced her the company knowingly enabled Russian election interference.

Headlines: Facebook ordered by U.S. judge to turn over data privacy records
Description: A U.S. judge ordered Facebook Inc to give shareholders emails and other records concerning how the social media company handles data privacy, after data for 87 million users was accessed by the British political consulting firm Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook ordered by U.S. judge to turn over data privacy records
Description:
A U.S. judge ordered Facebook Inc
to give shareholders emails and other records concerning how the
social media company handles data privacy, after data for 87
million users was accessed by the British political consulting
firm Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: U.S. judge orders Facebook to turn over data privacy records
Description:
A U.S. judge ordered Facebook Inc
to give shareholders emails and other records concerning how the
social media company handles data privacy, after data for an
estimated 87 million users was accessed by the British political
consulting firm Cambridge Analytica.

Headlines: Irish Supreme Court rejects Facebook bid to block ECJ data case
Description: The European Court of Justice (ECJ) will hear a landmark privacy case regarding the transfer of EU citizens' data to the United States in July, after Facebook's bid to stop its referral was blocked by Ireland's Supreme Court on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook keeps three-yearly 'say on pay' vote, amid outside investor doubts
Description: Facebook Inc investors will only get to vote on the pay of Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg every three years, rather than annually as most outside shareholders would prefer, according to a vote tally released by the world's largest social media company late on Monday, following its annual meeting last week.

Headlines: Apple touts privacy in web sign-on war with Facebook, Google
Description: Apple Inc on Monday launched a "Sign In With Apple" function to rival Facebook and Google web login accounts, drawing a contrast with rivals by stressing protection of users' information.

Headlines: Nasdaq confirms correction as Facebook, Alphabet, Amazon drag
Description: The Nasdaq tumbled 1.6% on Monday, confirming a correction as it was dragged down by Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.com on fears the companies are the targets of U.S. government antitrust regulators.

Headlines: FTC wins right for competition probe at Facebook: WSJ
Description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has secured the right to examine how Facebook Inc's practices affect its digital competition, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

Headlines: Apple asks developers to place its login button above Google, Facebook
Description: Apple Inc will ask developers to position a new "Sign on with Apple" button in iPhone and iPad apps above rival buttons from Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc, according to design guidelines released this week.

Headlines: Facebook investors seek independent chair, citing vote tally
Description: Public pension fund leaders on Tuesday called for separating the chairman and chief executive officer positions at Facebook Inc, both held by co-founder Mark Zuckerberg, citing a vote that showed strong support for the idea among outside investors in the world's largest social media company.

Headlines: Facebook may be ordered to remove duplicates of illegal posts worldwide: EU court adviser
Description: Facebook may be ordered to track down all posts duplicating content it has been told to remove by an EU court, an adviser to the European Union's top court said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Dutch 'Big Brother' creator sues Facebook over fake Bitcoin ads
Description: Dutch billionaire John de Mol filed a lawsuit against Facebook on Wednesday for allowing fake ads on its platform which used his name and image to perpetrate Bitcoin-related fraud.

Headlines: Facebook met with Dutch regulators over ad fraud: lawyer
Description: Facebook is in talks with Dutch regulators about how to stop criminals who place advertisements for scam products on the internet company's platform, a lawyer said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Google, Facebook have tight grip on growing U.S. online ad market: report
Description: The U.S. internet advertising industry is projected to hit $160 billion by 2023 from $107 billion last year, led by fast-growing categories like mobile video with Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc firmly controlling the market, consultancy PwC said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Russia to decide on Twitter, Facebook compliance with data law in Jan: TASS
Description: Russia's communications watchdog Roskomnadzor hopes to make a decision in January on how to force Twitter and Facebook to move its Russian user data onto servers inside the country, the TASS news agency quoted its head as saying on Thursday.

Headlines: Exclusive: Facebook suspends app pre-installs on Huawei phones
Description: Facebook Inc is no longer allowing pre-installation of its apps on Huawei phones, the latest blow for the Chinese tech giant as it struggles to keep its business afloat in the face of a U.S. ban on its purchase of American parts and software.

Headlines: Facebook to unveil new versions of Portal video chat devices this autumn
Description: Facebook Inc plans to release new versions of its Portal video chatting devices this autumn, the company's vice president of AR/VR, Andrew Bosworth, said during an interview at the Code Conference in Scottsdale, Arizona.

Headlines: Facebook CEO may have known of questionable privacy practices: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc emails appear to show Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg's involvement in discussions about its much criticized privacy practices, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: ProSieben signs cooperation with Facebook to share clips on video platform
Description: ProSiebenSat.1 Media said on Wednesday it had signed a cooperation agreement with arch-rival Facebook to post program clips on video platform Facebook Watch as the German broadcaster seeks to reach a younger audience.

Headlines: Facebook to create 500 jobs in new London engineering center
Description: Facebook will create 500 new tech jobs in London by the end of 2019, including 100 roles in artificial intelligence, with many working on systems to detect and remove malicious content, fake accounts and harmful behavior, it said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook's cryptocurrency-based payments system gets big backers: WSJ
Description: Facebook Inc has enlisted more than a dozen companies including Visa Inc, Mastercard Inc, PayPal Holdings Inc and Uber Technologies Inc to back its new cryptocurrency, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook to buy stake in Indian e-commerce start-up Meesho
Description: Facebook is buying a stake in Indian e-commerce start-up Meesho, the head of the U.S. tech giant's Indian business said on Thursday, looking to deepen its reach in one of the world's biggest internet markets.

Headlines: Facebook's cryptocurrency ambitions face privacy concerns, political backlash
Description: Facebook Inc announced ambitious plans on Tuesday to launch a new global cryptocurrency called Libra, part of an effort to expand into digital payments that immediately raised privacy concerns.

Headlines: U.S. lawmaker calls for Facebook to pause cryptocurrency project
Description: A leading U.S. House lawmaker on Tuesday called on Facebook Inc to halt development on its new cryptocurrency and for company executives to testify before Congress, adding to global concerns about what the digital currency could mean for data privacy and security.

Headlines: Senior U.S. lawmaker says Facebook should halt cryptocurrency project pending review
Description: U.S. House Financial Services Committee Chairwoman Maxine Waters said Tuesday that Facebook Inc should halt development of its announced cryptocurrency until Congress and regulators conduct a review.

Headlines: BoE's Carney says keeping open mind on Facebook's Libra
Description: Bank of England governor Mark Carney has said he is keeping an 'open mind' on the potential utility of Facebook's planned cryptocurrency, but warned it may face strict regulation if it takes off.

Headlines: Factbox: Facebook's new cryptocurrency Libra and digital wallet Calibra
Description: Facebook Inc revealed plans to establish a cryptocurrency called Libra on Tuesday. It will be run by an association comprised of other corporate investors and non-profit members, with an expected launch in the first half of 2020.

Headlines: Swiss regulator says in contact with initiators of Facebook's Libra
Description: Switzerland's financial regulator FINMA said on Tuesday that it is in contact with the "initiators" of Libra, Facebook's planned cyrptocurrency.

Headlines: Facebook called before Senate panel over digital currency project
Description: Facebook Inc's plans to create a global cryptocurrency will face scrutiny from the U.S. Senate Banking Committee on July 16, the latest sign that policymakers around the globe are casting a wary eye on the project.

Headlines: U.S. government should consider halting Facebook cryptocurrency project: lawmaker
Description: The U.S. government should consider forcing Facebook Inc to freeze work on its new cryptocurrency project, a senior U.S. lawmaker said on Thursday.

Headlines: Unruly social media no model for Facebook's Libra currency: BoE's Carney
Description: Facebook cannot expect its new Libra currency to benefit from the same unregulated free-for-all that helped the company achieve a dominant position in social media, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency could raise regulatory issues: BoE deputy governor
Description: Plans by Facebook Inc to launch a new global cryptocurrency called Libra could raise regulatory issues, Bank of England Deputy Governor Sam Woods said on Thursday.

Headlines: UK regulator tells Facebook, eBay to tackle sale of fake reviews
Description: Britain's competition watchdog on Friday told Facebook and eBay to go through their websites and crack down on the sale of fake and misleading online reviews.

Headlines: Facebook co-founder says Libra could shift monetary clout to private companies: FT
Description: Facebook Inc's Libra cryptocurrency would hand over much of the control of monetary policy from central banks to private companies, the company's co-founder Chris Hughes said in an opinion piece in the Financial Times on Friday.

Headlines: European central bankers claim oversight over Facebook’s cryptocurrency
Description: Three European central bankers are claiming oversight over Facebook's planned virtual currency to ensure it will not jeopardize the financial system or be used to launder money.

Headlines: France creates G7 cryptocurrency task force as Facebook's Libra unsettles governments
Description: France is creating a G7 task force to study how central banks ensure cryptocurrencies like Facebook's Libra are governed by regulations ranging from money-laundering laws to consumer-protection rules, France's central bank governor said on Friday.

Headlines: Central banks will want oversight of Facebook's Libra: Bank of England's Carney
Description: Major central banks and regulators will want oversight of Facebook's proposed new currency and payment system, Libra, to ensure it is safe and does not allow money laundering or finance terrorism, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said.

Headlines: Facebook's Clegg rejects break-up calls, prefers more regulation
Description: Facebook dismissed calls for a break-up of the world's biggest social network and other big internet companies on Monday, saying this would not tackle issues such as privacy, attempts to influence elections or harmful content.

Headlines: Brazil court slashes fine for Facebook's refusal to share WhatsApp data
Description: Facebook Inc's fine for withholding WhatsApp messages from a drug-trafficking investigation in Brazil should be reduced to 23 million reais ($6 million), a Brazilian federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

Headlines: Exclusive: In a world first, Facebook to give data on hate speech suspects to French courts
Description: In a world first, Facebook has agreed to hand over the identification data of French users suspected of hate speech on its platform to judges, France's minister for digital affairs Cedric O said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Fed to hold Facebook's crypto coin to 'high' bar: Powell
Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is looking carefully at Facebook's planned cryptocurrency Libra, and will hold it to high standards regarding protecting consumers and regulation, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.

Headlines: European watchdogs demand detail on Facebook's cryptocurrency
Description: Facebook's fledgling cryptocurrency faced mounting scrutiny on Tuesday as European central bankers and regulators demanded more detail on the social media giant's Libra project.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra coin closely watched by authorities: FSB
Description: Facebook's plan to expand into payments is not expected to be on the agenda of this week's G20 summit in Japan, but the social media giant's intentions could lead regulators to take a closer look at crypto assets, a G20 regulatory group said on Tuesday.

Headlines: UK watchdog wants more detail on Facebook's Libra coin plan
Description: There was "insufficient" detail to understand Facebook's plans to expand into payments and launch its own Libra coin, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra must obey anti-money laundering rules: French central banker
Description: Facebook's planned global 'Libra' cryptocurrency must respect anti-money laundering regulations and it must seek banking licenses if it offers banking services, France's central bank chief said in a magazine interview.

Headlines: Facebook CEO says delay in flagging fake Pelosi video was 'execution mistake'
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday said his social media company took too long to flag as false an altered video of U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi that appeared to show the Democratic Representative slurring and tripping through a speech.

Headlines: Bitcoin soars past $13,000 as Facebook's Libra fuels demand
Description: Bitcoin jumped to an 18-month high on Wednesday, as investors looked for safety in alternative investments amid geopolitical tension, and cheered prospects that Facebook Inc's Libra token could push cryptocurrencies into the mainstream.

Headlines: Facebook crypto plans turn up heat on EU banks over real-time payments
Description: The euro zone could have an instant payments system shared by all banks in the bloc by the end of 2020, finance industry officials said, as lenders face more competition from the likes of Facebook and other tech firms.

Headlines: Facebook outlines ideas for oversight board
Description: Facebook Inc  on Thursday released the findings from its consultations with outside experts into its content review process, providing a glimpse into how its plans for a proposed "external oversight board" might take shape.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra coin likely to run a regulatory gauntlet
Description: Facebook Inc will face unprecedented regulatory scrutiny over a new digital currency that the social media company hopes will become globally recognized legal tender within a year.

Headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp hires senior exec from London remittances startup: sources
Description: Facebook Inc's  WhatsApp has hired a senior executive from London-based money transfer startup WorldRemit, three people familiar with the matter said this week.

Headlines: New York Governor Cuomo orders probe into Facebook's advertising platform
Description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Monday ordered the U.S. Department of Financial Services to investigate reports that state-regulated advertisers were using Facebook Inc's advertising platform in a discriminatory manner.

Headlines: Facebook campus given all-clear after sarin scare
Description: Facebook Inc's  Silicon Valley campus received the all-clear on Tuesday after fears that a package at its mail facility contained the nerve agent sarin.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency needs deep thought and detail: UK regulator
Description: Facebook's fledging cryptocurrency will raise questions for both society and government that need close examination, a senior official at Britain's financial watchdog said on Tuesday, in  another sign that the planned project will face deep scrutiny.

Headlines: Germany fines Facebook for under-reporting complaints
Description: German authorities have fined Facebook  2 million euros ($2.3 million) for under-reporting complaints about illegal content on its social media platform in breach of the country's law on internet transparency.

Headlines: Facebook, privacy activist Schrems face off in July 9 court hearing
Description: Facebook will face Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems next week at Europe's top court in a landmark case that could affect how hundreds of thousands of companies transfer personal data worldwide as well as Europeans' privacy rights.

Headlines: UK regulator investigates role of Facebook, Google in ad market
Description: Britain's competition regulator has launched an investigation into the power wielded by Facebook  and Google  in digital advertising markets, including the ownership of data.

Headlines: Facebook not invited to White House social media summit -company
Description:
Facebook Inc said on
Monday that it had not been invited to a White House summit on
social media being held later this week.

Headlines: Europe's top court sets date for opinion on Facebook privacy
Description: Europe's top court will give an opinion on Dec. 12 on Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems' landmark case against Facebook, which will affect how hundreds of thousands of companies transfer personal data worldwide.

Headlines: Facebook not invited to White House social media summit: company
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday that it had not been invited to a White House summit on social media being held later this week.

Headlines: Fed chief calls for Facebook to halt Libra project until concerns addressed
Description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said on Wednesday that Facebook's  plan to build a digital currency called Libra "cannot go forward" until serious concerns are addressed, comments that pressured the project and dented the price of the original cryptocurrency bitcoin.

Headlines: Trump blasts Bitcoin, Facebook's Libra, demands they face banking regulations
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday criticized Bitcoin, Facebook's proposed Libra digital coin and other cryptocurrencies and demanded that companies seek a banking charter and make themselves subject to U.S. and global regulations if they wanted to "become a bank."

Headlines: Bitcoin extends losses after Fed chief urges halt to Facebook's crypto project
Description: Bitcoin dipped almost 8% on Thursday, extending losses the day after U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell called for a halt to Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency project until concerns ranging from privacy to money-laundering were addressed.

Headlines: U.S. regulators approve $5 billion Facebook settlement over privacy issues: source
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission approved a roughly $5 billion settlement with Facebook Inc this week over its investigation into the social media company's handling of user data, a source familiar with the situation said on Friday.

Headlines: Japan sets up working group on impact of Facebook's Libra ahead of G7
Description: Japanese authorities have set up a working group to discuss the impact Facebook's proposed Libra digital coin could have on monetary policy and financial regulation, government sources said, ahead of a G7 finance leaders' gathering where the topic will be high on the agenda.

Headlines: Facebook vows Libra currency will wait for approval as U.S. airs worries
Description: Facebook Inc said on Monday it would not proceed with the launch of its Libra cryptocurrency until regulatory concerns are addressed, as the U.S. Treasury secretary took the unusual step on of saying he had serious concerns it could be used for illicit activity.

Headlines: Mnuchin says Facebook cryptocurrency needs safeguards against money laundering
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin on Monday voiced serious concern that Facebook Inc's  proposed Libra cryptocurrency could be misused for money laundering, adding to the growing regulatory skepticism of the social media company's digital asset plans.

Headlines: Bitcoin tumbles as U.S. senators grill Facebook on crypto plans
Description: The cryptocurrency market took a beating on Tuesday with bitcoin losing over 10% in value after U.S. lawmakers grilled Facebook on its cryptocurrency plans, as political and regulatory scrutiny of digital coins intensifies.

Headlines: Facebook should not be trusted with 'crazy' cryptocurrency plan: senators
Description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers said on Tuesday that Facebook Inc's track record of what they described as untrustworthiness should stand in the way of it launching a digital currency, labeling the plan "delusional" and "crazy" at a Senate hearing.

Headlines: U.S. SEC chief says he has not met with Facebook since Libra announcement
Description: A top U.S. financial market regulator said on Tuesday he has not discussed with Facebook its Libra currency proposal, nearly a month after the social media giant announced the project.

Headlines: Senators criticize FTC's reported Facebook settlement
Description: Three U.S. senators who have been frequent critics of U.S. tech giants wrote a letter to the Federal Trade Commission on Tuesday to criticize its reported settlement with Facebook Inc.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz sounds alarm on cryptocurrencies such as Facebook's Libra
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday regulators must ensure that cryptocurrencies such as Facebook's planned digital coin Libra do not threaten financial stability and consumer privacy.

Headlines: U.S. lawmakers challenge Facebook over Libra cryptocurrency plan
Description: U.S. lawmakers bashed Facebook on Wednesday over its planned cryptocurrency, saying the company had not shown it could be trusted to safeguard the world financial system and consumers' data.

Headlines: G7 finance chiefs pour cold water on Facebook's digital coin plans
Description: Group of Seven finance chiefs cast a cloud over prospects for Facebook's Libra digital coin on Wednesday, insisting tough regulatory problems would have to be worked out first.

Headlines: Smaller cryptocurrencies feel pain as criticism of Facebook's Libra grows
Description: Bitcoin hasn't been the only casualty of the backlash by the world's major economic powers against Facebook's plans for a cryptocurrency, with smaller digital coins also feeling the burn.

Headlines: Consensus among G7 ministers to tackle Facebook's Libra: French chair
Description: G7 ministers meeting in France on Wednesday agreed on the need to confront the emergence of digital currencies following Facebook's plans to launch its Libra digital coin, a French G7 presidency source said on Wednesday.

Headlines: IMF says regulators must address possible risks from Facebook's Libra
Description: Facebook Inc's planned cryptocurrency, Libra, could help boost financial inclusion, but also raises concerns about consumer protection, data privacy, and potential "backdoor dollarization," the IMF's chief economist said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Conditions not in place for Facebook's Libra to go ahead: France
Description: Facebook's Libra digital coin project cannot go ahead in the form it has been presented so far, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Wednesday.

Headlines: France says G7 focused on containing risks of Facebook's Libra
Description: Group of Seven finance ministers meeting in France this week will make it one of their priorities to contain the risks posed by new currencies such as Facebook's Libra, the meeting's host, Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire, said.

Headlines: FTC to announce $5 billion settlement with Facebook as early as this week: sources
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is expected to announce a roughly $5 billion settlement with Facebook Inc as early as this week of its investigation into the social media company’s handling of user data, two sources briefed on the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Louisiana policemen fired over Facebook post suggesting Ocasio-Cortez be shot
Description: A Louisiana policeman who suggested on Facebook that high-profile U.S. Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez needed to be shot was fired on Monday, along with a second officer who "liked" his post.

Headlines: Facebook, Amazon and Alphabet take center stage on Wall Street
Description: The so-called FANG stocks take center stage on Wall Street this week, with Amazon , Alphabet  and Facebook  set to report as the S&P 500 approaches a record high.

Headlines: Facebook to create privacy panel, pay $5 billion to U.S. to settle allegations
Description: The Federal Trade Commission is set to announce on Wednesday that Facebook Inc has agreed to a sweeping settlement of significant allegations it mishandled user privacy and pay $5 billion, two people briefed on the matter said.

Headlines: Swiss data watchdog awaits details on Facebook crypto plan
Description: Facebook Inc's  Libra cryptocurrency project has not responded to an information request by Switzerland's data privacy watchdog, the authority said on Tuesday, noting it wants more details to help define its oversight role over the U.S. social media company's proposed digital currency.

Headlines: Facebook warns of costly privacy changes, discloses another U.S. probe
Description: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday that new rules and product changes aimed at protecting users' privacy would slow its revenue growth into next year and significantly raise expenses, taking the shine off quarterly revenue results that beat expectations.

Headlines: Facebook to pay record $5 billion U.S. fine over privacy; faces antitrust probe
Description: Facebook Inc will pay a record-breaking $5 billion fine to resolve a government probe into its privacy practices and will boost safeguards on user data, the U.S. Federal Trade Commission and the social media company said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook discloses antitrust probe; revenue beats estimates
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Wednesday
that the U.S. Federal Trade Commission had opened an antitrust
probe into the world's largest social network in June, adding to
regulatory pressure even as it beat analysts' estimates for
quarterly revenue.

Headlines: Facebook ends Microsoft, Sony access to friend data
Description: Facebook Inc will end access to limited friend data from Microsoft Corp and Sony Corp as a first step under a record $5 billion U.S. Federal Trade Commission settlement announced on Wednesday, the world's largest social media company said.

Headlines: Facebook to pay $100 million to settle with SEC over misuse of user data
Description: Facebook Inc  agreed to pay a $100 million fine to settle charges by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission that it misled investors for more than two years about the misuse of its users' data, the regulator said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Mnuchin says Facebook must satisfy regulatory concerns ahead of Libra launch: CNBC
Description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said in a television interview that Facebook must satisfy regulatory concerns before it launches Libra, its planned cryptocurrency.

Headlines: Facebook removes fake accounts from Thailand, Russia, Ukraine, Honduras
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Thursday it had erased over 1,800 accounts and pages from Thailand, Russia, Ukraine and Honduras, its latest move to counter deceptive political propaganda and other abuses of its service.

Headlines: Craigslist founder, Facebook's ex-security chief team up over 2020 online fears
Description: The project by Facebook Inc former chief security officer Alex Stamos to battle online abuses has received $5 million from Craigslist founder Craig Newmark, the Stanford Internet Observatory said this week.

Headlines: Australia to 'lift veil' on Facebook, Google algorithms to protect privacy
Description: Australia said it would establish the world's first dedicated office to police Facebook Inc  and Google  as part of reforms designed to rein in the U.S. technology giants, potentially setting a precedent for global lawmakers.

Headlines: Factbox: How Australia plans to curb Facebook and Google's market power
Description: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission has found, after an 18-month investigation, that Google and Facebook hold enormous power in the country's online advertising and news distribution markets, and that antitrust and privacy laws have not caught up to the real world.

Headlines: US STOCKS-Wall Street mixed as Amazon, Facebook weigh
Description:
* Dow up 0.16%, S&P 500 off 0.20%, Nasdaq down 0.62%
(Updates to early afternoon)

Headlines: Companies using Facebook 'Like' button liable for data: EU court
Description: Companies that embed Facebook's "Like" button on their websites must seek users' consent to transfer their personal data to the U.S. social network, in line with the bloc's data privacy laws, Europe's top court said on Monday.

Headlines: Facebook fact-checker says company must share more data to fight misinformation
Description: One of Facebook's third-party fact-checking partners on Tuesday said the company needed to share more data with fact-checkers to better curb misinformation.

Headlines: Facebook defeats appeal in U.S. claiming it aided Hamas attacks in Israel
Description: Facebook Inc on Wednesday defeated an appeal by American victims of Hamas attacks in Israel, who sought to hold the company liable for providing the group a social media platform to further its terroristic goals.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook defeats appeal in U.S. claiming it aided Hamas attacks in Israel
Description:
Facebook Inc on
Wednesday defeated an appeal by American victims of Hamas
attacks in Israel, who sought to hold the company liable for
providing the group a social media platform to further its
terroristic goals.

Headlines: Facebook approaches Netflix, Disney to support TV chat device: The Information
Description: Facebook Inc has approached Netflix Inc, Walt Disney Co and other media companies about putting their streaming services on a new Facebook device for making video calls from televisions, The Information reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook approaches Netflix, Disney to support TV chat device - The Information
Description:
Facebook Inc has approached
Netflix Inc, Walt Disney Co and other media
companies about putting their streaming services on a new
Facebook device for making video calls from televisions, The
Information reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: U.S. FTC probes Facebook's acquisition practices - WSJ
Description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is investigating whether Facebook Inc acquisitions were aimed at buying up potential rivals before they could become a threat to the social media company, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook begins adding its name to some screens on Instagram
Description: Facebook Inc started adding its name to some screens on its Instagram photo-sharing platform this week, one of the first links it has given users to its ownership of the popular platform.

Headlines: Facebook says it dismantles covert influence campaign tied to Saudi government
Description: People connected to the government of Saudi Arabia have run a network of fake accounts and pages on Facebook Inc  to promote state propaganda and attack regional rivals, the social media giant said on Thursday.

Headlines: Factbox: Facebook takedowns of 'coordinated inauthentic behavior' in 2019
Description: Facebook  said on Thursday it had dismantled a network of fake accounts and pages it said were run by people connected to the government of Saudi Arabia, the company's latest action to combat "coordinated inauthentic behavior" on its platform.

Headlines: Former Japan central banker warns Facebook's Libra may undermine monetary policy
Description: Central banks may see the impact of their monetary policies diminish significantly if Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency becomes widely used in their countries, a former Bank of Japan executive warned on Friday.

Headlines: UK's data watchdog seeks more clarity from Facebook over Libra
Description: Britain's data protection watchdog said on Monday that it had joined with its counterparts from around the world in calling for more openness about Facebook's proposed Libra digital currency.

Headlines: Apple to restrict Facebook's messaging apps feature - The Information
Description: Apple Inc is making a change to its mobile operating system that will restrict a feature that apps like Facebook Inc's Messenger and WhatsApp use to make voice calls over the internet, The Information reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Two U.S. senators raise privacy concerns over Facebook's Messenger Kids
Description: Democratic U.S. senators Edward Markey and Richard Blumenthal have written to Facebook Inc  questioning whether there was a "worrying pattern" of poor privacy protection for children using its Messenger Kids app.

Headlines: Facebook loses facial recognition appeal, must face privacy class action
Description: (This Aug. 8 story has been refiled to correct case number to 18-15982 instead of 19-15982 in last paragraph)

Headlines: Google, Facebook, Amazon to testify in U.S. against French digital tax
Description: Alphabet Inc's Google unit, Facebook Inc and Amazon.com Inc are among the companies that will testify Monday at a U.S. government hearing on the French government's digital services tax.

Headlines: Facebook paid contractors to transcribe users' audio: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc  has been paying outside contractors to transcribe audio clips from users of its services, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Irish regulator queries Facebook on transcription of users' audio
Description: The lead regulator of Facebook Inc  in the European Union is seeking information on how the company handled data during the manual transcription of users' audio recordings, Ireland's Data Protection Commission said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Democratic senator asks Facebook CEO if he gave 'incomplete' testimony
Description: Democratic U.S. Senator Gary Peters on Thursday asked Facebook Inc's  chief to answer questions about his April 2018 congressional testimony in light of reports that Facebook captured audio from users and sent it to a vendor to be analyzed and transcribed.

Headlines: Facebook failed to warn users of known risks before 2018 breach: court filing
Description: Facebook  users suing the world's largest social media network over a 2018 data breach say it failed to warn them about risks tied to its single sign-on tool, even though it protected its employees, a court filing on Thursday showed.

Headlines: Twitter, Facebook accuse China of using fake accounts to undermine Hong Kong protests
Description: Twitter Inc  and Facebook Inc  said on Monday they had dismantled a state-backed social media campaign originating in mainland China that sought to undermine protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: FTC chairman says Facebook's plan to merge brands may make it harder to split: FT
Description: Facebook Inc's plan to integrate Instagram and WhatsApp more closely could hinder any attempts to break up the social media giant, Federal Trade Commission Chairman Joseph Simons told the Financial Times on Monday.

Headlines: FTC chairman says Facebook's plan to merge brands may make it harder to split -FT
Description:
Facebook Inc's plan to integrate
Instagram and WhatsApp more closely could hinder any attempts to
break up the social media giant, Federal Trade Commission
Chairman Joseph Simons told the Financial Times on Monday.

Headlines: Factbox: Track Facebook's fight against disinformation campaigns in 2019
Description: Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc said on Monday they had dismantled a state-backed information operation originating in mainland China that sought to undermine protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: Facebook contractor hikes pay for Indian content reviewers
Description: Facebook contractor Genpact has raised minimum wages for the content moderation teams it runs for the Silicon Valley firm in India, the latest sign of improvement for workers after reports of stressful conditions at the social network's sites  globally.

Headlines: Who's tracking you? Facebook users to get more control over data
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it was tweaking its policies to allow users to see and control the data that the social network gathers from their browsing habits on other websites and apps.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra faces EU antitrust probe: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc's  proposed digital currency Libra faces anti-trust probe by European Union regulators, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing a document seen by the organization.

Headlines: U.S. conservatives say Facebook needs 'significant work' to address concerns: former senator
Description: A review by a former Republican U.S. senator concludes that political conservatives believe Facebook Inc needs to do "significant work" to satisfy their concerns that the social media website is biased, describing policies and examples that they found problematic without laying out evidence of systemic partisanship.

Headlines: Swiss watchdog expects details on Facebook's Libra by end of month
Description: Switzerland's privacy watchdog expects to receive details on Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency by the end of this month, a spokeswoman for the agency said on Tuesday.

Headlines: China cries foul over Facebook, Twitter block of fake accounts
Description: China said on Tuesday it had a right to put out its own views after Twitter and Facebook said they had dismantled a state-backed social media campaign originating in mainland China that sought to undermine protests in Hong Kong.

Headlines: EU antitrust regulators raise concerns about Facebook's Libra currency: sources
Description: EU antitrust regulators want to know whether Facebook's  proposed Libra cryptocurrency and its use of consumer data pose possible anti-competitive constraints, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook expands 'Local Alert' tool in bid to help in emergencies
Description: Facebook announced on Tuesday that it was rolling out a tool that aims to provide users with potentially life-saving information in emergencies, as it seeks to improve its public image and play down its reputation as a network that aids the spread of misinformation.

Headlines: Thiel's Founders Fund sells remaining Facebook shares
Description: Early Facebook Inc  backer, Founders Fund, has sold all of its holdings in the social media giant as part of a previously established trading plan by the venture capital firm's partner, Peter Thiel, according to a regulatory filing from late Monday.

Headlines: Facebook acknowledges flaw in Messenger Kids app
Description: Facebook Inc  acknowledged a flaw in its Messenger Kids app, weeks after two U.S. senators raised privacy concerns about the application, and said that it spoke to the U.S. Federal Trade Commission about the matter.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook tightens rules for U.S. political advertisers ahead of 2020 election
Description:
Facebook Inc is tightening its
political ad rules in the United States, it said on Wednesday,
requiring new disclosures for its site and photo-sharing
platform Instagram ahead of the U.S. presidential election in
November 2020.

Headlines: Funders threaten to quit Facebook project studying impact on democracy
Description: (This August 27 story corrects headline from "researchers" to "funders")

Headlines: Facebook brings face recognition to all users, discontinues 'Tag Suggestions'
Description: Facebook Inc is opening up its face recognition technology to all users with an option to opt out, the social media company said on Tuesday, as it discontinued a related feature called "Tag Suggestions."

Headlines: Facebook, tech firms meet with U.S. intelligence on 2020 election security
Description: U.S. technology companies including Facebook Inc , Alphabet's Google , Microsoft Corp  and Twitter Inc  met with U.S. intelligence agencies on Wednesday to discuss security strategies ahead of the November 2020 election.

Headlines: EU looking to see if Facebook's Libra currency poses competition risks
Description: EU regulators are examining Facebook's  proposed Libra cryptocurrency to see if it harms competition, Europe's antitrust regulator said on Wednesday, the latest watchdog to voice concerns about the social network's move into financial services.

Headlines: Facebook launches dating service in United States
Description: Facebook Inc  is launching its dating services in the United States, the social network said on Thursday, sending its shares up 2%.

Headlines: Facebook, Microsoft launch contest to detect deepfake videos
Description: Facebook Inc is teaming up with Microsoft Corp, the Partnership on AI coalition and academics from several universities to launch a contest to better detect deepfakes, the company said in a blog post https://ai.facebook.com/blog/deepfake-detection-challenge on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra falls into 'big gap' in EU rules: regulator
Description: Facebook's proposed Libra cryptocurrency falls into a "big gap" in European Union financial regulation at a time when the bloc's ability to tackle money laundering is already stretched, a top EU regulator said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. states launch antitrust probes of tech companies, focus on Facebook, Google
Description: Two groups of U.S. state attorneys general on Friday announced separate antitrust probes of large tech companies such as Alphabet's Google  and Facebook .

Headlines: China says new digital currency will be similar to Facebook's Libra
Description: China's proposed new digital currency would bear some similarities to Facebook's Libra coin and would be able to be used across major payment platforms such as WeChat and Alipay, a senior central bank officer said.

Headlines: Judge lets Facebook privacy class action proceed, calls company's views 'so wrong'
Description: A federal judge on Monday ordered Facebook Inc  to face most of a nationwide lawsuit seeking damages for letting third parties such as Cambridge Analytica access users' private data, calling the social media company's views on privacy "so wrong."

Headlines: Dutch 'Big Brother' creator seeks court judgment over fake bitcoin ads on Facebook
Description: Dutch billionaire John de Mol on Monday said he would ask a court to rule in the case he filed against Facebook Inc earlier this year over fake bitcoin ads.

Headlines: Facebook denies it is to blame after Russian political advertising accusation
Description: Facebook said on Monday that advertisers, not it, were responsible for complying with local election laws after Russia accused the tech giant of allowing political advertising during regional elections the previous day.

Headlines: Global money-laundering watchdog closely monitoring Facebook's Libra, official says
Description: The global anti-money laundering watchdog is closely monitoring developments on Facebook's planned Libra cryptocurrency, its new head told Reuters on Tuesday, in the latest sign of growing regulatory scrutiny of the project.

Headlines: Facebook bans self-harm images in fight against suicide
Description: Facebook Inc will no longer allow graphic images of self-harm on its platform as it tightens its policies on suicide content amid growing criticism of how social media companies moderate violent and potentially dangerous content.

Headlines: Switzerland warns Facebook's Libra it will face extra scrutiny
Description: Facebook's  Libra cryptocurrency suffered another setback on Wednesday when Switzerland said the proposed payments system could face strict rules that typically apply to banks, on top of tough anti-money laundering laws.

Headlines: France: We can't allow Facebook's Libra in Europe
Description: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency cannot be allowed to operate in Europe while concerns persist about sovereignty, systemic financial risks and the risk of abuses by a dominant market player, France's finance minister said on Thursday.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook fact-checker finds UK Conservatives ran ads with altered BBC headline
Description:
One of Facebook's third-party
fact-checkers accused Britain's governing Conservative Party on
Friday of misrepresenting a BBC News article in its ads on the
social media platform.

Headlines: Apple, Facebook, Amazon, Google emails demanded in U.S. House panel probe
Description: A U.S. House of Representatives panel on Friday demanded internal emails, detailed financial information and other company records from top executives of Amazon.com Inc., Facebook Inc, Apple Inc, and Alphabet Inc's Google, widening the antitrust probe of Big Tech.

Headlines: France, Germany blast Facebook's Libra, back public cryptocurrency
Description: France and Germany said on Friday that Facebook Inc's  Libra currency posed risks to the financial sector that could block its authorization in Europe, and backed the development of an alternative public cryptocurrency.

Headlines: Germany against allowing Facebook's Libra in Europe: Der Spiegel
Description: The German government is against giving regulatory approval for Facebook's Libra digital currency in the European Union, Der Spiegel magazine reported on Friday, citing a member of Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives.

Headlines: France and Germany agree to block Facebook's Libra
Description: France and Germany have agreed to block Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency, the French finance ministry said on Friday.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra in regulators' sights as ECB's Coeure warns of 'stablecoin' risks
Description: Facebook's  attempt to drag cryptocurrencies into the mainstream with its Libra digital coin met with further scepticism on Monday when an ECB board member said such "stablecoins" posed serious risks.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra will be disruptive, says ECB's Coeure
Description: Digital currencies such as Facebook's  Libra will disrupt the financial system, either by forcing central banks to innovate or by grabbing a global role that could challenge the dominance of the dollar, ECB board member Benoit Coeure said on Tuesday.

Headlines: London police and Facebook move to stop live streaming of terror attacks
Description: London police and Facebook said on Tuesday they plan to share resources to stop the live streaming of terrorist attacks like that in Christchurch, New Zealand, earlier this year.

Headlines: Facebook briefly blocks Netanyahu chatbot on election day
Description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu lashed out at Facebook on Tuesday after the social network blocked a "chatbot" from his right-wing Likud party's account for violating election day rules.

Headlines: ECB's Villeroy tells Facebook that Libra faces tough scrutiny
Description: European Central Bank board member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Tuesday that "stablecoins" like Facebook’s Libra highlight gaps in rules and the media giant's payments project faced a tough regulatory approach.

Headlines: Vietnam's social media crowd swells with new entrant to take on Facebook, Google
Description: A new social network has entered the already crowded field in Vietnam as the communist party squeezes U.S. tech giants Facebook and Google with a new cybersecurity law.

Headlines: Facebook met UK officials three times before Libra announcement
Description: Facebook  met British finance ministry, central bank and regulatory officials in the weeks before making public its plans for the Libra digital currency, responses to Reuters freedom of information requests show.

Headlines: Germany's Scholz: We cannot accept parallel currencies such as Facebook's Libra
Description: German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday policymakers could not accept the emergence of parallel currencies such as Facebook's  planned Libra, adding that Berlin would reject any such plans.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg meets Trump, seeks to mend fences in Washington
Description: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg met with President Donald Trump on Thursday during a fence-mending visit to Washington where the chief executive faced aggressive questioning from lawmakers about the social network's failures to protect consumer privacy.

Headlines: Trump says he had a 'nice' meeting with Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
Description: President Donald Trump said in a tweet that he had a "nice meeting" with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday and he included a picture of him shaking hands with Zuckerberg in the Oval Office.

Headlines: Trump, Facebook CEO Zuckerberg had 'good, constructive' meeting: Facebook
Description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg had a "good, constructive" meeting at the White House on Thursday, the social media company said in a statement.

Headlines: Facebook unveils new Portal video chat, TV streaming devices
Description: Facebook Inc  unveiled new models of its Portal video chatting devices on Wednesday, making the company's first foray into TV streaming hardware but offering a limited selection of subscription services.

Headlines: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg dines with senators in DC
Description: Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg met with a half-dozen U.S. senators on Wednesday for dinner as the company seeks to boost its reputation in Washington.

Headlines: Facebook suspends tens of thousands of apps in response to Cambridge Analytica row
Description: Facebook Inc said on Friday it has suspended tens of thousands of apps on the social networking platform, as part of the company's ongoing app developer investigation it began in March 2018 in response to the Cambridge Analytica row.

Headlines: Few U.S. lawmakers hit 'like' button after Facebook CEO visits Capitol Hill
Description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg wrapped up three days of discussions with Washington movers and shakers on Friday, with few if any indications he had won new "friends" to help the top social media company deal with multiple probes by Congress, state attorneys general and federal regulators.

Headlines: UPDATE 2-Few U.S. lawmakers hit 'like' button after Facebook CEO visits Capitol Hill
Description:
Facebook CEO Mark
Zuckerberg wrapped up three days of discussions with Washington
movers and shakers on Friday, with few if any indications he had
won new "friends" to help the top social media company deal with
multiple probes by Congress, state attorneys general and federal
regulators.

Headlines: U.S. dollar to be main currency underpinning Facebook's Libra:  Spiegel
Description: The U.S. dollar will make up 50% of the basket of currencies backing Facebook's planned digital coin Libra, with the euro, yen, sterling and Singapore dollar comprising the rest, Der Spiegel reported, referring to a letter from Facebook.

Headlines: Undeterred, Facebook to press on with Libra launch next year: executive
Description: Facebook still aims to launch its Libra digital currency next year, its executive overseeing the project told Swiss newspaper NZZ, as the company presses ahead despite authorities around the world pouring cold water on the plans.

Headlines: Undeterred, Facebook to press on with Libra launch next year - exec
Description:
Facebook still aims to
launch its Libra digital currency next year, its executive
overseeing the project told Swiss newspaper NZZ, as the company
presses ahead despite authorities around the world pouring cold
water on the plans.

Headlines: Facebook to buy brain science start-up CTRL-labs
Description: Facebook Inc  said on Monday it bought New York-based CTRL-labs, a start-up that is exploring ways for people to communicate with computers using brain signals, in a deal that CNBC said was valued at $1 billion.

Headlines: U.S. securities chief 'not prepared' to say if Facebook's Libra a security
Description: The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission repeatedly refused to tell a congressional panel on Tuesday whether or not Facebook's Libra would be regulated as a security under his watch.

Headlines: U.S. Justice Department to open Facebook antitrust investigation: source
Description: The U.S. Justice Department will open an antitrust investigation of Facebook Inc , a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday, marking the fourth recent antitrust probe of the social media company.

Headlines: Facebook to launch hand tracking feature on Oculus Quest
Description: Facebook Inc will bring a hand tracking feature to its virtual reality headset Oculus Quest, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook wins dismissal of investor lawsuit over privacy breach
Description: Facebook Inc and its chief executive Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday won dismissal of an investor lawsuit accusing them of deceiving investors about the likely impact of a privacy breach on its stock price, though the investors will be have a chance to refile their case.

Headlines: Launch of Facebook's Libra could be delayed over regulatory concerns: executive
Description: The launch of Facebook's Libra could be pushed back to tackle the regulatory concerns that have been raised around the world, the head of the organization set up to oversee the cryptocurrency told Reuters.

Headlines: Visa, Mastercard reconsider backing Facebook's Libra: WSJ
Description: Visa , Mastercard Inc  and other key financial partners may reconsider their involvement in Facebook Inc's  cryptocurrency, Libra, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg says Warren as U.S. president would be bad for tech
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg told employees in July that the company would "go to the mat" to defeat Democratic candidate Elizabeth Warren's expected effort to break up the world's largest social media company if she were elected president, according to audio of two internal company meetings published by The Verge.

Headlines: Factbox: Six things Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told staff in leaked audio
Description: Leaked audio of Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg addressing questions from staff in two internal July meetings was published on Tuesday by The Verge.

Headlines: Facebook, Google, Amazon face another House inquiry: Bloomberg
Description: Facebook Inc, Amazon.com Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google will face a congressional inquiry on how the big technology companies may be damaging the competitive landscape for small businesses, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: U.S. House panel wants Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify on Libra by January
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg has tentatively agreed to testify before a U.S. House committee on Oct. 29 about the company's plan for a digital currency, but the panel will not schedule the hearing until Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg commits to appear by January, a congressional source said on Thursday.

Headlines: Facebook's Instagram launches Snapchat-like 'Threads' app
Description: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it was launching a separate camera-first messaging app, "Threads", for its photo-sharing platform Instagram, stepping up the company's social media war with smaller rival Snapchat.

Headlines: UPDATE 1-Facebook's Instagram launches Snapchat-like "Threads" app
Description:
Facebook Inc said on Thursday it
was launching a separate camera-first messaging app, "Threads",
for its photo-sharing platform Instagram, stepping up the
company's social media war with smaller rival Snapchat.

Headlines: Facebook can be forced to remove content worldwide after landmark EU court ruling
Description: Facebook can be ordered to police and remove illegal content worldwide, Europe's top court said on Thursday, in a landmark ruling that rights activists say raises concerns some countries could use it to silence critics.

Headlines: Turkey fines Facebook $282,000 over privacy breach
Description: Turkish authorities have fined Facebook Inc  1.6 million lira ($282,000) for violation of data protection laws which affected nearly 300,000 people, the Personal Data Protection Board (KVKK) said on Thursday.

Headlines: FBI director warns Facebook could become platform of 'child pornographers'
Description: FBI Director Christopher Wray said on Friday that Facebook Inc's proposal to encrypt its popular messaging program would turn the platform into a "dream come true for predators and child pornographers."

Headlines: EU to urge G20 response on Facebook's Libra, calls for tech tax reform
Description: European Union finance ministers will tell their counterparts at a G20 meeting in mid-October that a global regulatory response is needed to "stablecoins" such as Facebook's Libra, an EU document said.

Headlines: U.S., allies urge Facebook for backdoor to encryption as they fight child abuse
Description: The United States, the United Kingdom and Australia have called on Facebook Inc to not go ahead with end-to-end encryption across its messaging services unless law enforcement officials have backdoor access, saying encryption hindered the fight against child abuse and terrorism.

Headlines: Facebook says removed multiple accounts from Indonesia, UAE, Nigeria, and Egypt
Description: Facebook Inc has announced it removed hundreds of pages, groups and accounts on its platforms for "coordinated inauthentic behavior" linked to three operations in Indonesia, the United Arab Emirates, Egypt, and Nigeria.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg defends encryption, despite child safety concerns
Description: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg defended on Thursday his decision to encrypt the company's messaging services, despite concerns about its impact on child exploitation and other criminal activity.

Headlines: State attorney general group probing Facebook could expand to 40: source
Description: An estimated 40 U.S. state attorneys general will participate in a probe of Facebook Inc, a source said on Monday, suggesting many more states want allegations of anticompetitive practices at the social media company investigated.

Headlines: Estimated 40 U.S. state attorneys general will join Facebook probe: source
Description: An estimated 40 U.S. state attorneys general will participate in a probe of Facebook Inc, a source said on Monday, which would be a big increase in the number of states joining the investigation.

Headlines: State attorneys general meet in Washington to discuss Facebook
Description: U.S. state attorneys general investigating Facebook Inc  met on Monday with officials of the Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission, both of which are probing the social media giant.

Headlines: Facebook's Zuckerberg to testify before U.S. House panel on Oct. 23
Description: Facebook  chief executive Mark Zuckerberg will testify before the U.S. House Financial Services Committee on Oct. 23 as the social media company faces growing scrutiny from U.S. lawmakers over a planned cryptocurrency and other issues including advertising policies.

Headlines: Bank of England sets out rules of engagement for Facebook's Libra
Description: The Bank of England set out the rules of engagement that Facebook's Libra crypto-currency and other new digital payments providers would have to meet before they can open for business in Britain.

Headlines: Mass shooting rumor in Facebook Group shows private chats are not risk-free
Description: Ahead of the annual Blueberry Festival in Marshall County, Indiana, in early September, a woman broadcast a warning to her neighbors on Facebook.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra currency abandoned by major financial companies
Description: Facebook Inc's ambitious efforts to establish a global digital currency called Libra suffered severe setbacks on Friday, as major payment companies including Mastercard and Visa Inc quit the group behind the project.

Headlines: Biden campaign asks Facebook, Twitter and Google to take down Trump ad
Description: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's campaign sent letters over the last week to Facebook Inc, Twitter Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google, asking them to take down a social media ad from President Donald Trump which the Biden campaign said contained false claims.

Headlines: Portugal cautious about risks posed by Facebook's Libra
Description: Portugal's Secretary of State for Finance raised concerns about Facebook's digital currency Libra on Friday, stating that it should not circulate until the risks it could pose for the financial system are addressed.

Headlines: Factbox: Facebook's Libra in trouble as firms jump ship
Description: A number of payment processors and fintech companies that joined Facebook Inc's  digital currency project Libra with great fanfare earlier this year, have abandoned the project, dealing a blow to the social media giant's plans.

Headlines: Risks from Facebook's Libra must be addressed before launch: Bank of France official
Description: The risks posed by cryptocurrencies such as Facebook's Libra must be addressed before any launch, a senior Bank of France official said on Tuesday, adding to a chorus of regulatory scepticism that threatens to derail the project.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra announces board as support shrinks further
Description: Backers of Facebook Inc's  Libra cryptocurrency project pledged to forge ahead after selecting a five-member board on Monday, shrugging off the latest member defection by online travel company Booking Holding earlier in the day.

Headlines: Facebook executive confident Libra will win enough financial backers
Description: Facebook Inc, whose digital currency project Libra has been abandoned by several high-profile partners including PayPal, Visa and Mastercard, still expects to get 100 banks and financial firms on board once it addresses regulatory concerns, the head of the project said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Facebook's Libra faces 'core' legal, regulatory challenges: Brainard
